column1: text

once upon a time there was a bad guy. he was mean and wanted to steal. one day, he saw gas in a big tank. he thought it was very heavy, but he wanted it so he tried to carry it away.

he struggled and stumbled trying to get the heavy tank, but he kept going. everyone started shouting, telling him to put it back. but the bad guy didn't listen.

suddenly, the police arrived. they asked him why he was stealing the gas. he looked scared and tried to hide the tank. but it was too late. the police caught him and he had to go to jail.

the bad guy learned his lesson and never tried to steal again. he was very sorry for trying to steal the heavy gas. he promised to always be good.

bob was feeling very nervous. he had a long walk ahead of him. but he was excited too, because he had a special surprise at the end of the walk.

every few steps he walked, bob looked up. there was something special hanging in the sky. he could not see it, but he knew what it was and he was excited.

when they finally arrived at their destination, bob was even more nervous. he was glad his surprise was near. as they walked through the door, they saw the surprise hanging on the wall. bob's eyes widened and he shouted, "a treasure map, i can't believe it!".

they had arrived at bob's house and the treasure map was hanging right in the middle. bob was overwhelmed with excitement and was so happy to find the map. he had been nervous about the long walk, but it was worth it.

bob and his friends started their adventure to find the treasure. they were happy and had lots of fun. this was the best surprise ever!

once upon a time, there was a big tree in a forest. the tree was very huge and it gave shade to all the animals in the forest. one day, a bird came to the tree and asked if it could build a nest in its branches. the tree agreed and the bird built a cozy nest.

one day, a fire broke out in the forest and the tree was very scared. it thought it would burn to ashes. but then, the bird came back to the tree and said, "don't worry, my friend. i will help you." the bird flew to the nearby lake and brought back water in its beak. then, it sprinkled the water on the tree and saved it from burning.

the tree was very happy and grateful to the bird. it realized that even though it was huge and strong, it still needed help from others. the bird and the tree danced together in joy and became good friends forever. the moral of the story is that even the strongest need help sometimes, and it's important to be a good friend.

once upon a time, there was a fish named nemo. nemo loved to swim in the ocean with his friends. one day, nemo found a shiny piece of jewelry on the ocean floor. it was so pretty, but nemo knew it was fake because it was made of plastic. nemo decided to take the jewelry to show his friends. 

when nemo showed the jewelry to his friends, they all laughed and told him it was fake. nemo felt sad, but his friends told him that he was still special and they loved him just the way he was. nemo felt better and they all continued to swim and play in the ocean together. from that day on, nemo learned that it doesn't matter if something is fake or real, as long as you are happy and with the ones you love.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy had a big orange ball that he loved to play with. one day, timmy decided to tie the ball to his wrist so he wouldn't lose it. but when he threw the ball, it flew away and pulled timmy with it! 

timmy's mommy saw what happened and quickly ran to him. she told him to release the ball from his wrist so he wouldn't get hurt. timmy listened to his mommy and let go of the ball. it flew high into the sky and timmy watched it until it was too small to see anymore. 

timmy was sad that he lost his ball, but his mommy gave him a hug and said they could get a new one together. timmy smiled and felt better knowing he had his mommy to help him. from that day on, timmy never tied anything to his wrist again.

once there was a wide tree. it was the only tree around and everyone loved it, especially the birds.

the farmer was very sad one day when he saw that someone had destroyed the tree. he was so ashamed he couldn't look anyone in the eye. he asked everyone he saw if they knew who had done it, but nobody had seen anything.

he asked the birds if they knew who had done it. the birds just looked sadly around. they had seen a scary monster come out of the woods and attack the tree.

the farmer was very sad. "who would do such a thing?!", he cried. the birds shook their heads sadly, but said nothing. he hugged the tree and said "i'm sorry i couldn't keep you safe".

the farmer was so sad and he decided to plant a new wide tree, so that the birds would have a safe place to come to.

once upon a time, there was a kind prince. he was very compassionate and generous, and always thought of others before himself.

one day, the kind prince came across a little boy. the little boy had no clothes and he was shivering in the cold. the prince immediately took off his own vest and put it on the boy.

the little boy was so happy and he smiled a big smile at the prince. he said, "thank you! i feel so warm now." 

the prince smiled back and said, "i'm glad. that's why i gave it to you." 

suddenly, the two were startled by a loud noise. it was the king! he had come to check on the prince and saw the little boy wearing his vest. the king was very angry and he struck the prince. 

the prince did not say anything, but the little boy was so angry. he shouted at the king, "why did you strike him? he was just being compassionate!" 
the king was embarrassed and he said nothing. instead, he motioned for the prince to take his vest back. 

the prince gratefully took his vest back and thanked the little boy. he said, "thank you for standing up for me!" the two smiled at each other and the little boy ran away, still wearing his warm vest. the kind prince had given him a lasting gift.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. lily was very proud of her toys and never wanted to share them with her friends. one day, lily's nurse told her that it's important to share with others and accept that they might want to play with her toys too.

at first, lily didn't want to listen to her nurse. but then, she thought about it and realized that sharing is important. she decided to bring her toys to school and share them with her friends. her friends were very happy and lily felt good about herself too.

from that day on, lily always shared her toys and felt proud of herself for doing so. she learned that it's important to accept that others might want to play with her toys too, and that sharing makes everyone happy. the end.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. one day, lily was playing outside when she found a weird rock. she picked it up and showed it to her friend, tommy.

tommy said, "that's a cool rock! can i have it?"

lily replied, "sure, you can have it."

tommy took the rock and said, "thank you, lily! you're a good friend."

lily felt happy and peaceful inside because she knew that being kind to others was the right thing to do. she learned that finding peace in her heart was more important than keeping a weird rock.

molly wanted to succeed. she had never done anything like this before and she was feeling a bit uncomfortable. but she was determined to try. 

before setting off on her adventure, she took a few deep breaths and told herself she could do it. with one last little leap, molly took off.

she was so close, but she hadnâ€™t quite made it yet. she kept going and going, pushing herself to keep going further. eventually she reached the end, and she had succeeded! 

molly was so proud of herself. she had faced her fears and done something she had never done before. she was a success.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named sam. he was playing hide and seek with his friends. sam wanted to be the first one to hide, so he quickly ran and hid in a big bush. but when he was hiding, he saw something scary! it was a ghost!

the ghost was very big and it was making loud, angry noises. sam was scared but he could not move. he was too scared to come out of the bush.

but then, his friends came to the same bush. they did not see the ghost. they started to cover up sam with leaves, because they thought he was still playing hide and seek.

but as soon as the leaves touched sam, the ghost got even angrier. it started to throw pieces of rocks and sticks at them. sam and his friends ran away as fast as they could. they all survived and never saw that ghost ever again!

once upon a time, there was a family with a mom, a dad, a big sister, and a little brother. they lived in a small house with a big tree in the yard. the family was broken because they didn't talk to each other. they were always sad and didn't play together.

one day, the big sister said, "i want to solve this problem. let's talk and play together." the little brother said, "yes, i want to be happy." so, they went to their mom and dad and asked them to join them.

the family started to talk and play together. they laughed and had fun. the broken family became happy again. they learned that talking and playing together can solve problems and make everyone happy. and they lived happily ever after.

lily and ben were playing in the park. they liked to run and slide and swing. they saw many things in the park: trees, flowers, birds, dogs, and people.

one day, they saw a big green truck in the park. it had a loud horn and a shiny ladder. lily and ben ran to the truck. they wanted to see it up close.

"hello, kids," said a man in a yellow hat. he was sitting in the truck. "do you like my truck?"

"yes, we do," said lily and ben. "it is very green and big. what do you do with it?"

"i am a firefighter," said the man. "i use my truck to put out fires and help people. sometimes i have to go very fast and far. do you know where i go?"

lily and ben shook their heads. they did not know.

"i go where the fire is," said the man. "sometimes it is in the east, sometimes it is in the west, sometimes it is in the north, and sometimes it is in the south. do you know what these words mean?"

lily and ben nodded. they knew. they learned them in school.

"east is where the sun comes up," said lily.

"west is where the sun goes down," said ben.

"north is where it is cold," said lily.

"south is where it is warm," said ben.

"very good," said the man. "you are smart kids. do you want to see the inside of my truck?"

"yes, please," said lily and ben.

the man smiled and opened the door. he let lily and ben sit in the truck. they saw many buttons and levers and screens. they felt very happy and excited.

they thanked the man and said goodbye. they ran back to their parents. they told them about the green truck and the firefighter. they said they learned new words and saw new things.

they recognized the truck when they saw it again. they waved to the man and he waved back. they felt proud and brave. they wanted to be firefighters when they grew up.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to spin around and around until she got dizzy. one day, she went to the park with her mom and dad. they saw a big tent and heard music coming from it. 

"what's that?" asked lily.

"that's an opera," said her mom.

"what's an opera?" asked lily.

"it's like a play with singing," said her dad.

lily was very enthusiastic and wanted to go inside. when they got in, they saw people singing and dancing on a big stage. lily loved it and started to spin around in circles. 

after the show, lily said, "i want to be in an opera one day!"

her mom and dad smiled and said, "we'll support you in whatever you want to do, lily."

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play with his toys, especially his toy cars. one day, timmy's mom gave him a napkin to wipe his hands after eating a sandwich. timmy thought the napkin was harmless and decided to use it to play with his cars. 

timmy pretended the napkin was a big mountain that his cars had to climb. but suddenly, timmy's little sister came into the room and accidentally destroyed the napkin mountain. timmy was sad because he couldn't play with his cars anymore. 

but then, timmy's mom gave him a new napkin to play with. this time, timmy was careful and made sure his little sister didn't destroy it. he had fun playing with his cars and the harmless napkin. the end.

once upon a time, there was a big boat with a door. the door was called a port. the boat could go on the water and take people to different places. 

one day, the wind was very strong and the boat was moving a lot. the captain told everyone to shut the port so the water would not come inside. 

the port was made of a flexible material that could move easily. when the wind stopped, the captain opened the port again and they continued their journey. 

everyone was happy and they arrived at their destination safely. the end.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved her teddy bear so much that she brought it everywhere she went. one day, lily and her mommy went to the store to buy some groceries. while they were there, lily saw a big, shiny toy car on display.

"mommy, can i have that car?" lily asked.

"no, sweetie. we can't buy everything we see on display," her mommy replied.

lily felt sad that she couldn't have the toy car, but her mommy took her to a special place in the store where they could play with some toys for free. lily forgot all about the toy car and had a lot of fun playing with the toys in the special place.

when they got home, lily displayed all of her toys in her room, including her teddy bear. she was happy again, knowing that she had a special place for all of her favorite things.

mia was a three-year-old girl who had very beautiful, long, white hair. her parents always made sure she combed her hair every day before going to bed. she enjoyed it very much, especially when the shiny teeth of the comb caught the light of the stars when it went through her hair.

one day, mia asked her dad "why do i need to comb my hair? is it because you care about me?"

her dad smiled and said "yes, of course! i care about you very much, so that's why i want you to brush your hair. we want it to be clean and healthy. that's why we comb it".

mia smiled and said "okay, i will always comb my hair if it shows you care."

from that day on, mia combed her beautiful, white hair every day. with her dad's help, she was always happy and her hair was always healthy and shining. with her dadâ€™s care, mia and her hair were happy and healthy!

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. he loved to play with his toys, especially his toy cars. one day, he went to the park to play with his friend, billy. they decided to play a game of soccer. timmy was the player and billy was the goalie. timmy kicked the ball so hard that it went over billy's head and into the bushes. timmy went to get the ball but he saw a gloomy looking dog. he was scared but he pushed his fear aside and slowly walked towards the dog. the dog turned out to be friendly and timmy was happy to have made a new friend. they played together for the rest of the day.

once upon a time there was a persistence little man who lived on a farm. one day he found an eraser lying in the field and decided to keep it as a reminder. every day he would look at the eraser, but he would feel very sad.

one day, his mom asked him: "why do you look so sad, dear?"
he looked up at her, blinking back tears, and said: "i miss the farm."

his mom gave him a hug and said, "let's go visit the farm today. i'm sure it will make us both happy."

so they hopped into the car and drove off. when they got to the farm, the little man was delighted. everywhere he looked he smiled, ran, and played. but when he tried to pick up the eraser, he started to weep.

his mom saw him weeping, so she hugged him tightly and said: "it's ok, sweetheart. you can keep the eraser and take it home with you. it will always be a reminder of our happy time at the farm."

the little man accepted the eraser with joy, and from then on his happiness was persistent.

once upon a time, there was a clever little mouse named timmy. timmy liked to carry his cane wherever he went. one day, while walking through the forest, timmy met a big, friendly bear named benny.

"hello, benny!" said timmy. "i like your big, furry coat."

"thank you, timmy," said benny. "i like your shiny cane. can i carry it for you?"

timmy thought for a moment. "sure, benny! but be careful not to break it."

benny picked up the cane and held it carefully in his big paws. "don't worry, timmy. i'll take good care of it."

from that day on, benny and timmy became the best of friends. benny would often carry timmy's cane for him, and timmy would share his clever ideas with benny. they had many adventures together in the forest, and they always looked out for each other.

one day, the family was going for a walk. as they walked, the mom noticed something on the ground. she asked, "who disagrees?â€. everyone shook their heads, but the younger brother said "me!"

the mom was surprised and asked why. the brother smiled, and said "it looks easy to pick up that thing."

the mom smiled, and said, "well, let's all disagree together, then!"

so, the entire family bent down and picked up the thing together. everyone had a smile on their face, and the mom was proud that her family had worked together. from then on, the family agreed that disagreeing could sometimes be a good thing.

once upon a time, there was a little chicken named chickie. chickie loved to collect eggs from the farm. one day, chickie found a big, brown egg. 

chickie asked her friend, cow, "do you think this egg will match the other eggs in my collection?" 

cow replied, "yes, chickie. that egg looks gentle and just like the others." 

chickie was so happy that she found a matching egg. she gently placed it in her basket and went back to the farm to show all her friends. they all clucked and cheered for chickie's new egg. 

from that day on, chickie made sure to always look for matching eggs to add to her collection. the end.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to sing and dance, but she was very shy. one day, her mommy gave her a notebook to write down her thoughts and feelings. lily loved her notebook and started to write in it every day.

one sunny day, lily's mommy took her to the park. they saw a tall tree and lily wanted to climb it, but she was too scared. her mommy told her to take a deep breath and remember what she wrote in her notebook. lily remembered that she wrote that she wanted to learn how to climb a tree.

lily took a deep breath and started to climb the tree. it was hard at first, but she kept going. when she reached the top, she felt very proud of herself. she wrote a note in her notebook that said, "i learned how to climb a tree today!" lily was very happy and felt very thin, like a feather in the wind.

teddy was feeling happy today. he was ready to take a bath. he grabbed a towel and a cup. he hopped into the warm bathtub with a smile on his face.

his mommy was on the doorstep. she asked, "what do you need, teddy?" teddy happily replied, "some soap, please!"

mommy gave teddy a big bar of soap that smelled delicious. he put it in the warm water and blew bubbles. he reached for the cup and splashed around, making waves in the tub.

teddy splashed and played for a long time until it was time to go. he hugged his mommy goodbye and sadly said, "i miss the bathtub already!" mommy answered, "i miss it too!"

mum and dad were playing with their child. they had some different coloured balls and they were throwing them up and down. dad said they were going to play football. the child was so excited!

dad said, "let's spin the different coloured balls around as you catch them". the child was so eager to try! so they started spinning the balls and the child was trying to catch them.

the child was spinning the ball when suddenly, the football came out! mum said, "oh, here's a football! let's play a game!" the child was thrilled and shouted, "yay!"

mum and dad showed the child how to throw and catch the football. it was so much fun for them all. they played for a long time until it was time to go home. the child was so happy. they had played with lots of different balls in different ways, and there was no better feeling!

once upon a time there was an adventurous little girl named emma. every day she would go out to explore and gain new experiences. but one day when emma went out, everything was very messy. everywhere she looked there was dirt, leaves and more mess. 

she didn't know what to do. she wanted to tidy it all up, but it was too hard for her. she started to feel defeated, but then she remembered she had a will. she could try her best to make things better! 

so, with a brave heart and a determined will, emma started tidying. she picked all the leaves off the ground and tidied all the mess she could. it was tiring but she kept going!

eventually, emma was able to gain back control of her garden. everything was neat and tidy, just the way she liked it. she was so proud of her hard work and she decided that no matter the mess she came across, she had the will to make it neat again.

once upon a time, there was a mama bear who lived with her two cubs in a deep, dark forest. one day, they noticed a big, old tree that was broken into two parts, and mama bear knew something had to be done. she went off to find something to help put it back together. 

they waited and soon enough mama bear returned with a shiny hammer and some wood. she got to work and soon enough the tree was restored. 

but when everyone was admiring the restored tree, one of the bear cubs started acting strange. everywhere he looked he was getting dizzy and didn't know what was wrong. mama bear quickly took him to the doctor, and it turns out he had earache. 

the doctor gave him some medicine and he was cured. the mama bear and her cubs were so relieved. 

they thanked the doctor and went back to the restored tree, safe and happy. the end!

one day, a big dog saw a small mouse run into a hole. the dog wanted to catch the mouse, so he ran after it and tried to dig the hole. but the hole was too small for the dog, and he got his nose stuck. the mouse saw the dog and laughed. he said, "you are not powerful, you are silly. you cannot fit in my hole. go away and leave me alone."

the dog felt angry and sad. he pulled and pulled, but he could not get his nose out. he started to cry and bark. he wished he had a friend to help him. he looked around and saw a cat. the cat was relaxing on a fence. she saw the dog and smiled. she said, "hello, dog. why are you crying and barking? do you need some help?"

the dog was surprised. he did not like cats. he thought they were mean and sneaky. but he was also scared and lonely. he said, "yes, please. i need some help. i tried to catch a mouse, but i got my nose stuck in his hole. can you help me get out?"

the cat was kind and clever. she said, "of course, i can help you. but you have to promise me something. you have to promise me that you will not chase mice or cats anymore. you have to be nice and friendly. can you do that?"

the dog thought for a moment. he realized that chasing mice and cats was not fun. it was hard and painful. he wanted to have friends and play. he said, "yes, i can do that. i promise i will not chase mice or cats anymore. i will be nice and friendly. please help me."

the cat nodded and jumped off the fence. she went to the hole and scratched it with her claws. she made the hole bigger and bigger, until the dog could pull his nose out. the dog was happy and relieved. he thanked the cat and licked her face. the cat purred and rubbed her head against his. they became friends and decided to relax together on the fence. the mouse watched them and smiled. he said, "maybe they are not so bad after all. maybe i can be their friend too." he came out of his hole and joined them on the fence. they all relaxed and enjoyed the sun. they learned that being powerful is not as important as being kind.

once upon a time, there was a wealthy man who owned a car. one day the tire of his car got flat and he was so unhappy. he went to a mechanic to examine the tire. 

the mechanic took a look and said "your tire is broken! you need a new one!" 

the rich man was very angry. he said "can't you fix it? don't you want to save the tire?" 

the mechanic replied "no sir, it's too late for that. the tire can't be mended." 

the wealthy man was angry and sad, but he had no choice but to buy a new tire. he paid a lot of money, but the tire he bought was old and weak. 

the next day, the car tire got flat again. the wealthy man was furious and had to buy another tire. he was so upset and angry that he never returned the mechanic's shop ever again!

once upon a time, there was a man. he was very nice and always tried to do the right thing. one day, he went to the store to buy some food for his dinner. he saw a big cake and thought it would be perfect for dessert. 

but when he got home and opened the cake, he saw that it was spoiled. that means it was not good to eat anymore. the man was sad because he really wanted to eat cake for dessert. 

he decided to go back to the store and ask for a new cake. the store was very nice and gave him a perfect cake. the man was happy and enjoyed his dessert very much. from then on, he always checked his food before he bought it so it wouldn't spoil again. the end.

once upon a time there was an old man and an old woman who loved each other very much. they lived in a little house with flowers around and a big tree in the backyard. every day they enjoyed the beauty and the peacefulness of the place, however, things were not always peaceful.

one day the old man and woman were walking in the garden and saw a shiny crystal on the ground. they got excited and ran to pick it up. but when they touched it, the crystal became very hot and suddenly magic started to happen! 

suddenly a little girl with blonde hair appeared from inside the crystal. the old man and woman were very scared and asked the girl who she was. she said her name was amy and explained that she was a princess from the magical kingdom inside the crystal. but unfortunately the old man had used too much of his strength to try and pick up the crystal, so he had broken it and now there was no way back home.

amy started to cry, but the old man and old woman said to her "don't be sad, princess. even when things don't happen the way you want you need to behave and be strong". then, the old woman found a way to repair the crystal with some magical words and the princess returned to her kingdom happily.

the old man and old woman learned an important lesson that day: even when bad things happen, if you stay calm and show courage, you can find a

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to bake with his mommy. they would make yummy cookies and cakes together. one day, timmy's mommy said they should make something healthy. timmy didn't like the sound of that, but he trusted his mommy.

they decided to make a piece of bread with lots of seeds and grains. timmy helped mix the dough and put it in the oven to bake. he was so excited to try it! when it was ready, they took a piece out and timmy took a big bite. but it didn't taste good at all. it was dry and hard and not sweet like he was used to.

timmy was very sad that he didn't like the healthy bread. he wished they had made cookies instead. from that day on, timmy didn't want to bake anything healthy with his mommy. he just wanted to make sweet treats.

lily and ben were playing in the park. they liked to slide and swing and run. lily had a big red boot that she brought from home. she liked to fill it with sand and make shapes.

"can i play with your boot, lily?" ben asked. he wanted to make a sand castle.

"no, it is mine!" lily said. she hugged the boot and ran away. ben felt sad and angry. he thought lily was naughty.

lily saw a big puddle near the fence. she wanted to splash in it with her boot. she put the boot on her foot and jumped in the puddle. but the boot was too big and it fell off. the puddle was deep and muddy. lily could not see her boot.

"help, help!" lily cried. she was scared and wet. she wanted her boot back.

ben heard lily and ran to her. he saw the boot in the puddle. he reached in and pulled it out. he gave it to lily.

"thank you, ben!" lily said. she was happy and sorry. she realized she was naughty.

"i'm sorry, ben. i should have shared my boot with you. do you want to play with it now?" lily asked.

"yes, please. and i have a blue hat we can share too. let's be friends!" ben said.

they smiled and hugged. they shared the boot and the hat and played together. they had fun and learned to share.

once upon a time there was a black cat. everywhere he went he got very, very dirty. his fur was filthy and he couldn't wait to take a bath. so one day he went to a pond and hopped in. he swished around and washed himself all over. he scrubbed himself and felt very clean. when he was done he climbed out and shook off. he had a great big smile and he looked beautiful and new! he hopped away with a bounce in his step. he was happy to be clean!

once upon a time, there was a little girl who loves to play. her name was gabby. every day she would play with her toys and sing her songs.

one day, gabby's mommy came to her with some scissors and some envelopes. she said, "gabby, we are going to mail some letters today." gabby was so excited! she was never allowed to do something herself that was so grown-up.

so they made the letters and put them in the envelope. then gabby got to take the scissors and cut the envelopes open. she was so proud of herself. gabby's mommy gave her some stamps and told her to put them on each envelope.

after gabby was done, she put the letters in the mailbox with a smile on her face. when she got back inside, her mommy said, "gabby, look at what we mailed today. remember that playful feeling when you put the letters in the mailbox?"

gabby nodded as she curled up into her mommy's lap. then she said, "let's mail more letters tomorrow." and they did!

once upon a time there were two friends who went to a classroom. they were both very excited to learn new things.

the teacher showed them lots of different objects, each one was special in its own way. the friends enjoyed learning about them.

at the end of the day, the teacher said it was time for sleep. the two friends said their goodbyes and went to their beds.

the next morning, the two friends went back to the classroom. everything seemed different now, with the morning sun shining through the windows. it looked really beautiful.

the two friends spent the morning learning and playing together. they enjoyed their time in the classroom together, until it was time for sleep again.

that night, when they got into bed, the two friends were tired but also very happy. they had had a really wonderful day.

lily was very happy. it was her birthday. she had a cake with four candles. she had a pink dress and a crown. she had many friends to play with.

"happy birthday, lily!" her friends said. they gave her hugs and gifts. lily smiled and said, "thank you, thank you!"

then, her mom said, "it's time to blow the candles, lily. make a wish!" lily closed her eyes and thought hard. she wished for something very special.

she opened her eyes and blew the candles. the lights went off and the room was dark. lily heard a noise. she looked around and saw a big surprise.

it was a puppy! a cute, fluffy, brown puppy. it ran to lily and licked her face. lily laughed and hugged the puppy. she felt its soft fur and warm tongue.

"mom, dad, is this for me?" lily asked.

"yes, sweetie, it is. happy birthday, lily. we love you," her mom and dad said.

lily was so happy. she had a cake, a dress, a crown, friends, and a puppy. she felt very lucky.

she said, "i love you, too. and i love my puppy. what is his name?"

"you can name him, lily. it's your choice," her dad said.

lily thought for a moment. she looked at the puppy and said, "i will name him lucky. because he is lucky to have me, and i am lucky to have him."

her friends clapped and cheered. they said, "that's a great name, lily. lucky is lucky. and you are lucky. happy birthday, lily!"

lily and lucky smiled and wagged their tails. they had a lot of fun. they played, ate, and sang. it was the best birthday ever.

the sun was shining outside and henry was so excited. he had been invited to explore a building today. as he scurried along, he met a friendly dog.

henry waved at the dog, but the dog just shook its head. henry furrowed his brows, he was getting frustrated. suddenly, the dog barked, â€œiâ€™m not allowed to come too! but you can invite me, if you want."

henry smiled. he nodded and said, â€œletâ€™s go!â€ and they set off together.

when they got to the building, henry was mesmerized by all the shiny things it had. he ran around in amazement, exploring every nook and cranny. the dog watched him excitedly, cheerfully following as henry went from room to room.

when henry had seen everything, he smiled and waved goodbye to the dog. he was happy that he had found such a wonderful adventure.

ben liked to ride his bike. he had a red bike with two big wheels and a bell. he always wore his helmet when he rode his bike. his helmet was blue and had a star on it. his helmet kept his head safe.

one day, ben wanted to ride his bike to the park. he asked his mom if he could go. his mom said yes, but he had to be back before lunch. she gave him a hug and a kiss and told him to have fun. ben put on his helmet and got on his bike. he was very happy.

he rode his bike along the sidewalk, past the houses and the trees. he saw some birds and some dogs and some cars. he rang his bell and waved to the people he met. he was having a lot of fun.

he got to the park and saw some other kids playing. he parked his bike near a bench and took off his helmet. he put his helmet on the bench and ran to join the kids. they played on the swings and the slide and the sandbox. they laughed and shouted and had a good time.

but ben forgot about his helmet. he left it on the bench. he did not see a big dog come by and sniff his helmet. the dog liked the smell of ben's helmet. he picked it up with his mouth and ran away. he chewed and bit and tore ben's helmet. he spoiled ben's helmet.

when ben was done playing, he said goodbye to the kids and went back to his bike. he looked for his helmet, but he could not find it. he saw some pieces of his helmet on the ground. he saw some teeth marks and some drool on his helmet. he felt very sad. his helmet was spoiled.

he picked up his helmet and got on his bike. he rode his bike back home. he was not happy. he did not ring his bell or wave to the people. he got home and showed his mom his helmet. his mom saw his helmet and felt sorry for him. she hugged him and said she was sorry. she said she would get him a new helmet. she said there were many helmets available at the store. she said he could pick one he liked. she said she loved him.

ben felt a little better. he thanked his mom and said he loved her too. he hoped he would find a new helmet soon. he hoped it would be blue and have a star on it. he hoped no dog would spoil it. he learned to always keep his helmet with him when he rode his bike. he still liked to ride his bike. he was a good boy.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved the color green and always ate yummy vegetables. one day, lily went to the park to play with her friend, timmy.

"hi, timmy! do you want to play on the swings?" asked lily.

"no, i want to climb the big tree!" said timmy.

lily was scared of climbing trees, but she didn't want to say no to her friend. she tried to climb the tree, but she fell down and hurt her arm. she cried and cried.

timmy didn't know what to do. he felt bad and said, "i'm sorry, lily. i didn't know you couldn't climb trees. are you okay?"

lily shook her head and said, "no, it hurts."

timmy ran to get help, but it was too late. lily had to go to the hospital and get a cast on her arm. she couldn't play with timmy for a long time. she missed her friend and wished she had said no to climbing the tree.

once upon a time there was a young boy named tony. tony was three years old and always eager to learn new things. one day, tony was walking through the forest with his mom when he was stopped by an old wise man. 

the old wise man had a long grey beard and crinkly eyes that sparkled when tony's mom said hello to him. he put his hands on tony's shoulders and said, "have you ever seen wisdom before?" 

tony shook his head. his mom smiled and said, "let's show you."

the old man took tony's hand and led him to a nearby tree. he said, "look here. wisdom is like this new leaf. it grows and changes over time. it's something you can always learn from." 

the old man smiled at tony and said, "that's wisdom, my friend. display it and it will be yours for life!" tony smiled and thanked the old man for showing him such a wonderful thing. he wanted very much to display his wisdom in all he did. 

the old man smiled and said, "good luck! wisdom awaits you!" and with that, the old man slowly disappeared. tony took a deep breath, smiled and set off to display his newfound wisdom throughout his life.

once upon a time, there was a little kitten named mittens. mittens was very cute and adorable, with soft fur and big green eyes. one day, mittens saw a pen with ink in it on the table. mittens wanted to play with the pen, so he picked it up in his mouth and carried it away.

mittens started to perform some tricks with the pen. he tried to write his name, but all that came out was a big blob of ink. mittens didn't mind, though. he was having fun playing with the ink and the pen.

suddenly, mittens heard his owner coming. he quickly hid the pen under the couch and pretended to be sleeping. mittens' owner saw him and thought he looked adorable. mittens was happy that he didn't get in trouble for playing with the ink. from then on, mittens knew he had to be careful when playing with things that weren't his.

once upon a time there was a naughty bird. he was very curious and wanted to explore everywhere. one day the bird decided to fly to the top of the tree. as he was flying, he noticed a big branch jutting out from the tree. he decided to land on the branch.

the bird marked the branch with his small claws. he wanted to make sure it was always here when he wanted to come back. then he flew around the tree and explored more. he found some interesting things like a bright red berry! 

but then the bird heard a strange noise. he looked up and saw a big furry creature coming near the branch. it was a fox. the fox was very naughty and wanted to get the bird. the bird was scared and flew away quickly. the fox was too slow and could not catch the bird.

the naughty bird went back to the branch every day to make sure it was still there. he was always happy to find that it was still there. the branch was his favourite spot and it was safe from the naughty fox. 
the end.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a sister named anna. they lived in a small house with their furry dog, max.

one sunny day, lily and anna went to the park with max. they played and laughed all day. but then, max started to bark. lily did not listen to max. she kept playing with anna. max barked louder and louder. anna told lily, "we should listen to max."

lily stopped and listened to max. she saw that max was trying to tell them something. they followed max and found a lost little boy. the boy was sad and scared. lily and anna helped the boy find his mom. the mom was so happy and thanked them.

the sisters learned that it is important to listen. sometimes, others know things we do not. by listening, we can help and learn from them.

max was a little boy. he liked to whistle as he walked along. he liked to whistle so much that he even whistled in the bath. he picked up some of the soap and started to whistle a tune. the soap was light and creamy, and it floated through the air as max spun it around. max smiled and laughed, enjoying the fun his whistling made. he wrapped the soap back up and put it away, and then he went for a walk, whistling again. he walked through a sunny park, feeling the light of the sun on his skin. max kept whistling as he walked, and his happy little tune filled the air.

once upon a time there was a shy king who ruled over a kingdom. in his kingdom he had recorders who wrote down everything the king said and did. one day the king was feeling very shy and he decided to hide. he tried to make sure no one could find him. suddenly one of the recorders noticed the king had gone missing and he declared an alert. the entire kingdom searched everywhere but they could not find the king. everyone was getting worried. after days of searching the kingdom finally found the king! he had been hiding in the nearby forest. the recorders were overjoyed and they quickly got to work and recorded all the events of the king's disappearance. the kingdom was relieved and the shy king vowed to never hide again.

once, there was a little girl who wanted to play a game. she ran to her room and got out her toy box. inside, she found a shield, but it was very messy.

the little girl wanted to organize it so she could play with it. she put all the pieces in a line and made sure they were neat. then she took a cloth and polished the shield.

finally, it was time to play. she picked up the shield and pretended she was a knight. with it, she could protect herself and fight against the bad guys.

the little girl was very happy with her cheap shield. she waved it around, imagining all the adventures that were waiting for her. from then on, she kept it organized and used it to make all kinds of stories.

once upon a time, there was a little bunny. the bunny lived in a big field with lots of other animals. one day, the bunny saw a very noisy bird. the bird was singing a very loud song. the bunny did not like the noisy bird, so he hopped away to find a quiet spot.

as the bunny was hopping, he saw a big hole in the ground. the bunny was curious, so he went to look inside. suddenly, he fell into the hole! the bunny was scared and he wanted to escape. but he could not find a way out. 

the bunny stayed in the hole for a long time. he was very sad and missed his friends. one day, he heard a noise outside the hole. it was his friends! they had been looking for him. they found a way to help the bunny escape from the hole. the bunny was so happy to be with his friends again.

once upon a time there lived an adorable little spider called steve. one day steve was walking in the garden and saw something exciting. he decided to take a closer look.

steve got closer and saw a big rock. he started to rub the rock with his tiny little legs. suddenly, the rock started to move. 

steve was so surprised that he jumped back. he saw something emerge from underneath the rock. it was a little rabbit.

the rabbit said, "hi there! what are you doing?" 

steve replied, "hi! i'm just rubbing this rock."

the rabbit said, "ah, that's nice" and they both went back to rubbing the rock. 

they had so much fun that they both forgot to stop. after a while, steve realized how late it was and said goodbye to the rabbit and went home.

steve was so happy that he made a new friend! he knew that this would be an adventure he would never forget.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named tim. one day, he went for a walk with his mom. while walking, tim saw a big rock. he wanted to jump over it, but his mom said, "be careful, tim. it's important to watch where you walk."

tim didn't listen and jumped over the rock. "ouch!" he cried. tim felt pain in his foot. he was very sad. his mom hugged him and said, "i told you to be careful. now you know why it's important to listen."

from that day on, tim always listened to his mom. he knew it was important to be careful and not feel pain. tim and his mom went on many more walks together, and they were always happy. the moral of the story is to always listen and be careful.

once upon a time, there was a foolish sun in the sky. it was so foolish that it often disappeared behind clouds and made them go grey.

one day, a little girl saw the sun and wanted to play. but just when she stepped outside and looked to the sky, the foolish sun had disappeared behind the clouds.

but the little girl was not sad. she knew that eventually the sun would come out from behind the clouds and she would be able to play.

she waited and waited but the sun didn't reappear. she started to get a little bit worried. then, just when she was feeling silly and helpless, the sun suddenly returned!

the little girl was so happy to see the sun again that she ran around, clapping with joy. when the sun disappeared behind the clouds, she knew it would always come back!

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. one day, she was playing outside when she heard a loud noise. she looked around and saw that a bird had gotten stuck in a pipe.

lily ran to her mom and said, "mommy, there's a bird in the pipe! we need to save it!"

her mom quickly came outside and saw the bird. "you're right, lily. we need to help it. but how can we get it out?"

lily thought for a moment and said, "i have an idea! we can use this attractive toy to lure the bird out of the pipe."

so they tried lily's idea and it worked! the bird flew out of the pipe and into the sky. lily and her mom felt happy that they were able to save the bird.

john was a clever three-year-old who loved to play outside. he often went for walks with his mom and dad. one day, john asked them if he could ride on a mule. his dad thought for a moment and said, "we don't have a mule, but if you're a good boy and take a nap, we'll see what we can do."

john knew he would need to be extra good while his parents were away. he took his nap, and when he awoke, his parents had returned with a mule. he was so excited he could hardly stand still! his dad told him how clever he was and that he had learned to ride the mule.

john couldn't believe it! his dad had taught him how to ride a mule and now he was a regular cowboy. he hopped on the mule and rode around the town all day. everyone was amazed at how skillfully he was riding. 

finally, the day came to a close and john had to return home. but his short time riding the mule was a day he would never forget. he was so proud and thanked his dad for teaching him such a clever skill!

sara loves her bird, sunny. sunny is yellow and sings a lot. sara likes to watch sunny in his birdcage. sometimes, sara wants to play with sunny outside the birdcage. but mom says no.

"sunny needs to stay in his birdcage, sara. he is safe and happy there. if he goes outside, he might fly away or get hurt by a cat or a dog," mom says.

"but mom, i want to hold sunny and pet him. he is my friend. he likes me too. please, mom, please," sara insists.

mom shakes her head. "no, sara, i'm sorry. you can talk to sunny and give him some seeds, but you can't take him out of his birdcage. maybe when you are older, you can learn how to handle him gently and carefully. but not now."

sara feels sad and angry. she thinks mom is mean and unfair. she decides to wait until mom is busy in the kitchen. then, she sneaks into the living room and opens the birdcage. she reaches for sunny and tries to grab him. but sunny is scared and flaps his wings. he flies out of the birdcage and out of the window. sara gasps and runs after him.

"sunny, sunny, come back!" she cries. "i'm sorry, sunny, i didn't mean to scare you. please, sunny, please."

but sunny is gone. he is in the sky, with the other birds. he feels free and happy. he sings a loud song. he doesn't want to go back to the birdcage.

sara is in the yard, with tears in her eyes. she sees mom coming out of the house. she knows mom will be angry and sad too. she doesn't know what to say.

"mom, i'm sorry, i'm sorry," she sobs. "i just wanted to play with sunny. i thought he would be fine. but he flew away. he flew away, mom."

mom hugs sara and sighs. she is angry and sad too. but she also loves sara and understands her. she knows sara didn't mean to hurt sunny. she knows sara learned a hard lesson.

"it's okay, sara, it's okay," she says. "i know you love sunny. but you have to remember that he is a bird, not a toy. he needs his birdcage to be safe and happy. he is not like us. he belongs to the sky, not to the house. maybe he will come back someday, maybe not. but we have to let him go. we have to say goodbye to sunny."

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play with her dolls and sing songs. one day, lily's mom came in with some news. she said that they had to move to a new house far away. lily was sad because she loved their beautiful home.

when they got to the new house, lily saw that it was not as beautiful as their old one. she felt unhappy and missed her old friends. but then, she saw a big rock in the backyard. she climbed on it and sat there, feeling better. she realized that even though things were different, she could still find happiness in new places.

lily's mom saw her sitting on the rock and came over to talk to her. they talked about how change can be hard, but it can also bring new adventures. lily felt better and knew that she would make new friends and have new fun times in their new home.

lila and tom were at the zoo with their mom. they saw many animals, but their favorite was the seal. the seal was big and gray, and had a thick fur. it liked to swim and splash in the water.

"look, mom, the seal is waving at us!" lila said, pointing at the seal that lifted its flipper.

"maybe it wants to say hello," mom said. "do you want to say hello back?"

"yes, yes!" lila and tom said, and waved their hands at the seal.

the seal seemed happy, and made a loud noise. it sounded like "arf, arf, arf!"

"what is it saying, mom?" tom asked.

"i don't know, maybe it's saying thank you for being nice," mom said. "or maybe it's saying that it values your friendship."

"what does value mean, mom?" lila asked.

"it means that you care about something or someone very much, and that you think they are important and special," mom said.

"oh, i see. i value you, mom, and i value tom, and i value the seal too," lila said.

"i value you too, lila, and i value mom, and i value the seal too," tom said.

"i value you both, lila and tom, and i value the seal too," mom said.

they all smiled and hugged each other, and then waved at the seal again. the seal waved back, and arfed some more. they felt happy and warm, and knew that they had made a new friend.

once there was a little girl. her name was mandy. she was three years old.
she had a big dream. she wanted to be a lamp.
one day she told her mom about her dream. her mom smiled and said it was a great idea.

so that night, mandy hoped and wished to be a lamp. soon enough, her dream came true.
mandy could now shine and twinkle like a bright lamp. she bounced around and twirled among the stars.

mandy was so happy that she could make people smile while they looked at her bright light. she realized that hope can sometimes come true.

sara and ben are twins. they like to play soccer in the park. but they do not have good equipment. their ball is old and flat. their shoes are too small and hurt their feet.

one day, their mom says, "i have a surprise for you. we are going to buy new equipment for soccer. come with me to the store."

sara and ben are very happy. they hop in the car and go to the store. the store is big and open. it has many things for soccer. balls, shoes, nets, cones, jerseys, and more.

mom says, "you can choose one thing each. what do you want?"

sara says, "i want a new ball. a big and round and shiny ball. like this one." she points to a red ball with white stars.

ben says, "i want new shoes. shoes that fit and are fast and cool. like these ones." he shows a pair of blue shoes with yellow stripes.

mom says, "okay, those are good choices. let's buy them and go to the park."

sara and ben are very excited. they thank mom and pay for their equipment. they run to the car and drive to the park. they can't wait to play soccer with their new equipment. they feel happy and proud.

once upon a time, there was a little bird. the bird loved to sing every day. it would sing in the morning, in the afternoon, and in the evening. one day, the bird woke up early to see the sunrise. it was beautiful! the sky turned pink and orange, and the sun came up over the mountains. the bird sang a happy song.

later that day, the bird flew to a new place. it was a harsh place with no trees or flowers. the bird felt sad and didn't want to sing anymore. but then, the bird remembered the sunrise and how beautiful it was. it started to sing again, and soon other birds joined in. together, they made a beautiful song that filled the harsh place with joy.

from that day on, the little bird sang every day. it didn't matter where it was or how harsh the place was. the sunrise reminded the bird that there is always something beautiful to sing about.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to draw and make things with her hands. one day, she decided to design a special hat for her teddy bear. she used colorful paper and glue to make it just right.

later that day, lily went to a meeting with her friends. they were going to have a picnic in the park. when they saw lily's bear with the unusual hat, they all wanted one too! so, lily helped her friends design their own hats.

everyone had a great time at the picnic, wearing their unique hats and playing games. lily felt happy that she could share her love of creating things with her friends. from that day on, they had many more meetings where they designed and made things together.

emily looked at the beautiful flowers. she saw some butterflies fluttering around them. she smiled and decided to pick a few. she carefully moved them into her basket.

suddenly, her tummy rumbled. she knew it was almost lunchtime. emily carefully put the flowers back and moved towards the house. her mom was in the kitchen and when she saw emily, she smiled. she asked, "what would you like for lunch?".

emily thought for a moment. she felt thoughtful, and it seemed like the perfect time to try something new. her mom asked, "what about a tasty salad?". emily nodded and said, "move me to try it please!".

her mom laughed and said, "of course!". she moved to the fridge and made a gentle salad for emily's empty stomach. she served it with a smile.

emily tucked into the delicious salad and knew she had made a wise decision. she thanked her mom for being so thoughtful.

once there was a boy called max. he was three years old and he liked to watch movies. one day he was at the park with his family. he was feeling fine and he ran around and chased the birds.

suddenly, he felt his foot slip and he fell to the ground. he started to cry, but his dad came over and helped him get up. he was all right and his dad was happy too.

they all went to the movies that evening. max liked the movie because it was fine. he didn't even think about falling. he just enjoyed the movie and all the fun with his family.

once there was a puppy named snuggles who was always very alert. one day, he was walking down a row of houses when he heard something that sounded like a voice calling for help. snuggles hesitated, but then he ignored it and kept on walking.

snuggles kept walking until he heard the voice again. this time, he paid attention and stopped. he looked around and noticed a green house on the end of the row. he walked towards it, and sure enough the voice was coming from inside.

snuggles peeked inside the window. inside the house was a little girl, who was crying for help. he barked to get her attention and she ran to the window.

the little girl opened the window and hugged snuggles. she told him that she had been stuck inside all day because her parents had gone out and had forgotten to let her out. she thanked snuggles for being so alert and ignoring his own safety to come and help her. 

the little girl and snuggles spent the rest of the day playing in her garden. snuggles was very happy that he had been alert enough to ignore his own safety and help the little girl.

sammy was at the beach with his parents. he watched as the waves rocked against the shore. he was amazed at how lively the ocean was. 

his parents put him on a surfboard and told him to catch a wave. he was scared at first but when he tried it, he felt a rush of excitement. he rocked back and forth with the surf. he felt alive, like he could do anything. 

as he rode the fish, he smiled and laughed. he kept riding the waves, going up and down. more and more surfers started to join him and before he knew it, the beach was filled with people. 

sammy had a great time. he couldn't believe he got to surf on such a lively beach day. he had never had so much fun in his life. he couldn't wait to come back and rock the waves again!

one day, joshua went to the park. he saw a big purple fish swimming in the pond. joshua was so excited that he couldn't help but to smile and giggle. then, the fish yawned and joshua also yawned too. he thought it was so funny that they had the same thing in common. joshua wanted to catch the fish. but the fish was too fast. so, joshua just enjoyed watching the fish swim in the pond. after a while, the fish swam away. joshua gave one last goodbye to the fish and waved goodbye. then he went back home.

once upon a time, there was a kind man. his name was tom. tom loved to cook yummy food. he made pancakes, eggs, and bacon for breakfast. he also made soup and sandwiches for lunch. for dinner, he cooked spaghetti and meatballs.

one day, tom went to the store to buy a new motor for his car. when he got home, he put the motor in his car and fixed it. his car was now working again!

tom was a very thoughtful man. he always helped his friends and family. he cooked meals for them and fixed things when they were broken. everyone loved tom because he was kind and helpful.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play dress-up and wear pretty clothes. one day, she asked her mommy if she could wear a new dress. "mommy, can i wear a new dress please?" lily requested. 

her mommy went to the closet and showed her a beautiful dress. "this is the style of the season, lily. it will look impressive on you," her mommy said. 

lily put on the dress and twirled around. "wow, mommy! this dress is so pretty! thank you for letting me wear it," lily said happily. 

her mommy smiled and said, "you're welcome, lily. you look very impressive in that dress. now let's go show daddy!" and they went to show lily's daddy her new dress.

once there was a mommy and a nursery. the nursery was full of lots of fun things, like toys, games and stuff. but one day, something "dangerous" showed up. it was a bottle of "poison". the mommy was so scared that the kids would get hurt so she was worried all day.

but then, the mommy thought of something. she knew that if she was careful and did her best, the "poison" would stay away from the kids. she quickly put it in a special place with a lock so it wouldn't fit anywhere near the nursery.

the mommy sighed with relief. she had made sure that the nursery was safe. she thanked her lucky stars that the "dangerous" "poison" was locked away and no longer a threat. now the kids could play safely without fear!

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lucy. she loved to work and patch with her dad. one day, lucy asked her dad for help with a fragile patch.

"daddy, can you help me patch this?" asked lucy.

"sure thing, sweetie," he replied, "but you'll have to be very careful. this patch is very fragile so you'll need to be extra gentle when mending it."

lucy nodded and slowly worked on the patch with her daddy, taking extra care not to damage it. after a while, their hard work paid off and the patch was as good as new.

lucy and her dad hugged each other proudly and smiled.

"i'm so glad we could fix it together," said lucy.

"me too," said her dad, "we make a good team!"

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside and explore. one day, she went to a stream to play with her friends. they had lots of fun splashing in the water and catching little fish.

but then, lily's mom came to pick her up. she was embarrassed because she was all wet and her clothes were muddy. her mom told her not to worry, and they went home to change.

later that day, lily decided to separate her toys into different piles. she put her dolls in one pile and her blocks in another. it made her feel happy and organized.

once upon a time, there was a small boy named bob. bob was very anxious. he was afraid of the dark, so he always kept a candle beside his bed. one night, bob woke up and remembered he had forgotten to lock his bedroom door. he got out of bed nervously and quickly walked to the door.

bob grabbed the doorknob and tried to turn it, but the door wouldn't budge. then, he heard a loud voice. it was his mum! she said, "bob, why aren't you locked in your room?" bob looked down, embarrassed. he quickly replied, "i forgot to lock the door, mum."

mum said, "there's no need to worry. i will help you lock the door." she grabbed the key and put it in the lock. she turned the key and there was a clicking sound! the door was now locked.

bob was relieved. he thanked his mother and grabbed his candle. he lit it up and the yellow light lit up his room. with his candle beside him, bob felt much less anxious and went back to bed.

lily and tom were playing in the park. they saw a big pole with a sign on it. the sign said "do not climb". lily wanted to climb the pole. she thought it would be fun. tom did not want to climb the pole. he thought it would be dangerous.

"come on, tom, let's climb the pole!" lily said.

"no, lily, we should not climb the pole. the sign says no. we could fall and hurt ourselves." tom said.

lily did not listen to tom. she ran to the pole and grabbed it. she tried to pull herself up. but the pole was slippery and hard. she could not climb the pole. she slid down and fell on the ground. she scraped her knee and started to cry.

tom ran to lily and helped her up. he saw blood on her knee. he was frightened. he did not like blood. he hugged lily and said, "i'm sorry, lily. are you okay?"

lily nodded. she was sorry too. she said, "i'm sorry, tom. you were right. i should not have climbed the pole. i was silly. can you forgive me?"

tom smiled. he said, "of course i can forgive you, lily. you are my friend. but next time, let's resist the pole, okay?"

lily smiled back. she said, "okay, tom. let's resist the pole. and let's go to the nurse and get a band-aid for my knee."

they held hands and walked to the nurse. they learned their lesson. they did not climb the pole again.

anna and ben were twins who liked to play in the park. one day, they saw a big brown bear in a cage. the bear looked sad and lonely.

"can we go and say hello to the bear?" anna asked.

"ok, but we have to be careful. the bear might be naughty and bite us," ben said.

they walked closer to the cage and saw a sign that said "do not feed the bear". but anna and ben did not know how to read. they thought the sign was a picture of a cake.

"look, the bear wants some cake. let's give him some of ours," anna said.

she took out a piece of cake from her pocket and threw it into the cage. the bear sniffed the cake and ate it. he liked it very much.

"more, more!" the bear growled.

anna and ben were happy to see the bear smile. they threw more cake into the cage. the bear ate it all and licked his lips.

"thank you, thank you!" the bear growled.

but then, something bad happened. the cake made the bear feel sick. he started to cough and sneeze. he felt angry and restless. he wanted to get out of the cage.

he pushed the cage door with his paws. the door was old and rusty. it broke open with a loud bang.

the bear was free. he ran out of the cage and towards anna and ben.

"run, run!" ben shouted.

anna and ben were scared. they ran away from the bear as fast as they could. they looked for their mom and dad, who were sitting on a bench nearby.

"mom, dad, help!" they cried.

mom and dad saw the bear chasing their children. they were shocked and worried. they got up and ran to them.

they reached anna and ben and hugged them. they were safe.

the bear stopped and looked at them. he felt sorry for what he had done. he did not want to hurt them. he just wanted some cake.

he turned around and walked back to his cage. he lay down and closed his eyes. he hoped someone would come and take him to a better place. a place where he could be happy and free.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named tim. he was very sad and miserable because he always forgot things. one day, he forgot to bring his favorite toy to the park. he sat on a bench, feeling very unhappy.

a friendly squirrel saw tim and asked, "why are you so sad, tim?" tim said, "i forgot my toy at home, and now i have nothing to play with." the squirrel thought for a moment and said, "i have an idea! let's play together. we can run and jump in the park."

tim liked the squirrel's opinion and decided to play with him. they ran and jumped all around the park, laughing and having fun. tim felt much better because he had a new friend to play with. he learned that even if he forgot something, he could still have fun and be happy. from that day on, tim was not so miserable anymore, and he always remembered to look for the good things in life.

once upon a time, there lived two best friends, daisy and emily. daisy and emily loved going to the gym together. 

on one sunny afternoon, daisy and emily entered the gym. emily whispered, "let's go and play with the balls." daisy happily said, "yes!" 

they grabbed some balls and went to a calm corner. "let's play catch!" daisy said, while gently throwing a ball to emily. emily smiled and threw the ball back to daisy.

they continued playing until they heard a clap. looking around, they saw daisy's mom standing near the door. "come on daisy, time to go home," she said softly.

emily and daisy hugged eachother as daisy waved goodbye and left. "see you tomorrow," emily whispered. 

and so every day, daisy and emily would go to the gym and whisper secrets to eachother whilst playing catch with the balls.

once upon a time, there was a helpless girl. she was walking in a meadow and she saw a big envelope. she was surprised, and went close to have a look. suddenly, a big wind came and scattered the envelope all around. the helpless girl was very sad and felt like she had lost something very important.

but then, a big bird came flying from the sky and started picking up the pieces from the envelope. he put them back together, carefully, and dropped it off in the same place. the helpless girl was very happy and could not believe it. she hugged the envelope tightly and thanked the bird for his help.

soon enough, the girl opened the envelope and found a great surprise. inside, there was a toy for her to play with. her eyes lit up and she was happier than ever! from that day onwards, the little helpless girl and the big bird were best friends.

once upon a time, there was a little girl who liked to compete in races. she was very competitive and would practice every day. she was always determined to win each race.

one day, she went to the meadow to practice. as she was running, she noticed a herd of sheep standing in the meadow. she smiled and stopped to watch them.

the little girl noticed that the sheep were not running in a race. they were content to just stand there and the little girl thought that it was beautiful. she thought that it was ok to stand and be content with who she was and let her competitors run their own race.

the little girl learned an important lesson that day; it was ok to be competitive and practice for races, but it was also ok to stand still sometimes and be at peace.

once upon a time, there was a girl named lily. she had a pet dog named max. max was big and furry. he loved to play with lily all day long.

one day, lily and max went to the park. they were having so much fun playing fetch with a ball. suddenly, max barked very loud. lily asked max what was wrong. max needed to go potty!

lily took max to the bushes and waited for him to finish. max was a good boy and did his business quickly. lily was happy that max told her he needed to go. they continued playing fetch and having fun at the park.

timmy was so excited to go to the park. he had a picnic lunch packed in his bag and was wearing his favourite shorts. when he arrived at the park, he saw something unusual. through the faucet, water was coming out and it was shooting into the air wildly! timmy had never seen anything like it before. 

he started to laugh and run around the faucet, letting the water spray all over him. his mom, seeing this, laughed and said, â€œwhat an unusual surprise!â€ she reached into her bag and pulled out a bright red umbrella. she opened it and twirled it around with timmy, so the water sprayed them both. 

the water show was so much fun. timmy and his mom kept playing and laughing until the water began to slow down and eventually stopped altogether. timmy thanked his mom for the best park trip ever, and they hugged before heading home.

once upon a time, there was a small cat named kitty. kitty loved to play outside. one day, kitty saw a big tree and wanted to climb it. so, she climbed up, up, up the tree. but, oh no! kitty was stuck and could not get down.

kitty's friend, doggy, heard her cry. "help me, doggy!" said kitty. doggy wanted to rescue kitty and make her safe. he thought of a plan. doggy found a long rope and held it in his mouth.

doggy threw the rope up to kitty. "hold on, kitty!" said doggy. kitty held the rope tight. doggy pulled and pulled, and kitty came down from the tree. kitty was safe now and happy to be on the ground.

kitty and doggy played together in the grass. they were happy to be safe and together. from that day on, kitty never climbed a tree too high, and doggy always had a rope, just in case. they were the best of friends, always ready to rescue each other.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play at the park. her favorite thing to do was slide down the big, red slide. lily would slide down the slide all day long. she would laugh and have fun.

one day, lily saw a little boy named tim sitting on a bench. he looked sad. lily walked up to him and asked, "why are you sad?" tim looked down at his shirt and said, "i have a pattern on my shirt, and the other kids laughed at me." lily saw the pattern of stars on tim's shirt and thought it was nice.

lily had an idea. she told tim, "let's slide down the slide together. we can be proud of your pattern." tim smiled and they both went to the slide. they slid down the slide, laughing and having fun. the other kids saw them and wanted to join in. soon, everyone was sliding and playing together.

lily and tim showed the other kids that it was okay to be different and to be proud of who you are. the kids learned that being kind and including others is important. and from that day on, they all played happily together at the park.

lily and ben were playing with their toy animals in the garden. they had a big box with many animals, like lions, elephants, monkeys and snakes. they liked to make noises and pretend they were in the jungle.

but one day, a snake escaped from the box. it was a green and yellow snake, with a shiny scale on its back. it slithered away, looking for a place to hide. lily and ben did not see it, they were too busy playing.

the snake found a hole under the fence. it crawled inside, hoping to find some food. but it was a bad idea. on the other side of the fence, there was a big dog. the dog saw the snake and barked loudly. it wanted to catch the snake and play with it.

the snake was scared and confused. it did not know what to do. it tried to go back to the hole, but the dog was too fast. it blocked the hole with its paw. the snake hissed and coiled, ready to bite.

lily and ben heard the noise. they stopped playing and looked at the fence. they saw the dog and the snake. they were worried and curious.

"look, ben, it's our snake!" lily said. "how did it escape?"

"i don't know, lily. maybe it was bored in the box." ben said. "we have to save it. the dog is angry."

they ran to the fence and called the dog. they tried to make it go away. they threw some sticks and stones. they shouted and clapped. but the dog did not listen. it wanted the snake.

the snake was in trouble. it had no place to go. it wished it was back in the box, with the other animals. it wished it never escaped.

lily and ben are playing in the park. they see a big slide. lily wants to go first. she climbs up the steps and sits on the slide. she says, "whee!" and slides down.

ben follows her. he climbs up the steps and sits on the slide. he says, "whee!" and slides down too. but he slides too fast and falls off the slide. he lands on the wood chips. he says, "ow! ow! ow!"

lily runs to him. she says, "are you okay, ben?" she helps him get up. she sees a scratch on his knee. she says, "you have a boo-boo. let me kiss it." she kisses his knee. he says, "thank you, lily. you are a good friend."

they hug each other. they see a man with a cart. he is selling ice cream. they run to him. they ask, "can we have some ice cream, please?" he says, "sure, what flavor do you want?" they say, "chocolate!" he gives them each a cone with a scoop of chocolate ice cream. they say, "thank you, mister!" they lick their ice cream. they say, "yummy! yummy! yummy!" they smile and laugh. they forget about the fall. they are happy.

sara and tom were playing in their room. they had many toys and books, but they wanted to do something new. sara had an idea.

"let's dress up like mom and dad!" she said. "we can use their clothes and hats and shoes."

tom liked the idea. he ran to their closet and found a big shirt and a tie. sara found a dress and a scarf. they put on the clothes and looked at each other. they laughed.

"we look funny!" tom said.

"let's go to the kitchen and pretend to cook!" sara said.

they went to the kitchen and saw a big oven. mom had put a cake in the oven before she went to the store. she told them not to touch the oven, because it was very hot. but sara and tom did not remember.

sara opened the oven and saw the cake. it smelled good. it had thick chocolate on top.

"wow, look at the cake!" sara said. "can we have some?"

tom nodded. he reached for the cake. but he did not see the oven mitts. he touched the cake pan with his hand. it was very hot. he screamed.

"ow, ow, ow!" he cried. "it hurts!"

sara was scared. she closed the oven and ran to tom. she saw his hand was red and swollen.

"tom, are you okay?" she asked. "we need to tell mom!"

they heard the door open. mom came back from the store. she heard tom crying and sara calling. she ran to the kitchen and saw what happened.

"oh, no!" she said. "what did you do?"

she took tom to the sink and put his hand under cold water. she hugged him and sara and said sorry.

"we were playing dress up and we wanted some cake," sara said. "we forgot you said not to touch the oven."

mom sighed. she was angry, but she was also glad they were not hurt more.

"i know you were playing, but you have to listen to me," she said. "the oven is very dangerous. you could have burned yourself badly. you have to be careful."

sara and tom nodded. they said sorry too. they learned their lesson. they did not play with the oven again. they waited for the cake to cool down and then mom gave them a slice. it was still good. they said thank you and hugged mom. they loved her. she loved them too.

once upon a time there was a little girl named lulu. she was deaf and couldn't hear the world around her like other people.

one day, lulu wanted to explore the universe. she imagined all the wonderful things she would find and the exciting places she could go. 

but on that day, something else happened. lulu became friends with a kind, wise old lady and they talked until the sun went down. the old lady taught her all about the world and how it works. she showed lulu that the universe isn't just about seeing and hearing, it's about helping and understanding too. 

lulu learned that becoming deaf didn't mean she couldn't explore the world, she just had to find different ways to do it. she learned to listen with her heart, instead of her ears. 

the moral of the story is that no matter what, you can still explore the world by being kind and understanding. even if you can't hear, you can still be part of the universe.

tom and his mom went to the museum. they wanted to see the big dinosaurs. tom loved dinosaurs. he had many dinosaur toys at home.

when they got to the museum, they had to unpack their bags. the museum lady said they could not bring food or drinks inside. she checked their bags and gave them a sticker. tom put the sticker on his shirt. he was proud.

"look, mom, a t-rex!" tom said, pointing to a huge skeleton. he ran to the dinosaur and looked up. it was taller than his house. he wanted to touch it, but there was a rope around it.

"be careful, tom. don't cross the rope. the dinosaur is very old and fragile. we have to respect it," his mom said, following him.

"why is it old and fragile, mom?" tom asked.

"because it lived a long time ago, before people. it was a real animal, not a toy. the museum people found its bones and put them together. they want to show us how it looked like and what it ate and how it moved," his mom explained.

"wow, that's amazing, mom. can we see more dinosaurs?" tom asked.

"of course, tom. there are many more dinosaurs in the museum. come on, let's go and explore," his mom said, holding his hand.

tom smiled and nodded. he was happy. he loved the museum. he loved his mom. he loved dinosaurs.

sammy and his family were getting ready to go on a safari. sammy had never been on a safari before and he was both excited and a bit scared.

mummy told sammy, "there is nothing to be scared of darling, just relax and enjoy the adventure!"

sammy put on his hat and sunglasses, gave mummy a hug, and hopped into their family car.

after a long drive, the family arrived at the safari. there were a lot of animals to see and sammy was fascinated. every time he saw a different animal, he would say, "wow", in his little humble way. they saw elephants, giraffes and zebras, all in the wild being free.

sammy smiled and said, "mummy, this is the best day ever, and it's so much fun to relax and watch the animals."

once upon a time, there was a little girl named sue. sue loved to feed her pet cat, fluffy. fluffy was an incredible cat who could do many things.

one day, sue found a small pin on the floor. she picked it up and showed it to fluffy. fluffy looked at the pin and had an idea. fluffy took the pin in her paw and began to dance.
