sue was so happy to see her incredible cat dance with the pin. she clapped her hands and laughed. fluffy danced and danced until it was time to eat. sue fed fluffy a big meal, and they both went to bed, dreaming of more fun days together.

once upon a time, there was a friendly sheep named baa. baa had soft and fluffy wool. one day, it started to rain and baa got very wet. baa didn't like being wet, so it went to a big tree to hide from the rain. baa waited for the rain to stop, but it didn't stop for a long time. baa was still wet and cold. suddenly, the sun came out and started to dry baa's wool. baa was happy again because it was dry and warm.

tom and lily like to play in the park. they run and jump and swing and slide. they have fun and get good exercise.

one day, they see a big dog in the park. the dog is black and furry and has a loud bark. tom and lily are scared of the dog. they think the dog will chase them and bite them.

they run away from the dog and hide behind a tree. they hug each other and hope the dog will go away. they hear the dog barking and running around the park.

but then, they hear another voice. it is a man. he says, "rex, come here, boy. good dog, rex. where are you, rex?"

tom and lily peek from behind the tree. they see the man with a leash and a ball. he is looking for the dog. he is the dog's owner.

the dog sees the man and runs to him. he wags his tail and licks his face. he is happy to see the man. he is not a bad dog. he is a friendly dog.

the man sees tom and lily behind the tree. he smiles and waves at them. he says, "hi, kids. do you want to play with rex? he is a good dog. he likes to play fetch and give kisses. he won't hurt you. he just wants to have fun."

tom and lily look at each other. they are not scared anymore. they are curious. they come out from behind the tree and walk to the man and the dog. they pet the dog and throw the ball for him. they laugh and play with him. they make a new friend.

they learn that the dog is not scary. he is good. they have more fun and get more exercise. they are happy.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy liked to play with blocks. he had a lot of blocks that were different colors. one day, timmy's mom gave him some new blocks. they were square and very colorful. timmy was happy to have new blocks to play with.

timmy started building with his new blocks. he made a tower that was very tall. then, he made a castle that had four square walls. it was very colorful too. timmy's mom came to see what he had made. she recognized that timmy was very good at building with blocks.

timmy was proud of his castle and he played with it every day. he liked the new square and colorful blocks that his mom gave him. he was happy to have so many blocks to play with.

once upon a time, there was a big castle. the castle was perfect. it was very pretty with lots of colors. in the castle, there lived a kind king and queen. they had a little girl named lily.

one day, lily wanted to go for a walk. she put on her shoes and opened the door. she stepped outside and saw a cute cat. the cat was playing with a ball. lily said, "hi, cat! do you want to play with me?"

the cat meowed and jumped up. lily and the cat played together. they ran, they jumped, and they laughed. they had so much fun. then, they stepped back into the castle. lily said, "that was a perfect day!"

lily and the cat became best friends. they played together every day. the king and queen were happy too. the perfect castle was filled with love and laughter. and they all lived happily ever after.

once upon a time, in a small town, there was a cop named tom. he was a very fine cop. tom loved to help people and keep everyone safe. he also loved to bake. when he was not working, he would bake yummy treats for his friends.

one day, tom wanted to bake a big cake for his friend's birthday. he went to the store to buy all the things he needed. he got eggs, flour, and sugar. he also got some fun toys to put on top of the cake.

tom went home and started to bake the cake. he mixed all the things together and put it in the oven. the cake smelled so good! when it was all done, he put the toys on top and took it to his friend's house. everyone loved the cake and had a great time. tom was very happy that he could help make his friend's birthday special.

once upon a time there were two friends, anna and jake. they were playing in the garden. jake saw a bush and said "let's shake it!" anna shook it and suddenly a face peeked out. it scared them because it was so unexpected.

the face asked "what do you want?" in a very loud voice.
"we want to play!" jake said.

but the face just shook its head and said "no! i can't hear you. i'm deaf." they were very confused so anna asked what their friend meant. the face explained that it was deaf and couldn't hear them.

the friends were sad that they couldn't play with the face. anna took out a piece of paper and a pen and she wrote "please play with us". the face smiled and nodded its head. 

they all played together and had a wonderful time. anna and jake finally understood that it wasn't easy to communicate with someone who is deaf. they decided to stay friends with the face forever.

once upon a time, there were two best friends named sam and jerry. sam was very creative and loved to design things. one day, sam had a big idea. he told jerry, "let's make a sculpture with dough!"

jerry was very excited. he ran off to get some dough. he returned with a giant bowl full of dough.

sam smiled. he took the bowl of dough and began to design a sculpture. he added shapes and colors to the dough. after a few minutes, the sculpture was finished.

however, jerry made a bit of a mess. the dough was all over the floor and their hands were sticky and messy.

sam laughed and said, "no worries! let's just clean this up and start again."

so, sam and jerry worked together to clean the mess, and then they started all over again. they made many more sculptures with dough until they were both satisfied.

once there was a little girl who wanted to practice balancing. she thought it would be fun.

she tried to balance on one foot while her other foot was in the air. it was tough, but she kept trying. with lots of practice, she started to get better and better.

the girl asked her friends for their opinion. they said balancing was really tricky and she was doing a great job. she was so proud of herself.

the little girl kept practicing and soon she was able to stay balanced on one foot for a long time. she was amazed at what she had achieved.

this little girl showed that she was tough and with lots of hard work and practice, she was able to do something amazing.

sam and mia are friends. they like to play in the park. one day, they find a big sack near a tree. it is black and heavy.

"look, a sack!" sam says. "what is inside?"

"i don't know. let's open it!" mia says. they pull the sack to a bench and open it.

inside, they see many shiny things. there are rings, necklaces, bracelets, and earrings. they are all gold and silver and have jewels on them.

"wow, so pretty!" mia says. she picks up a necklace with a big red jewel. she puts it around her neck.

"look, i'm a princess!" she says.

sam sees a bow and an arrow. they are also gold and have jewels on them.

"look, i'm a hunter!" he says. he picks up the bow and the arrow. he aims at a bird on a branch.

"sam, no!" mia says. "don't hurt the bird!"

but sam does not listen. he shoots the arrow. it flies in the air and hits the bird. the bird falls to the ground.

"sam, you are bad!" mia says. she runs to the bird. it is not moving. it has blood on its feathers.

"sorry, mia. i didn't mean to." sam says. he drops the bow and the arrow. he follows mia.

they see a man running towards them. he is angry. he has a mask on his face. he is the thief who stole the sack from the shop.

"hey, you kids! give me back my sack!" he says. he grabs the sack from the bench. he pushes sam and mia away.

"help, help!" sam and mia shout. they are scared.

a policeman hears them. he sees the thief with the sack. he runs after him. he catches him and puts handcuffs on him.

"thank you, officer!" sam and mia say. they hug the policeman.

"you're welcome, kids. you did the right thing. this man is a bad man. he took these things from the shop. they are not his. they belong to the people who made them and sold them." the policeman says.

he takes the thief and the sack to his car. he drives away.

sam and mia look at the bird. it is still not moving.

"is the bird dead?" sam asks.

"i think so." mia says. she is sad.

they bury the bird under the tree. they say sorry to the bird.

they go home. they tell their parents what happened. their parents hug them and say they are proud of them.

they learn a lesson. they do not play with things that are not theirs. they do not hurt animals. they are good friends.

mum and dad were going out, and mum was very excited. she had a new dress with a big zipper on the back.

mum asked her little girl if she wanted to help her get ready. the girl was so excited because mum said they could paint her nails. she liked to dress up and pretend she was a princess.

mum made some pretty designs on her nails with the paint. then they went to the mirror to look at her sparkly nails. the girl smiled at herself and felt so excited.

mum helped her put on the dress with the zipper. the girl twirled around and showed off her dress and nails.

mum and dad said she looked beautiful. she couldn't wait to show off her new look to all her friends.

once upon a time, there was a little duck who loved to play in the pond. one day, the duck saw a big storm cloud coming. the duck knew that it was going to rain soon, so he swam to the shore and found a cozy spot under a tree.

as the rain started to pour down, the duck felt happy and safe under the tree. but then, the rain got heavier and heavier, and the water started to rise. the duck realized that he needed to find a higher place to stay dry.

suddenly, the duck remembered a big, wild bush that he had seen nearby. he knew that if he could get there, he would be safe from the rising water. so, he quickly swam to the bush and climbed up to the top. from there, he watched as the pond became completely soaked and flooded.

thanks to the duck's quick thinking, he stayed safe and dry during the storm. and from that day on, he always remembered to look for a safe place when the rain started to pour down.

once upon a time, there was a strong man who mentioned to everyone he knew how tough he was. everyone thought he was very boastful, but he always insisted he was telling the truth. one day, he decided to prove his strength by wearing his old boots and making the long journey up a high mountain. as he was walking, a strong wind started to blow. the man had to hold on to his boots tightly to keep them from flying away.

when the man finally reached the peak of the mountain, a thunderous roar greeted him. thinking he had conquered the mountain, he shouted out in joy. then he noticed a large crack in the ground. before he could do anything, the crack started to spread and soon the ground beneath him was shaking. 

soon, the man found himself standing on a small island between two large pieces of land. the man tried to jump to the other side, but he was too scared. he thought he could make it if he could use his strong boots, but the gap was too wide. in the end, the man stayed stranded on the island until his death. 

moral of the story: be careful when you mention how strong you are, or you may end up with a bad ending like the strong man did.

once upon a time, there was a little bird and it was just learning to fly. one day it was close to a river and decided to splash in the water. the bird was so happy as it splashed and it felt good.

but then suddenly, a big fish came out of the water and gave the little bird a reward! it was a piece of light fruit that sparkled in the sun.

the bird was very excited and ate the piece of light fruit straight away. it was so delicious and the bird was so thankful for the reward. after that, it splashed and played in the river for the rest of the day. 

it was so much fun and the little bird was very happy that it got the light reward from the fish.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. one day, she went to the park with her mom. lily saw a butterfly and wanted to catch it. her mom said, "be careful, lily. we have to protect the butterfly."

lily saw a boy playing on the slide. he was very loud and not being quiet. lily's mom said, "let's go play somewhere else. it's too noisy here." 

lily and her mom found a quiet spot to play. they saw some kids playing a game. one kid said, "i want to win every time!" lily's mom said, "it's not fair to always win. everyone should have a turn to win." 

lily had a lot of fun at the park that day. she learned that it's important to protect animals, be quiet when needed, and play fair with others.

once there was a little girl called lucy. she was three years old and loved to celebrate.

every month, lucy's family would get together and have a party. they would dance and eat cake and sing songs. lucy's favorite part was when her dad would take out a big bow and tie it around her wrist. it made her feel so special!

but one day, something bad happened. lucy got very sick and she was stuck in the hospital for weeks. she was so helpless and felt lonely without her family.

but finally, lucy got better! and her family came to the hospital to celebrate. they all hugged her, gave her lots of presents and took her out for ice cream. as a special surprise, they even brought out the big bow and tied it around her wrist again.

this time, lucy was feeling much better and she celebrated with all her heart, knowing she was surrounded by people who loved her.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to dance and dreamed of being famous one day. one day, lily went to a dance class and it was her turn to show her moves. she practiced a lot and finally succeeded in doing a perfect twirl. 

everyone in the class clapped and cheered for her. lily felt very happy and proud of herself. she knew that if she kept practicing, she could become famous one day. 

from that day on, lily practiced every day and never gave up. she knew that with hard work and determination, she could succeed in achieving her dream of becoming a famous dancer.

once there was a monkey named molly. she lived in a tall tree in the jungle. molly was hungry, so she started looking for food.

suddenly, molly saw a banana on a high branch. she was excited and quickly climbed up the tree. when she got to the top, she reached for the banana.

suddenly, there was a big roar! molly looked down and saw a lion walking towards her. the lion warned molly not to take the banana. it said that the banana belonged to him.

molly was scared and quickly climbed down the tree. she was relieved when she reached the ground safely. from then on, she always remembered to listen to the lionâ€™s warnings.

once there was a brown bear. he loved to stretch and he was very good at it. every day he would go outside and stretch his arms over his head and his legs out wide. it was his favorite thing to do.

one day while he was stretching, he saw a novel on the ground. it was a magical book and it had brown covers. he picked it up and opened it. inside he found a story about a bear who loved to stretch! he was so excited and knew he had to go on an adventure.

so the brown bear stretched his legs and arms as high as he could and ran off as fast as his short legs could carry him. he ran for what seemed like forever, until he arrived at a big, brown castle. the magical novel told him that inside was a treasure.

when the brown bear walked through the entrance, he found a room filled with big, sparkling treasures! he stretched his arms wide and chose his favorite one. it was the ultimate reward for a bear who loved to stretch!

lily liked to play the flute. she had a small flute that made nice sounds when she blew into it. she played the flute every day in her room. she felt happy and peaceful when she played.

one day, her brother tom came into her room. he was bored and wanted to play with lily. he saw her flute and grabbed it. he said, "let me play with this. it looks fun."

lily was angry and scared. she did not want tom to take her flute. she said, "no, tom, that is mine. give it back. you don't know how to play it. you will break it."

tom did not listen. he blew into the flute very hard. he made a loud and ugly noise. he laughed and said, "this is easy. i can play better than you."

lily started to cry. she wanted her flute back. she said, "tom, please, stop. you are hurting my flute. you are hurting my ears. you are hurting my feelings."

tom saw that lily was crying. he felt sorry and ashamed. he realized that he was being mean and selfish. he said, "i'm sorry, lily. i was wrong. here, take your flute. i won't touch it again."

he gave the flute back to lily. lily stopped crying. she looked at her flute and saw that it was not broken. she was relieved and grateful. she said, "thank you, tom. i forgive you. do you want to play something else with me?"

tom nodded and smiled. he said, "yes, lily. i want to play with you. you are my sister and i love you."

they hugged each other and went to play with their toys. they felt happy and peaceful again. they learned to share and respect each other's things. they played the flute together and made nice sounds.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named tim. he had a blue bicycle that he loved to ride. one day, he planned to ride his bicycle to the park. he was very excited.

on his way to the park, he saw a big dog. the dog barked loudly and scared tim. tim did not know what to do. he wanted to go to the park, but the dog was in the way.

tim had an idea. he went back home and got a ball. he threw the ball far away, and the dog ran to get it. tim quickly rode his blue bicycle to the park. he had so much fun playing there.

once there was a girl who liked to pretend. she used her imagination to make up new games and adventures. one day she found a penny on the ground. she thought it was so unusual to find a penny on the ground - she had never seen one before!

she wanted to do something special with it so she decided to pretend it was magic. she closed her eyes and waved it over herself and then opened her eyes to see what would happen. she was so excited when she saw glittery sparkles coming out of the penny - it had worked!

she kept playing pretend with the penny, finding out what other fun things it could do. every day she would pretend the penny could do something new and it was always exciting. the penny made her imagination grow and she had lots of fun pretending with it.

once upon a time there were two friends, mike and dan. they went outside to play in a wet field. the grass was wet and the sky was gray.

the two friends started to run and shout. then, further away, they saw something. it was a row of boats in the pond. they wanted to take a ride, but there was a delay.

the sky had started to pour and the boats were getting wet. mike and dan saw that they had to wait. they watched the rain and talked while they waited. 

after a while, the rain stopped and the sky was clear again. they quickly grabbed a couple of boats and rowed away. they went so fast that the water splashed on their faces.

they spent the rest of the day in the boat, going up and down the long row. they waved to the other boats, sang songs and laughed along the way.

at the end of the day, they thanked each other before walking back home. they had had a great time and were sure to come back and play again!

anna and ben are going to the airport with mom and dad. they are very happy because they are going to see grandma and grandpa. they have big bags with clothes and toys.

at the airport, there are many people and planes. anna and ben see a big sign that says "welcome". they also see signs with pictures of animals and places. they like to look at the signs and say what they are.

mom and dad have tickets for the plane. they show the tickets to a lady who smiles and gives them stickers. anna and ben put the stickers on their shirts. they feel very special.

they follow the signs to the gate where their plane is. they see a big plane with a blue and white tail. they hear a man say their plane is ready to go. they walk to the door of the plane and say "bye" to the lady.

they find their seats on the plane and buckle their belts. they look out the window and see the airport get smaller and smaller. they wave to the signs and the people and the planes. they are very excited to see grandma and grandpa soon.

once upon a time, there was a boy named jack. he liked to go for long walks in the park. one day, he saw something moving in the grass. he went over to have a look.

it was a green shape! jack wondered what it could be. he poked it with a stick and the shape moved. he was so surprised!

he looked closer and saw that it was a little green frog. jack was excited and he reached out to touch it. the frog hopped away into a bush.

jack just stood there and wondered. he wondered where the frog went and if he would ever see it again. he smiled and said goodbye to the frog before walking home.

once there was a boy who had a board. he wanted to solve something with the board. so, he asked his friends to join him. he was very envious of the board and thought it had magic powers.

so, he put some pieces on the board and tried to solve the puzzle. his friends watched as he worked on the puzzle. the boy was so excited and concentrated really hard.

after some time, he was able to solve the puzzle! everyone cheered for him as he shouted out the solution. the boy was very proud of himself and just couldn't stop smiling. he thought the board was truly magical and thanked it for helping him solve the puzzle.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy lived in a big house with his family. timmy's family was very rich, which means they had lots of money. 

one day, timmy's mommy got some mail. it was a big envelope with lots of papers inside. timmy asked his mommy what was in the mail. his mommy said it was important grown-up stuff that he wouldn't understand.

but timmy wanted to see what was inside, so he grabbed the envelope and started to twist it. suddenly, all the papers fell out and timmy's mommy got very upset. she told timmy that he shouldn't play with the mail and that it was important. timmy felt bad and promised to never twist the mail again.

once there was a little girl named sandy who loved to decorate. she had colourful crayons, glitter, and lots of stickers. one day she decided to decorate a journal. in it, she put lots of pink and purple stickers and drew pretty little hearts. she knew it was going to be yummy! 

when sandy finished decorating, she was so excited that she ran around and showed it to everyone she could find. her mom, her dad and her brothers all admired her work. she was so proud of a job well done. 

sandy made the journal her very own special place. she wrote stories and drew pictures in it every day. she was the happiest girl around. now sandy always has something both yummy and fun to share with her family and friends.

once there were two friends called sam and mia. sam wanted to talk to mia about something but was feeling a bit shy. he finally mentioned it to her. mia had a different opinion to sam, but that was ok. the opinion mia had was very smelly! sam was surprised by mia's smelly opinion. but he still liked mia, even if her opinion was smelly. they both laughed together and made up their own smelly opinion. they still talk about it now.

lily and ben are friends. they like to play in the park. one day, they find a big club on the grass. it is brown and heavy.

"look, a club!" lily says. "let's play with it!"

"ok!" ben says. "what can we do with it?"

lily thinks for a moment. then she has an idea. "we can spin it!" she says. "like this!" she holds the club with both hands and turns around fast. the club makes a whoosh sound in the air.

"wow, that looks fun!" ben says. "can i try?"

"sure!" lily says. she gives the club to ben. ben tries to spin it, but it is too heavy for him. he falls down and drops the club.

"ouch!" ben says. "that hurts!"

lily laughs. she helps ben get up. "you are lazy!" she says. "you need to be strong to spin the club!"

ben makes a face. "i am not lazy!" he says. "i am just small. you are big and strong. that's not fair!"

lily smiles. she hugs ben. "don't be sad," she says. "we can play something else. how about we swing on the swings?"

"ok!" ben says. "that sounds fun!"

they leave the club on the grass and run to the swings. they swing high and low, and laugh and sing. they are happy. they are friends.

once upon a time, there was a silly cat named mittens. mittens liked to play with a teaspoon. one day, mittens was playing with the teaspoon when it fell on the ground and made a loud noise. mittens got scared and ran away.

mittens ran all around the house until he found a cozy spot to settle down. he found a soft blanket and made himself comfortable. mittens felt happy and safe in his new spot.

from that day on, mittens played with his teaspoon in his cozy spot. he never let it fall again. and whenever he felt scared, he knew just where to go to settle down and feel better.

johnny was a very special boy. he had a rare brain. it made him very smart. he could do things that other boys and girls his age couldn't do.

one day johnny was playing with his toys in the garden. he wanted to show his mum how smart he was. he started to do somersaults and jump. he had so much fun!

mum was so proud of him. she said, "you have a rare brain, johnny. you can do so many things!" 

johnny was very happy. he felt special that he had a rare brain. he kept practicing and having fun. whenever he had questions, he knew he could always ask mum.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily who loved to play with her toys. one day, she found a big box of toys in her attic. she was so excited to play with them, but the box was too heavy for her to carry. 

lily's mom saw her struggling and asked, "what's wrong, sweetie?" lily replied, "the box is too heavy for me to carry. can you help me?" 

her mom said, "of course, let's discuss how we can make it lighter." they decided to take out some of the toys and put them in a different box, so it would be easier for lily to carry. 

as they were moving the toys, they found a toy snake that looked harmless, but lily was afraid of it. her mom said, "don't worry, it's just a toy. it won't hurt you." lily felt better and they continued to play with their toys happily ever after.

once upon a time, there was a deer. the deer was very lonely because it had no friends to play with. one day, the deer closed its eyes and started to imagine having lots of friends to play with. it imagined running and jumping with its new friends in the forest. suddenly, the deer heard a rustling sound in the bushes. it opened its eyes and saw a group of friendly rabbits hopping towards it. the deer was overjoyed and it played with the rabbits all day long. from that day on, the deer was never lonely again because it had lots of new friends to play with.

tom and lily were playing in the sand. they had a big bucket and a small bucket. they wanted to make a sand castle with the big bucket, but it was difficult. the sand was too dry and the bucket was too heavy.

"let's ask mom for some water," tom said. he picked up the small bucket and ran to the picnic table. mom was reading a book. she smiled at tom and gave him some water in the small bucket.

"thank you, mom," tom said. he ran back to the sand with the small bucket. lily was waiting for him. she had a question.

"tom, how will we make the sand castle with the big bucket?" she asked. "the small bucket is easy, but the big bucket is difficult."

tom had an idea. he poured some water on the sand and mixed it with his hands. he made the sand wet and sticky. he filled the big bucket with the wet sand and pressed it hard. he turned the big bucket upside down and lifted it. a big sand castle came out of the bucket.

"wow, tom, you did it!" lily said. she clapped her hands. "you are so smart!"

tom and lily were happy. they had made a big sand castle with the big bucket. they decorated it with shells and stones. they played with their sand castle until it was time to go home. they hugged their sand castle and said goodbye. they hoped it would stay there until they came back.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to draw circles because they were easy for her to make. one day, her friend emily came over to play. emily saw lily's circles and wanted to draw them too, but she didn't know how. 

lily said, "i can explain how to draw circles. it's easy!" she showed emily how to make a circle by drawing a big round shape. emily was happy because now she could draw circles too! 

they drew circles all day and had so much fun. when it was time for emily to go home, she said, "thank you for explaining how to draw circles. you're a good friend." lily smiled and felt happy that she could help her friend.

once there was a wealthy man who owned a metal box. he was very proud of the box and kept it in a safe place. one day, he decided to take it outside and show it off to his friends. he went out into the field, with the box in his hands, and he smiled as he admired how shiny it was.

suddenly, he heard a spring. it was coming from the box. he opened it, and out jumped a small mouse. the mouse felt so scared that it ran away. the wealthy man was very angry and threw the box on the floor in frustration. the metal was bent and dented, and he knew it would never be the same again. he was very sad and walked back home, feeling despondent. the wealthy man never spoke of the box again.

once upon a time, there was a fat monkey named momo. momo loved to eat bananas. one day, momo found a big, yellow banana under a tree.

momo was very happy and started to eat the banana. but then, a little bird came and disturb momo. the bird wanted some of the banana too. momo did not want to share his banana.

but then, momo thought about it and decided to share the banana with the bird. they both ate the banana and became good friends. from that day on, momo and the bird always shared their food and played together.

once upon a time there was a lucky bird. every day it would fly high up into the sky over the valley. it would soar in the air and feel so happy.

the birdâ€™s friends were two little rabbits who lived in the valley. every day they would run around playing, chasing each other and having lots of fun.

one day the lucky bird flew down to them and taught its friends how to fly. the rabbits were so excited. they flapped their ears like wings and jumped up and down trying to fly.

but no matter how hard they tried, the rabbits couldn't get high enough to fly. so the lucky bird swooped down and grabbed each rabbit with its strong beak. it flew up into the sky and dropped them inside the valley.

the rabbits were so happy and thanked the lucky bird for helping them. they ran around the valley playing, chasing each other and having lots more fun. from then on, the lucky bird and the two rabbits were best friends forever.

ben and mia are friends. they like to play in the park on tuesday. they have a ball and a bat. they take turns to hit the ball with the bat. they call it strike.

one tuesday, ben and mia go to the park. they see a big dog. the dog is brown and furry. it has a long tail. the dog runs to them and barks. ben and mia are scared. they drop the ball and the bat.

"go away, dog!" ben says. "we want to play strike!"

the dog does not go away. it picks up the ball in its mouth. it wags its tail. it thinks ben and mia want to play with it.

"hey, that's our ball!" mia says. "give it back, dog!"

the dog does not give it back. it runs away with the ball. ben and mia chase the dog. they run and run. they cannot catch the dog.

they see a man. the man is the dog's owner. he is sitting on a bench. he is reading a book. he does not see the dog or the children.

"excuse me, sir!" ben says. "your dog has our ball!"

the man looks up. he sees the dog and the children. he smiles. he thinks they are silly.

"i'm sorry, kids," he says. "my dog likes to play, too. he does not know he is being naughty. here, i have another ball for you. you can have it. it is red and shiny. do you like it?"

ben and mia look at the red ball. they like it. it is bigger and brighter than their ball. they say thank you to the man. they take the red ball. they go back to play strike.

they forget about the dog and their old ball. they have fun with the new ball. they hit it hard with the bat. they laugh and shout. they are happy. it is a good tuesday.

billy wanted to play hide and seek. he felt that the best spot was behind a curtain, so he opened it up. the curtain was tough, but billy was brave and so he pushed it back and crawled inside.

he felt so safe and quiet, covered by the cloth. it was like he was hidden in a secret cave. as he curled up in the corner, he heard his mom call his name.

billy popped his head out from the curtain and looked around. all of his friends were gathered around and they were ready to start the game. he went out and joined them, ready to cover up and start counting.

it was a lot of fun. they all took turns covering themselves up behind the tough curtain. they looked forward to the game every day and it became a regular routine. billy continued to love the thrill of feeling hidden away in the secrecy of the curtain.

one day, ben and lily went to the beach with their mom and dad. they liked to play in the sand and look for shells. they saw a big wave coming and ran to the water. "splash!" they shouted as the wave wet them.

but then they saw something terrible on the shore. it was a big fish that was not moving. it had no eyes and its skin was falling off. it smelled very bad. "ew!" ben and lily said. "what is that?"

their mom and dad came to see. "that is a fish that has rot," their dad said. "rot means that it is very old and sick and has no life. we should not touch it or go near it. it can make us sick too."

ben and lily felt sorry for the fish. they wondered why it had rot and how it came to the beach. they wished they could help it. "can we bury it in the sand?" lily asked. "maybe then it will not smell and other animals will not eat it."

their mom and dad nodded. "that is a good idea," their mom said. "but we have to be careful and use a stick or a shovel. we do not want to touch it with our hands." they found a stick and a shovel and dug a hole in the sand. they pushed the fish into the hole and covered it with sand. they made a cross with two sticks and put it on top.

"goodbye, fish," ben and lily said. "we hope you are happy now." they went back to play in the water and forgot about the terrible rot. they had fun with the waves and the shells. they were happy.

peter was a three year old boy who loved going to the park. one day, he noticed a beautiful poppy in the corner of the park. it was red and vibrant, so peter knew he had to pick it. he carefully plucked the poppy from the ground and smiled to himself with joy. 

using his small hands he carefully cradled the poppy. just then, a little old man stumbled up to peter and told him, â€œson, you mustnâ€™t take that poppy. itâ€™s loyal to the ground.â€

peter nervously responded, â€œplease donâ€™t make me suffer, sir! i just wanted to pick the poppy.â€

the wise old man smiled and said, â€œitâ€™s okay, son. i understand. go ahead and pick the poppy, but be sure to put it back once youâ€™re done.â€

peter thanked the old man and walked off with the poppy. he couldnâ€™t believe his luck! he held it close and kept it safe until it was time to put it back. once he had done so, peter skipped away with a big smile. he had been loyal to the poppy, just like the old man had said.

once upon a time, in a big green forest, there lived an intelligent little fox named foxy. foxy loved to play with her friends and find surprises in the forest.

one sunny day, foxy and her best friend, bunny, were playing near a big tree. foxy said, "let's enter the tree and look for a surprise!" bunny nodded with a big smile, and they both went inside the tree.

as they looked around, they found a shiny box. foxy said, "look, bunny! a surprise!" they opened the box and found yummy treats inside. they laughed and shared the treats, happy with their adventure in the forest.

once upon a time there was a very thoughtful girl. she would often invite her friends to her house to play. on this particular day, her best friend had come over and they were exploring the backyard.

"look, what's that?" asked the friend, pointing to something.

the girl looked carefully and saw it was a toy car. it was old and rusty but she knew it could be fixed.

"i think this car needs a new battery," she said.

they found an old battery and worked together to get the car running again. the girl turned to her friend.

"let's try and reverse it," she said.

excitedly, they got the car going in reverse. whooping and cheering, their excitement filled the backyard. even their parents came out to see what all the noise was about.

the girl smiled, knowing she had been thoughtful and been able to fix the car.

once upon a time, there was a boy named tim. he had a guitar. he loved to play it every day. tim also liked to joke and be a little naughty.

one day, tim saw a cat. the cat was naughty too. tim thought, "maybe the cat wants to joke with me." so, he played his guitar to make the cat laugh. the cat liked the music but did not laugh yet.

tim played the guitar louder and made a funny face. the cat laughed! they joked and played together. the cat was not naughty anymore. tim and the cat became good friends. and they lived happily ever after.

max was a 3 year old wearing his favorite red shirt. he was sitting in the living room, feeling curious. he looked up at his mom and asked, "mommy, can you stretch my hair?"

his mom smiled and replied, "sure, let's try!" she took out a comb and a brush and started brushing maxâ€™s hair. she brushed it carefully and gently.

max smiled and said, "wow, my hair looks so clean!" his mom nodded and said, "that's right. now, letâ€™s stretch your hair." she grabbed a hair tie and gently stretched his hair. she tied it up into a neat little ponytail.

max beamed, "wow my hair looks so good!" his mom laughed and said, "well, now you have a clean and neat ponytail!"

once there was a calm avocado. she liked to play in the sunshine every day. one day she wanted to go for a walk, so she left her tree and started walking.

but soon she saw smoke in the air. the smoke was coming from a fire! before she knew it, the fire was burning around her and she was very scared.

but then she remembered the wise advice of her tree to stay calm. so she stopped and took some deep breaths. suddenly, she saw a brave fire fighter, who put out the fire with a big hose.

the avocado was so grateful! and when the fire was gone, she went home safe and sound.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside in the park. one day, she saw a big red ball and wanted to play with it. she ran towards it and tried to grab it, but it was too heavy for her.

suddenly, she heard a sound. it was a bell ringing. she looked around and saw a man opening a door. she ran towards him and asked, "can i play with the ball?" the man smiled and said, "sure, you can grab it and play with it as much as you want."

lily was so happy. she grabbed the ball and started playing with it. she ran and jumped and had so much fun. when it was time to go home, she thanked the man and said, "i love playing with the ball and hearing the bell ring. it makes me so happy." the man smiled and said, "i'm glad you had fun. come back and play anytime." and lily walked home with a big smile on her face.

once upon a time, there was a big, rare bird. the bird loved to dance. every wednesday, the bird would dance in the park. all the kids would come to see the bird dance.

one day, a little girl named emma came to the park. she saw the bird dancing and said, "wow! i want to dance too!" the bird smiled and danced with emma. they danced and danced, and all the kids clapped and laughed.

from that day on, every wednesday, emma and the rare bird would dance together in the park. the kids loved to watch them dance. and they all lived happily ever after.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named tim. tim had a tooth that hurt a lot. he did not like it. it made him feel sad.

one day, tim's mom gave him a green leaf to rub on his tooth. she said it would help his tooth feel better. tim took the green leaf and rubbed it on his tooth. the leaf was bitter, but tim kept rubbing.

after a while, tim's tooth started to feel better. the bitter leaf helped his tooth not hurt anymore. tim was happy, and he gave his mom a big hug. they both smiled, and tim's tooth did not hurt anymore.

once upon a time there was a little girl named anne. she was only three years old and very excited about her visit to her aunt's house. anne and her family went for a long car ride. when they arrived, anne was a bit sleepy.

anne's aunt greeted them warmly. then, she took out an old toy car and handed it to anne. it was small and had a yellow paint job. anne was so happy to have a toy car of her own.

aunt and anne got down to play. aunt showed anne how the car can be reversed by pressing a button. anne was amazed! she had so much fun reversing the car back and forth. time flew and soon it was time to go. anne remembered to say thank you before they left.

anne felt so lucky to have an aunt who loves her so much. she was so happy as they drove back home, feeling sleepy but content.

once upon a time there was a girl named lucy. she loved to skip. every day she'd put on her shoes and go skipping around the garden.

one day, lucy found a box filled with salt. she thought it was really hard to carry, but she decided to take it anyway.

suddenly, lucy started feeling funny in her stomach. she wanted to skip but it was too hard to do with a big box of salt.

so, lucy looked around to find something to help her. she saw a stick and had a brilliant idea. she put the box of salt on the stick and lifted it up.

lucy smiled as she carried and skipped around the garden. she had solved her problem and she was very happy.

lily liked to design things. she had many crayons and papers and stickers. she made pictures of flowers and animals and stars. she liked to give her pictures to her friends and family.

one day, lily's mom said they would have a party. it was lily's birthday soon. lily was happy and curious. she wanted to know what kind of party it would be. she asked her mom many questions.

mom said it would be a surprise. she said lily could help her design the party. lily was excited. she said she wanted to make invitations and decorations and games. mom smiled and said yes.

they went to the store and bought many things. they bought balloons and streamers and hats. they bought cake and candles and candy. they bought cards and pens and stamps.

they came home and started to design the party. lily wrote her name and drew a heart on each card. she asked mom to write the date and time and address. she put a stamp on each card and put them in the mailbox. she blew up the balloons and tied them to the chairs. she hung the streamers and hats on the walls. she made a sign that said "happy birthday lily". she set up the games and prizes on the table.

lily was proud of her design. she said it was the best party ever. she hugged her mom and said thank you. mom hugged her back and said you're welcome. she said she loved her very much. lily said she loved her too. she said she couldn't wait for the party. she said she wondered who would come. she was very curious.

once upon a time, there was a tall giraffe. he had a long neck and legs. one day, he saw a little monkey who could not reach the bananas on the tree. so, the giraffe decided to give the monkey a lift. the monkey climbed onto the giraffe's arm and reached the bananas. the monkey was very happy and thanked the giraffe. from that day on, they became good friends and always helped each other.

lily and tom were best friends. they liked to play outside in the sun. one day, they went to the stream near their house. the stream was clear and cool. they saw some fish and frogs in the water.

"look, lily, a big frog!" tom said. he pointed to a green frog on a rock. "let's catch it and make it our pet!"

lily nodded. she liked frogs. they were funny and slimy. she and tom crept closer to the frog. they tried to be very quiet. but the frog saw them and jumped into the stream.

"ribbit, ribbit!" the frog said. it sounded like it was laughing at them.

"hey, frog, that's not nice!" lily said. she was a little sad. she wanted to pet the frog.

tom smiled. he had an idea. he picked up a stick and pretended it was a fishing rod. he dangled it over the water.

"come on, frog, i have a tasty worm for you!" he said. he made a funny voice. he hoped the frog would come back.

lily saw what tom was doing. she giggled. she knew tom was joking. she picked up another stick and joined him.

"me too, me too!" she said. she also made a funny voice. "frog, frog, we have yummy bugs for you!"

the frog heard them and peeked out of the water. it saw their sticks and their faces. it realized they were joking too. it decided to play along. it jumped out of the water and landed on tom's stick.

"gotcha!" tom said. he lifted the stick and the frog. he was very happy.

lily clapped her hands. she was happy too. she reached out to touch the frog.

"hello, frog, you are our friend now!" she said.

the frog smiled. it liked lily and tom. they were fun and kind. they were not ordinary children. they were special. it croaked happily.

"ribbit, ribbit!" it said. it meant "thank you" and "let's play some more".

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. one morning, as lily was playing outside, the sun began to rise. she looked up and said "look! the sun is rising in the sky!" as the sun rose, the weather got cooler and cooler. 

then lily's mom came out and said "lily, it's time for breakfast." 

lily replied, "mommy, can i stay out just a little bit longer? the weather is so cool and i really want to keep playing."

mom smiled and said, â€œokay, but just a few more minutes. then you have to come in.â€

so, lily continued to play while the sun rose higher and higher. she enjoyed the cool morning and loved the sight of the bright sunshine.

when lily's mom saw the sun was high in the sky, she said â€œlily, it's time for breakfast now. come inside and we'll have pancakes.â€

lily was so excited that she quickly ran inside. she had a wonderful time playing in the cool, sunny morning, and even better time eating pancakes!

once there was a boy named tim. he was three years old and very happy. tim loved to explore the world around him, and he did it a lot. one day, he saw something very special. it was a modern carâ€“shiny, new and cool. tim's face lit up with a big smile as he admired it.

then, before he knew it, tim was behind the wheel. he excitedly moved his hands around, pretending that he was driving. time flew as he imagined himself zooming around and having adventures in the modern car.

finally, tim's mom came to the rescue. she told him it was time to go home. tim was a bit sad but then he smiled again when his mom promised to take him out for a ride in the car some day. together, they left for home with a big smile on tim's face.

once upon a time, there was a playful bunny named benny. benny loved to hop around in the grass and play with his friends. one day, benny saw a hedge and decided to hide behind it. his friends couldn't find him, so they started to tease him by saying "where's benny? where's benny?" 

benny thought it was funny and started to hop out from behind the hedge to surprise his friends. they all laughed and played together. as the sun started to set, benny and his friends went back to their burrows to rest. benny was happy that he had such fun friends to play with and he couldn't wait to do it again tomorrow. the end.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. one day, she was eating her dinner and her mom put some cauliflower on her plate. lily didn't like cauliflower, so she made a serious face and said, "mom, i don't like this."

her mom replied, "lily, you need to mind your manners and try new foods. cauliflower is good for you."

lily thought about it for a moment and decided to take a small bite. to her surprise, she actually liked it! she said, "mom, this cauliflower is yummy! can i have more please?"

her mom smiled and gave her more cauliflower. from that day on, lily always tried new foods and didn't mind eating cauliflower anymore.

once upon a time there was a little girl called jess. jess was only 3 years old, but loved wearing beautiful summer dresses. one day jess wanted to go out sailing in her daddy's boat on the lake. when they got to the lake they realized they had forgotten to bring the sail!

jess was very embarrassed and started to cry. her dad said to her "there's no need to be embarrassed jess, sometimes we forget things and that's ok. or, we can find a solution if we use our imagination!"

so, jess and her dad used a big blanket to make a sail. after lots of hard work, the sail was ready! jess and her dad were so proud of their sail and went sailing on the lake.

the moral of the story is: it's ok to make mistakes, but it's even better if we use our imagination to find a solution.

there was a giant in the forest. he was so big and so tall that he could look over the trees. he was an enormous giant! one day, a baby bunny came to the forest. he wanted to peek at the giant, but he was scared he might get into trouble. he hid in the grass and peered through the leaves to peak at the giant. the giant didn't even know he was there. the bunny saw the giant's enormous feet, and decided he had seen enough. he hopped away and ran back home to his family, thankful he had been able to peek at the giant without getting into trouble.

once upon a time, there was a young dog. his name was chase. one day, chase was playing in the garden when he saw a trail. it was a long shiny trail of stones and twigs. he was fascinated. he wanted to know where it led to.

chase followed the trail. it twisted and turned through the garden, and then went out into a field. as chase kept walking, he felt more and more troubled. he did not know if he was still on the right trail or not.

suddenly he heard a noise. he saw a person throwing rocks at something just ahead. chase was scared. he wanted to run away, but he had to find out what was going on. he slowly crept closer to get a better look.

the person was throwing rocks at a poor little bird, trying to hurt it! chase was very angry. he wanted to help the bird, so he started barking and running to scare the person away. it worked! the person ran away, leaving the trail and the bird alone.

chase had saved the bird. he felt proud and happy. he followed the trail all the way back home, but this time he felt a lot more sure of himself.

lily and ben were best friends. they liked to play in the park every day. they liked to swing, slide and run. one day, they saw a big duck pond in the park. they wanted to feed the ducks.

lily had some bread in her bag. she broke it into small pieces and threw them to the ducks. the ducks came closer and quacked. lily was happy. she gave some bread to ben and said, "here, you feed them too."

ben took the bread and threw it to the ducks. but he threw it too hard. one piece hit a duck on the head. the duck was angry. it flapped its wings and chased ben. ben was scared. he ran away from the duck. he dropped the bread and bumped into lily. lily fell down and hurt her knee. she cried.

ben felt bad. he said, "i'm sorry, lily. i didn't mean to hurt you or the duck. are you okay?"

lily looked at her knee. it was red and sore. she looked at ben. he looked sad and sorry. she looked at the duck. it was graceful and calm. it had stopped chasing ben and was eating the bread. lily thought for a moment. she said, "it's okay, ben. i forgive you. you didn't do it on purpose. and the duck is fine too. see, it's happy now."

ben smiled. he said, "thank you, lily. you're a good friend. can i help you up?"

lily nodded. she said, "yes, please. and can we still play in the park?"

ben said, "of course. let's go to the swings. they're fun and safe."

lily and ben held hands and walked to the swings. they forgot about the duck and the bread. they laughed and played. they were best friends again.

once upon a time, there was a big bull named bob. bob loved to run and play in the green fields. one day, bob was very dirty and smelly. his owner decided to wash him with soap and water. bob didn't like the water, but he felt better after his wash.

after his wash, bob saw a fragile butterfly flying around. he wanted to play with it, but he was afraid he might hurt it. so, he watched the butterfly from afar and didn't touch it. the butterfly was very pretty with its colorful wings. bob was happy to see it and felt grateful for his wash.

ben and sam are friends. they like to play with rockets. they have a big rocket toy in the backyard. they want to go to the moon.

"are you ready, sam?" ben asks.

"yes, i am ready, ben," sam says.

they get inside the rocket. they push the buttons. the rocket makes a loud noise. it starts to go up.

"wow, we are going to the moon!" ben says.

"yay, we are going to the moon!" sam says.

but the rocket is not a good rocket. it is a bad rocket. it goes too fast. it goes too high. it goes out of the backyard. it goes out of the town. it goes out of the world.

"help, help!" ben says.

"help, help!" sam says.

but no one can hear them. no one can see them. no one can help them. they are lost in space. they are scared. they are sad. they are not going to the moon. they are not going to come back. the end.

lily and ben were playing in their room. they had many toys and books, but they liked to make their own games. they moved the furniture around and made a big fort with a blanket and some pillows. they pretended they were in a cave, hiding from a dragon.

"shh, be quiet," lily whispered to ben. "the dragon is outside. he can smell us and hear us. we have to be smart and trick him."

"how?" ben asked.

lily had an idea. she took a flashlight from her backpack and turned it on. she made it glow under the blanket. "look, we have a magic stone. it can make us invisible. if the dragon comes in, we can use it to escape."

ben smiled. he liked lily's idea. he took another flashlight and made it glow too. "we have two magic stones. we are very powerful. the dragon can't hurt us."

they heard a loud roar from outside. it was their dad, playing along. he knocked on the door and said in a deep voice, "i smell children. i smell tasty children. where are you? i want to eat you."

lily and ben giggled. they turned off their flashlights and hid under the blanket. they waited for their dad to come in. they were not scared. they were having fun. they knew their dad loved them and would not really eat them. they were ready to use their magic stones and surprise him.

once upon a time there was a little boy who loved to play with his new hoop. every day the little boy played with the hoop and made up new games with it.

one day, the boy noticed something strange in the distance. it was a tall, modern-looking building. the boy wanted to find out what was inside.

so, the boy decided to take his hoop and explore the building. he was so excited because he thought something great must be inside. 

when the boy reached the building, he saw a big sign. it said â€œthis area provides free food and toys to children.â€ the boy thought it was too good to be true! he ran inside the building and found a big room filled with delicious food and lots of toys. the boy was so happy that he started eating and playing with the toys.

suddenly, the door of the room closed and the building started shaking. the little boy was scared and started to cry. it turned out that the building was actually an old abandoned factory and the sign was a trick. the little boy was never able to get out of the building.

moral of the story: be careful what you believe.

one day, tommy and his mom were walking in the park.

tommy saw something hidden under the bushes. he asked his mom, "what is that?"

his mom answered, "it looks like an iron. let's talk to the person who put it there."

so they looked around and called out. then a man with a hat came to them.

the man said, "i put my iron there because i could not find it. i was so happy to see it again!"

tommy and his mom smiled. then tommy said, "can i see it?"

the man said, "sure, take it." tommy was so excited.

he and his mom talked about it all the way home. tommy was happy to have found such a hidden treasure.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to cook with her mommy in the kitchen. one day, they decided to make pancakes. lily helped her mommy mix the batter and pour it on the pan. they watched as the pancakes cooked and flipped them over with a spatula.

suddenly, lily saw a mysterious bottle on the counter. she asked her mommy what it was. her mommy said it was syrup and showed her how to squeeze it onto the pancakes. lily was so excited to try it. she squeezed the syrup all over her pancake and took a big bite. it was delicious!

from that day on, lily loved making pancakes with her mommy and squeezing syrup on top. she thought it was the best breakfast ever!

once upon a time, there was little boy called john. he liked to find treasures and hide them in the garden. one day he found a smooth page and he couldn't wait to hide it.

john went outside and he started to bury the page in the ground. it was not easy. he used his tiny hands to dig the hole and he worked very hard.

john's father saw him and said, "what are you doing, john?"

john looked up and he said, "i am burying a smooth page for safe-keeping".

john's father smiled and he helped john to bury the page in the ground.

they said goodbye to the page and went inside.

john was so happy that he had found something special and buried it in the garden.

tom and lily were twins. they liked to play with their toys and share their snacks. but they did not like to share their gifts. when their birthday came, they each got a big gift from their mom and dad. tom got a red car that could roll fast. lily got a pink doll that could talk and sing.

tom wanted to play with his car on the floor. he rolled it back and forth and made loud noises. lily wanted to play with her doll on the bed. she hugged it and listened to its voice. but soon they got bored of their own gifts. they wanted to try the other one.

"can i play with your car, tom?" lily asked.

"no, it's mine. you have your doll," tom said.

"can i play with your doll, lily?" tom asked.

"no, it's mine. you have your car," lily said.

they both got angry and started to cry. their mom and dad heard them and came to their room.

"what's wrong, tom and lily?" their mom asked.

"they won't share their gifts with me!" they both said.

their mom and dad looked at each other and smiled. they had an idea.

"how about we play a game?" their dad said. "we can take turns with the gifts. you can roll the car for five minutes, then give it to your sister. she can play with the doll for five minutes, then give it to you. that way, you can both enjoy the gifts and have fun together."

tom and lily thought about it. they liked the idea of playing a game. they liked the idea of trying the other gift. they nodded and agreed.

"okay, let's play!" they said.

they wiped their tears and smiled. they gave each other a hug and said sorry. then they started to play with the gifts. they rolled the car and talked to the doll. they laughed and sang. they were cheerful and happy. their mom and dad watched them and felt proud. they knew they had taught them a good lesson. sharing is caring.

tom and mia were playing with their toys in the living room. tom had a rare car that his dad gave him for his birthday. it was shiny and fast and had a big sticker on the door. mia had a doll that could sing and dance and had a pretty dress. they were having fun making noises and stories with their toys.

suddenly, they heard a loud knock on the door. they ran to see who it was. it was a man with a big bag and a mask. he looked mean and scary. he pushed the door open and ran inside. he was a thief!

"give me your toys!" he shouted. "they are mine now!"

tom and mia were scared and angry. they did not want to give their toys to the thief. they loved their toys. they worked together to stop him.

tom grabbed his car and threw it at the thief's head. it hit him hard and made him dizzy. mia took her doll and attached it to the thief's leg. it sang and danced and made him trip. the thief fell to the floor and dropped his bag.

tom and mia ran to the bag and saw that it was full of other toys. they were toys that the thief had stolen from other kids. they felt sorry for the other kids.

they heard sirens outside. they looked out the window and saw a police car. the police came in and saw the thief on the floor and the bag of toys. they were happy and proud of tom and mia.

"you are very brave and smart," they said. "you stopped the thief and saved the toys. you are heroes!"

tom and mia smiled and hugged each other. they were happy and proud too. they gave their toys to the police and asked them to return them to the other kids. they hoped that the other kids would be happy and grateful too. they learned that sharing is better than stealing.

once upon a time there was a little boy named joe who loved to explore the world. one day, he had a very exciting adventure. he went with his parents to a restaurant to order lunch. when the waiter gave them the menu, joe was very excited as he had never seen so many things to choose from.

but when joe looked at all the choices, he became anxious and began to resist. he wanted a simple meal and he could not decide what to have. his parents tried to help him, but he kept shaking his head.

finally, joe's dad pointed to one of the items on the menu and said, "what about this one? it looks terrible! are you sure?", but joe nodded and said yes. his dad was relieved as he knew joe was very picky. joe chose a very simple and plain dish, a cheese sandwich. 

his parents smiled since they were happy joe had resisted his urge to choose something that was too complicated. happily, they all enjoyed their lunch together.

once there was a charming bookshelf. it stood in the corner of a room and was filled with fun books.

a 3 year old loved to play in the bookshelf. he would take out the books and look at all the wonderful pictures. he loved to whisper the stories to himself and make up more stories too. 

one day, the 3 year old wanted to keep the bookshelf to himself. he tried to protect the bookshelf with a big blanket. but the blanket was too small and the bookshelf was still exposed. 

the 3 year old started to cry. he wanted to protect the bookshelf but he couldn't. he was sad and frustrated.

suddenly, someone came in and took the bookshelf away from him. he screamed, but it was too late. the bookshelf was gone and he was left alone in the room. he could never see it again.

once upon a time, there was a big house with lots of rooms. it was a modern house with shiny floors and bright lights. one day, the mom noticed a leak in the kitchen sink. water was coming out of the pipe and making a big mess. she told her son to push a bucket under the sink to catch the water. the little boy pushed the bucket under the sink and it caught all the water. the mom was happy that her son was so helpful. they called a plumber to fix the leak and soon the kitchen was dry again. the end.

tom and lily liked to play in the park. they liked to swing, slide and run. but they did not like the big dog that lived near the park. the big dog was rough and loud. he liked to chase and bark at tom and lily.

one day, tom and lily saw the big dog sleeping under a tree. they wanted to go to the swing, but they were afraid of the big dog. tom had an idea. he said, "let's throw some stones at the big dog. then he will go away and we can play." lily said, "ok, but be careful. he might wake up and bite us."

tom and lily picked up some small stones and threw them at the big dog. the big dog did not move. he did not even open his eyes. tom and lily threw more stones. they threw harder and harder. they thought it was fun.

but then, something bad happened. one of the stones hit the big dog on his nose. the big dog woke up. he was angry. he jumped up and ran after tom and lily. he barked and growled. tom and lily were scared. they ran away, but the big dog was faster. he caught up with them and bit them on their legs.

tom and lily cried. they cried very loud. their legs hurt. their legs were red and swollen. their legs had an itch. they wished they had not thrown stones at the big dog. they wished they had been nice to him. they learned a lesson. they learned not to be mean to animals. they learned to be kind and gentle.

once upon a time, there was a girl named jane. jane wanted to do something very special. she wanted to succeed.

so one day, she went out into the valley. everywhere she looked, she could see ordinary things. but jane didn't give up.

she kept walking until she found something special. it was a big rock with lots of sparkly spots! jane was so happy. she picked up the rock and called it her success stone.

she kept it with her always. whenever she felt like she couldn't make it, she looked at the stone and remembered that anything was possible.

and before long, jane did succeed! she did something no one else had done. jane had made her dreams come true!

john was a three- year-old boy living with his parents in a nice house on a hill. every day, he would look out of the window, watching the birds in the sky and dreaming.

one day, john noticed something special â€“ a rabbit! curious, he decided to go outside in search of the animal. after a few minutes of searching, john saw the rabbit again!

seizing the opportunity, john quickly grabbed the animal into his hands. but the rabbit was too scared and ran away quickly. feeling defeated, john began to pray, asking god to help him catch the rabbit.

unexpectedly, god answered john's prayers! a strong wind blew an eraser right next to john, who was ignorant of this divine intervention.

john picked up the eraser and threw it at the rabbit. just then, the rabbit couldnâ€™t escape any more, and john had caught it! now, he could finally bring the rabbit home and show it to his parents.

once upon a time there was a little girl named lucy. she was three years old and loved to dress herself up in different clothes. one morning she was wearing her favorite pink dress when she asked her mom, "what is history?" her mom smiled and said "history is like a story that happened a long time ago". 

lucy thought it sounded very exciting so she put on her dress and said "i want to go and see some history now!" her mom replied "my brave girl, of course you can go, but be careful". 

so lucy put on her shoes and walked out the door. as she walked down the street she felt a little bit nervous, but she kept going. finally, she arrived at the museum. she stepped inside and looked around. everywhere she looked she saw old artifacts and beautiful artifacts. 

lucy walked around the museum for an hour, looking at the old history. after a while, she realized it was time to go home. she felt a mixture of emotions. she was both excited and nervous because she had seen a lot of history that day. 

when lucy arrived home, she told her mom all about her adventures and what she had seen. her mom smiled and said "it sounds like you had a very interesting day!" 

the end

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to dream about princesses and unicorns. one day, lily went to the park with her mom. they played on the swings and slide. 

suddenly, lily's mom said, "lily, we have to go home now. don't forget to open the door when we get there." 

lily replied, "okay, mommy! i remember!" 

on the way home, lily fell asleep in the car. she had a dream about a magical castle with a big pink door. when they got home, lily woke up and remembered what her mom said. she opened the door and ran inside to tell her dad all about her dream. 

her dad smiled and said, "that sounds like a wonderful dream, lily. i'm glad you remember it."

once upon a time, there were two little birds who lived in a nice big tree. they lived happily and sang together every day.

one day, the two birds saw a shiny circle in the sky. they were curious. they decided to peek up and see what it was.

when the birds poked their little heads out of the tree, they were amazed to see the moon. it was so beautiful and important!

the two birds learned a lesson that day. they knew from then on that it was important to peek up once in a while to see what special things were in the sky.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to eat cereal for breakfast every day. he would pour the cereal into his bowl and add milk until it was ready to eat. 

one day, timmy's mommy asked him if he wanted to own his very own cereal box. timmy was so excited! he had never owned anything before. mommy took him to the store and they picked out a box of his favorite cereal. 

now, timmy had his very own cereal box that he could eat whenever he was ready. he felt so grown up and proud to own something of his own. every morning, he would pour his cereal into his bowl and eat it all up. timmy was the happiest little boy in the world.

once upon a time, there was a girl. she wanted to find something special. so, she decided to go to the beach.

when she got to the beach, she found a big, heavy rock. she lifted it up and she was so excited because there was a dolphin underneath! it was so cute!

the girl wanted to take her new dolphin friend with her. but it was so heavy! she tried and tried to lift it up. finally she was able to take it home with her.

they became the best of friends. everywhere the girl went, she took the dolphin with her. they went on lots of adventures together.

the girl was so happy to have found her special dolphin.

once there was a boy named tom. he was a curious boy and was always looking for something to explore and do. 
one day, tom decided to go for a walk and found a pistol in the woods. he was so excited and so he ran home to show his mum.

tom's mum was not so excited. she looked at the pistol and said â€œtom, you must never touch a distant pistol again! itâ€™s very dangerous and could hurt someone.â€

tom nodded and promised to never touch it again. he thanked his mum for teaching him such an important lesson.

from that day on, tom always thought before taking a risk. he remembered the lesson his mum taught him and kept herself and others safe.

once upon a time, there was a wealthy family with a mom, a dad, and their two children. every night, the family would sit together at the dinner table and share stories. 

one night, the mom opened a bottle of wine to share with the family. "this wine is so special," she said. "it's from the most grand vineyard in the world!" 

the dad smiled and took a sip. "mmm. delicious!"

the children looked wide-eyed at the bottle. "what's wine?" asked the youngest.

mom and dad looked at each other and chuckled. "wine is a special drink," mom said. "it's only for grownups!" 

both children put their hands behind their backs and nodded. "we will listen carefully," the eldest said. 

the mom smiled and filled each glass with wine. they drank, laughed and shared stories until bedtime. 

at the end of the night, the mom told the two children, "let's remember to listen carefully and also be thankful for all our blessings. we're a very lucky and wealthy family!" the children nodded in agreement. 

the family gave each other a hug and went to bed.

once there was a fine little girl named sarah. she loved to look at her model of a boat. she adored it, and loved to run her hands along it. 

one day, sarah wanted to take her model boat outside and play with it. she asked her mom if she could, and her mom said yes.

so sarah went outside with her model boat, and suddenly she saw a big puddle of water! she went closer and saw that it was getting bigger and bigger by the second.

sarah knew that if the boat got in the water it would get ruined! so she quickly reached down and grabbed it. she then looked around for something to dry it off. 

suddenly she found a towel nearby. she picked it up, and started to dry her model boat. finally, once she was done, sarah brought the boat back inside and put it in a safe place. 

now sarah was very happy, because her model boat stayed safe, and it was nice and dry!

tom and mia are friends. they like to play at the beach. they make castles with sand and shells. they laugh and have fun.

one day, tom falls and hurts his knee. he cries and shows mia his boo-boo. mia says, "don't cry, tom. i will help you." she runs to the water and gets a wet cloth. she puts it on tom's knee and says, "this will make it heal. it will feel better soon."

tom stops crying and smiles. he says, "thank you, mia. you are a good friend." mia smiles back and says, "you are welcome, tom. you are a good friend too."

they hug and go back to their sand castles. they are hungry and thirsty. they see a man with a cart. he sells ice cream and juice. they run to him and ask for some. he gives them each a cone and a cup. they say, "thank you, mister." he says, "you are welcome, kids. enjoy."

they sit on the sand and eat their ice cream and drink their juice. they say, "this is yummy. this is the best day ever." they lick their lips and smile. they are happy.

tom and lily are friends. they like to play in the park. they see a big dog. the dog is brown and has a long tail. tom and lily want to pet the dog.

"can we pet the dog?" tom asks a man. the man is holding a leash. the leash is for the dog.

"yes, you can. he is gentle and friendly. his name is rex." the man says. he smiles at tom and lily.

tom and lily go near the dog. they touch his fur. the fur is soft and warm. the dog licks their hands. tom and lily giggle.

"rex, you are so nice. do you want to play with us?" lily asks the dog.

the dog barks. he wags his tail. he looks happy.

"ok, let's play. what do you want to do?" tom asks the dog.

the dog runs to a ball. the ball is red and bouncy. the dog picks up the ball in his mouth. he brings it to tom and lily.

"let's play catch. you throw the ball and i catch it." the dog seems to say.

tom and lily nod. they take turns throwing the ball. the dog chases the ball. he catches it and brings it back. they have fun.

but then, something bad happens. a loud noise scares the dog. the noise is from a car. the car is fast and noisy. the dog drops the ball. he runs away from the noise. he runs across the street.

"rex, come back!" the man shouts. he drops the leash. he runs after the dog.

tom and lily watch. they are scared. they see the car. the car does not see the dog. the car hits the dog.

the dog yelps. he falls to the ground. he does not move. he is hurt.

the man reaches the dog. he cries. he hugs the dog. he calls for help.

tom and lily cry too. they are sad. they liked the dog. they wanted to play more.

the end.

lily and ben were twins who liked to play in the garden. one day, they saw a big pile of wood near the fence. they wanted to build a house with the wood, but they did not ask their mom.

they took some wood and started to stack it on the grass. they used a hammer and nails to make the wood stick together. they were having fun, but they were also very naughty.

"look, ben, our house is almost done!" lily said.

"yes, lily, it is very nice. but we need a door and a window," ben said.

they looked around and saw a big piece of wood leaning on the fence. it had a hole in the middle. it looked like a door with a window.

"let's use that one, lily. it is perfect for our house," ben said.

they ran to the fence and tried to pull the wood. but it was too heavy and too big. they could not move it.

they heard a loud voice behind them. it was their dad. he was angry.

"what are you doing, lily and ben? that is not your wood. that is the wood for the new shed. you are not supposed to touch it. you could hurt yourself with the hammer and nails. and you made a mess on the grass. you are very naughty. go to your room right now!" he said.

lily and ben felt scared and sorry. they dropped the hammer and nails and ran to their room. they knew they did something bad. they wished they had asked their mom first.

they sat on their bed and hugged each other. they did not want their dad to be mad at them. they wanted him to love them.

they closed their eyes and folded their hands. they prayed to god.

"dear god, please forgive us for being naughty. we did not mean to make dad angry. we just wanted to have fun. please help us to be good and listen to our mom and dad. please make dad happy and love us again. thank you, god. amen," they prayed.

they opened their eyes and saw their mom standing at the door. she had a smile on her face.

"your dad is not angry anymore. he knows you are sorry. he loves you very much. he wants to talk to you and hug you. come on, let's go to him," she said.

lily and ben jumped off the bed and ran to their mom. they hugged her and said, "we love you, mom. we are sorry for being naughty."

they followed their mom to the garden, where their dad was waiting for them. he hugged them and said, "i love you, lily and ben. i am sorry for being loud. i was worried about you. you have to be careful with the wood and the tools. they are not toys. they are for building the new shed. do you want to help me with that?"

lily and ben nodded and said, "yes, dad. we want to help you. we are sorry for taking your wood. we will ask you next time."

they smiled and kissed their dad. they were happy again. they thanked god for answering their prayer. they learned their lesson. they decided to be good and not naughty.

once upon a time, there was a little bunny named benny. benny loved to play outside in the sunshine and run through the grass. one day, benny saw a spark in the woods and went to investigate. he found a shiny rock and decided to keep it as his treasure.

but as benny walked back home, the sky turned gloomy and dark clouds covered the sun. benny started to feel scared and worried. he tried to relax and tell himself everything was okay, but he couldn't shake the feeling of unease.

suddenly, a big storm came and lightning struck a tree near benny. he was so scared that he dropped his treasure and ran back to his burrow. when he got there, he realized that his treasure wasn't worth risking his safety for.
