the moral of the story is that sometimes things may seem important, but it's not worth risking your safety or happiness for them. it's important to stay safe and relaxed, even when things seem scary.

tom and anna were playing with their toys in the living room. tom had a big truck and anna had a doll. they were having fun, but tom was a little lazy. he did not want to share his truck with anna, or help her clean up the toys.

"tom, can i play with your truck for a little bit?" anna asked.

"no, it is mine. you have your doll," tom said.

"but i want to try something new. please, tom, just for a little bit," anna said.

"no, no, no. go away, anna. you are bothering me," tom said.

anna was sad and angry. she wished she could make tom share his truck. she remembered that her grandma had given her a book of spells for her birthday. she ran to her room and looked for the book. she found a spell that said "shrink, shrink, shrink. make something small as a wink."

anna smiled. she took the book and went back to the living room. she pointed at tom's truck and said the spell.

"shrink, shrink, shrink. make something small as a wink."

suddenly, tom's truck became very tiny. it was smaller than anna's doll. tom was shocked and scared. he dropped the truck and it fell on the floor.

"anna, what did you do? you made my truck shrink!" tom cried.

anna pointed at tom's truck and said the spell.

"grow, grow, grow. make something big as a bow."

tom's truck became big again. it was bigger than before. tom was happy and relieved. he hugged anna and thanked her.

"anna, you are very kind and smart. you can play with my truck anytime. i am sorry i was mean and lazy. i will be a good brother to you," tom said.

they played with their toys and had fun. they shared and helped each other. they were happy and they learned a lesson.

once upon a time, there was a playful kitten named mittens. mittens loved to play with her toys all day long. one day, mittens saw a little birdie flying outside. she wanted to play with the birdie, but the birdie flew away.

once there was a dependable dog. he loved taking pictures and playing outside. every day he would go for a walk and take a picture of something he liked. one day, he was out for a walk when the sky suddenly turned dark. the wind began to blow and it was very cold. then it started to snow. he took a picture of the snowflakes falling, but then the sky froze solid!

once upon a time, there was a little bunny named benny. benny loved to play outside in the sun. one day, the sky turned dark and it started to rain. benny got scared and ran to his mommy.

"mommy, i'm scared," benny said. "can we stay inside our shelter until the rain goes away?"

"of course, my little benny," his mommy replied. "we're ready for any kind of weather."

as they sat inside their shelter, benny's mommy told him a story about a little bird who didn't have a shelter and got very wet in the rain. benny felt sad for the little bird and decided that he would share his shelter with any animals who needed it.

from that day on, benny always made sure his shelter was ready for anyone who needed it, even if it meant he had to stay inside with them. and that's how benny learned that sharing is caring.

once upon a time, there was a pretty puppy named spot. spot loved to play in the park with his friends. one day, spot saw a big bone in the park and he wanted to take it home. 

spot's mommy said, "spot, you can't take that bone home. it doesn't belong to you." 

spot replied, "but mommy, i want to take it home and show it to my friends. they will think i'm cool." 

mommy said, "no, spot. you have to leave it here. it's not yours to take." 

spot was sad, but he knew his mommy was right. he walked away with his head down, thinking about how he could get that bone. 

as he walked, he saw a man working on a fence. the man looked away for a moment, and spot ran over to the bone and grabbed it with his mouth. 

the man saw spot and chased after him, but spot was too fast. spot ran and ran until he got to the street. suddenly, a car came and hit him. 

spot's mommy came running over, but it was too late. spot was gone. mommy cried and cried, wishing she had never let spot out of her sight.

sam was a dog who liked to run and play. he had a big yard with a fence and a ball. he also had a friend, max, who lived next door. max was a cat who liked to nap and eat. sometimes, sam and max would play together through the fence.

one day, sam saw max with a treat. it was a fish, and it smelled good. sam wanted some, too. he asked max to share, but max said no. he said it was his treat, and he worked hard to catch it. sam felt sad and angry. he thought max was mean and selfish.

he did not know where they were going. he did not know if he would see max again. he did not know if he would play or run again. he did not know if he would get a treat again. he only knew he made a big mistake. he sighed and closed his eyes. he wished he was nice to max. he wished he was happy.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved cookies, especially the chocolate chip ones his mom made. one day, timmy saw a jar full of cookies on the kitchen counter. he knew he shouldn't take one without asking, but he couldn't resist the temptation. he took a cookie and ate it quickly.

from that day on, timmy made sure to always ask before taking a cookie. he didn't want to repeat his mistake and feel guilty again. timmy learned that it's important to be honest and take responsibility for our actions.

the victory! jenny had found the victory she had been looking for. she felt so proud and brave, she had done it! jenny raised both legs in the air and cheered. her march had been a success!

lily and ben liked to play with their toys. they had a big box of toys with many things inside. one day, they found a new toy in the box. it was a small machine with a red button and a black wire. the wire had a round thing at the end. it looked like a bell.

"what is this?" lily asked.

"i don't know. maybe it is a phone," ben said.

they pressed the red button and heard a beep. then they spoke into the bell.

"hello, hello, can you hear me?" lily said.

"hello, hello, i can hear you," ben said.

they laughed and took turns talking into the bell. they did not know that the machine was a recorder. it was recording everything they said.

after a while, they got bored and put the machine back in the box. they played with other toys. they forgot about the machine.

the next day, their mom came to the room. she saw the machine in the box and was curious. she pressed the red button and heard a beep. then she heard lily and ben's voices.

"hello, hello, can you hear me?"

"hello, hello, i can hear you."

she smiled and listened to their conversation. they said many funny and weird things. they talked about their toys, their dreams, their friends, and their secrets.

mom thought it was very cute and sweet. she decided to keep the machine and the recording. she wanted to remember how lily and ben sounded when they were little. she thought it was a precious gift.

once upon a time, there was a little ant. the ant was walking in the grass when it saw a big piece of candy. the ant was happy and said, "i have found a yummy candy!" then, a little girl came and saw the ant. she wanted to play with it, but the ant was scared and said, "please don't hurt me, i want to be safe." 

the little girl picked up the candy and the ant and put them in her pocket. she went back to her house and showed her mom the candy and the ant. her mom was not happy and said, "we don't keep ants in the house, they can make us sick." the little girl was sad and said, "but i want to keep it safe." 

the mom said, "no, it's not safe for us to have ants in the house." so, the little girl had to let the ant go outside. she put the ant on the ground and it ran away. the little girl was sad that she couldn't keep the ant safe, but she knew it was the right thing to do.

one day there was a regular tank. it was filled with water and it had a lid. the tank was very heavy and one day it dropped. the lid fell off and out came a stream of water. 

the water spilled out onto the ground and made a big puddle. all the water in the tank dropped onto the ground, so quickly that nobody saw it happen. 

tiny fish were living in the tank. the fish were all so scared of the loud noise and the spilling of the water. 

but the fish were all ok. they found a big puddle and just stayed there. 

they were happy because the water in the puddle was just like the water in the tank and they could swim around. even if the dropped tank was regular, it made a new home for the little fish.

anna and ben are friends. they like to play pretend. one day, they decide to be a king and a queen. they find a big box and some blankets. they make a palace with the box and the blankets. they put some toys and books inside the palace.

anna and ben have fun in their palace. they read stories and play games. they pretend to have tea and cake. they wear crowns and capes. they are happy and warm.

but then, the wind blows hard. the box and the blankets move. the palace falls down. anna and ben are sad and cold. they try to fix the palace, but it is too hard. they look for a new place to play.

they see a big tree. the tree has many leaves and branches. they decide to make a new palace in the tree. they climb up the tree and find a cozy spot. they bring some toys and books. they make a new palace with the leaves and branches.

anna and ben have fun in their new palace. they read stories and play games. they pretend to have tea and cake. they wear crowns and capes. they are happy and warm. they like their new palace in the tree. they are good friends. the end.

once upon a time there was a little girl named alice. she loved to play make believe and dress up like a princess. one day, alice wanted to spritz her favorite perfume. she held the bottle tight, then sprayed it all over her room with a big sniff! unfortunately, the scent was too strong and made alice sleepy. 

alice's mom noticed the perfume in the air and became upset. she said, "alice, what did you do? why are you spraying perfume?"
alice sighed and said, "i wanted to try it, but it made me sleepy". her mom replied, "i'm sorry you are tired now, but you should never do this again. it's not safe."

alice felt regret as she looked at the bottle in her hands. she put it back and silently apologized. from then on, alice knew better than to spray perfume without permission.

once upon a time, there was a weak boy named tim. he lived in a small village. one day, tim found a spear near his house. he wanted to play with it, but he was too weak to lift it.

tim thought if he could add more strength, he could lift the spear. so, he started to eat healthy food and exercise every day. he ran, jumped, and played with his friends. slowly, he became stronger.

one day, a big and mean dog came to the village. the dog scared everyone. tim knew he had to help. he took the spear and faced the dog. with his new strength, he scared the dog away. the village was safe, and everyone was happy. tim learned that even a weak boy can become strong and brave.

sam was walking in the park. he looked around and saw nothing but boring grass. he sighed and said to himself, "this is no fun". 
suddenly, he saw a beautiful, shiny coin in the grass. he couldn't believe his luck, so he quickly picked it up. 

sam said, "wow! i've gained something special."
he jumped and ran around in circles with excitement, not noticing a nearby fairy who had been watching him. 

the fairy smiled and said, "you've gained something special. would you like something more?"

sam replied, "yes, i would like something more!"

the fairy sprinkled some magical glitter on the grass and it started to grow. suddenly, the boring grass transformed into a beautiful field of wild flowers. 

"now you can play and explore in the wonderful field of flowers," said the fairy. "it will never be boring again!"

sam thanked her and ran off to explore his new and magical world.

once upon a time there was a mighty aunt. she had the power to make things rot at a moments notice. everywhere she went things she touched went bad. one day she went to the market and as usual, she made the apples and tomatoes rot in minutes. all of the customers were so angry about their wasted money. 

the aunt was very sad. she didn't understand why she had this power and why couldn't she just be like everyone else. but deep down, she knew she was special and had amazing powers. 

one day her niece, a sweet little 3 year old girl, came with her to the market. remembering that little child, her aunt softened her heart. she touched the most rotten apples and suddenly they were as fresh as the morning dew. everyone was amazed. 

the aunt smiled. she knew she could make things better despite her very special and mighty powers.

once there was a little girl named lola. she was three years old and liked to ask lots of questions. every morning, lola woke up impatient to learn more things. she wanted to know why the trees were tall, why the sky was blue and why the grass was green.

so lola asked her mom all kinds of questions. her mom was always happy to answer them. then, lola asked her mom why the sun was so bright. her mom explained that the sun made light for us to see. lola thought about this for a moment and thought it was so amazing.

lola asked her dad questions, too. she asked her dad how the wind moved from one place to another. her dad laughed, and smiled at her, before explaining that the wind was made of air.

lola asked questions all day long and learned something new each time. her parents were very patient in answering all her questions, and lola was so happy and excited to find out more.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. he loved to go to the beach with his mommy and daddy. one day, they saw a huge dolphin swimming in the ocean. timmy was so happy to see the dolphin. he felt excited and amazed.

the dolphin swam closer to the shore and timmy could see it better. it had a shiny grey skin and a big smile on its face. timmy wanted to touch the dolphin, but his mommy told him it was not safe. they watched the dolphin swim away and timmy felt a little sad.

but then, the dolphin jumped out of the water and did a flip in the air! timmy laughed and clapped his hands. he felt happy again. from that day on, timmy always looked for the huge dolphin whenever he went to the beach.

once upon a time, there lived a kind and honest little girl named jenny. one night, jenny was struggling to get to sleep because she had a really bad itch. she knew she had to do something, but she didn't know what. suddenly, she heard a noise in the bathroom and she walked over to take a look.

she saw a razor lying there and she knew it wouldn't be safe to use. she knew that she was too small to use it and she started to cry. she didn't know what to do and she was getting more itchier by the second.

she tried to think of another way to make the itch go away, but she couldn't. eventually, jenny started to feel frustrated and she started to cry. just then, jenny's mom came in and asked what the matter was. when she heard the story, jenny's mom smiled and said to her, "you want to scratch it? here, i'll do it for you."

jenny's mom took the razor and she scratched gently near the itch. jenny felt relieved and the itch was gone in no time. jenny thanked her mom, who was honest and kind, and went back to bed. she was very relieved and she felt safe knowing that her mom was there to help her.

once upon a time, there was a brave little rabbit. it was a wild rabbit, with big ears and a bouncy tail. it loved to explore the world.

the rabbit hopped through the meadow, looking for adventure. suddenly, it heard a loud noise! it was thunder! the rabbit was scared and ran to hide.

the thunder roared and the skies got dark. the rabbit shivered, but did not run away. suddenly, the rabbit realized that thunder was just the sound of the clouds. it wasn't scary afterall!

the rabbit felt brave again and jumped out of its hiding place. it looked up at the wild clouds and saw a bright, shiny rainbow. that made the rabbit smile. it was an adventure after all!

once upon a time there was a little girl. her name was daisy. daisy was three years old.

one day, daisy wanted to touch something new. she walked over to a big tree with lots of leaves. daisy was so excited - she just had to touch it!

when daisy touched the tree she heard a loud noise. a police officer was walking by and he heard the noise. he saw daisy, so he said "what are you doing?"

daisy said, "i wanted to touch the tree." the policeman said, "that's against the law, you can't do that!"

daisy didn't know what the law was, but she was scared. she said, "please don't get mad at me - i'm sorry!"

the policeman said, "it's ok - just don't do it again. next time, find something new to touch!"

daisy said, "ok, i promise!"

and that is the story of how daisy learned about the law.

once upon a time, there was a brilliant boy who lived in a town far away. he was very clever but he needed help with his learning.

one day, he asked his mum if he could have a tutor to help him. his mum said yes!

so the boy and his mum went on a hunt to find a tutor. they looked all around the town, searching for the perfect tutor to help the boy.

finally, the boy and his mum found a tutor that was just perfect. she was kind and helpful, and could help the boy with his learning.

the boy was so pleased that he got a tutor who could help him. with the help of his tutor he got better and better and now he is even more brilliant than before!

once upon a time, there was a big, tough wolf. he liked to go on long walks and explore the woods. one day, he decided to bring a friend with him on his walk.

so the wolf brought a little lamb along with him. the lamb was so excited to go on this big adventure with the wolf. she was a bit afraid, too, because she had heard stories about wolves.

the wolf was very nice to the lamb. he showed her all the interesting things in the woods, like the birds and the squirrels. he also showed her how to pick blueberries, which were yummy and sweet.

the two friends had a lot of fun together. they talked, laughed and even raced each other. the wolf knew he had to keep the lamb safe, so he stayed close by her side and kept a careful eye out for danger.

in the end, the lamb wanted to thank the wolf for being so tough. she gave him a big hug and said, â€œthank you for bringing me on this adventure. i had so much fun today!â€

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. one day, she went to her grandma's house for dinner. her grandma made spaghetti, which was lily's favorite food. lily was so happy and jolly that she ate a lot of spaghetti.

after dinner, lily and her grandma sat on the couch and talked. lily mentioned that she had a new toy she wanted to show her grandma. her grandma was interested and asked lily to show her the toy. lily ran to her bag and brought out a jolly toy clown.

her grandma was so happy to see the toy and said, "what a wonderful toy, lily! you always have the best toys." lily smiled and said, "thank you, grandma. i love my new toy." they both laughed and played with the toy clown until it was time for lily to go home.

once upon a time, there was a playful little girl named lily. she loved to play with her toys all day long. one day, she saw her brother playing with a cool toy car that had many gears. 

"can i play with your car?" asked lily.

"sure, you can play with it for a little bit," said her brother, passing the car to her.

lily was so happy to play with the gear-filled car. she made it go fast and slow, and even made it pass through her toy tunnel. 

"thank you for letting me play with your car," said lily, passing it back to her brother.

"no problem, lily. you can play with it anytime you want," said her brother with a smile. 

from that day on, lily and her brother played together with the toy car, passing it back and forth, and having lots of fun.

once there was a little boy who was playing in his bathtub. he had lots of fun, splashing the water with his hands. he started to get all wet so his mommy gave him a big bar of soap. 

he started to play with the soap and it made big bubbles. the little boy loved the bubbles, they felt so nice on his skin. he wanted to keep playing with them but soon they were all gone.

the little boy wanted more bubbles so he grabbed his toy alligator. he put some fake soap in the alligators mouth and splashed it in the water. suddenly, lots of bubbles started to appear. 

the little boy was so excited to have more bubbles that he forgot he was playing in the bathtub. he had such a great time making bubbles with his alligator that he forgot to get all clean.

once upon a time, there was a big castle. in the castle, there were many people who worked there. they were called the staff. they helped the king and queen with everything they needed.

one day, a mysterious package arrived at the castle. nobody knew where it came from or what was inside. the king and queen asked the staff to open it, but they were too scared. finally, a brave knight accepted the challenge and opened the package.

inside the package, there was a beautiful crown. the king and queen were very happy and gave the knight a big reward. from that day on, the knight became part of the staff and helped the king and queen every day.

one day, a boy named tim went outside to play. it was a rainy day, so tim's mom gave him a big umbrella. she said, "tim, you are allowed to play, but stay dry with this umbrella."

tim went to the park with his umbrella. he saw his friend, sue, playing in the rain. sue did not have an umbrella. she was wet and cold. sue saw tim and his umbrella. she felt envious. she said, "tim, i wish i had an umbrella like yours!"

tim was a kind boy. he wanted to help sue. he said, "sue, come under my umbrella. we can both stay dry and play together!" sue smiled and joined tim under the umbrella. they played and laughed together, staying dry and warm.

their friends saw them and felt envious too. they all wanted to join tim and sue under the big umbrella. tim and sue let them come under the umbrella. they all played and had fun together, even on the rainy day.

once upon a time, there was a messy dog named spot. he loved to dig and bury his bones in the yard. one sunny day, spot found a big, juicy bone. he was so happy and couldn't wait to bury it.

spot dug a big hole in the yard and put the bone inside. then, he covered it with dirt. "now, i will wait until later to eat my bone," he thought. spot went to play with his friend, a little bird named chirpy.

chirpy saw the messy dirt and asked, "spot, what did you do?" spot told chirpy about the bone he buried. chirpy smiled and said, "that's a great idea! now your bone will be safe." spot and chirpy played all day, and when the sun went down, spot dug up his bone and enjoyed his tasty treat.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named tom. tom liked to play with his toy cars. one day, he saw a big tree with a tire swing hanging from it. he thought it looked comfortable and fun. so, he ran to the tree and sat on the swing.

tom swung back and forth, having a great time. then, he saw a little girl named sue. sue wanted to play on the swing too. but there was only one swing, so tom and sue didn't know how to play together. they looked at each other and frowned.

tom had an idea. he said, "let's play a game! we can find a match for each car. the one who finds the most matches wins and gets to swing first!" sue liked the idea, so they started to play. they took turns on the swing and had a fun day together.

once upon a time, there was a tall dark valley. it was full of mystery and surprise.

one day, a little girl decided to explore the valley. she walked around and read all the signs. she discovered that the valley was full of colourful flowers and birds. 

the little girl was so excited to explore the valley that she decided to spend the whole day there. as the sun went down, the valley became dark. but the little girl was not scared. 

she looked up at the stars and kept reading the signs. she read about the different plants and animals that lived in the valley. then, she started to feel sleepy.

she curled up and fell asleep in the dark valley. in the morning, when the sun came up, she was ready to learn more and explore the valley once more.

one day, a little girl named lily was sleeping in her bed. she heard a loud noise that made her wake up. lily was scared, but she wanted to be brave like her favorite hero. she got out of her bed and walked to the door.

lily opened the door and saw her parent in the room. her parent was making the loud noise. "why are you making noise?" lily asked. her parent said, "i am fixing the chair. i did not mean to wake you up."

lily felt better and was happy she was brave. she went back to her bed and her parent gave her a hug. they said, "you are very brave, lily. now, go back to sleep." lily smiled and fell asleep, feeling safe and brave.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named jane. jane was 3 years old and loved to explore. one day, jane asked her mom, "can i go outside and explore?" her mom said, "yes, but don't go too far!"

jane smiled and said, "okey dokey!" she put on her coat and ran outside. she saw the sun, the trees, and the flowers -- her eyes sparkled! jane made her way to the park.

once she arrived, she noticed a group of kids playing. one of them said to jane, "hi, do you want to play too?"

jane shrugged and replied, "i don't know how to play." the kids laughed and said, "it's easy! we'll show you."

so the kids taught jane how to play. she listened carefully and before she knew it, she was having a really good time! and they all lived happily ever after. the end.

lila and ben are at the park with mom. they see a truck with a picture of ice cream on it. they run to the truck and ask mom for some ice cream.

"can i have a cone with chocolate and vanilla, please?" lila says.

"can i have a cone with strawberry and banana, please?" ben says.

mom gives the man some money and he gives them their cones. lila and ben lick their ice cream and smile.

they see a big slide and want to go on it. they run to the slide with their cones.

"wait, lila and ben," mom says. "don't bring your cones on the slide. they will fall and make a mess. put them on the bench and come back for them later."

lila and ben put their cones on the bench and go on the slide. they have fun sliding down and climbing up.

they see a purple bird on a tree. they want to look at it. they run to the tree with their cones.

"wait, lila and ben," mom says. "don't bring your cones to the tree. the bird will peck them and take them away. put them on the bench and come back for them later."

lila and ben put their cones on the bench and go to the tree. they watch the bird and listen to its song.

they see a swing and want to go on it. they run to the swing with their cones.

"wait, lila and ben," mom says. "don't bring your cones to the swing. they will fly out of your hands and land on the ground. put them on the bench and come back for them later."

lila and ben put their cones on the bench and go to the swing. they swing high and low and laugh.

they are done with the swing and want to eat their ice cream. they run to the bench with their cones.

but their cones are gone! they see a dog licking the last bits of their ice cream. the dog has a purple tongue and a happy face.

"hey, that's our ice cream!" lila and ben say.

"sorry, kids," the dog says. "it was too yummy to resist. next time, don't leave your cones alone. or better yet, bring them to me!"

lila and ben are sad and angry. they look at mom.

mom smiles and says, "don't worry, lila and ben. i have a surprise for you. look, the ice cream truck is still here. let's go and get some more cones. and this time, don't bring them anywhere but your mouths!"

alice and bob were walking in the park.
alice said, "let's go to the office".
bob replied, "ok".
when they arrived, the office was empty. alice put her hand into her sack, and took out a key. she used the key to open the door, and they both went inside.
bob looked around and said, "it's so empty in here".
alice smiled and said, "let's make it better".
bob looked in his sack and took out some crayons and paper. alice got out a teddy bear and started drawing on the paper.
they both laughed and made the office look much better.

lena and tom are playing in their room. they have a big sheet and some chairs. they want to make a tent with the sheet. lena says, "i will stand on this chair and hold the sheet. you stand on that chair and hold the other end." tom nods and does what lena says.

but then, their dog, spot, comes into the room. spot is a lively dog. he likes to run and jump and bark. he sees the sheet and thinks it is a toy. he runs to the sheet and pulls it with his teeth. lena and tom shout, "no, spot, no! let go of the sheet!"

spot does not listen. he tugs harder on the sheet. the sheet slips from lena's hand. lena falls off the chair and lands on the floor. she cries, "ow, ow, ow! spot, you are a bad dog!" tom jumps off his chair and runs to lena. he hugs her and says, "are you okay, lena? i'm sorry, spot is a silly dog."

spot drops the sheet and looks at lena and tom. he wags his tail and licks their faces. he thinks they are playing with him. he barks, "woof, woof, woof! i love you, lena and tom!" lena and tom are not happy. they push spot away and say, "go away, spot! you ruined our tent!" they pick up the sheet and the chairs and try to make the tent again.

once upon a time, there was an ancient jar. the jar was very special and the people that lived nearby were in awe of it. 

they used to tell stories about the jar, about how it used to be full of treasures. the jar was said to be full of secrets that only it knew. 

one day, a three-year-old boy was walking by the jar. he was so small and curious and he wanted to see what was inside. 

he went up to the jar and gently touched it with his little hands. suddenly, the jar began to glow. 

the boy was so amazed that he just kept looking at the jar until it disappeared. he never told anyone what he saw, but the jar was still talked about in the town.

jill and tom were friends who liked to dance. they danced at home, at school, and at the park. they danced to music, to birds, and to their own songs. they were happy when they danced.

one day, they saw a big poster that said: dance contest. it had a picture of a shiny trophy and a lot of money. jill and tom wanted to win the contest. they thought they could dance better than anyone else.

they went to the contest and saw many other dancers. some were big, some were small, some were fast, some were slow. jill and tom were not scared. they were polite and said hello to the other dancers. they waited for their turn.

when it was their turn, they went to the stage. they smiled and bowed to the judges. they started to dance. they danced with joy and skill. they danced as a team. they danced their best.

but then, something bad happened. a loud noise came from the speakers. it was a scary noise. it hurt their ears. it made them stop dancing. they looked around and saw smoke and fire. the speakers were broken. someone had put a bomb in them. someone wanted to ruin the contest. someone wanted to hurt the dancers.

jill and tom were scared. they ran to the exit. but the exit was blocked. there were too many people. they could not get out. they screamed and cried. they hugged each other. they wished they had never come to the contest. they wished they had stayed at home and danced. they wished someone would provide help. but no one did. the fire grew bigger and bigger. the smoke filled their lungs. they fell to the ground. they stopped breathing. they died.

once upon a time, there was a lively little bird who loved to sleep. he had two beautiful wings that he used to fly through the sky. each night he would find a nice, comfortable tree where he could sleep. he would tuck his wings up close to his body and close his eyes.

one night he was so tired, he fell asleep right away. as he slept, something strange happened. his wings began to grow until they were so big he could hardly move! he flapped them a few times and he was surprised to find that he could fly! he flew all through the night, higher and higher until the sun came up.

in the morning, he found himself in the most beautiful garden he had ever seen. he flapped his big wings and landed on a big, cozy leaf. he was so happy he could fly around and explore the garden. he knew this was the perfect spot for his nightly sleep. from then on, he was the happiest bird ever. he slept peacefully every night in his garden with his big, lively wings safely tucked away.

once upon a time there was a brave little girl. her name was ella and she was very strong. one day, ella went on a magical adventure and met a big, tough monster. 

the monster growled at ella but she wasn't scared. she had a plan. 

"don't be so grumpy," said ella. "i have something that can make you feel better. let me replace it!" 

the monster just blinked.

ella reached into her pocket and pulled out a bouncy ball. she handed it to the monster. he smiled and his grumpiness went away.

"thank you for the present," said the monster. "i will cherish it for a very long time."

ella beamed with happiness. she had replaced the monster's bad feelings with joy. 

the end.

once upon a time, there was a friendly bear. he wanted to go on an adventure to find something special.

so he started walking through the forest. he came to a tunnel and he wanted to see what was on the other side. he was a bit scared, but he kept walking.

as he walked, he started to see beautiful colours. he also heard lovely sounds, like birds singing and rivers bubbling. he was amazed by all the new things he saw. 

he decided to spend more time in the tunnel. he explored all around, poking his nose into different corners and he even made a special friend, a friendly rabbit. 

after a long time, he was happy and decided to go home. but he promised himself he would come back and spend more time in the tunnel, exploring and making more friends.

the little girl was playing in the garden. she had a delicate tube in her hand. she kept it in her hands and twirled it around. she smiled as the sun lit up the tube. all of a sudden she heard loud noises coming from the sky. it was a big red plane, flying high in the sky.

the girl gasped in delight and quickly ran inside to show her mummy what she had seen. her mummy smiled and hugged her warmly.

"that was a plane my darling. they fly up so high and keep going round and round. let's keep your tube safe."

the little girl nodded and put the delicate tube in a safe drawer. every day she remembered the plane and kept her tube safe.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy loved playing football in the stadium with his friends. one day, his mom asked him to wash his hands before dinner.

timmy replied, "but mom, i don't want to wash my hands. they're not dirty."

mom said, "it's important to wash your hands before you eat, timmy. you don't want to get sick."

timmy sighed and went to the sink to wash his hands. while he was washing, he heard a loud noise outside. he looked out the window and saw his friends playing football in the stadium. he finished washing his hands quickly and ran outside to join them.

one day, a little girl named sara went outside to play. she was having a great time when she noticed a cute little bunny hopping around. sara smiled and decided to bring it some food. she went to the kitchen and found some meat. she carefully put the meat in her pocket and went back outside to give it to the bunny. 

the little bunny happily munched away. after it had finished, sara smiled happily. suddenly, the bunny got scared and hopped away. sara had a moment of realization. she understood that giving food to animals was nice, but if she wanted to keep them around, she needed to be gentle. 

sara learnt a great lesson that day. being kind and gentle can bring so much joy, not only to animals, but also to people!

joe looked out the window and saw it was a regular day. he saw his mom pick up a baby from the daycare. she was an infant and looked so small. joe wanted to go outside and see the infant too.

so joe ran outside and saw the little infant in his mom's arms. he looked around, but he didn't see anyone else. he wanted to play with the infant, so he asked his mom if he could hold her. his mom said yes and carefully handed her over to him.

joe held the infant close and smiled. he looked into her eyes and smiled some more. he loved her and wanted to stay with her forever. his mom hugged him and told him to take care of the infant. joe promised he would and kissed the infant good-bye.

once there was a little boy who loved playing with his toy stove. every day he would take his toy and set up a pretend kitchen in his living room. he would stir the imaginary food, turn on the flame and enjoy pretending he was a real cook. 

one day, something strange happened. when he started to stir, a real flame came out of the toy stove! the little boy was very serious and he knew he needed help quickly. 

he ran to his mother, who was very surprised. she quickly turned off the flame and took the little boy outside to safety. 

once outside, the boy and his mother thanked their lucky stars that nothing serious had happened. he promised his mother to never play with the stove again and she promised to keep a closer eye on him. 

the little boy never forgot the flame and it reminded him always to be careful when playing with pretend things.

once upon a time, there was a chubby witch. she lived in a big, dark house in the forest. one day, she decided to go on a walk. she put on her pointy hat and grabbed her broomstick. 

as she flew through the forest, she saw a little girl picking berries. the witch wanted to scare her, but the girl was not afraid. she said, "hello, witch! what are you doing?" the witch was surprised and said, "i'm going for a walk." 

the little girl asked if she could come along, and the witch said yes. they walked and talked together, and the witch realized that not all people were afraid of her. from that day on, the witch and the little girl became friends and went on many more walks together.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved playing in the sand at the beach. he had a bucket and a shovel and he liked to make sandcastles. one day, timmy's friend billy came to play with him. billy had a shiny new toy truck.

timmy said, "wow, billy! your truck is so cool! can i try playing with it?"

billy said, "sure, timmy. but be careful, it's new."

timmy played with the truck for a while, but then he got bored. he said, "playing with the truck is dull. let's go back to making sandcastles!"

billy said, "but timmy, you didn't even try to make the truck go up the sand hill. maybe you just need to try harder."

timmy thought about what billy said and realized that he didn't give the truck a fair chance. he tried again and this time, he was able to make the truck go up the sand hill. timmy learned that sometimes things may seem dull at first, but if you try harder, you might discover something new and exciting.

once upon a time, there was a purple monster having lots of fun. the monster made big promises to the people around it, like to always be happy and to share with its friends. but the monster was not very flexible. whenever it made plans, it would stick to them very tightly, no matter how much the people around it asked it to change its plans.

one day, the monster made a promise that it would take a group of people on a fun activity. everyone was excited! but then they started to argue over what activity they should do. the monster heard the arguing, and it started to worry. it felt like it couldn't keep its promise if the people couldn't agree on what to do.

but then something amazing happened. the monster watched as the people kept talking. and then it saw something it had never seen before: people being flexible. they listened to each other and compromised until everyone was happy with the plan.

the monster smiled and learned an important lesson. it was okay to change plans, and it was okay to be flexible. from then on, the purple monster kept its promises, no matter what.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. lily loved to eat her food with sauce. one day, she felt uncomfortable because her favorite sauce was all gone. she was very sad.

lily's mommy saw that she was unhappy. so, she went to the store and bought more sauce for lily. when lily saw the sauce, she felt so much better. she was very happy and excited to eat her food with the sauce again.

lily said, "thank you, mommy, for getting me more sauce!" her mommy smiled and gave her a big hug. they both enjoyed their meal with the yummy sauce. from that day on, lily always remembered to thank her mommy for the things she did for her.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she went on a trip with her family and they stayed in a big hotel. lily loved the hotel because it had a big pool and lots of toys to play with.

one day, lily saw an adorable puppy outside the hotel. she went to pet the puppy, but it ran away. lily was sad and said, "please come back, puppy!" suddenly, the puppy ran back to lily and licked her face. lily was so happy and her family took the puppy to the hotel room.

in the hotel room, lily played with the puppy and said, "you are so adorable!" her family decided to keep the puppy and take it home with them. lily was so excited and said, "thank you, puppy!" the puppy barked happily and lily knew they would be best friends forever.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named tim. he had a camera that he loved very much. he would take pictures of his toys, his dog, and the trees in the park.

one day, tim saw a big cat in his yard. he was scared, but he hoped the cat would not hurt him. he picked up his camera and said, "i want to take a picture of you, cat!"

the cat looked at tim and said, "do not be scared. i am a nice cat. you can take a picture of me." tim smiled, and took a picture of the big cat. the cat looked at the picture and said, "thank you, tim. that is a nice picture."

tim was not scared anymore. he and the big cat became good friends. they played together every day, and tim took many more pictures with his camera.

once upon a time, there was a sweet little girl named sarah. she was 3 years old and loved to play with her mom and dad. one night, mom and dad decided to surprise sarah with some special popcorn. they bought her some special popcorn with lots of chocolate and sprinkles and they were very thoughtful.

sarah was so excited when she saw the popcorn and she wanted to learn how to make it. mom said, " sarah, let's create some popcorn together. follow me and we'll do it together.â€

so sarah and mom went to the kitchen and they started to make the popcorn. first they added some oil to the pot, then they poured the popcorn, and put the pot over the fire. sarah watched and waited until the popcorn was ready.

the popcorn smelled so delicious and it was filled with a magical smell. finally, when the popcorn was ready, sarah was so excited that she jumped and clapped her hands.

mom and dad gave sarah some popcorn and she enjoyed it. from that day forward, sarah always looked forward to making popcorn with her mom and dad.

once upon a time, there was a big train with a loud engine. the train loved to travel and would go on long trips to different places. one day, the train was feeling really sad and miserable because it had been stuck in the station for a long time. 

suddenly, the train heard a loud noise and felt a jolt. the train knew that it was time to spring into action! the engine roared to life and the train started to move. the train was so happy to be moving again and it chugged along the tracks with excitement. 

as the train traveled, it passed by fields of flowers and forests full of trees. the train felt so much better now that it was on the move again. it realized that sometimes, even when things feel miserable, all it takes is a little bit of spring in your step to get going again.

once there lived a powerful dragon named shade. he lived with his family in a big cave near the sea. he was loved and respected by all of his family, even the other dragons.

one day, shade's family wanted to go on a long journey. they asked shade to stay and watch over their home while they were gone. shade agreed happily and promised to take good care of their cave.

before leaving, his family reminded shade to be careful and to never leave the cave. shade promised that he would not leave. he would stay at home and keep an eye on their cave.

but one day shade became curious about the world outside and forgot about his promise. without telling anyone, he decided to take a quick look at the outside world.

that night, a mighty storm descended on the area. shade remembered his family's warning but it was too late - he had left the cave. the powerful wind and rain were destructive and tore through the cave, destroying everything inside.

in the end, shade learned that it is important to listen to the advice of your family. he realised that the reminder about staying in the cave could have helped him avoid this tragedy.

once upon a time, there was a big elephant named ellie. ellie loved to eat lots of yummy fruits and vegetables. she was very heavy and weighed a lot!

one day, ellie wanted to take a nap in the shade of a big tree. she found a nice spot and closed her eyes. it was so peaceful and cool in the shade.

ellie had a dream that she was successful in finding the biggest banana she had ever seen! when she woke up, she decided to go on a search for the banana. she walked and walked, but couldn't find it. even though she wasn't successful in finding the banana, she was happy to have had a nice nap in the shade.

walt was feeling uncomfortable. he sat in a chair, looking around the room but he didn't want to turn his head. suddenly, his mom came into the room. she was smiling and holding out her hands.

"walt," said mom, "come to me. i have something special for you."

walt stood up slowly and walked towards his mom. when he was close enough, he saw a box she was holding.

"open it," said mom.

walt opened the box, inside he found a toy car. when he saw it his eyes grew wide with surprise.

"do you like it?" asked mom.

walt nodded, his face breaking into a huge smile.

"it's to remind you to value each turn in life," mom explained. 

walt hugged his mom tight and said with a big smile; "thank you mom!"

one day, a wild bunny named bob saw a big cauliflower in the garden. it was so big and yummy, he wanted to eat it. bob hopped over to the cauliflower and gave it a spin. it spun round and round, making him laugh.

bob's friend, a bird named sue, flew down to see what was so funny. "bob, why are you spinning the cauliflower?" she asked. bob said, "it's fun, sue! try it!" sue gave the cauliflower a spin too, and they both laughed as it spun round and round.

as they played, the sky got darker and darker. soon, it began to rain. bob and sue knew they had to find shelter. they remembered the spinning cauliflower and thought it might help them. they spun it one more time, and it opened up like a big umbrella! bob and sue hid under the cauliflower and stayed dry. the spinning cauliflower saved them from the rain, and they were happy they had found it.

tom and sue are friends. they like to play in the park. one day, they see a big map on a wall. the map shows many places and colors.

"look, tom, this is where we are," sue says. she points to a spot on the map. "and this is where the sun goes down. it is called west."

"wow, west is far away," tom says. he looks at the map. "i wonder what is there. maybe there are animals and trees and mountains."

"maybe we can find out," sue says. she has an idea. "let's pretend we are explorers. we can go west and see what we can find."

"ok, let's go," tom says. he is excited. he and sue take their backpacks and hats and start to walk. they follow the map and the sun.

they walk for a long time. they see many things. they see cars and buses and shops and people. they see flowers and birds and dogs and cats. they see a river and a bridge and a boat. they have fun.

but they do not find west. west is still far away. they start to feel tired and hungry.

"tom, i think we should go back," sue says. she looks at the map. "we are lost. we do not know where we are."

"me too," tom says. he looks at the sun. "it is getting dark. we need to find our way home."

they are scared. they do not know what to do. they look around. they see a big sign. the sign says: "park".

"look, sue, the park!" tom says. he is happy. he knows the park. "we are not lost. we are lucky. we can find our way home from here."

"yes, tom, we are lucky," sue says. she is happy too. she knows the park. "we can find our way home from here."

they run to the park. they see their parents. their parents are looking for them. they are worried.

"tom! sue! where have you been?" their parents say. they hug them. they are relieved.

"we went west," tom and sue say. they show them the map. "we were explorers. we saw many things. but we got lost. then we found the park. we are lucky."

their parents smile. they are proud. they are glad.

"you are lucky," their parents say. "but you are also brave. and curious. and smart. you learned a lot today. but next time, please tell us where you are going. and do not go too far. west is a big place. maybe we can go there together someday."

tom and sue nod. they agree. they are sorry. they are happy.

they go home. they have dinner. they tell their parents more stories. they have a lot of questions. they want to know more about west.

they go to bed. they dream of west. they are lucky.

once upon a time there was a nation of very obedient people. everyone in the nation obeyed all the rules, every day.

one day, the ruler of the nation took a trip to a far away place. he asked the people of the nation to stay obedient while he was away. they all agreed.

the ruler left, and the people started to take care of their nation. they planted trees and cleaned the streets. 

but when the ruler came back from his trip, he saw something very surprising. there were beautiful flowers growing everywhere! he was so happy that the people had followed his instructions.

the ruler said, â€œthank you for being so obedient. you have made our nation even more beautiful!â€

once upon a time, there was a smart dog. the dog wanted to travel the world to see new things. he wanted to find out new things and learn more. so off he went!  

the dog travelled far and wide, seeing new places and meeting new people. it was a lot of fun! he was having a great time, until something bad happened. 

the dog got very sad news. a tornado had swept through his home town, destroying everything. he was worried about his home and family. 

the dog was determined to get back home and help. he travelled as quickly as he could, but it was too late. everything was gone.

the dog was shattered. he had travelled so far, but now he had nothing. he had been so smart to go travelling, but it had not led to a happy ending.

bella was three years old and excited to go to the park. she had been watching more birds and squirrels outside her window lately and wanted to see them in person. as she put on her shoes, her mom said to her, "be sure to be calm at the park. can you manage that?" bella nodded and smiled.

at the park, bella was amazed. the trees were tall and the sky a bright blue. she saw several ducks and birds around the pond. but what she was most excited about was all the oranges that were on the trees! she had never seen oranges on trees before. 

bella plucked one off the tree, put it in her pocket, and ran to find her mom. smiling, bella gave her mom the orange. "mommy, i managed to find an orange!"

her mom smiled and laughed. she gave bella a hug and said, "yes you did! you did a great job - let's all calm down and enjoy these oranges." 

bella, her mom, and their friends all sat down and ate the oranges, laughing and enjoying the sunny day. bella spent the rest of the day running around and watching the birds, but she never forgot how she managed to find the orange.

once there was a tall girl called sally. she liked sports very much. every day, she played sports until the sun went down. one day, sally wanted to play her favorite sport, but it was raining. she was sad because the rain prevented her from playing her sport.

then, sally had a great idea. she took some newspapers and built a tall house using them. under the tall house, she played her sport and it was dry.

she was so happy that the tall house had prevented the rain from stopping her from playing her sport. every time it rained, sally built her tall house and played her sport in the dry.

for many days and many months, sally was able to play her sport without the rain stopping her. she was glad that the tall house had prevented the rain from ruining her sport games!

once upon a time, there was a bossy cat named max. max liked to tell everyone what to do, even his friends. one day, max and his friends were playing with some square blocks. max wanted all the blocks for himself, but his friends wanted to play too. max didn't want to share, so his friends went home.

later that day, max realized he didn't have enough blocks to build a tower. he needed more blocks! max went to his friends' houses to ask for their blocks, but they didn't want to give them to him because he was being bossy. max was sad and didn't know what to do. then, his mom came and said she could supply him with more blocks from the store. max was happy again and learned that sharing is important.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named tim. tim loved to play outside. one day, he found a statue in the park. the statue was very big and tall.

tim saw a man with a spray bottle. the man was spraying the statue. tim asked, "why do you spray the statue?" the man said, "i spray it to make it clean."

tim wanted to help. he took the spray bottle and started to spray the statue. but, he sprayed too much. the statue became very wet and slippery. tim tried to stop, but it was too late.

the statue started to wobble and shake. then, it fell down with a big crash! tim felt very bad. the man was sad too. they could not fix the statue. and that was the bad ending.

lily and max are friends. they like to play in the park. one day, they find a big jar of sugar on a bench. they are very happy.

"look, max, sugar! we can eat it and be sweet!" lily says.

"yes, lily, sugar! let's open it and have some!" max says.

they open the jar and take some sugar with their fingers. they put it in their mouths and smile. it is very yummy.

but then, a big dog comes. it sees the jar of sugar and wants it too. it barks and runs to the bench. it knocks over the jar and spills the sugar on the ground.

"hey, dog, stop! that is our sugar!" lily shouts.

"go away, dog, you are bad!" max shouts.

the dog does not listen. it licks the sugar on the ground and growls at lily and max. they are scared and sad. they have no more sugar.

then, a lady comes. she sees the dog and the jar and the sugar. she is angry.

"bad dog, bad dog! what have you done? that is my sugar! i left it here for a minute!" she says.

she grabs the dog by the collar and pulls it away. she looks at lily and max and sees their faces.

"i'm sorry, kids, i didn't know you were here. did the dog hurt you?" she asks.

"no, lady, we are okay. but the dog ate our sugar. we found it on the bench and we wanted to eat it. it was very yummy," lily says.

the lady smiles and says, "oh, i see. well, that was very naughty of the dog. and of you, too. you shouldn't eat sugar from a jar you don't know. it could be bad for you. sugar is not good for your teeth or your tummy."

lily and max feel sorry. they say, "we are sorry, lady. we didn't know. we just wanted to be sweet."

the lady says, "it's okay, kids. i forgive you. but you don't need sugar to be sweet. you are sweet enough already. you know what is sweeter than sugar?"

lily and max shake their heads. they don't know.

the lady says, "a kiss. a kiss is sweeter than sugar. and it makes you happy and lucky. do you want a kiss?"

lily and max nod. they do want a kiss.

the lady bends down and gives them each a kiss on the cheek. they feel warm and happy. they smile and say, "thank you, lady. you are very nice."

the lady says, "you're welcome, kids. you are very nice, too. now, go and play. and remember, no more sugar from strangers. only kisses from friends."

lily and max say, "okay, lady. we will remember. bye, bye."

they wave to the lady and the dog. they hold hands and run to the swings. they are sweet and happy and lucky. they kiss each other on the cheek and laugh. they are friends.

once upon a time, there was a girl who wanted to explore. one day, the girl asked her mommy if she could go out and explore. her mommy said yes and showed her where to go.

the girl was very excited. she grabbed her hat and followed the path. soon, she found an ice mountain. it was so tall and sparkly.

the girl was amazed. she wanted to discover more. she started to climb up the mountain, but it was slippery! she couldn't get up at first.

but then, she remembered that her mom gave her some cheap boots. she put on the boots and managed to get up the mountain.

as she climbed to the top of the mountain, she discovered a cave filled with ice! it was so exciting. she wondered what she could find inside.

to her surprise, inside the cave, there were lots of colorful gems! she was so excited to find this place and the gems! 

the girl returned to her mom and told her all about her discovery. her mom was so proud of her and they both agreed that this was an amazing adventure!

once upon a time there was a jet. it cut through the sky like a knife. it was very fast and strong. but one day it ran into something rough. it was a mountain. the jet was stuck.

the pilot was worried. he looked all around. then he saw something. it was a saw. it had big, sharp teeth. the pilot knew what he had to do. he grabbed the saw and started to cut. he cut and he cut, until finally the jet was free.

the pilot was relieved. he thanked the saw for helping him. the jet flew up into the sky and away. the pilot and the jet lived happily ever after.

once upon a time, there was a little girl called emma. she liked to play outside with her friends. one day, emma decided to play inside. she grabbed a big bottle of spray and headed for the floor.

emma began to spray the floor in unusual ways. she made swirls and zig zags. she even wrote her name in the floor! then, emma stepped back and laughed as she looked at her amazing art.

suddenly, there was a loud noise. emma's dad had come home. he was not happy at all with the mess on the floor. he shook his head and said it was time to clean up.

so, emma had to spray the floor one more time, but this time she sprayed water. she had to use the mop to make the floor shine like new. finally, the floor was clean and back to normal.

emma had learned her lesson: it was fun to play with spray, but she had to be careful and not make a mess.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play with blocks and build tall towers. she would stack them up so high, but sometimes they would fall down. 

one day, lily's dad helped her build the tallest tower she had ever seen. it was so tall that lily had to stand on her tiptoes to put the last block on top. her dad said, "now, be gentle with it, lily. we need to balance it just right." 

lily was careful not to knock the tower over as she stepped back to admire it. she was so proud of herself and her dad. they had worked together to make something amazing. as she looked at the tower, she noticed a little bird perched on top. the bird was so small and light that it didn't knock the tower over. lily smiled and said, "look, dad! the bird is balancing on top of our tower!" 

from that day on, lily always made sure to be gentle and balance her blocks just right. she knew that if she did, she could make something amazing too.

lily and tom are friends. they like to play with toys. one day, they go to the store with lily's mom. the store has many toys. lily and tom see a big box. the box has a picture of a cell. a cell is a thing that makes a phone work.

"look, tom, a cell!" lily says. "i want to see it."

"me too," tom says. they open the box. inside, there is a cell. it is shiny and has many buttons. lily and tom want to touch it.

"can we play with it, mom?" lily asks.

"no, lily, that is not a toy. that is a cell. it is for grown-ups. it is very expensive. put it back in the box," lily's mom says.

but lily and tom do not listen. they take the cell out of the box. they press the buttons. they make noises. they think it is great.

"beep, beep, beep!" lily says.

"hello, hello, hello!" tom says.

they laugh. they have fun. they do not see the man who works at the store. the man is angry. he sees lily and tom with the cell. he walks to them.

"hey, you two, what are you doing? that is not a toy. that is a cell. give it to me. now!" the man says.

lily and tom are scared. they drop the cell. the cell falls on the floor. it breaks. it makes a loud sound. lily and tom cry.

"i'm sorry, i'm sorry, i'm sorry!" lily says.

"me too, me too, me too!" tom says.

lily's mom runs to them. she sees the cell. she sees the man. she sees lily and tom. she is sad. she is mad.

"lily, tom, what have you done? that was a very bad thing to do. you did not listen to me. you did not listen to the man. you broke the cell. you have to say sorry to the man. you have to pay for the cell. you have to learn to be good," lily's mom says.

lily and tom say sorry to the man. they say sorry to lily's mom. they have no money to pay for the cell. lily's mom has to pay for the cell. she has to pay a lot of money. she has no money for toys. lily and tom have no toys. they are sad. they are sorry. they wish they had listened. they wish they had not played with the cell. they wish they had been good.

once upon  a time there was a little girl named mia. she was 3 years old and loved birthdays. unfortunately, mia's last birthday was very different than her previous ones. instead of having a melting cake and presents, she only had a healthy cookie. everyone in her family was feeling sad.

mia was feeling very sad too but she tried to keep a smile on her face. she decided to go play in the park. on her way there she saw a lot of kids playing and she sighed. she wished she could be outside with them but she felt a bit lonely.

suddenly, she heard somebody calling her. she saw one of her favorite friends holding a present and a birthday cake. her friends had come to give her a surprise birthday party! 

mia was so happy! instead of feeling lonely, she was now surrounded by all the kids playing together. she learned that day that it is important to be kind and caring and that it can make somebody happy even if they don't have a lot of gifts.  mia was so grateful, and she and her friends ate a healthy birthday cake together.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play with his toys, especially his toy cars. one day, timmy's mom gave him some peanut butter to spread on his bread. timmy loved peanut butter, so he spread it all over his bread with a stick.

after timmy finished his snack, he went to play with his toy cars. but he accidentally dropped his bread on the floor. the peanut butter stuck to the floor and made it very dull. timmy's mom was very upset because she had just cleaned the floor.

timmy realized he should have been more careful and not played with his toys near his snack. he learned the moral value of being responsible and not making a mess. from that day on, timmy made sure to eat his snacks at the table and play with his toys in his play area.

once upon a time in a jungle, there was a young vine. one day, the vine was very excited and started to dance. its leaves were twirling and its branches were swaying back and forth.

the vine's dance was so happy and fun that it caught the attention of the creatures in the jungle. a small bird, a monkey and a butterfly all came to watch the vine dance. they clapped their wings, hands, and feet to the beat!

the vine kept dancing and twirling around the jungle. all the creatures enjoyed watching the vine's performance. they smiled and laughed in delight. 

soon enough, the sun set and the vine stopped dancing. the creatures all said goodbye to the young vine, thanking it for the wonderful show and returned to their homes.

the vine was happy that it made everyone in the jungle smile and feel so much joy. it stood proudly, still holding on to its happy dance.

once upon a time, there was a boy who lived by the side of a giant lake. every day, he would take long walks around the lake and look for leaks. one day, as he was walking, he saw a funny leak! it was coming from a boat near the shore.

the boy was very curious, so he decided to get closer and have a look. he thought it looked a bit silly, and he suggested to himself that maybe he should plug the leak up.

he looked around and eventually found a thick piece of cloth. he took it, put it over the leak and tied it tightly. he did a really terrific job, because the leak stopped right away.

the boy was so proud of himself for being so clever and helping the boat. he showed all his friends and they said that he was very wise and not at all foolish. and they all lived happily ever after!

once there was a little boy who loved to perform. he practiced every day and had lots of fun. he's gotten very good at it!

one day he found a chain. it was the most beautiful thing he'd ever seen. he put it around his neck and started to perform. he sang and danced and twirled around.

but then he started to feel something strange. the chain was bitter on his skin. he stopped and touched it. the chain felt strange and cold.

he put it back in the exact spot he had found it. he knew he wasn't supposed to have it. he decided it was best to leave it there.

the little boy danced and sang without the chain, feeling happy and free. he was still performing, but he was doing it without that bitter chain.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to bake cakes with her mommy. one day, lily's mommy had an urge to bake a special cake for their neighbor's birthday. 

lily asked, "mommy, can i help you bake the cake?" 

her mommy replied, "sure, sweetie. but first, we need to make sure we have all the ingredients ready." 

lily helped her mommy measure the flour and sugar. they mixed the batter and poured it into the pan. 

after the cake was baked, they decorated it with frosting and sprinkles. lily's mommy said, "this cake looks so pretty and delicious. let's go give it to our neighbor." 

lily was excited to share the cake with their neighbor. she said, "i hope she likes it!"

once upon a time, there was a dog named spot. spot was not like other dogs, he was very original. he had a beautiful, big, and colorful tail. spot loved to play with his friends and have fun.

one day, spot was playing with his friend, tim. tim said, "wow, spot! your tail is so big and pretty!" spot was very happy to hear this. he wanted to make his tail even more special, so he decided to increase the size of his tail.

spot ate a lot of food and his tail grew bigger and bigger. all his friends were amazed by how big it got. they all said, "spot, you have the biggest tail we have ever seen!"

spot was very proud of his big tail, but he also liked being original. he knew that having a big tail was not the only thing that made him special. he decided to be happy with his original tail and not try to increase it anymore.

from that day on, spot learned that being original is what makes you special. he continued to play with his friends and have fun, and they all loved him for who he was.

once upon a time there was a big hole in the ground. a sleepy fox was inside the hole and he couldn't get out. he tried over and over, but his tired legs were too tired.

then one day the fox looked up and saw a friendly cat. the cat said, "i know how to help you get out." the fox jumped up with joy!

the cat put her paw over the hole and she said, "close your eyes and count to three." the fox did what she said and when he opened his eyes, the hole was closed.

the fox and the cat were so happy that they couldn't stop smiling. they were friends forever!

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to draw on her white board with colorful markers. one day, her mom came into her room and said, "lily, let's test out your new board. can you draw a picture of a flower for me?"

lily smiled and picked up her pink marker. she drew a big, beautiful flower with green leaves. her mom was so impressed! "wow, lily! you're such a great artist!" she said.

lily beamed with pride and said, "thank you, mommy! i love my new board. it's so much fun to draw on!" from that day on, lily spent hours drawing on her white board and testing out new markers. she even started teaching her little brother how to draw too. they had so much fun together!

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily who loved to play in her backyard. one day, she found a big box that was locked. she tried to open it, but she couldn't. she asked her mom for help, but her mom didn't have the key.

lily was sad because she really wanted to see what was inside the box. she went to bed that night feeling disappointed. the next morning, she woke up to a surprise. her mom had found the key and unlocked the box! inside, there was a lot of yummy food that lily had never tried before.

lily was so happy and excited to try the new food. she ate until she was full and then went outside to play. as she was playing, the sky started to get dark. lily remembered that her mom had told her to come inside before it got too dark. she ran inside and turned on the light, feeling safe and happy. from that day on, lily always made sure to come inside before it got too dark.

once upon a time, there was a little brown bunny named benny. benny loved to run and race with his friends in the forest. one day, benny's friend asked him, "benny, can you print your name?" benny replied, "no, i don't know how to print yet."

benny felt sad that he couldn't print his name like his friend. he went to his mother and asked her to teach him. his mother said, "benny, you can learn how to print your name if you practice every day." so, benny practiced every day until he could print his name perfectly.

benny's friends were amazed when they saw him print his name. they all congratulated him and said, "benny, you are so smart!" benny was happy that he learned something new.

the moral of the story is that if you practice something every day, you can learn how to do it well.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. one day, her mommy brought home a big box. "let's unpack it together," said mommy. lily was excited to see what was inside. 

as they opened the box, lily saw something yummy. "muffins!" she exclaimed. mommy smiled and said, "yes, we're lucky to have them." they ate the muffins together and they were very delicious. 

later that day, lily went to play outside. she saw her friend timmy and said, "i had a muffin today! it was so yummy!" timmy was excited and said, "i want to try one too!" lily remembered that her mommy had packed an extra muffin. she ran back home to get it for timmy. 

when she arrived home, she saw the box was still open. she looked inside and saw a toy she had been wanting for a long time. she knew it was meant for her, but she also knew how much timmy wanted a muffin. she thought about it for a moment and then decided to give the toy to timmy instead. when she gave the toy to timmy, he was so happy and said, "lily, you're the best friend ever!" from that day on, they shared everything they had and were always lucky to have each other.

once upon a time, there was a boy named john. one day, john was playing in the park when he saw an interesting barrel. he could not help but investigate it. he started walking towards the barrel, when suddenly he heard a loud call from his mother.

john froze and felt ashamed. he had forgotten that his mother asked him to stay near the park bench. so he quickly ran back to the bench. 

when he arrived, he saw his mother standing there with a stern expression on her face. she spoke to john: "i told you not to wander off, why did you disobey me?"

john hung his head low and was too ashamed to answer. he knew he made a mistake and his mother was disappointed in him. his mother took him home and told him not to do it again. john promised he would listen next time.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to dance and twirl around in her room. one day, she went to a big show with lots of dancers. lily saw a beautiful dancer on stage and she felt happy. the dancer was so polite and smiled at everyone.

after the show, lily went home and wanted to be a dancer just like the one she saw. she closed her eyes and prayed to be a good dancer. the next day, lily practiced and practiced until she could dance just like the polite dancer she saw. she was so happy and felt like she could do anything. from that day on, lily knew that if she prayed and practiced, she could become anything she wanted to be.

john and his dad were camping. they had been out in the wild for three days, it was getting dark.

john found a flashlight and started to unpack it. he was very excited to explore with it and his dad was happy john was having a fine time.

suddenly, the flashlight stopped working. his dad tried to unpack it, but it had broken. john was very sad and his dad felt bad. they had no way of lighting the way and they had to return to their tent without seeing the stars. 

john felt disappointed and was not sure what to do. his dad knew they would have to wait until morning now and the camping trip was at an end.

once upon a time, there was a tough cow. he was carrying a napkin in his mouth. he was so proud of himself and he wanted to be the strongest cow in the world.

one day, the cow decided to walk to a nearby farm. he thought he'd have some fun there. when he got to the farm, he tried to find something he could lift, but everything seemed too heavy for him.

then he saw a big rock. he tried to lift it, but it was too tough for him. suddenly, he remembered the napkin he was carrying in his mouth. he put it over the rock and started to push with all his might. 

finally, the rock started to move. he was so proud that he could move something so heavy. the other cows in the farm were happy too! they clapped and cheered for the tough cow.

from then on, the cow was the strongest cow in the world and the other cows respected him. he would always carry his napkin with him and it reminded the other cows of the tough cow who could carry anything.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved going to her yellow class every day. her teacher, miss daisy, was always kind and encouraged her to learn new things.

one day, lily was feeling shy and didn't want to participate in class. but miss daisy noticed and said, "lily, you can do it! i believe in you." this encouraged lily to try her best and she ended up doing a great job.

after class, lily's mom picked her up and asked how her day was. lily replied, "it was good! miss daisy encouraged me and my class is so yellow!" her mom smiled and was happy to hear that lily had a good day.

once upon a time, there was a bird named billy. billy was sad because he thought his life was boring. he wanted to do something fun and exciting. one day, he saw a big, red balloon in the sky. he decided to fly up to it and grab it with his beak.

as billy grabbed the balloon, he started to soar high up in the sky. he was so happy and excited. he saw his owner, tommy, down below. tommy looked up and shouted, "billy, come back! it's not safe!"

but billy did not listen. he was having too much fun soaring with the balloon. he went higher and higher. suddenly, the balloon popped! billy tried to flap his wings, but he was too high up and too scared.

billy fell down, down, down, and landed on the ground with a thud. tommy ran over to him, but it was too late. billy had learned a hard lesson about not listening to his owner. the end.

tom and lily are friends. they like to play with toys. one day, they find a big box in the garage. the box has many stickers on it. the stickers say "do not open".

tom is curious. he wants to see what is in the box. he says to lily, "let's open the box. maybe there is something fun inside."

lily is scared. she remembers what her mom said. her mom said, "never open a box that says 'do not open'. it could be dangerous or bad." she says to tom, "no, tom. we should not open the box. mom said no. we could get in trouble."

tom does not listen. he says, "i don't care. i want to open the box. it is just a box. nothing bad will happen." he pulls the tape and removes the lid. he looks inside the box.

lily gasps. she sees what is in the box. it is a big cake. the cake has candles and frosting. the frosting says, "happy birthday, tom". tom is surprised. he says, "wow, a cake. for me?"

lily smiles. she says, "yes, tom. it is your birthday today. mom and dad made the cake for you. they wanted to surprise you. they are famous for making cakes. they are very good at it."

tom feels happy. he says, "thank you, lily. you are a good friend. and thank you, mom and dad. you are the best. i love you." he hugs lily and his parents. they sing happy birthday to him. they cut the cake and eat it. it is very yummy.

the result is that tom has a great birthday. he learns a lesson. he learns that he should listen to his mom and dad. he learns that he should not open boxes that say "do not open". he learns that sometimes, surprises are good. he is a happy boy.

once upon a time, there was a baby named billy. billy was very small and liked to play with toys. one day, billy's big sister was being bossy and wouldn't let him play with his favorite toy. so, billy decided to whistle to get his mom's attention. 

when his mom came, she saw that billy was sad. she talked to his sister and told her to share her toys with billy. billy was happy again and started playing with his toys. he even tried to whistle again, but it didn't work very well because he was still learning. 

from that day on, billy's sister wasn't bossy anymore and they played together happily. billy learned how to whistle better and even taught his sister how to do it too. they had fun whistling together and playing with their toys. the end.

once upon a time there was a loyal store. the store was filled with wonderful things and everyone who worked there was always very nice.
