the store had many customers who would smile when they came in and the employees would smile back. they would chat and laugh and everyone felt very happy. the employees felt lucky to work at the store.

everyday, a small girl would come to the store. her name was lucy and she was only three years old. lucy was always very excited when she arrived! she would smile as she looked around and point out the different things she liked.

the store workers would smile back. they were so kind to lucy and were very loyal to her. they would never forget her happy smile and always treated her with respect.

no matter how sad lucy felt when she left, the store had made her happy. lucy was always excited to come back to the store. it was her happy place!

once upon a time, there was a bald man. everyday he would walk to the beach near his house and admire the beautiful ocean. on his way, he would always pass by a small shop. he looked inside and saw a very special vase. the vase was so beautiful, the bald man just had to have it. 

he went inside and asked to the shopkeeper, "can i make the vase mine?" 

the shopkeeper replied with a smile. "of course! that will be five dollars." 

the bald man was so excited - he now had the vase! he quickly paid the shopkeeper and ran home. 

the bald man was so proud of his vase. he showed it to all his friends, who all admired it. 

the bald man said softly to himself, "i am so happy i was able to make this vase mine."

once upon a time there was a brown comet. every night it would dance in the sky. it would twirl and leap in the night sky. it made a beautiful sight. every night the comet would invite a friend. they would join the comet and dance in the night sky. they smiled and laughed and made a wonderful show. animals below watched and smiled along too. after the comet's friends would leave for their homes, the comet kept dancing in the sky until the sun came up. then the comet would go to sleep until the night time came again, when it would start dancing again.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy had a copper penny that he loved to show to his friends. one day, timmy went to the park with his friends. they saw a big swing and timmy wanted to try it. he sat on the swing and started to swing higher and higher. it was so much fun! suddenly, timmy's penny fell out of his pocket and he couldn't find it. timmy's friends saw him looking sad and they decided to help. they all looked for the penny together and finally found it! timmy was so happy and thanked his fair friends. from that day on, timmy knew that his friends would always be there to help him.

once upon a time, there was a duck who loved to fly. she often flew in a zigzag path as she was so happy in the air. one day, the mild wind blew strong and pushed the duck off course. she tried to fly back to her zigzagging but the wind kept pushing her away.

the duck became frustrated and spoke out loud. "why must the wind be so mean to me?", she said. 

suddenly, a voice called out from above. it was a thunderous voice that made the duck quiver. it was a giant cloud that had struck the duck with a powerful gust of wind. "how dare you defy my wish!", the cloud shouted. "i have power to make you fly in whatever direction i wish!"

the duck was so scared. she tried to explain that she was just delighted to be flying in a zigzag, but the cloud was too angry. suddenly, the cloud softened its voice and said,"go now, but make sure you stay in the zigzagging path from now on."

the duck breathed a sigh of relief and agreed. she flew off in the zigzag path and never defied the mild cloud again.

once upon a time there was a large monster who lived in the toilet. he wanted to protect himself so he decided to hide in the large toilet and never come out.

one day, a brave girl heard noises coming from the toilet and decided to investigate. she opened the lid and found the monster! she was a little scared at first but then she remembered that monsters need friends too, so she said hello and offered her hand. the monster smiled and reached out to shake her hand.

the girl and the monster became best friends and would spend hours playing and having fun. the monster now had a safe place to call home and the girl was happy to have a new friend to look after and protect. they would travel all around the world together, finding new places to explore and adventures to embark on.

they lived happily ever after, safe in the knowledge that they would always have each other to protect.

once upon a time, there was a little boy who loved to swim. every day, he would go to the lake and splash around for hours.

one day, the boy's mom said to him, "let's watch a video!" the boy was excited and begged his mom to put it on. she said yes and put the video on the tv.

the little boy watched the video, but it was so boring that he started to feel restless. he asked his mom if he could go back to the lake and swim. his mom said no.

the boy felt really sad, so he decided to go outside and swim anyway. he ran to the lake and jumped in.

but this time, it was different. the lake was too deep and the little boy couldn't swim back to the surface. he drowned alone and sadly, never returned to his mother.

once upon a time, there were two friends. the first friend was called jack, and the second friend was called jill. jack and jill were having a picnic in the park, and they had lots of yummy food that they could eat.

jack looked at the table and noticed a strange jar. he asked jill, "what's in this jar?" jill smiled and said, "it's sugar! would you like some?" 

jack shook his head and said, "no, thank you. i don't think i should eat sugar. my mom won't allow it." 

jill nodded and said, "i have something else for you. take a look!" she handed jack a box of sour candy.

jack was surprised. "sour candy! that sounds yummy. can i try some?" 

jill nodded again. "of course! here, take one. i hope you like it!" jack took one of the sour candies, put it in his mouth, and smiled. "mmm, this is delicious! thank you, jill!" 

and that's the story of jack and jill and the sweet and sour candy.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to travel with her family. one day, they went to the airport to go on a trip. lily's mom had a thick luggage with her.

lily saw a big screen that displays the flights. she pointed to it and asked her mom, "mommy, what is that?" her mom replied, "that's a display, it shows the flights and their times."

as they were waiting for their flight, lily saw a little boy crying. she went up to him and asked, "why are you crying?" the little boy replied, "i lost my teddy bear." lily felt sad for the little boy and decided to help him. she took out a stuffed animal from her mom's luggage and gave it to the little boy. the little boy was so happy and thanked lily.

the moral of the story is to always be kind and helpful to others, even if it means giving away something of your own.

sandra was excited to visit the museum. "mummy, what can we make at the museum?" she asked.

her mummy replied, "we can make lots of cool things at the museum. we can explore and learn a lot too."

as they walked into the museum, sandra's eyes lit up. she was amazed by all the strong things she saw - sculptures, paintings, and many other kinds of art.

they decided to make a painting. sandra used bright and bold colours to paint a strong and beautiful picture. she worked hard and when it was finished, everyone clapped and praised her work. sandra was so proud.

"you did a wonderful job, sandra," her mummy said.

"yes! making things at the museum is so much fun!" sandra smiled.

once upon a time, there were two friends named rick and kate. rick loved playing games and always wanted to win. every day, he would try to come up with new ways to challenge kate.

one day, rick found a special game. it was a modern game and it had lots of ice. rick and kate decided to play it together.

they had to use the ice to build structures and then the structures had to be the tallest. the tallest structure would win the game.

rick and kate worked together and created the tallest structure ever! everyone was impressed by their work and rick was very proud to win the game.

kate was happy too, even though she didnâ€™t win. she was proud of how well they worked together as friends. from then on, rick and kate always wanted to play together and have fun.

once upon a time there was a boy. he was very adventurous. one day he decided he wanted to make a special sound. he thought about it for a while and then he knew exactly what he wanted to do.

he ran to the kitchen and grabbed some pots and pans. he made it his mission to make the loudest sound possible. he banged on the pots and pans and it made a very loud and adventurous sound.

the sound was so loud that it made all of his family laugh. his mom, dad and little sister came from all around the house to hear the sound. they clapped and cheered for him and said he did a great job.

the boy was very proud of himself for making such an adventurous sound. he knew he would remember this special moment for the rest of his life.

once there was a family with a little boy named jim. jim's parents were very proud of him. they were happy to take jim on an adventure. 

the family packed their things and applied for a passport. they were all excited to travel. 

they flew in an airplane to a new country. there were a lot of different places to explore. jim and his family went to a park, a beach, and a dinosaur museum.

jim had the best time. he played in the park, built sandcastles at the beach, and took pictures of the dinosaurs. he was so happy that he told his parents he wanted to come back and explore again.

his parents were proud of him, and they enjoyed watching him have so much fun. jim's passport was filled with fun stamps from all the places he explored. he smiled as he looked at it. the family was happy to have such a wonderful adventure together.

once upon a time there was a very fit lemon. he was so fit that he could run and jump all day. so, every day he would go out and play in the sunshine.

the lemon had lots of fun running around and jumping. but, after all of that running and jumping he was very tired. so he climbed up a tree to take his nap.

he curled up under the leaves and closed his eyes. soon, he was fast asleep and snoring. the birds and bugs in the trees were all very quiet so the lemon could sleep peacefully. 

time flew by and before the lemon knew it, he was waking up from his nap. he felt so energised and ready for the day ahead. he jumped down from the tree and ran off into the sunshine to play again. 

the end.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play with her hoop in the park. one day, she went to the park with her friends, but the park was very messy. there were toys everywhere and the children were running around and screaming. 

lily decided to help her friends organize the toys. she asked her friends to gather all the toys and put them in one place. they worked together and soon all the toys were organized. 

after they finished, lily and her friends played with the hoop. they were very calm and happy because they had organized the toys. they had a great time playing together and promised to always keep the park clean and organized.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she lived in a house with her mommy and daddy. one day, lily's mommy asked her if she wanted to go on an adventure. 

"where are we going?" lily asked.

"we're going to the park in the east," her mommy replied.

lily was excited to go on an adventure with her mommy. when they got to the park, they saw a man with a sharp knife cutting some fruits. 

"look, lily! those fruits look so tasty!" her mommy said.

"i want to try some!" lily exclaimed.

the man with the sharp knife smiled and gave them some fruits to taste. they were very tasty, and lily was happy that she went on an adventure with her mommy.

once, there was a boy. he liked to rush around and play. one day he had to rush very quickly to go to school. he grabbed his socks but forgot they were still in the dryer! he was in a rush and couldn't wait, so he went without them.

when he got to school, he was embarrassed! everyone was looking at him and he knew he must have forgotten something important. then he remembered his socks! he rushed to the office and asked politely for a pair of socks. they kindly gave him a pair of super cosy socks - he was so happy that he hurried back to class! 

the boy was so glad he had remembered something very important - his socks. from that day, he was always sure to put his socks in the right place before he rushed out the door!

once upon a time, there was a dog named spike. spike was a big dog with a lot of fur. one day, spike went to the park with his owner. at the park, spike saw a fancy lady with a pretty dress. she had a bag with treats for dogs. spike barked and wagged his tail. the lady gave spike a treat and he was very happy. spike loved going to the park and meeting new friends.

once upon a time, there was a person named tim. tim was very tidy. he liked to keep his toys and room clean. one day, tim went to the park to play with his friends. he saw a new person there. tim asked the new person, "what is your name?" the new person said, "my name is max." tim and max played together and had fun. when they were done playing, tim said goodbye to max and went home to tidy his room. the end.

one day, mama and baby were getting ready to relax. mama found a big box and gave it to baby. baby opened the box and found tape. mama said, "let's use the tape to make a comfortable spot to relax!"

baby was so excited that he started to tape the walls together. mama helped by adding more pieces of tape. when they were finished, there was a cozy space that was perfect for relaxing.

baby crawled inside and said, "mama, can i relax here?"

mama smiled and said, "yes! this is a very comfortable spot to relax."

baby lay down and sighed in comfort. mama lay down next to him and they both relaxed together. it was a perfect day.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside with her friends, but one day a big storm came. the sky turned dark and the wind blew hard. lily was scared, so she went inside her house.

her mom told her that it was normal for storms to come sometimes, but they would always pass. lily felt better knowing that. she closed the curtains and snuggled up with her favorite blanket. she listened to the rain tapping on the window and felt safe inside her cozy home. eventually, the storm passed and the sun came out again. lily went outside to play with her friends, happy that everything was back to normal.

once upon a time, there was a selfish little girl named sally. sally never wanted to share her toys with anyone, not even with her best friend. 

one day, sally got a cold, and she sneezed and sneezed. she was so stuffy she couldn't even play with her toys anymore. her mom got her a nice, soft rag and said, â€œsally, use this to wipe your nose and keep yourself clean.â€

but sally, who was so selfish, wouldn't even share her rag with her friend when they made houses out of blocks together. she said, â€œthis rag is only for me.â€

fortunately, sally had a mom who was wise and kind. she reminded sally that it's important to share and to not always be so selfish. so sally finally shared her rag and they both felt happy. 

the end.

lily and tom were friends who liked to play with words. they made poems with rhymes and sounds and wrote them on paper. they were proud of their poems and wanted to show them to everyone.

one day, they had a very naughty idea. they decided to hang their poems on the walls of the school, where the teacher and the other children could see them. they thought it would be funny and clever, but they did not ask for permission.

they sneaked into the school at night, with a roll of tape and their poems. they hung them on the windows, the doors, the blackboard, and even the teacher's desk. they giggled and whispered as they did it, and then ran away.

the next morning, the teacher and the other children were very surprised and angry when they saw the poems. they were not nice poems, but rude and mean ones. they made fun of the teacher's nose, the children's names, and the school rules. they hurt the feelings of many people and broke the trust of the teacher.

the teacher was very smart and soon found out who did it. she called lily and tom to her office and scolded them. she made them take down all the poems and apologize to everyone. she also gave them a lot of extra homework and no recess for a week. lily and tom felt very ashamed and sorry for what they did. they learned that hanging poems without permission was not funny or clever, but naughty and wrong. they also learned that words can be powerful and hurtful, and that they should use them with care and respect.

henry was a furry bear. he was a very happy bear and he had a plan. he was going to have a shower. he thought it would be fun. first he needed to find a big tub. he went to the forest to see what he could find. he looked around and saw a big bucket. he thought it would be perfect for the shower. then he started to fill it with water. it took him a while, but he filled it with water from the river nearby. after he was done he hopped inside the bucket and enjoyed his shower. the cool water made him feel so nice and refreshed. then he got out and gave himself a big hug. he was so happy that he had finished his special plan.

once upon a time, there was a big, heavy bear named benny. benny loved to sleep in the morning and always forgot to wake up on time. one day, his friend rabbit came to remind him to wake up early. 

benny got up and went outside to play with his friend. they played hide and seek and had so much fun. benny was happy that his friend reminded him to wake up early. 

after playing for a while, benny got tired and went back to his cave to take a nap. he slept for a long time and when he woke up, it was already evening. benny realized that he had slept for too long and missed the whole day. 

from that day on, benny made sure to set his alarm clock so he wouldn't forget to wake up in the morning. he was grateful to his friend rabbit for reminding him to wake up early.

one day, there was a little girl playing in the park. it was hot outside, so she was hot too. suddenly, she started to cry because she was feeling sad. but then, her mom came and comforted her. she gave her a hug and said 'it's ok, i'm here'. the little girl felt better.

then, they went over to a cart. it was full of toys and candy! the little girl's eyes lit up and she smiled. she picked out her favorite toy and she felt happy again.

next, they sat down in the shade of a big tree and had an ice cream. it was cold and it tasted so good. the little girl felt comforted again. her mom hugged her and said 'i'm so happy that you're smiling again'. the little girl smiled a big smile and said 'me too!'.

once upon a time there was a little octopus who lived under the sea. one day, he was scared of the deep blue level where he lived, so he decided to move away from it. he swam to the surface and saw a wide, available beach. he was no longer scared and happily played around the beach.

one day, he noticed two little children were playing in the water. he wanted to play with them, too. he stretched out his tentacles to reach the children, but alas! he scared them away.

the octopus was sad, realizing his tentacles scared the children away. he learned a lesson: never do something that will scare other people away.  he returned to the sea and continued living in a deep blue level, remembering his lesson and being happy without scaring people away.

one day, a little girl was playing with her string. she loved it so much and was grateful for it. she spun it around her body and laughed as it flew in the air. suddenly, she sneezed! she was so surprised and laughed all the more. she felt the sneeze tickle her nose and made her eyes water. she then opened her eyes and saw the string was tangled around her. she quickly untangled it and said thank you for the surprise that made her laugh even more. she was so very grateful for her string. the end.

once upon a time, there were two friends - a monkey and a bird. the monkey was always eager to explore the world, while the bird was always eager to take pictures of new places with her camera.

one day, the two friends decided to go to the jungle. as they were walking, the monkey noticed an old bridge and wanted to cross it. the bird asked the monkey to be careful and not take too many risks. but the monkey was too eager and he started to climb without looking. suddenly, the bridge collapsed and the monkey fell into the river.

the bird was so scared! she quickly took out her camera and clicked a few pictures of the incident. then she ran to the river bank and started to speak. she begged and pleaded for the monkey to come out of the water. after a few moments, the monkey emerged from the water, safe and sound.

the bird and the monkey had learnt a valuable lesson - take risks, but be careful! taking pictures can help you remember important moments in life, but you must always be careful.

lilly was walking in a big, beautiful park with her mom. she saw a little bird and wanted to follow it. so she asked, "mom, can i follow the bird?"

her mom smiled and said, "yes, lilly. keep your eyes on the bird and follow where it goes."

lilly did as her mom said and followed the bird. the bird flew up into the sky and lilly's eyes got big and wide as she looked up into the fancy sky.

the bird flew around and around, and lilly kept her eyes on it as it flew higher and higher. but then the bird flew away and lilly had to stop following it.

lilly was sad and said, "mom, can i follow the bird again?"

her mom said, "no, lilly, the bird has gone now. but we can look for another bird in the park and you can follow it instead."

and so lilly looked around and eventually found another bird to follow. she followed it around the big, beautiful park with a big smile on her face.

once upon a time, there was a furry bag. the bag was so happy, it liked to race! on one sunny day, the bag raced down a hill. it was so fast and it felt so good. the bag raced around trees, over rocks and around a big pond. 

suddenly, it spotted a 3 year old child. the child was so curious and excited. he wanted to join in and race with the furry bag! 

the child and the bag raced around the pond several times. the child was laughing and having so much fun. they raced faster and faster until they were dizzy. 

finally the race was over. the child and the furry bag were exhausted and lay down in the warm sunshine. they were both happy and content.

once upon a time, there was a little girl who loved orange. everywhere she looked, she noticed orange things. the leaves in the park were orange, her socks were orange, even her car was orange. 

one day, her mom and dad said "guess what? we're going on vacation!" the little girl was so excited to go on a vacation. on the day they left, she packed her orange suitcase and jumped into the car. 

when they got there, the little girl went to the beach. the sand was hot, like the sun was melting it! she played in the sand and made orange sandcastles until it was time to go home. 

along the way home, the little girl noticed that something orange was melting in the sun. it was her orange ice cream cone! she ate the last bit of it and smiled. she had so much fun on her orange vacation.

once upon a time, there was a happy ball. the ball was red and round, and it loved to roll around. one day, the ball met a mean cat who made a threat to pop it. the ball was scared and tried to roll away, but the cat was too fast. just when the cat was about to catch the ball, a perfect boy came and scared the cat away. the boy picked up the ball and rolled it back to its home. from that day on, the ball was grateful to the perfect boy who saved it from the threat of the mean cat.

once upon a time, a little girl named lily went on a picnic with her mommy and daddy. they packed yummy sandwiches and fruit in a big basket. they found a nice spot under a big tree and spread a blanket on the grass.

lily wanted to play, but her mommy said, "wait, first we eat." lily saw the sandwiches and said, "yum, i want one!" but her daddy said, "not yet, you need to fit your new dress first." lily was sad because she wanted to eat.

suddenly, a big dog came and took their basket! lily screamed, "oh no, our picnic!" her daddy chased the dog and got the basket back. they all laughed and ate their sandwiches. lily said, "i see the dog, but he can't have our food!" they had a fun day at the park. the end.

one day, a little girl named lily went for a walk in the wide park. she saw a big tree and a pretty flower. lily loved to play in the park.

while playing, lily saw something shiny. it was a small, silver angel. the angel was stuck in a block of ice. "oh no!" said lily, "the angel is freeze!"

lily wanted to help the angel. she thought hard, and then had an idea. lily hugged the ice and her warm hands made the ice melt. the angel was free!

the angel smiled at lily and said, "thank you for helping me!" the angel gave lily a big hug and flew away. lily felt happy and went home to tell her mom and dad about her new friend.

one day, a red bird was flying high in the sky. it saw a tall tower made of blocks. the tower was very big and colorful. the red bird wanted to play with the tower, so it flew down to take a closer look.

a little boy was playing with the tower. he saw the red bird and said, "hi, red bird! do you want to play with me and my tower?" the red bird nodded its head and they started to play together. they had lots of fun building the tower higher and higher.

as they were playing, the tower began to shake. the little boy and the red bird looked at each other, worried. suddenly, the tower started to fall. the little boy and the red bird jumped back to stay safe. the tower fell down with a loud crash, but nobody was hurt. the little boy and the red bird laughed and started to build the tower again, happy to be playing together.

once upon a time, there was a girl named lucy. she had a good friend named tom. they liked to play together. one day, they found a big box in lucy's room. they were very excited.

lucy said, "let's wrap this box like a present!" tom agreed, and they found some pretty paper. they wrapped the box together. they put a big bow on top. it looked like a nice gift.

then, lucy had an idea. she said, "let's draw a picture on the paper!" tom liked the idea. they got some crayons and drew a pretty picture on the wrapped box. they were very happy with their work.

john was walking through the park, and he was starting to shiver. he was wearing a cheap sweater, so it wasn't keeping him very warm. he saw a pear tree and he decided to have a look. there were lots of pears growing on the tree, and they looked delicious. john picked the biggest pear he could find. it felt soft and smooth in his hands, and he was happy. he took a bite of the pear and it was so sweet and juicy! john suddenly stopped shivering, he was feeling much warmer. he was so pleased with his cheap find! john finished the pear and went home with a big smile on his face.

once upon a time, there was a little boy who really needed a spoon. he didn't have one anywhere, so he asked his mom for help.

his mom put on her funny hat and took him to the store. when they got there, the little boy saw lots of spoons and got so excited!

he ran to the silver spoon section and picked out a sparkly one with a handle shaped like a star. it was so pretty and so shiny, he wanted it right away!

his mom smiled and said he could have it. the little boy was so happy! he ran home with the spoon and he had lots of fun playing with it. 

the end.

once upon a time, there was a crab. it lived in a deep river.
one day, the crab went to the river bank and wanted to take a rest.
but then, something strange happened. a strange creature came out of the water and slapped the crab!.
the crab was scared, so it quickly ran back into the deep river. from then on, it was very careful to stay in the deep ocean and not come close to the shore again.

once upon a time, there was a little brown dog named spot. spot loved to play and run in the park. one day, spot had an idea. he wanted to watch the big red ball in the sky go down.

spot ran to the park and waited for the big red ball to go down. he saw his friend, a little yellow bird named tweet. tweet liked spot's idea and wanted to watch the big red ball go down too. so, they sat on a green hill and waited.

as they watched, the big red ball started to go down. the sky turned pretty colors like pink, orange, and purple. spot and tweet were very happy they saw it together. from that day on, they always met at the park to watch the big red ball go down.

once upon a time, there was a gray squirrel. he was a very cute squirrel and he was always blinking at the world around him. one day, he came across a tree full of nuts. he was so excited that he could hardly contain his excitement. he started to blink happily.

suddenly, he heard a voice from up above. looking up, he saw a small bird perched on the branch of the tree. it asked, "hey there, little squirrel. what are you looking at?"

the squirrel stopped blinking and looked at the bird. he replied, "oh, i just discovered this tree full of nuts. it looks delicious!"

the bird smiled and said, "i'll bet it does. would you like me to help you eat them?"

the squirrel smiled and nodded. together they ate all of the nuts until they were full. after they were finished, the squirrel thanked the bird and they said their goodbyes.

the squirrel blinked one last time and said, "thank you for helping me. i had the best nut feast ever!" 

the bird smiled and said, "you're welcome. i'm so glad we could have this nut feast together." 

and with that, the squirrel scurried away, blinking happily.

one day there was a little girl named lila. she was three years old and very shy. she was outside playing with her puppy when she spotted a flame in the grass. she was scared of the flame and peeking from behind a tree, she asked her puppy, "what is that?". the puppy barked, "it's a flame!" lila got a little bit closer and cautiously asked the flame, "what do you do?". the flame said, "i make pretty shapes and colours in the sky!". lila smiled and slowly moved towards the flame. she said, "i'm not so scared of you anymore. will you show me your pretty shapes?". the flame said, "yes, of course!" and together they made the most beautiful shapes and flames in the sky. lila was so happy and even though she was still a bit shy, she was no longer scared of the flame.

once upon a time, there was a little girl called meg. she had a special purse that was open and she carried it with her wherever she went.

one day, meg decided to go to the park. she brought her open purse with her and was very excited. when she got to the park, she saw a swing and ran over to it.

reaching into her open purse, meg discovered a surprise! inside was a pink balloon that she had not seen before! meg was very happy and said thank you to her purse for bringing her such a wonderful gift.

she grabbed onto the string attached to the balloon and ran around the park with it, laughing and smiling. as meg skipped, her purse swung by her side. meg felt so happy that she decided never to leave the park.

once, there was a rabbit who lived in the forest. he was very hungry, so he went to look for food. he came across a thick mushroom that made him very excited.

he wanted to eat it, so he reached out to pick it up. but as soon as he touched the mushroom, a beautiful flower started to bloom from it. the flower had purple petals and a yellow centre.

the rabbit was amazed, and so he decided not to pick the mushroom. instead, he admired its beauty from a distance. 

the moral of the story is that it is better to appreciate things from a distance, rather than taking them away. nature is beautiful and it is important to respect it and care for it.

one day, a little gray bird was flying in the sky. the gray bird saw a big tree and thought it would be a good place to make a nest. so, the gray bird flew down to the tree and started to make a nest with sticks and leaves.

while the gray bird was making the nest, a friendly squirrel came by. the squirrel said, "hi, bird! what are you doing?" the gray bird replied, "i am making a nest for my family." the squirrel smiled and said, "that's nice! i live in this tree too."

the gray bird and the squirrel became good friends. they played together every day and helped each other find food. the gray bird was happy to have a new friend and a cozy nest for its family.

once upon a time, there was a player who loved to play outside. the player wanted to run and play even when it rains. he had an idea! his idea was to find something to put over his head to keep him dry. one day, he found a nice healthy umbrella. it kept him dry while he played all afternoon.

the player was so thankful! he had so much fun playing in the rain without getting wet. he also loved that he was able to stay healthy and fit while he played.

the player had lots of fun with his new umbrella and often used it even when it wasn't raining. it was his best friend.

the player was so thankful for his cool healthy umbrella. it made sure he stayed dry and had lots of fun!

once upon a time there was a boy called harry. he thought he was different from all the other children as he had a special power like no one else did. he could make things appear and disappear.

one day his parents took him to the underground station to show him something very special. on the wall of the underground station there was a beautiful display of different animals and objects. it was a very special sight. 

harry was amazed at what he saw and wanted to show everyone the same display. so he decided to make it appear everywhere. he used his special power to make the display appear in every part of town. 

soon people started talking about the display and some even said it wasn't normal. but harry knew it was special, and that it brought delight to everyone who saw it.
 
so harry's parents told him that it was okay to be different. that the display he created was not only unique but brought a lot of joy to people. they told him that it was a good thing to show his special power to bring something different and special in the world.

the moral of the story is that it is okay to be different, even if something is not considered "normal". being different can bring something extra special and extraordinary to the world.

once upon a time, there were two friends named timmy and tommy. they loved to play with their ball on the pitch. one day, they had a quarrel because they both wanted to play with the ball at the same time. they were both angry and didn't talk to each other.

the next day, they came back to the pitch. it was very quiet because nobody was there. timmy and tommy felt sad because they missed playing together. they decided to say sorry to each other and play together again. they had so much fun and promised to never quarrel again.

once upon a time, in a small open house, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play near the fireplace. one day, her mom told her to be careful and not to play too close to the fireplace. but lily did not listen.

one cold day, lily was playing with her toys near the fireplace. she saw a pretty red ball near the fire. she wanted to get the ball, but she was scared. she thought of what her mom said and decided to reverse and move away from the fireplace.

later that day, lily's mom saw the red ball near the fire. she told lily how proud she was that she listened and stayed away from the fire. lily learned that it is important to listen to her mom and be careful near the fireplace.

once upon a time, there was a girl called sally. sally was 3 years old. she loved to explore, and today she had come across a big white glass wall.

"can i climb it, mummy?" sally asked her mummy.

mummy smiled. "no, no, darling," mummy said. "it's too high and too slippery."

but sally was determined. she was going to climb the white glass wall, no matter what!

taking a deep breath, sally started to climb. she used her little hands and feet to grip onto the smooth glass and, bit by bit, sally inched her way up.

after a few minutes, sally was at the top! "i did it!" she cheered.

mummy was so proud of her and gave her a big hug. 

sally smiled from ear to ear. she had climbed the big white glass wall - and she was so happy!

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she liked to play outside in the big green yard. one day, she went exploring and found a bush with lots of pretty flowers. she picked some and put them in her hair.

but then, she realized she was lost. she looked around and everything looked different. she didn't know how to get back home. she started to cry.

luckily, her mom heard her and came to find her. lily was so happy to see her mom and she hugged her tight. they walked back home together, and lily never went exploring alone again.

tom and lily were twins who liked to play with their toys. one day, they found a big box of blocks in the basement. they decided to build a castle with the blocks. they worked hard and made a tall and strong castle.

"look at our castle, lily! it is so big and nice!" tom said.

"yes, tom, it is. but we have to be careful. do not destroy it!" lily said.

they played with their castle for a long time. they pretended to be kings and queens and knights and dragons. they had a lot of fun.

but then, their mom called them. "tom and lily, it is time for your shower! come upstairs, please!"

tom and lily did not want to stop playing. they wanted to stay with their castle. they ignored their mom.

"tom and lily, i am waiting for you! come on, get ready for your shower!" their mom said again.

tom and lily still did not listen. they kept playing with their castle.

but then, they heard a loud noise. they turned around and saw their dog, rex, running towards them. rex was big and playful. he saw the castle and thought it was a toy. he jumped on the castle and destroyed it. he knocked down all the blocks and made a big mess.

"rex, no!" tom and lily shouted.

they ran to their castle and tried to save it. but it was too late. their castle was gone. they felt sad and angry.

"look what you did, rex! you destroyed our castle! bad dog!" tom said.

lily started to cry. "our castle was so beautiful! why did you do that, rex?"

rex did not understand. he wagged his tail and licked their faces. he thought they were playing with him.

their mom came downstairs and saw what happened. she was not happy.

"tom and lily, what is this? why did you not come for your shower? and why did you make such a mess?" she asked.

tom and lily looked at their mom. they felt sorry. they knew they did something wrong.

"we are sorry, mom. we did not listen to you. we wanted to play with our castle. but rex destroyed it. he did not know it was ours." tom said.

"we are sorry, mom. we should have come for our shower. we should have put away our blocks. but we were having fun. we did not think about rex." lily said.

their mom hugged them. she was not angry anymore. she was glad they were honest.

"i understand, tom and lily. i know you love your castle. but you have to listen to me when i call you. and you have to be careful with your toys. you have to share them with rex. he is part of our family. he does not mean to destroy your things. he just wants to play with you." she said.

tom and lily nodded. they learned their lesson. they said sorry to rex. they gave him a hug and a treat. they helped their mom clean up the mess. then they went upstairs for their shower. they were ready to be clean and cozy.

the end.

moral value: the story teaches the children to listen to their parents, to be responsible for their toys, and to be kind to their pets.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside in her backyard. one day, she saw a mosquito flying around her. she tried to swat it, but it flew away.

lily's mommy came outside and said, "what are you doing, lily?"

"i'm trying to get the mosquito," lily said.

mommy laughed and said, "don't worry about the mosquito. it's just a little joke from nature."

lily thought about what mommy said and looked up at the sky. she saw a beautiful rainbow. "wow, mommy! look at the beautiful colors!" she said.

mommy smiled and said, "yes, it's so beautiful. let's enjoy it together."

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to draw and write in her journal. her journal was a special book where she could write about her day and draw pictures of her favorite things. one day, lily went to the park with her friends. they played on the swings and slide, and had a lively time. 

after a while, lily's friends had to go home. lily wanted to finish playing on the slide, so she asked her mommy if she could stay a little longer. her mommy said yes, but reminded her that they had to go home soon. lily was sad that her friends had to leave, but she was happy to have more time to play. 

when it was time to go, lily remembered to put her journal in her backpack. she wanted to write about her fun day at the park. when they got home, lily sat down to write in her journal. she wrote about the slide, the swings, and her lively friends. she was happy to finish her story and go to bed.

once upon a time, there was a little girl called amy. she was three years old, and she had a brilliant idea. she wanted to make a surprise for her friends.

amy went to the market and bought a big ticket. she was so excited! she wanted to give everyone the ticket as a special mark. she thought it would be a brilliant surprise.

she rushed home to tell all her friends. they were all so happy when they heard her plan! everyone was excited to get their ticket as a special mark.

at the end of the day, all of amyâ€™s friends had their ticket and they were really happy. they had a brilliant day, thanks to amy and her ticket surprise!

once upon a time, there was a twin who loved being outside. she had a bright pink sack that she filled with all her favorite things.

one day, the twin was playing outside when she found a mysterious pink flower. she decided to put it in her sack.
"thank you!" said the flower.

the twin jumped back in surprise. she had never heard a flower talk before! she asked the flower, "who are you?"
"my name is pinky," said the flower.

the twin was now even more surprised. she asked, "can i take you with me?"
"yes, of course," said pinky.

so off the twin went, with pinky in her pink sack. they had lots of fun together, stopping to smell all the other flowers along the way. 
they became best friends, forever. 
the end.

tim and jen are playing soccer in the park. they like to kick the ball and run after it. they are on the same team and they wear red shirts.

"look, jen, i can kick the ball very far!" tim says. he kicks the ball with all his might. the ball flies over the fence and lands on the road.

"oh no, tim, you kicked the ball too hard!" jen says. "how will we get it back?"

they run to the fence and look for the exit. they see a gate that says "exit". they open the gate and go to the road. they see a big truck coming. the truck is very loud and fast.

"tim, jen, come back!" their mom shouts. she sees them on the road. she is scared. she runs to the exit and grabs them. she pulls them back to the park. she hugs them and says, "you are safe now. but you should never go to the road without me. the road is dangerous. do you understand?"

tim and jen nod. they are sorry. they say, "we are sorry, mom. we just wanted to get our ball back. we did not see the truck."

their mom says, "i know, but you have to be careful. next time, ask me for help. i will get your ball for you. ok?"

tim and jen say, "ok, mom. thank you."

their mom says, "you are welcome. now, let's go and find your ball. maybe it is still on the road. or maybe someone picked it up. come on, let's go."

tim and jen follow their mom. they hope they can find their ball. they like to play soccer. they are proud of their kicks. but they also know they have to be safe. they will not go to the road again. they will stay in the park. they will listen to their mom. they will have fun.

once upon a time, there was a little dog named max. max loved to play and run outside. one sunny day, max was playing in his yard when he saw a big, red ball.

max was eager to play with the ball. he ran and jumped to catch the ball with his mouth. he was so happy and wagged his tail all around. max played with the ball all morning.

after playing, max was hungry. he went inside his house and saw a yummy snack on the floor. max ate the snack and felt full. he was very happy and went back outside to play with his red ball some more.

lily and tom are playing in the park. they have a ball and a basket. they like to throw the ball into the basket and see who can do it more times.

"tom, it is my turn now!" lily says. she wants to throw the ball.

"no, it is not. i want to throw more!" tom says. he does not want to share.

they start to yell and fight. they are very noisy. the ball falls on the ground and rolls away.

a big dog sees the ball. he runs to get it. he picks it up with his mouth and runs away.

"hey, that is our ball!" lily and tom shout. they run after the dog.

the dog is faster than them. he goes to his owner, who is sitting on a bench. he gives him the ball.

"good boy, rex!" the owner says. he pets the dog.

lily and tom reach the bench. they are out of breath.

"excuse me, sir, can we have our ball back?" lily asks. she is polite.

the owner looks at them. he sees that they are angry and sad.

"sure, you can have your ball back. but first, i have a question for you," he says. he is friendly.

"what is your question?" tom asks. he is curious.

"why were you so noisy and mean to each other? don't you know that sharing is caring?" the owner asks. he is wise.

lily and tom look at each other. they feel ashamed.

"we are sorry, sir. we were selfish and rude. we should have taken turns and played nicely," lily says. she is sorry.

"yes, we are sorry. we should have been friends and not enemies," tom says. he is sorry too.

the owner smiles. he gives them the ball.

"here you go, kids. i hope you learned your lesson. now go and have fun, but remember to be kind and respectful," he says. he is nice.

lily and tom thank him. they hug the dog. they go back to the basket. they throw the ball and take turns. they laugh and cheer. they are happy. they are friends.

once upon a time, in a big sea, there was a sleepy fish named bob. bob lived near a reef with many other fish. one day, bob woke up and saw that his friend, the starfish, was gone. he felt sad and decided to search for his friend.

bob swam around the reef and asked his other friends, "have you seen the starfish?" they all said no. but one fish told bob, "i heard a big fish talking about a starfish. maybe it's your friend!" bob thanked the fish and continued his search.

bob found the big fish and asked, "have you seen my friend, the starfish?" the big fish smiled and said, "yes, i found him stuck in the reef. i helped him get out, and he went home." bob was happy and swam back to the reef. there, he found his friend, the starfish, safe and sound. they were both so happy to see each other and played together all day long.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. lily loved to take baths in her big, white bathtub. one day, lily's mom asked her if she wanted to go to the store to get a new toy. lily was very excited and said, "yes, please!" 

at the store, lily saw a wise owl toy that she really wanted. she asked her mom if she could get it. her mom said, "sure, but we have to hurry home so you can take your bath." 

when they got home, lily ran straight to the bathroom to take her bath. she brought her new owl toy with her and showed it to her rubber duck. "look, duckie! i got a wise owl toy at the store!" said lily. 

after her bath, lily got into her pajamas and snuggled up with her owl toy. she was so happy to have a new friend to play with. and from that day on, lily always remembered to bring her wise owl toy with her to the bathtub.

once there was a shy little girl. she was scared of the dark. she was alone in the park.

suddenly, a cat appeared from the shadows. it meowed loudly. 

"who are you?" asked the little girl with a quiver in her voice.

the cat meowed again. the little girl was not sure what to do.

all of a sudden, a big dog came out of nowhere. it growled at the cat, and they started to fight. the little girl was so scared.

the little girl started to weep and call for help. soon, an old man appeared. he grabbed the dog and took it away.

the little girl was so relieved. she thanked the old man. he smiled kindly and told her to stay safe, before leaving.

the cat and the little girl stayed together in the dark park. the girl realized that sometimes, even the shyest people can find comfort in a special friend.

once upon a time there was a competitive knob. he was a very busy knob, always signing things. every day, he signed more and more things. one day, the competitive knob decided to have a competition. he asked all of his friends from around the world to meet in his home. they all agreed and showed up.  

when they arrived, the competitive knob gave everyone a sign to sign. he explained that whoever could sign the most in one minute, would win the competition. everyone started signing as quickly as they could. the competitive knob watched with a smile on his face. 

after one minute, the competitive knob stopped the competition. he looked around the room to see who had signed the most papers. to his surprise, it was a three year old child! everyone cheered and clapped as the little child proudly walked up to the knob to receive his prize. 

the knob was very pleased with the child's performance, so he invited the child to be his special guest. from then on, the knob and the child were the best of friends. the child visited the knob every day to sign more and more papers. 

it was a magical time of friendship and competition!

once upon a time, there lived two animals. the first animal was a small, round rabbit. the second animal was a big, strong bear. the rabbit and the bear lived far apart in two different forests. 

the rabbit wanted to find someone to play with, so he looked for the bear. he found a plant that was growing in the forest and he knew it was special. it was an herb that made the rabbit and the bear feel like friends. 

one day, the rabbit decided to take the herb with him on his journey. when he came close to the bearâ€™s home, the rabbit gave the herb to the bear. as soon as the bear ate it, he and the rabbit felt like old friends!

the bear and the rabbit decided to join together and explore the different forests. they became best friends, and their friendship was made heavier with every new adventure. 

and that is the story of how the rabbit and the bear united together with the help of a special herb!

once upon a time, there was a baby named timmy. timmy was a good baby who loved to sleep in his crib. one day, timmy's mommy came to him and said, "timmy, what do you want to do today?"

timmy thought for a moment and said, "i want to play with my toys."

mommy smiled and said, "that sounds like fun, but first we need to change your diaper."

timmy giggled and said, "okay, mommy. then we can play!"

after mommy changed timmy's diaper, they went to timmy's room and played with his toys. timmy had so much fun that he forgot about his crib and didn't want to go to sleep. but mommy reminded him that he needed to rest, so timmy went back to his crib and fell asleep with a smile on his face.

once upon a time, there were two best friends, ann and will. they were both honest people who cared a lot about each other.

one day, ann gave will a present. will was so happy and he waved his hands in the air to say thank you! ann was happy to see him so happy and waved back to him.

they smiled and had a happy hug. they both felt so lucky to have each other as honest friends.

the end.

john was a persistent three year old. every day, he asked his mom to play with him.

"mama can we go outside and play?" he asked.

mama smiled and said, "yes, we can go to a park and have a picnic. we can bring the blanket and a basket of food."

john cheered, "yay! let's go!"

so they put on their coats, grabbed the picnic supplies and headed to the park.

john chased birds and butterflies. he splashed in mud puddles.

mama said, "let's lay the blanket down and have our picnic."

so they did.

john liked the picnic. he smiled and said, "this is so much fun! i'm so happy."

mama said, "see? i told you you'd have a good time if you were persistent. now, let's go home and clean up before bedtime."

john nodded and started to pack up the picnic. he was already thinking about what he and mama could do tomorrow.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play with his tools. he had a hammer, a screwdriver, and a saw. one day, timmy's friend billy came over to play. 

"wow, timmy! your tools are lovely!" said billy. 

"thank you, billy. do you want to play with them?" asked timmy. 

"i don't know if i dare," said billy. 

"it's okay, billy. i'll show you how to use them safely," said timmy. 

so, timmy showed billy how to use the hammer, the screwdriver, and the saw. they had so much fun building a fort together. when it was time for billy to go home, he said, "thank you for teaching me how to use your tools, timmy. i had so much fun!" 

"you're welcome, billy. anytime you want to play with my tools, just let me know," said timmy. 

and they lived happily ever after, playing with their lovely tools.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play outside in the sun. one day, timmy's mom told him to come inside because it was getting dark outside. timmy didn't want to come inside because he was having too much fun.

as the sun started to move down, the sky got dark. timmy started to feel scared because the dark was tough for him to handle. he tried to move closer to his mom, but she was busy cooking dinner. suddenly, timmy heard a noise coming from the bushes.

timmy's mom heard the noise too and went to investigate. she found a little kitten stuck in the bushes. timmy's mom helped the kitten move out of the bushes and brought it inside. timmy was so happy to have a new friend to play with, even in the tough dark. from that day on, timmy wasn't scared of the dark anymore because he knew he had his new friend to keep him company.

once upon a time, there was an old house. it was very scary because it was dark and creaky. one day, a little girl named lily went inside the house to explore. she found an old vase on a shelf. when she tried to pick it up, it slipped from her hands and broke into many pieces. lily felt sad, but she knew accidents happen. she left the old house and promised to be more careful next time.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy loved to play with his kite. he would run and run until the kite flew high in the sky.

one day, timmy met a new friend named billy. billy was an ignorant boy who didn't know much about kites. timmy tried to teach billy how to fly the kite, but billy didn't listen. he thought he knew everything.

timmy decided to test billy's knowledge by asking him questions about kites. billy couldn't answer any of the questions. timmy realized that billy needed to learn more about kites before he could play with them. he decided to teach billy everything he knew about kites so they could play together happily.

once upon a time, there was a bad wheel. it was so bad that it could not roll. so, the boy and his mommy went to find a new wheel. when they found it their joy increased. it was a beautiful new wheel, and it was so shiny it sparkled in the sun.

the boy couldnâ€™t wait to get the new wheel on his toy and play with it. so they hurried home, and the boy and his mommy put it on the toy together.

once the wheel was on the toy, the boy tried it out. he pushed the toy and the wheel rolled easily. the boy was so happy and he was very proud that the bad wheel was gone and he had a new one.

the boy and his mommy had big smiles and their joy increased even more. now the boy could play with the toy and spin the new wheel. the end.

once upon a time, there was a family who was going on vacation. the parents had just bought a brand new camera to take pictures of the trip. when they got to the hotel, they decided to wrap the camera up to keep it safe.

the next morning, the family went out to explore the city. suddenly, their 3 year old got really excited and shouted: â€œlook, look!â€ everyone saw a camera in the window of a store. 

the 3 year old wanted to go inside and buy the camera, but the parents said no. they told him that they had already bought a camera and it was wrapped at the hotel. the 3 year old was very upset and stomped his feet.

but later on that day, when the family went back to the hotel, they realized something strange. when they opened the package, the camera was missing!

the 3 year old couldn't hide his excitement. he said: â€œdid you get a new camera?â€ the parents were speechless. it turned out that the 3 year old had taken the camera out of the package and brought it to the store. they had bought the new camera by mistake!

once upon a time, there was a thief. he was very naughty and did not behave. he sneaked around and took things that did not belong to him.

one night, the thief saw a nice house with a very shiny window. though the window was expensive, the thief did not care. he broke the window with a stone and reached his hand in.

just then, a big dog saw the thief and started to bark. the thief ran away as fast as he could. he did not even bother to take the cheap things inside the house.

the neighbours heard the dog barking and called the police. they arrived soon afterwards and caught the thief. the police were very mad at the thief and told him off for not behaving.

moral of the story: be good and behave. donâ€™t be a thief!

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy had a little sword that he loved to play with. he would swing it around and pretend to be a brave knight.

one day, timmy went to the park to play with his sword. but then, he saw a big dog that made him worry. the dog barked loudly and timmy felt scared. he didn't know what to do.

suddenly, a bigger boy came and scared the dog away. timmy was happy that he was safe, but he felt sad that he couldn't protect himself. from that day on, timmy decided to practice with his little sword every day so that he could be brave like the bigger boy.

once upon a time, there lived a mighty mouse in a valley. every day he would spin around the valley very fast. 

one day, he caught sight of a rabbit. he stopped his spinning and said, "good day, rabbit. what brings you here." 

the rabbit replied, "i like watching you spin! you are so mighty and fast. i was wondering if you could teach me how to do the same." 

the mouse smiled and said, "yes, i sure can! with some practice, you too can spin like me!" 

the rabbit was excited and tried to spin but found it difficult at first. but the mouse encouraged him to keep practicing and soon the rabbit was spinning around the valley like the mighty mouse!

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to eat yummy treats like cookies and candy. one day, her mom baked a big batch of cookies that smelled so tasty. lily couldn't wait to eat them all.

as she was about to take a bite, the ground started to tremble. lily was scared and held onto her mom's hand tightly. suddenly, there was a loud shock that shook the house. lily was so scared that she dropped her cookie on the floor.

after a while, the shaking stopped and lily's mom checked the news. they found out that there was an earthquake in their town. lily was sad that she couldn't eat her cookie, but she was grateful that she was safe. her mom promised to bake more cookies once everything settled down. and they lived happily ever after, enjoying their tasty treats and staying safe from any future shocks.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named tim. tim was a normal boy who liked to play with his toys and eat lunch. one day, tim went to the park with his mom. they had a fun time playing and running around.

at lunch time, tim's mom gave him a yummy sandwich. while he was eating, tim saw a little bird. the bird was hungry too. tim gave the bird some of his lunch. the bird was very happy and started to follow tim.

tim and the bird played together all day. they became best friends. when it was time to go home, tim said goodbye to the bird. the bird flew away and tim went home with his mom. tim had a great day at the park with his new friend.

once upon a time there was a family that had an oven. it was big and red and they used it to make food. it was special because it was the only oven in the world like it.

one day, the family got a surprise. it was a box that had something inside. they opened it and it was full of crazy colourful jewels. it was like a treasure.
 
everyone was so excited. they wanted to know how much the jewels were worth. they worked out that the jewels were worth a lot of money.

the family was so happy and wanted to show everyone the jewels. they organised a party and invited everyone. they put the jewels in the oven so everyone could see them.

at the party, everyone loved the jewels and everyone said how valuable they were. the family was so proud. 

the end.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. he loved to play with his toys and run around outside. one day, timmy's mom told him that they were going to a birthday party for his friend sarah. timmy was excited to go because he knew there would be lots of cake and presents.

at the party, timmy saw a big box with a shiny bow on top. he knew it was a gift for sarah. timmy thought the box was very attractive and wanted to play with it. but his mom told him that the gift was not for him, it was for sarah.

later on, when it was time to open presents, timmy saw that sarah ignored the big box with the shiny bow on top. she opened all her other gifts first. timmy wondered why sarah didn't want to open the attractive gift. finally, when all the other gifts were opened, sarah opened the big box. inside was a beautiful doll that sarah had been wanting for a long time. timmy realized that sometimes it's important to ignore things that are attractive to us, because they may not be the best gift for someone else.

mia's uncle was always a great guy to be around. he often visited mia's family, and he was always so kind and generous. one day, mia's uncle came to visit and he had a big surprise for mia.

mia was so excited as his uncle pulled out a large, smooth box. "this is for you," her uncle said, smiling.

mia opened the box and pulled out a beautiful, smooth wooden toy airplane. she flashed a big smile at her uncle and thanked him.

"this is a special offer just for you," her uncle said, "it's from me to you."

mia hugged her uncle tight and enjoyed playing with her special new toy the rest of the day. she was so excited to have this special offering from her uncle.

tom and lily like to play with blocks. they make towers with the blocks. they try to make the tallest tower they can. they have fun with the blocks.

but sam does not like to play with blocks. he likes to knock down the towers. he thinks it is funny to see the blocks fall. he is a silly boy. he does not care if tom and lily are sad.

one day, tom and lily have an idea. they want to prevent sam from knocking down their tower. they make a trap for sam. they put some blocks on the floor. they hide behind the couch. they wait for sam to come.

sam sees the blocks on the floor. he thinks they are part of a tower. he runs to knock them down. but he does not see the string. the string is tied to a bucket. the bucket is full of water. the bucket is on top of the door.

when sam pulls the blocks, he pulls the string. the bucket falls on his head. the water splashes on him. he is wet and cold. he is not happy. he cries.

tom and lily come out from behind the couch. they laugh at sam. they say, "that is what you get for being a silly boy. now you cannot knock down our tower. we prevented you from ruining our fun."

sam learns his lesson. he says he is sorry to tom and lily. he asks if he can play with them. they say yes, but only if he is nice. they share the blocks. they make a big tower together. they have fun with the blocks. they are friends.

mama and mia were playing together in their backyard. mia had her very own wooden stool, which mama had given her as a special birthday present. "let's polish your special stool mama said!", and mia was delighted! mama and mia stood in the sun and on this unique tuesday, they both took turns polishing the wooden stool. when it was time to finish, mama said, "wow mia, it looks beautiful! you did a great job polishing it". mia smiled and said, "it looks so sparkly and special now mama, thank you for helping me polish it". they both hugged, feeling very proud. the end.

tom and lily are playing in the park. they see a big machine near the fence. it has wheels, pipes and buttons. tom wants to go and touch it. lily says no.

"that is a dangerous machine. it can hurt you. mommy and daddy said we cannot go near it. we have to stay here and play with our toys."

but tom does not listen. he runs to the fence and climbs over it. he goes to the machine and pushes a button. the machine makes a loud noise and starts to move. tom is scared. he tries to run away, but he falls. he hurts his knee and cries.

lily hears tom cry. she runs to the fence and sees him on the ground. she is worried. she calls for help.

"help! help! tom is hurt! he went to the dangerous machine and he fell!"

a man hears lily's voice. he is a worker. he works with the machine. he runs to tom and picks him up. he checks his knee and puts a bandage on it. he carries him to the fence and gives him to lily. he is angry.

"what were you doing here? this is a dangerous machine. it is not a toy. you could have been hurt very badly. you have to listen to your sister. she is smart. she knows what is safe and what is not. you have to say sorry to her and to me."

tom is sorry. he says sorry to the worker and to lily. he hugs lily and says thank you. he says he will not go to the dangerous machine again. he says he will listen to lily and play with their toys. lily hugs him back and says it is okay. she says she loves him and she is glad he is okay. they go back to their toys and play. they are happy.

teddy and amy were best friends. every day they managed to do something fun together.

one day teddy and amy went for a walk in the park. they took a big folder with them and inside the folder, teddy had a healthy snack for them both.

"this is going to be so much fun!" teddy said as he opened the folder.

but when teddy looked inside the folder, he saw that the healthy snack was gone!

"oh no!" teddy said. "where did the snack go?"

"maybe it flew away," amy said, looking sadly at the empty folder.

but then teddy had an idea. he got down on the ground and reached under the bench and sure enough, he managed to find the healthy snack!

"i found it!" teddy shouted, standing up with a big smile on his face.

teddy and amy cheered and ate the healthy snack together. they were very happy and enjoyed their fun day in the park.

once there was a fat car. it belonged to a little boy named jack. he loved the fat car. he liked to take it for rides around the block. he used to roll down the windows and laugh.

one day jack was playing with his fat car. his mom said, "jack, time for dinner!" but jack wanted to keep playing. so his mom said, "remember to come in before it gets dark."

jack said, "ok!" he kept playing until it got dark.

he got scared and started to cry. his mom came out and said, "i told you to remember!" jack nodded and went inside with his mom.

every day his mom would remind him to come inside before it got dark. jack always remembered.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved going to the gym with her mommy every day. one day, lily saw her friend sarah playing with a big toy. she got jealous and wanted to play with it too. but sarah didn't want to share.

lily asked, "can i play with it too, please?"

sarah said, "no, it's mine!"

lily got angry and tried to take the toy away. but the toy snapped and broke into pieces. sarah started crying and lily felt bad. she said sorry but it was too late. sarah didn't want to be friends anymore.

lily learned that it's not nice to be jealous and take things that don't belong to her. she felt sad and wished she could make things right with sarah.

once upon a time, there was a grumpy cat named tom. tom lived in a small house with his friend, a happy dog named max. they liked to play together, but sometimes, tom would get mad and run away.

one day, tom found a big knot in a long string. he tried to untie the knot, but it was too hard. he pulled and pulled, but the knot just got tighter. tom got very grumpy and didn't want to play anymore.

max saw tom was sad and wanted to help. he walked over to tom and gave him a sign that said, "i can help!" max used his paws to untie the knot. tom was so happy and not grumpy anymore. they played together all day and had lots of fun. and from that day on, tom knew that max would always be there to help him.

once upon a time there was a mommy who worked hard to make yarn. she was very strong and she worked day and night to spin the yarn. every morning she woke up and she would go to work to make the yarn.

she would spin the yarn so fast and it always came out so healthy and strong. every day she wrapped the yarn around her spinning wheel and made lots of yarn. she worked very hard and every night she was very tired. she also sold some of her yarn so she could buy food for her family.

one day, she made very special yarn, it was the softest and prettiest yarn ever. she used the yarn to make a special blanket for her baby. the baby was so happy with the blanket, it kept her warm and cozy every night.

the mommy was so proud of her work, she made very healthy, strong and beautiful yarn. she was a very special yarn maker and her work was amazing!

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy who loved to play basketball. he was a good player and loved to shoot the ball into the hoop. one day, he went to the park to play with his friends. it was a hot day and the sun was shining bright.

timmy's friend, johnny, came up to him and asked, "hey timmy, can i play too?" timmy said, "sure, but we need to squeeze the ball to make sure it's not too flat." they squeezed the ball and started to play. timmy was happy to have his friend playing with him.

after a while, timmy's team was winning and johnny was getting upset. he said, "it's not fair, you guys are too good." timmy replied, "don't worry, it's just a game. let's keep playing and have fun." johnny felt better and they continued to play until the sun went down. they were tired but happy, and timmy felt lucky to have such a great friend to play with.

lily was sick and had to go to the hospital. she did not like the hospital. it was big and loud and scary. she missed her home and her toys and her mom and dad.

one night, she had a dream. in her dream, she saw a big, soft bear. the bear was friendly and smiled at her. he said, "hello, lily. i am here to make you feel better. do you want to play with me?"

lily nodded and smiled back. she liked the bear. he was warm and cuddly and fun. he gave her a hug and said, "don't be afraid, lily. you are brave and strong. you will get well soon and go back to your home and your toys and your mom and dad."

they played together in the dream. they sang songs and told stories and laughed. lily felt happy and safe with the bear. she forgot about the hospital and the pain and the fear.

when she woke up, she saw her mom and dad by her bed. they looked happy and proud. they said, "good morning, lily. we have good news. the doctor said you are much better and you can go home today. how do you feel?"

lily felt good. she remembered her dream and the bear. she said, "i feel good, mom and dad. i had a dream. i met a big, soft bear. he was my friend. he made me feel better. can i take him home?"

her mom and dad smiled and hugged her. they said, "of course, lily. you can take him home. he is your special friend. he will always be with you in your heart." they gave her a big, soft bear to hold. it looked just like the one in her dream. lily hugged the bear and smiled. she was happy and ready to go home.

once upon a time, there was a happy puppy named max. he lived with an old lady and everyday, he would crawl through the garden and make it his mission to find the best cream.

one day, max was crawling around the garden and he found a special tree with the most delicious cream he had ever seen. he quickly ate a large spoonful and it was even better than he could have imagined. he was so happy!

when the old lady came outside and saw max licking his lips, she laughed and said, "max, what did you do? it looks like you found something delicious."

max smiled and said, "i found the best cream ever. i'm so happy!" the old lady reached over and gave max a pat on the head.

max was very content with his special treat and continued to crawl around the garden, looking for more cream.

ben loves his rabbit, fluffy. fluffy is soft and white and has long ears. ben likes to hug fluffy and feed him carrots. fluffy likes to hop and play in the garden.

one day, ben hears a loud bark. he sees a big dog running towards fluffy. the dog has sharp teeth and a mean look. ben is scared. he wants to protect fluffy from the dog.

ben runs to fluffy and picks him up. he holds fluffy close to his chest. he shouts, "go away, dog! fluffy is mine!" the dog stops and growls. he wants to bite fluffy.

ben sees his mom coming out of the house. she sees the dog and ben and fluffy. she is angry. she says, "bad dog! leave my son and his rabbit alone!" she picks up a stick and waves it at the dog. the dog is afraid. he runs away.

ben is happy. he says, "thank you, mom! you saved me and fluffy!" his mom hugs him and fluffy. she says, "you're welcome, ben! you are brave and kind. you love your rabbit and you protect him. i'm proud of you." she takes them inside the house. she gives ben a cookie and fluffy a carrot. they are safe and happy.

tim and sam are brothers. they like to watch television after school. but today, the television is not available. mom says it is broken. she says it burned in a storm. tim and sam are sad and bored.

they go to their room and look for something to play with. they find some crayons and paper. they start to draw pictures of their favorite shows. tim draws a superhero. sam draws a dinosaur. they show each other their drawings and pretend to act like them.

"look, i am super tim! i can fly and save the world!" tim says. he jumps on the bed and makes flying noises.

"roar, i am dino sam! i can run and eat everything!" sam says. he crawls on the floor and makes biting noises.

they have fun playing together. they forget about the television. they make up their own stories and adventures. mom hears them laughing and smiles. she is happy that they are using their imagination. she thinks they are very creative and clever. she hopes the television will be fixed soon, but she also hopes they will keep playing like this.

once upon a time, there was a little girl. she was always very alert and always looking around. one day, she was out in the backyard. she noticed something shiny on the ground. it was a marble. she went to pick it up and mention it to her mom. 

her mom was very happy and said it was a special marble. she told the little girl that she could keep it as a prize. 

the little girl was so excited. she held onto the marble tightly. she ran back out to the backyard, but this time she was even more alert. she wanted to see if she could find more marbles. 

the little girl spent the whole afternoon looking and searching, but all she found was an old shoe. she showed it to her mom and they laughed. 

the little girl kept the marble safely in her pocket. it became a special reminder of the day she was so alert and found something special.

sam and lily are friends. they like to play with chalk on the sidewalk. they draw flowers, stars, and animals. they have fun and laugh.

one day, sam is sick. he cannot go outside and play with lily. he stays in bed and drinks soup. he feels sad and bored. he misses lily and the chalk.

lily comes to visit sam. she brings a gift for him. it is a big box of chalk. she says, "i miss you, sam. i hope you feel better soon. i brought you some chalk. you can draw on paper or on your window. it will make you happy."

sam smiles and hugs lily. he says, "thank you, lily. you are a helpful friend. i like the chalk. i will draw with you when i am well. you make me happy."

lily and sam draw together on paper. they use different colors and shapes. they make a card for sam's mom. they write, "we love you, mom. thank you for taking care of sam." they give the card to sam's mom. she smiles and hugs them. she says, "you are both very sweet and kind. i love you, too."

robbie was walking down the hill. it was a bright, red day. robbie was wearing his red cap. 

he saw a mailbox at the bottom of the hill. he was curious. he had never seen a mailbox before. 

he asked his mom what it was.

"that's a mailbox," said his mom. "it's where people mail letters."

robbie was excited. he wanted to mail a letter. 

his mom told him he could mail a letter if he wanted to. robbie found a piece of paper and wrote a letter to his best friend. 

he went to the mailbox and put the letter inside. he felt very proud that he had mailed it all by himself.

once upon a time, there was a good painter. he painted pictures with many colors. he had a dog named spot who was always with him. spot was a loyal dog who never left the painter's side.

one day, the painter went out to buy more paint. spot wanted to come with him, but the painter said no. spot was sad, but he stayed home. while the painter was gone, spot saw a cat outside. the cat was very mean and scratched spot.

when the painter came back, he saw that spot was hurt. he was angry at the cat for hurting his loyal dog. he decided to punish the cat by chasing it away. spot was happy that the painter protected him. from then on, spot never left the painter's side again.

once upon a time, there was a tiny house with a warm fireplace. in the house lived a kind cat and a weak mouse. the cat was big and strong, but the mouse was small and not strong.

one cold day, the mouse was trying to get warm by the fireplace. but he was too weak to move close to the fire. the cat saw the mouse and felt sad for him. so, the cat decided to lend a paw to the mouse.
