the cat gently picked up the weak mouse and put him close to the fireplace. the mouse felt warm and happy. from that day on, the cat and the mouse became best friends. they always helped each other and stayed warm by the fireplace together.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to dance and twirl around in her pretty pink dress. one day, she went to a party and saw a big cake with zero candles on it. the cake looked so delicious that lily couldn't resist taking a bite. 

as she ate the cake, she felt so happy that she started to dance again. her friends joined in and they all danced together, laughing and having fun. lily realized that even though there were zero candles on the cake, the party was still amazing. 

from that day on, lily danced whenever she felt happy, and she always remembered that even if there were zero candles, there was still plenty to celebrate. and whenever she ate something delicious, she couldn't help but dance a little jig.

one day, a brown dog came to the beach. he saw the sand and he wanted to explore. he saw a bird and a big tree, and then he saw the most exciting thing of all. there was a big pile of salt on the ground! he wanted to find out what it was. he sniffed it and he realized it was salty. he was so excited! he didn't know why the salt was there, but he was happy he found it.

he started to bark happily and he jumped around in the sand. he was having so much fun that he didn't notice the waves coming in. soon enough, the waves were getting closer and closer to the pile of salt. the dog knew he had to do something, so he used his paws and he started to dig a hole. he worked really hard and eventually the waves were coming too close to the salt. so he grabbed the pile of salt in his mouth and carried it to higher ground.

once the salt was safe, the dog stopped and looked back at the beach. he was proud of himself for protecting the salt and he woofed loudly to let everyone know. the beach was safe again and the brown dog was happy to have helped.

dot was so happy. today was perfect. she had put on her favourite dress, and was ready to go. she was going to the jam factory. she skipped out the door with a big smile.

when she got to the factory, the smell was delicious. she knew the jam would taste even better. she grabbed a spoon and filled up a jar with purple jam. it was the perfect colour.

she watched as the sunshine made the jam sparkle. dot closed her eyes and blinked. when she opened them, she was sure the jar was even fuller! she was so excited, she couldn't wait to get home and try it. 

dot skipped back home. she opened the jar, and the smell filled her room like a warm hug. she spread the jam on some toast, and took a bite. it was delicious. she smiled and thought to herself, today was perfect.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play with her toys all day long. one day, her mommy said, "lily, we are going to arrive at the store soon. we need to buy some food for dinner." lily was happy to go to the store with her mommy.

when they arrived at the store, they saw a lot of people. but something was different. there was silence in the store. lily asked her mommy, "mommy, why is it quiet here?" her mommy replied, "the power went out, so the music stopped playing." 

lily saw a toy that she really wanted, but it was expensive. she asked her mommy if they could buy it. her mommy said, "i'm sorry, lily. it's too expensive for us to buy right now." lily was sad, but she knew that her mommy was right. they bought the food they needed and went back home. 

when they arrived home, they cooked dinner together and had a fun time. lily forgot about the toy and was happy to spend time with her mommy.

ben and mia liked to play in the park. they liked to swing, slide and run. but their favorite thing was to watch the big crane. the crane was very tall and strong. it could lift heavy things and move them around. ben and mia wanted to touch the crane, but their mom said no.

"mom, can we please touch the crane?" ben asked.

"no, ben, you can't. the crane is not for playing. it is for working. it could hurt you if you get too close. you have to stay away from the crane," mom said.

"but mom, it looks so cool. we just want to see it up close. please, mom, please," mia begged.

"no, mia, you can't. the crane is not for you. it is for the workers. they have a job to do. you have to respect their work. you have to listen to me," mom said.

ben and mia were not happy. they did not like mom's answer. they thought mom was mean. they wanted to touch the crane. they waited until mom was busy talking to another mom. then they sneaked away from the swings. they ran towards the crane. they did not see the sign that said "danger. do not enter."

they reached the crane. they felt the rough metal. they climbed on the wheels. they pulled on the wires. they had fun. they did not hear the workers shouting at them. they did not see the crane moving. they did not feel the crane lifting them up.

mom saw the crane. she saw ben and mia. she was scared. she ran towards the crane. she yelled at ben and mia. she told them to get down. she told them to be careful. she told them they were in trouble.

the workers saw the crane. they saw ben and mia. they were angry. they stopped the crane. they lowered ben and mia. they told them to get off. they told them they were naughty. they told them they could have been hurt.

ben and mia were sorry. they realized they made a mistake. they realized they disobeyed mom. they realized they endangered themselves and others. they apologized to mom. they apologized to the workers. they promised to never touch the crane again.

mom was relieved. she hugged ben and mia. she was glad they were safe. she was sad they were disobedient. she explained to them why they should not touch the crane. she explained to them why they should listen to her. she explained to them why they should respect the work of others.

ben and mia learned a lesson. they learned to obey mom. they learned to stay away from the crane. they learned to appreciate the work of others. they still liked to watch the crane, but from a safe distance. they never forgot the day they touched the crane.

once upon a time there was a naughty little boy. his parents did not like how rude he was. one day, the boy decided to play near a well in the forest. he thought it would be fun to destroy it.

he quickly found some stones and started throwing them into the well. splash, splash! he laughed and threw more and more in. soon, the well was full of stones, and the water had vanished.

the boy's parents were very angry. they scolded him and taught him a lesson. he learned that it was not nice to destroy things. from then on he was a good boy and never destroyed anything again.

once upon a time, there was a clever boy named tom. he lived with his parents in a big house. every day, tom would take a walk around his neighborhood.

on one special day, he saw a piece of paper lying on the ground. he picked it up and started to read. it was a note from a friendly bear! the note said: "come to my cave on the other side of the forest. i have something special to show you. signed, bear".

tom ran home to his parents. he told them all about the note. tom's parents were worried - it was dangerous to go alone! however, tom was clever and decided to take the bear up on his offer. he asked his parents if he could go and promised to be very careful.

tom set off into the woods, stopping every once in a while to take in the beauty of the forest. at last he found the bear's cave. inside, tom saw a strange sight - the bear had set up a secret paper factory! everywhere around the cave were huge stacks of paper. 

the bear saw the surprised look on tom's face and said, "welcome, tom! i was hoping you would come. i was planning to make a special paper, but i needed a clever boy like you to help me!"

tom was excited. he and the bear worked together to create something amazing - a beautiful paper house! 

tom carefully

ben and lily liked to play in the park. they liked to swing, slide and run. one day, they saw something unusual in the pond. it was an otter. the otter was brown and furry. it had a long tail and whiskers.

"look, lily, an otter!" ben said.

"wow, ben, it is so cute!" lily said.

they went closer to the pond. the otter saw them and swam to them. it had something in its mouth. it was a letter. the letter had a stamp and an address.

"hello, otter, what do you have?" ben asked.

the otter made a funny noise and gave them the letter. ben and lily opened the letter. it was from their grandma. she wrote that she missed them and sent them a picture of her and her cat.

"thank you, otter, for mailing us this letter!" lily said.

the otter nodded and smiled. it splashed in the water and waved goodbye. ben and lily waved back. they were happy to get a letter from their grandma. they were also happy to meet an unusual otter. they decided to write a letter back and mail it to their grandma. maybe the otter would help them again.

once upon a time, there was an ice cube. the ice cube was mysterious, because it was always doing something interesting. one day, the ice cube wanted to play a game. 

it said, "let's play a game. can you guess what i'm going to do next?" 

the ice cube floated around the room and waited for the answer.

then, a little girl walked into the room. she watched the ice cube and thought for a moment then she said, "i guess you are going to melt!" 

the ice cube smiled and said, "yes! you guessed it!" 

the little girl was happy and the ice cube was happy too. they both enjoyed playing the mysterious guessing game.

on wednesday, maisy woke up feeling cheerful. she quickly ran down the stairs to the kitchen and found her dad making breakfast.

"good morning, maisy!" said her dad cheerfully.

"good morning, daddy," she replied.

"i want pancakes!" said maisy excitedly.

her dad laughed and said, "let's listen and see if your mom agrees."

maisy's mom was standing in the doorway and said, "yes, pancakes sound nice. let's all make them together."

maisy, her mom and her dad laughed and talked while they made pancakes together. they ate the pancakes with lots of syrup and shared stories.

maisy was so happy to be with her family. wednesday had been a very cheerful day.

once upon a time, a hippo was walking through the forest. he was feeling weird and didn't know why. suddenly, he heard a voice calling him. he followed the voice and it lead him to a small lake. 

he was very curious so he peeped into the lake. he saw a giant creature sleeping at the bottom of the lake. he was so scared that he backed away and ran. 

he ran deeper into the forest and he heard the voice calling him again. he was so scared that he ran even faster. he didn't know why he was so scared but he followed the voice.  

the voice lead him to a cave. feeling brave, he entered the cave. when he got inside, he realized that the creature he saw in the lake was also inside the cave. it jumped on him and licked his face. 

the hippo was relieved to find out that the creature was really friendly. he had been lead to the cave by his new friend! the hippo was no longer feeling weird. 

from then on, the hippo and the creature played together all the time and they were the best of friends.  they had a lot of fun because of the weird things that lead them to meet.

once upon a time, there lived a cat and a mouse. the mouse wanted some food, but she was scared to go out alone. so she asked the cat if he would take her with him.

the cat said, â€œyes, of course! letâ€™s go.â€ and so off they went.

they walked for what felt like a long time until they found some food. but it was an old, tough piece of cheese. the cat took it and offered it to the mouse.

the mouse looked at it and said, â€œthat looks tough. i donâ€™t think i can eat it.â€

the cat smiled. â€œdonâ€™t worry,â€ she said. â€œiâ€™ll take it away and find something else.â€

and so thatâ€™s what they did. eventually, they found some fresh, tasty food and they were both very happy. the mouse could eat and the cat could watch her eat. it was a wonderful day.

one day, daisy was feeling lonely. she didn't have anyone to play with, but she looked at the sky and saw a wonderful sunrise. suddenly, a magical sparkle flew from the sky and landed in front of her. it was a sparkle fairy! 

the sparkle fairy said she was lost and needed help. daisy said she would rescue her. daisy used her hand to carefully pick up the sparkle fairy and took her to a safe place. 

the sparkle fairy thanked daisy with a happy smile and flew away. daisy waved goodbye and watched until the sparkle fairy had disappeared into the sky.

as daisy looked back at the beautiful sunrise, she felt proud of herself for rescuing the sparkle fairy. she knew that she had made a difference and hadn't been so lonely after all.

once upon a night, there was an ancient little boy named zeke. he was only three years old but, he loved to explore all sorts of exciting places.

he stepped outside and saw the shiny stars in the night sky. he then heard a loud noise in the distance. he stepped closer and closer until he saw an old man sitting near a campfire.

the old man said, "come closer my boy and step into the fire light."

zeke stepped cautiously toward the man. he asked, "what is this ancient fire?"

the old man laughed. he said, "it's a campfire. i've been camping here for many years, and this fire is ancient. it brings light in the night and keeps us safe."

zeke smiled and stepped closer to the fire. he watched as the flames danced and was amazed by what he saw.

the old man said, "the night is magical zeke. never forget that."

zeke nodded with a smile and stepped away to explore some more.

once there was a happy boy named jimmy. he was three years old. every day his mom allowed him to play with his toys. one day he saw a box of tape. he asked his mom if he could use it. she said yes and allowed him to use it. 

jimmy was so excited. he used the tape to build things with his toys. he built a boat and a castle. he loved making new things with the tape. 

jimmy's mom was so proud of him. she always videotaped him while he played. she always said he was a very normal boy and madeher very happy. 

jimmy and his mom had so much fun together. and it was all because she allowed him to use the tape.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named tim. tim had a very interesting hat. it was red and blue with a big, yellow star on it. he loved to wear his hat every day.

one day, tim saw a big tree with a kite stuck in it. he wanted to help get the kite down. tim thought, "if i wear my interesting hat, maybe i can succeed!" so, he put on his hat and started to climb the tree.

with his hat on, tim felt strong and brave. he climbed higher and higher until he reached the kite. he pulled it free and climbed back down. tim succeeded in getting the kite down, all thanks to his interesting hat.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a unique teddy bear that she loved very much. one day, lily went to the park to play with her teddy bear. she left her teddy bear on the bench and went to play on the swings. when she came back, her teddy bear was gone!

lily started to cry and went to her mom to tell her the news. "mommy, my teddy bear is gone! i miss him so much," said lily. her mom hugged her and said, "don't worry, we'll find him."

they looked everywhere in the park but couldn't find the teddy bear. just when they were about to give up, they saw a little boy playing with the teddy bear. lily ran over and said, "that's my teddy bear! i missed him so much!"

the little boy said, "i'm sorry, i didn't know it was yours. here you go." lily hugged her teddy bear tightly and said, "thank you, thank you, thank you!"

lily and tom were playing with their toys in the living room. they had a lot of fun making different shapes and animals with their blocks, balls and dolls. lily liked to make houses and gardens, and tom liked to make cars and rockets. they were very creative and happy.

but then, lily had an idea. she saw a big bottle of glue on the shelf. she wanted to make her house more strong and pretty. she took the bottle and opened it. she poured some glue on her blocks and stuck them together. she thought it was brilliant. she smiled and said to tom, "look, tom, i made a glue house! it is very strong and shiny. do you want to make one too?"

tom looked at lily's house. he thought it was silly. he did not want to use glue. he liked to move his blocks and change his shapes. he shook his head and said, "no, lily, i don't want to make a glue house. glue is sticky and messy. i like to make cars and rockets. they are fast and cool. you can keep your glue house."

lily felt sad. she wanted tom to like her house. she wanted to share her glue with him. she did not understand why he did not want to use glue. she said, "but, tom, glue is fun and nice. it makes things more strong and pretty. you can make a glue car or a glue rocket. they will be strong and shiny too. please, tom, try some glue."

tom felt annoyed. he did not like lily's idea. he did not want to ruin his toys with glue. he wanted to play his way. he said, "no, lily, i don't want to try glue. glue is bad and yucky. it makes things stuck and hard. i like to move my toys and play with them. go away, lily, leave me alone."

lily felt hurt. she did not like tom's words. she did not want to go away. she wanted to play with him. she said, "but, tom, we are friends. we always play together. why are you so mean to me? don't you like me anymore?"

tom felt guilty. he did not mean to hurt lily. he did like her. he was just angry with her glue. he said, "i'm sorry, lily. i do like you. you are my friend. i was just mad at your glue. i don't like glue. it is not fun for me."

lily felt hopeful. she wanted to make up with tom. she wanted to play with him again. she said, "it's okay, tom. i'm sorry too. i did not know you don't like glue. it is fun for me. but we can play different things. we can play with blocks and balls and dolls. we can make anything we want. we can have fun together."

tom felt happy. he wanted to make up with lily too. he wanted to play with her again. he said, "yes, lily, let's do that. let's play with our toys. we can make anything we want. we can have fun together."

lily and tom hugged and smiled. they put the glue away and took their toys. they played with their blocks and balls and dolls. they made different shapes and animals. they were very creative and happy. they were friends again.

once upon a time there was a little girl. she was only three years old. but the girl was very helpful. every day, she found ways to provide help to her family.

one day, the girl got an exciting idea. she wanted to provide a special surprise for her family. so every day, she worked very hard. she made little gifts and put them aside.

when the end of the year arrived, the girl was ready. she gave all the gifts to her family. they were so happy! from then on, the little girl was always looking for ways to provide kindness and happiness to the people she loved.

once upon a time, there was a little fishy named nemo. nemo loved to swim in the big ocean with his fishy friends. one day, nemo got tired and wanted to rest. he found a cozy spot near some seaweed where he felt comfortable. 

suddenly, nemo smelled something yummy coming from the other side of the ocean. he wanted to see what it was, so he swam over to investigate. when he got there, he saw his friend dory stirring a big pot of fish soup! 

nemo was so excited to try the soup, but he didn't want to leave his comfortable spot. dory understood and brought a bowl of soup over to him. nemo slurped up the soup and felt so happy and comfortable. he thanked dory for being such a good friend and for making the delicious soup.

once upon a time, there was a hot day. a little girl sneezed and said, "i need a mint." then she went on an adventure to find a mint.

the little girl searched in the garden and the kitchen, but the mint was nowhere to be found. then she started to get tired and thought, "maybe i should take a nap."

so she found a nice spot in the sunshine and curled up for a nap. she was dreaming of minty treats when she felt something tickling her nose.

she opened her eyes, and right next to her was a big pile of mints. there must have been a thousand of them! the little girl smiled, and then ate a mint. it was cold and sweet, just like she had hoped.

the little girl was so happy that she had found all these mints to enjoy. she stayed outside in the sunshine until she got too hot, and then she took another nap.

lila was a little girl who liked to ride in her dad's big car. she felt safe and happy when she sat in her seat and heard the buckle click. her dad was a wealthy man who worked hard and bought nice things for lila and her mom.

one day, her dad said they were going to visit a new friend. he said the friend was very kind and generous and had a big house with a lot of toys. lila was excited and curious. she wondered what the friend looked like and what toys he had.

they drove for a long time and reached a big gate. her dad pressed a button and the gate opened. they drove up a long driveway and saw a huge house with many windows and a fountain. lila gasped. she had never seen such a big house before.

they parked the car and got out. her dad held her hand and walked to the door. he rang the bell and waited. lila heard a loud bark and saw a big dog run to the door. she felt scared and hid behind her dad. the dog looked angry and fierce.

the door opened and a man came out. he smiled and said, "welcome, welcome, my friends! i'm so glad you're here!" he bent down and petted the dog. he said, "don't worry, this is rufus. he's very friendly and loves children. he just wants to say hello."

he picked up lila and hugged her. he said, "you must be lila. you're so pretty and sweet. i have a surprise for you. come, let me show you." he carried her inside and showed her a big room full of toys. there were dolls, cars, books, puzzles, and more. lila felt happy and amazed. she said, "wow, thank you, thank you! you're so nice!"

the man said, "you're very welcome, lila. i'm your grandpa. i've been looking for you and your dad for a long time. i'm so happy to finally meet you. you're my family and i love you very much." he kissed her cheek and hugged her again.

lila smiled and hugged him back. she said, "i love you too, grandpa. you're my family too. can i play with rufus and the toys?"

grandpa said, "of course, you can. you can play with anything you want. this is your home too, lila. you're always welcome here." he put her down and watched her run to rufus and the toys. he felt a tear in his eye and thanked his son for bringing lila to him. he said, "this is the best day of my life."

once upon a time there was a young fish named jake. jake loved to explore the reef. he would swim around it every day and explore all of its nooks and crannies. 

one day, as he was exploring, he noticed something odd. he said to himself, "where did all the coral go?". he looked around but he couldn't find it anywhere. 

suddenly, he saw a magical bubble floating towards him. when it came close, it vanished! jake gasped. he knew that he had to act fast if he wanted to see where it went. 

he jumped into the water and started swimming. he followed the bubble until it stopped at the edge of a cliff. looking down he saw something strange- a secret hidden cave with glimmering objects inside it!

jake curiously peered inside and saw a large collection of coral. he was amazed! he quickly swam down to retrieve the coral before it could vanish again! he was able to save the reef and protect all of the young fish living there.

jake was proud of himself for saving the reef. he swam back to his home, with a big smile on his face.

once upon a time, there were two little girls who looked out the window one day. they seemed so excited! outside, there was a cactus. it was very tall, but it was patient. the girls had a funny idea. they decided to try and climb it like a ladder.

they tried their best, but they couldn't reach the top. the cactus was just too tall. but they seemed to be having fun trying. eventually they had to give up. on their way back inside, one of the girls had an idea. she suggested that they bring back some of their toys and build a tower around the cactus. 

so, the girls grabbed their dolls, stuffed animals and toy blocks. they worked together and it didn't take long for the tower to grow. when they were finished, the tower was so high it almost reached the top of the cactus! the girls were so proud of their work. 

the cactus seemed happy too. it just stood there patient and tall no matter how many times the girls climbed it or built towers around it. it was the perfect friend for the two little girls.

once upon a time there was a young musician. she played her music in the park every day. the musician was very polite and she always smiled at everyone.

one day while she was playing, she saw a little girl who looked very sad. the musician asked her what was wrong and the little girl said that she was tired and her legs hurt.

so the musician took the little girl to a shady spot for her to rest. she lay down and almost immediately fell fast asleep. 

the musician sat with the little girl until she woke up. the little girl was feeling better, and thanked the musician for being so kind. the little girl said that she had been having a bad day, but lying in the park with the polite musician had really made her feel better. 

the musician said it was no problem and they both smiled. the little girl waved goodbye and the musician went back to playing her music.

sara and ben were playing in the kitchen. they saw a big jar of jam on the shelf. they wanted to eat some jam. they climbed on a chair and reached for the jar. but the jar was too heavy and slippery. it fell down and broke on the floor. jam was everywhere.

"oh no!" sara said. "mom will be mad. we have to escape."

"where can we go?" ben asked.

"let's hide in the closet," sara said. they ran to the closet and closed the door.

they waited in the dark. they heard mom come home. they heard her scream.

"what happened here? who made this mess?" mom said.

sara and ben were scared. they did not want to get in trouble. they did not say anything.

mom looked around. she saw the chair and the broken jar. she guessed what happened. she was angry and sad.

"who did this? sara? ben? come out now!" mom said.

sara and ben did not come out. they hugged each other. they felt bad. they knew they did something wrong. they wished they could say sorry. but they were too afraid.

mom opened the closet. she saw sara and ben. they looked at her with big eyes. they were covered in jam.

"sara, ben, what did you do?" mom said.

sara and ben did not know what to say. they started to cry.

mom sighed. she was not happy. but she loved sara and ben. she knew they were just kids. she knew they did not mean to make a mess.

she hugged them and said, "it's okay. i'm not mad anymore. but you have to help me clean up. and you have to promise not to touch the jam again. do you understand?"

sara and ben nodded. they said, "yes, mom. we're sorry. we love you."

mom smiled. she said, "i love you too. now let's go wash up. you are sticky and poor."

sara and ben smiled. they were glad mom was not mad. they learned their lesson. they followed mom to the bathroom. they did not want to escape anymore. they wanted to stay with mom.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy had a shiny red bicycle that he loved to ride. one day, timmy's friend billy came over to play. billy saw timmy's bicycle and felt jealous because he didn't have one. 

timmy let billy ride his bicycle and they had fun together. they rode around the block and marked their path with chalk on the ground. billy felt happy to ride the bicycle and forgot about feeling jealous. 

after they finished riding, timmy and billy went inside to have some snacks. timmy's mom gave them cookies and milk. they talked about how much fun they had riding the bicycle together. billy realized that he didn't need to be jealous because he had a good friend like timmy.

lila was a bird who loved to soar in the sky. she liked to feel the wind on her wings and see the clouds and the sun. she wanted to learn more about the world, so she decided to go to university.

university was a big place with many buildings and many birds. lila met new friends who taught her different things. she learned about songs, colors, shapes, and numbers. she also learned about other animals and places.

one day, lila and her friends went to the park to play. they saw a turtle who was very slow. he was walking on the grass, looking for food. lila flew down and said hello.

"hello, turtle. what is your name?" lila asked.

"my name is tim. i am a turtle. what are you?" tim said.

"i am lila. i am a bird. i go to university. do you know what that is?" lila said.

"no, i don't. what is university?" tim said.

"university is a place where you learn new things. you can learn about songs, colors, shapes, and numbers. you can also learn about other animals and places. do you want to come with me and see?" lila said.

tim thought for a moment. he liked to learn new things, but he was very slow. he was afraid he would not be able to keep up with lila and her friends.

"i don't know, lila. i am very slow. how can i go with you?" tim said.

lila smiled. she had an idea.

"don't worry, tim. you can ride on my back. i will fly you to university. you can see the world from the sky. it is very fun. come on, let's go!" lila said.

tim agreed. he climbed on lila's back and held on tight. lila flapped her wings and soared in the sky. tim was amazed. he saw the trees, the flowers, the river, and the city. he saw other birds, squirrels, dogs, and cats. he saw the university and the park. he felt the wind and the sun. he was very happy.

lila and tim became good friends. they went to university together and learned new things. they also played and had fun. they learned that even if they were different, they could still share and help each other. they soared in the sky and in their minds.

once there was a little girl named lisa. she was just three years old. one day, she woke up and it was very cold outside. she shivered in her bed and then she got out. she put on her boots, coat and a hat.

she stepped outside and the wind was blowing hard. she shivered even more and her teeth were chattering.

â€œwhy itâ€™s so cold today?â€ she said to herself.

then she saw her mom and said, â€œmommy, why itâ€™s so cold?â€

â€œwell, because itâ€™s winter sweetheart,â€ said her mom as she hugged her tight.

suddenly, lisa felt a bit better and was no longer shivering. she went inside for a cup of milk.

â€œmmm, this milk is so yummy,â€ she said as warm milk ran down her chin.

but then lisa heard a loud noise outside and it scared her. she shivered again, but this time it was because of the terrible noise.

â€œwhat was that?â€ she asked her mom.

her mom hugged her again and said, â€œit was just the wind my sweetheart. donâ€™t worry, thereâ€™s nothing to be scared of.â€

lisa felt better and finished her milk with a smile on her face

once upon a time, there was a barber who had a little shop. the barber was very good at cutting hair. one day, a man came into the shop to get his hair cut. the barber set to work, cutting the man's hair very carefully.

the man wanted his hair to look very clear and nice. the barber used his scissors and comb to make the man's hair look just right. the man was very happy with his haircut. the barber was happy too, because he had done a good job.

the barber's shop became very popular. people came from far away to get their hair cut by the barber. the barber set to work every day, making everyone's hair look clear and nice. and they all lived happily ever after.

once upon a time, a cute little dog named spot lived in a small house. spot loved to play with his red ball. one day, he saw a flame outside his house. spot was scared, but he knew he had to be brave.

spot went outside to see what made the flame. he saw a big red fire truck. the firemen were putting out the fire. spot wanted to guess how they did it. he watched them spray water on the flame. the flame went away and the firemen were happy.

spot felt proud that he guessed how the firemen put out the flame. the firemen saw spot and thought he was very cute. they gave him a treat for being brave. spot went back to his house and played with his red ball, feeling like a hero.

once upon a time in a far away land, there lived a princess named jane. she was very brave and daring, but she was not very good at managing her time.

one day, jane was late for her swimming lesson and she was very upset. when she got to the pool, it was raining outside and it was very wet.

jane's teacher asked her, "what took you so long, jane? you are very late!" jane replied, "i'm sorry, miss. i'm having trouble managing my time."

her teacher said, "well, let's find you something dry to wear and get you into the pool right away!"

so, jane and her teacher found her some dry clothes. after she changed, jane was happy and no longer upset.

the swimming lesson went very well, and jane finally managed to get her time under control. she learned her lesson and never missed her swimming lesson again.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. one day, she went on a long car ride with her family. along the way, she saw many pretty things outside her window. she saw big trees, blue sky, and green grass. she said, "wow, what a beautiful landscape!" 

after a while, lily got tired and felt a little cranky. her mom told her to relax and take a nap. lily closed her eyes and soon fell asleep. when she woke up, she saw a mountain in the distant. she said, "look, a big mountain!" 

finally, they arrived at their destination. lily was so happy to be there and see all the new things. she felt excited and couldn't wait to explore more.

lily was a brave knight. she had a sword and a shield and a helmet. she liked to play with her friends and pretend they were fighting dragons and monsters. one day, she saw a big hill in the park. she thought it looked like a castle. she wanted to climb it and see what was on top.

she asked her friends to come with her, but they were scared. they said the hill was too high and steep and there might be bugs or snakes. lily sighed. she was not scared of anything. she said she would go by herself and show them how brave she was. she took her sword and shield and helmet and started to climb the hill.

it was hard work. the hill was very high and steep and there were rocks and dirt and grass. lily had to be careful not to slip or fall. she used her shield to protect herself from the sun and the wind. she was hot and tired, but she kept going. she wanted to see the castle.

she reached the top of the hill. she looked around. she did not see a castle. she only saw more hills and trees and sky. she felt sad and disappointed. she had climbed so far for nothing. she sat down on the ground and put her sword and shield and helmet next to her. she was pale and sweaty and thirsty. she wished she had stayed with her friends.

she heard a noise. she looked up. she saw a big bird flying over her. it had a long beak and sharp claws and bright feathers. it looked like a hawk. it saw lily and her sword and shield and helmet. it thought they were shiny and pretty. it wanted to take them. it swooped down and grabbed lily's helmet with its beak. it flew away with it.

lily was shocked and angry. she jumped up and shouted at the bird. she wanted her helmet back. she picked up her sword and shield and ran after the bird. she did not care how high or steep or scary the hill was. she was a brave knight. she would not let the bird steal her helmet. she would get it back. she would show the bird and her friends how brave she was.

tom and sam are friends. they like to play with toy soldiers and cars. they make a big war with their toys. they put some toys on one side and some toys on the other side. they say, "this is my team and that is your team. we will fight and see who wins."

they take turns to move their toys and make noises. "bang, bang, bang!" tom says. he moves his car and hits sam's soldier. "ha, ha, i got you!" he says. "no, you didn't!" sam says. he moves his soldier and hits tom's car. "boom, boom, boom!" he says. "now i got you!"

they keep playing and having fun. they do not care who wins or loses. they just want to play. but then, the sun goes down and it gets dark. they cannot see their toys very well. they cannot tell who is who. they get confused and scared. they do not like the dark.

"tom, where are you?" sam says. he looks for his friend. "sam, i'm here!" tom says. he looks for his friend. they find each other and hug. they are happy to see each other. they do not want to play war anymore. they want to go home.

they pick up their toys and run to their houses. they say goodbye and see you tomorrow. they go inside and turn on the light. they feel safe and warm. they show their toys to their moms and dads. they tell them about their war. they say, "we had fun, but we did not gain anything. we like to play, but we do not like war. we like light, but we do not like dark." their moms and dads smile and hug them. they say, "we are proud of you. you are smart and kind. you are our heroes."

one day, there was a humble boy called tim. he was only three years old and he was out playing in his garden. he was playing with his rake in the grass and making it look neat.

suddenly, he heard a voice say "hello tim!" he looked up, and it was the kind lady next door, mrs. jones.

she said "would you like a treat?" tim nodded and said "yes please!".

mrs. jones came over and said "here you are. i baked you some cookies for being so humble". she handed him the plate of cookies and went home.

tim thanked mrs. jones, then he went back to his rake. he grinned as he continued to rake the grass. he thought to himself, the kind mrs. jones is always so nice.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a big pink pillow that she loved to hug when she went to bed at night. one day, lily's mommy asked her to clean up her toys. lily said, "it's too difficult, mommy. can you help me?"

mommy said, "sure, lily. let's make it fun. every time we put a toy away, we can clap our hands!" lily thought that was a great idea. so, they started to clean up together, clapping their hands every time they put a toy away.

after they finished, lily's mommy gave her a big hug and said, "you did a great job, lily! now, let's go read a story together with your favorite pink pillow." lily smiled and hugged her mommy back, feeling happy and proud.

once upon a time, there was a modest girl named lucy. she was preparing for a very special day â€“ a day to celebrate a delicious dinner!

the dinner was a special cauliflower dish that lucy had never seen before. it was white, bumpy and smelled like something yummy!

lucy was so excited that she couldn't wait to tell her family about it. she ran to find her mom and dad and shouted, â€œlook what i found - a special, bumpy cauliflower! we can all celebrate the dinner together!â€

her family was just as excited as she was. they all worked together to prepare the delicious dinner.

when the meal was ready, they all sat down to enjoy it. it was a joyful feast, shared by the little family with love. everyone had a wonderful time celebrating the special dinner.

the end.

anna and ben like to play with crayons. they have many colors and they make marks on paper. sometimes they make marks on the wall too, but mommy does not like that. she says it is not polite to make marks on the wall.

one day, anna and ben are playing with crayons in their room. anna wants to make a mark on the wall. she thinks it will be fun. she takes a red crayon and strikes the wall hard. she makes a big mark. she smiles and says, "look, ben! i made a mark on the wall!"

ben sees the mark and he is scared. he knows mommy will be angry. he says, "no, anna! that is bad! mommy will be mad! you should not make marks on the wall!"

anna does not listen to ben. she thinks he is silly. she says, "it is not bad. it is pretty. i like to make marks on the wall. you can make one too. here, take a blue crayon and strike the wall."

ben does not want to make a mark on the wall. he wants to be polite. he says, "no, thank you. i do not want to make a mark on the wall. i want to make marks on paper. that is polite. mommy likes that."

anna gets angry. she says, "you are no fun. you are boring. i do not want to play with you. go away!"

ben feels sad. he does not want to fight with anna. he loves his sister. he says, "i am sorry, anna. i do not want to go away. i want to play with you. but please do not make marks on the wall. mommy will be sad. and we will be in trouble."

anna thinks for a moment. she looks at the mark on the wall. she looks at ben. she looks at the crayons. she says, "you are right, ben. i am sorry too. i do not want to make mommy sad. i do not want to be in trouble. i want to be polite. let us make marks on paper. that is fun too."

ben smiles. he says, "ok, anna. let us make marks on paper. we can make many colors and shapes. we can make a picture for mommy. she will be happy."

anna and ben hug. they take their crayons and paper. they make marks on paper. they make a picture for mommy. they are polite. they are happy.

one day, a beautiful boy named tim went to the park. his mum told him to stay where she could see him. tim found a nice grassy area, so he started to skip. he was very happy and smiled while he skipped. 

after a while, tim noticed a big billboard. it was very colourful, and he thought it was very beautiful. he wanted to go and have a closer look. 

he ran over to the billboard, but then he remembered that his mum had told him to stay. he felt very sad, but he knew it was the right thing to do. he skipped back to the grassy area, and stayed where he was supposed to. 

tim smiled when he saw his mum looking over at him. he was very proud that he had remembered to stay.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lola. she was very curious and wanted to explore her world. one day, lola was walking by the ocean, when she noticed an oyster. she wanted to take a look inside so she began to stir it. as she stirred, the oyster opened and lola saw a pearl inside.

lola was so excited. she showed the pearl to her mommy. her mommy said, "oh, my! that's a magical pearl. put it back, lola and make sure to stir the oyster so it closes again!"

confused, lola put the pearl back into the oyster and stirred as her mommy told her. suddenly, the oyster grew giant and angry. it said, "why did you stir me? now i'm so upset!" lola was scared, but her mommy said, "oysters usually aren't this size and they don't usually talk. we must have reacted a magical spell by stirring the oyster and that's why it's so angry now."

lola learned a lesson that day. no matter what she encounters, she should never stir it without thinking first.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named victoria. she was a very polite girl who always said 'please' and 'thank you'. one day, she ran into trouble. she couldn't find the toy she wanted.

victoria went over to her dad for help. "daddy, can you supply me with a toy?" she asked very politely. 

her dad smiled. he explained to her in simple words, "i will try my best to find the toy you need, but it might be tricky."

victoria was very relieved. she said, "thank you, daddy. i'm so glad you can help!" 

so together, victoria and her dad went looking for the toy. after a long search, they finally found it! 

victoria was very happy. she gave her dad a big hug and said, "thank you, daddy! you supplied me with the toy i wanted." 

her dad smiled and said, "you're very welcome, my dear. always remember, if ever you need help, i'm here."

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to fish with his dad. they would go to the lake and use a hook to catch fish. timmy thought the hook was very useful.

one day, timmy found a toy gun. he wanted to shoot it like he saw in the movies. his dad told him guns were not toys and he should never shoot them. but timmy didn't listen.

he found some rocks and aimed the gun at them. he pulled the trigger and the gun shot. but the bullet hit a bird flying by. timmy was very sad. he realized that shooting was not a game and he should have listened to his dad.

clara was playing with her toys when she noticed a feather lying near her toys. she thought it looked pretty and wanted to see if it could fit in any of her toys. she carefully picked up the feather, then tried to fit it in her doll house. she tried holding the feather in different ways, but it just didn't fit.

clara was getting frustrated. she tried and tried, but the feather still didn't fit. then she remembered to be patient. clara took a deep breath and calmly tried again. she turned the feather and finally, it fit!

clara was overjoyed! she ran to tell her mom all about the feather fitting in the doll house. her mom smiled and told her that being patient was the key to the feather fitting. clara was very proud that she had been patient and was able to fit the feather in the doll house. from then on she was always careful to remember to be patient!

once upon a time, there were two characters. one was called jane and the other was called joe. jane and joe were the best of friends and always liked to do things together. 

one day, jane had an idea. she wanted to go on an adventure in search of a rare mineral. joe thought it sounded like a lot of fun and so he agreed to come with her. 

jane and joe made a plan. they decided to go on a walk and explore the woods near their house. they packed some food to have along the way, and jane made sure to bring a bag for the rare mineral. 

the two friends walked for hours, but they could not seem to find the rare mineral. jane sat down and sighed. joe didn't give up. he said that they should keep looking a bit longer. 

in an incredible stroke of luck, they eventually found it! jane shouted gleefully and hugged joe. they had discovered the rare mineral! the two friends returned home, excited to tell their families about their adventure.

once there was a grumpy bear walking by a pond. as he looked out over the pond he noticed a rabbit. the rabbit asked "why are you so grumpy?" the bear thought for a moment and then said "i am grumpy because no one talks to me". the rabbit smiled and said "let's talk".

the bear and the rabbit talked for a long time. the bear told the rabbit about all of his worries and his sadness. the rabbit listened carefully and was very kind to the bear.

when it started to get dark, the rabbit said goodbye and hopped away. the bear felt much better and was no longer grumpy. that night, the bear watched the stars above the pond with a big smile on his face. from then on, the bear and the rabbit were friends and they talked all the time.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved cake very much. one day, her mommy baked a cake for her. it was a big cake with lots of frosting on top. lily was very happy and she ate the cake very quickly. 

as she ate the cake, she made loud noises because it was so yummy. her mommy laughed and said, "lily, you are so silly!" lily giggled and kept eating the cake until it was all gone. 

after she finished eating, lily felt very full and happy. she gave her mommy a big hug and said, "thank you for the cake, mommy. it was the best cake ever!"

once upon a time, there was a pretty butterfly. she had colorful wings that looked like a pastel drawing. she flew around the flowers and trees, looking for sweet nectar to drink.

one day, the butterfly saw a sharp thorn on a rose bush. she tried to fly past it, but her wing got caught. she was stuck and couldn't fly away. the butterfly felt scared and sad.

but then, a graceful bird saw the butterfly and came to help. the bird gently removed the thorn and set the butterfly free. the butterfly was so happy and grateful. she thanked the bird and flew away, feeling safe and free once again.

once upon a time, there was a big cloud. the cloud was scary. it was dark and loud. the cloud had lightning inside it.

one day, the cloud wanted to spread. it moved and moved. the lightning went with the cloud. the cloud went over a small town.

the people in the town saw the cloud. they saw the lightning. they were scared. they ran inside their homes. the cloud moved away. the people were happy again. the scary cloud and lightning were gone.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved playing with her toys, especially her little car. one day, she accidentally drove her car into a pile of waste and it got all dirty. she tried to clean it, but it was broken.

lily was very sad and didn't know what to do. she went to her mom and said, "mommy, my car is broken. can you fix it?" her mom said, "let me see." she looked at the car and said, "i can't fix it, but maybe we can reverse the damage."

lily didn't understand what that meant, so her mom explained, "we can try to make it clean and shiny again, like it was before." lily was excited and helped her mom clean the car. after a while, the car was clean and shiny again, and lily was very happy. she said, "thank you, mommy. you reversed the bad thing and made it good again!"

once upon a time, there was a little dog named max. max had a toy board that he loved to play with all day. but max's friend, a cat named luna, did not have a toy board. luna was jealous of max's board.

one day, max saw luna looking sad. max asked luna, "why are you sad?" luna said, "i am sad because i want a toy board like yours." max thought about it and decided to help luna. max went to his owner and requested a toy board for luna.

max's owner was kind and gave luna a toy board. now, max and luna both had toy boards to play with. they played together and were very happy. luna was not jealous anymore, and they became the best of friends.

once upon a time there was a little girl named emma. every day she went outside and played until it was time to rest. one day after emma got very tired, she asked her mom if she could go to the toilet. so they both went to the toilet, but it was empty.

"where is the toilet, mommy?" emma asked.

"it's empty, sweetheart. we'll need to find another one," her mom replied.

so they went outside until they found another toilet. when they got there, it was full of water. emma was so happy! she couldn't wait to use the toilet.

after she was done, her mom gave her a big hug and said, "that was a great job, emma! you did so well."

emma was so proud of herself. as they walked back home, she knew that she could always find a toilet, even when the first one was empty.

once there was a little boy who loved to play. he went outside and saw a tire in his backyard. he was curious and wanted to poke it. he went up to the tire and poked it with his finger. it felt squishy and strange. he poked it again and it moved. he thought it was so fun! he poked it again and it kept moving. he kept poking the tire for a long time until he got tired and stopped. he was so happy with his new game that he forgot all the other toys he had in his house. he knew he would have fun with the tire forever.

once upon a time, there was a little dove. it had feathers that were so soft and white, it looked like a doily! the dove had one special talent â€“ it liked to polish. every day it would make sure that its feathers were nice and neat.

one day, the little dove had an idea. she decided to polish something else â€“ something very special. she flew around looking for the perfect thing. suddenly, she spotted a beautiful shiny ring.

the dove was pleased! she knew this little ring needed some polishing. she flapped around it, making sure that all its little curves were buffed and polished. when she stepped back, the ring sparkled like a million stars in the night sky.

the dove was proud of her work. she sang a cheerful song and flew away in the sunshine.

once upon a time, there was a big boat. the boat had a big anchor that kept it in one place. the boat was owned by a bald man named jack. jack loved to sail on his boat and he often took his friends with him.

one day, jack's friend tom came to visit him. tom wanted to go on a sail with jack. jack said, "sure, you can come with me but you have to allow me to steer the boat." tom said, "okay, i will let you steer the boat."

as they sailed, jack noticed that the anchor was not working properly. he said to tom, "can you please check the anchor and see if it is okay?" tom checked the anchor and found that it was broken. jack said, "we cannot sail without the anchor. we need to fix it first."

tom said, "i know a man who can fix it. let me call him." the man came and fixed the anchor. jack was happy and said, "thank you, tom. you are a good friend. now, we can sail again."

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside in the sunshine. one day, she found a tiny plant growing in the dirt. it was so small and cute!

lily wanted to take care of the plant, so she watered it every day. soon, the plant grew bigger and bigger. it was so pretty! lily was very happy.

one day, lily's friend came to play. her name was emily. emily saw the plant and said, "wow, that's a pretty plant! can i have one too?" lily thought about it for a moment and then said, "sure, we can share it!"

emily was very happy and they both took care of the plant together. they watered it every day and watched it grow. after a while, the plant was so big that it needed a bigger pot. lily and emily got their hands dirty and repotted the plant. their hands were filthy, but they didn't mind because they were having so much fun sharing and taking care of their plant.

once upon a time, there was a big, fat cat named whiskers. whiskers loved to play in the yard and chase butterflies. one day, whiskers saw a lawyer walking by. the lawyer was carrying a big bag of books.

whiskers was curious and wanted to learn more about the books. so, he followed the lawyer to his office. the lawyer was very kind and let whiskers look at the books. whiskers learned that books are filled with stories and pictures.

from that day on, whiskers loved to read books and learn new things. he even became friends with the lawyer and would visit him often. and that is how whiskers the cat learned about books and made a new friend, the lawyer. the end.

once upon a time there was a tall tree in the woods. the tree shivered and trembled in the wind. there was a mist in the air, making everything feel strange and cool.

the tall tree was scared. it shook and quivered as the mist floated by. the tree wanted to run but it just couldn't. it wished for a friend to help it feel better.

then one day, a little bird flew down from the sky and landed on the tall tree. the bird was gentle and kind. the tree stopped trembling and felt safe.

the bird sang a beautiful song and the mist slowly disappeared. the bird stayed with the tall tree for a long, long time and the tree was never scared again.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside in the park. one day, she found a green twig on the ground. she picked it up and put it in her pocket. 

as she was walking, she saw a bird's nest in a tree. the nest looked empty, so she put the twig in the nest. suddenly, a little bird flew down and saw the twig. it was so happy and chirped a song. 

lily was happy too because she made the bird happy. from that day on, lily would always look for twigs to put in the bird's nest. and the little bird would always sing a happy song whenever it found a new twig in its nest. the end.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to sing and dance in her room all day long. one day, she heard a loud horn outside her window. she went outside to see what was happening.

there was a big parade in the street with lots of people and animals. lily saw a famous singer on a float with a big horn. she ran up to the singer and said, "i love to sing too!" the singer smiled and said, "well, why don't you come up here and sing with me?" 

lily was so happy and climbed up onto the float. together, they sang a beautiful song and played the horn. everyone in the parade clapped and cheered for them. lily felt like a superstar and knew that she would always remember this special moment.

once upon a time, there was an adventurous little girl called sarah. she loved to explore everywhere and learn new things. today, sarah wanted to go to the shop. she put on her shoes and grabbed her bag. 

sarah said goodbye to her mommy and walked out the door. she felt so brave and excited - it was her first ever time walking alone. she skipped and hopped all the way to the shop. 

once sarah got to the shop, she started to look around. there were so many things to see and choose from! she saw the sweet treats and colourful toys, and even picked out a new, sparkly headband for herself. 

when it was time to go home, sarah said goodbye to the shop keeper, who had helped her find some goodies for her friends at home. holding onto her shopping bag, sarah took a deep breath and started her walk home. even when it got a bit dark, she wasn't scared - she knew she would make it home safe. 

when sarah finally arrived home, she couldn"t stop talking about her wonderful, adventurous day. she was so proud of herself for taking the journey all by herself and couldn't wait to do it all over again!

once upon a time, there was a kind girl named lily. she had many clothes but didn't like to show off. she was humble and always helped her friends. one day, her friend tommy came to her and said, "i don't have any clothes to wear." so, lily took him to her room and showed him her clothes. tommy was amazed and asked, "how many clothes do you have?" lily said, "i don't know, let's count them together." they counted and found out that lily had many clothes. 

tommy was happy to wear one of lily's clothes. he felt good and thanked her. from that day on, tommy and lily became good friends. the moral of the story is that it's good to be humble and share what you have with others.

lily and ben were having lunch with their mom. they liked to eat soup and bread. lily wanted some salt on her bread, but the salt was on the other side of the table. she tried to reach for it, but she could not. she asked her mom to pass the salt, but her mom was busy talking on the phone.

"mom, can you give me the salt, please?" lily said.

but her mom did not hear her. lily felt angry. she wanted the salt now. she stood up on her chair and stretched her arm. she almost touched the salt, but then she lost her balance. she fell off the chair and knocked over the soup bowl. the soup spilled all over the table and the floor. lily cried out loud.

mom heard the noise and dropped the phone. she ran to lily and hugged her. she was frightened. she checked if lily was hurt.

"lily, are you okay? what happened?" mom asked.

"i wanted the salt, but i could not reach it. i fell and made a mess. i'm sorry, mom." lily said.

mom kissed lily and said, "it's okay, sweetie. i'm glad you're not hurt. but you should not stand on the chair. that's dangerous. next time, just wait for me or ask ben to help you. okay?"

lily nodded and said, "okay, mom. i'm sorry, ben."

ben smiled and said, "it's okay, lily. i'll help you clean up. and i'll share my salt with you."

lily and ben hugged each other. mom smiled and said, "that's very nice of you, ben. you're a good brother. now let's finish our lunch and then we'll have some cookies. how does that sound?"

lily and ben said, "yay! cookies!"

they all laughed and ate their lunch. they were happy.

once upon a time, there was an elderly lady who loved to sit on a bench in the park. she would watch the children play and smile at them. one day, a little girl came to sit on the bench next to her. they started to talk and the elderly lady was happy to have a new friend.

as they talked, the little girl noticed that the bench was old and falling apart. she asked the lady if she knew why the bench was like that. the lady explained that many people had sat on the bench over the years and some had not taken care of it. they had left it dirty and broken.

the little girl understood and promised to take care of the bench from now on. she knew that it was important to take care of things that we share with others. and so, she cleaned the bench and made sure that no one would part it again. the elderly lady was proud of her new friend and they continued to sit on the bench together, enjoying the park and each other's company.

anna and ben were twins who liked to play with their toys. they had many toys, but they did not like to share them. sometimes they fought over who got to play with what.

one day, their mom told them to clean up their room. she said they had to put their toys in the right places and make their beds. she said she would check on them in ten minutes.

anna and ben looked at their room. it was very messy. there were toys everywhere, on the floor, on the bed, on the desk. they did not know where to start.

"i want to play with the train," ben said.

"no, i want to play with the train," anna said.

they started to pull the train from each other.

"stop it, you two," their mom said, coming back to the room. "you have not cleaned up your room yet. you have to settle this and be organized. how about you take turns with the train? anna, you can play with it for five minutes, then give it to ben. ben, you can play with it for five minutes, then put it away. then you can both help each other clean up the rest of the toys. ok?"

anna and ben nodded. they agreed to share the train and be organized. they played with the train for five minutes each, then put it in the toy box. they also picked up their other toys and put them in the right places. they made their beds and folded their clothes.

their mom came back to the room again. she smiled when she saw how clean and organized it was.

"good job, anna and ben," she said. "you settled your problem and worked together. i am proud of you. now you can have a snack and watch a show."

anna and ben hugged their mom and thanked her. they were happy that they cleaned up their room and shared their toys. they learned that being organized and settling things was better than fighting and being messy.

once there was a fisherman. he was out fishing in his boat one day. the wind was strong and the water was bumpy. the fisherman wanted to be safe, so he stopped the boat. suddenly, he heard something in the water. he ran to the side and looked over. he saw a small duck, swimming around. the fisherman smiled and the duck came right up to the boat. he petted it's soft feathers and the duck chirped happily. the fisherman felt safe in the boat with the duck, so he stopped and enjoyed the moment. after a few minutes, the duck swam away. the fisherman waved goodbye and carried on fishing. he felt safe and happy.

once upon a time there was a little girl named mary. mary loved to play outside in the sunshine. 
one day mary found a beautiful golden chain in the garden. she picked it up and it sparkled in the light. she couldn't wait to show her mom. 
but when she went to show her mom the chain, it had disappeared! 
mary didn't know where it had gone. she started to feel very sorry. 
she asked her mom, "mommy, did you mind the chain?"
her mom said, "oh no, sweetheart. i'm sorry. i didn't see it."
mary smiled and said, "that's ok mommy. i'm sure it will turn up soon." 
and it did! in the end, mary found her chain in the corner of the garden. she was so excited! she put it on and felt like a princess. from that day, mary never forgot to mind her belongings.

once upon a time there was a kid called tom. tom was three and he loved to clean. every morning he would clean his room and every night he would clean his toys. tom thought that cleaning was fun! 

one day tom tried to clean his secret hiding place, his secret was so special he kept it all to himself. he tried his best to clean it but could not move the messy stuff out. he pushed and he pulled, but nothing worked. he got so mad he started screaming and throwing things. 

tom's mother heard the noise and came to see what had happened. she was very angry and scolded tom for being so crazy. she told him it was not ok to make such a mess. tom was so embarrassed and tried to hide his secret. 

his mother was not happy and told tom she was very disappointed in him. she said it was time for him to learn that cleaning was important. from that day forward, tom was very careful to keep his room clean and to always hide his secrets. the bad ending was that tom was sad and no longer thought cleaning was so fun.

tommy loved spaghetti. he ate it every day for lunch. he liked to twirl it on his fork and slurp it up. he also liked to play with it and make funny shapes on his plate.

one day, tommy was eating spaghetti with his mom and dad. he was having fun making a spaghetti snake on his plate. he wanted to show his mom and dad his snake. he picked up his plate and said, "look, mom, look, dad, a spaghetti snake!"

but tommy was not careful. he moved his plate too fast and the spaghetti snake fell off. it landed on the floor and made a big mess. tommy's mom and dad were not happy. they looked at tommy with angry faces.

"tommy, what did you do?" his mom asked. "you made a big mess with your spaghetti. that is not how you eat your lunch. you have to be careful and respectful."

"tommy, you are in trouble," his dad said. "you have to clean up your mess and say sorry. and you have to go to your room. you are punished. no more spaghetti for you today."

tommy felt bad. he did not mean to make a mess. he just wanted to have fun. he was also frightened. he did not like to be punished. he did not like to go to his room. he did not like to miss his spaghetti.

he started to cry. he said, "i'm sorry, mom, i'm sorry, dad. i love spaghetti. please don't punish me. please let me eat my spaghetti."

but his mom and dad did not change their minds. they made him clean up his mess and go to his room. they said, "maybe next time you will learn to eat your spaghetti properly. and maybe next time you will listen to us and be a good boy."

tommy went to his room. he was sad and hungry. he wished he had not played with his spaghetti. he wished he had not made a mess. he wished he had not been punished. he hoped his mom and dad would forgive him and love him. he hoped he could have spaghetti again soon.

once upon a time, there was a little bird. the bird was very happy and liked to sing all day. one day, the bird saw an arrow on the ground. the bird was curious and went to see the arrow. the arrow was sharp and dangerous. 

suddenly, a big cat appeared. the cat wanted to catch the bird. the bird tried to fly away, but the cat was too fast. the bird laid down on the ground, hoping the cat would be gentle. 

but the cat was not gentle. the cat caught the bird with its sharp claws. the bird could not fly away anymore. the bird was very sad and could not sing anymore. the end.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. one day, her mom told her to sit on a towel while she played with her toys. lily was busy playing with her dolls and didn't listen to her mom. 

suddenly, lily spilled her juice on the floor. her mom said, "i told you to sit on the towel. now we have to clean up the mess." 

lily learned her lesson and always sat on the towel when she played with her toys. one day, her mom surprised her with a new toy. lily was so excited that she forgot to sit on the towel. but this time, her mom had put a towel under the toy to catch any spills. 

lily was happy and said, "thank you, mommy! i will always remember to sit on the towel."

maggie the kangaroo marched through the woods. she was happy and full of energy. suddenly, she heard a voice yelling. it was her friend johnny.

"maggie, stop! there's a big hole in the ground ahead," he said. 

maggie stopped and looked. she could see the hole and it was very big.

"i'm scared," said maggie. "i don't want to hurt my foot trying to jump over it."

but johnny was brave. he marched right up to the edge of the hole and said, "i know how to get across. follow me!"

maggie followed johnny. he used a large stick to help him balance as he hopped from one side of the hole to the other.

when he was safely across the other side, he called out to maggie, "see, it was easy! come on, you can do it too!"

maggie got ready and started to jump. she easily leapt over the hole and safely landed on the other side. maggie was so happy. she had conquered the big hole and didn't get hurt!

once upon a time, there was a hero. he was very brave and strong. he saved people from danger. one day, he went to sleep in his bed. he had a dream that made him nervous. he woke up in the middle of the night and couldn't go back to sleep.

the next day, the hero went to save people from a fire. he was nervous because it was a big fire. he went inside the building to save a little girl. but the fire was too strong. the hero couldn't save the little girl and he got hurt. he was taken to the hospital, but he didn't make it. 

everyone was sad that the hero had died. they remembered him as a brave and strong hero who saved many lives.

once upon a time, there was a noisy bird named bobo. bobo lived in a big tree with his family. they loved to sing and play all day long. bobo's tree was near a patch of pretty flowers. the flowers were red, blue, and yellow.

one day, bobo decided to fly to the patch of flowers. he wanted to find a nice flower for his mom. bobo looked at all the pretty flowers. he saw a big red flower, a small blue flower, and a bright yellow flower. bobo thought very hard about which flower to pick.

finally, bobo decided to pick the bright yellow flower. he knew his mom would love it. he flew back to the big tree with the flower in his beak. when bobo gave the flower to his mom, she was very happy. they all sang and played together in their noisy, happy tree.

one day, a little girl was walking in the woods. she was feeling kind and wanted to discover something new. suddenly, she heard a buzzing noise. she looked around, and she found it. it was a mosquito! she had never seen one before and she was excited. she reached out her hand to touch it. the mosquito was very kind and stayed still. the girl was happy to have made a new friend. she thanked the mosquito, and continued her walk. she had discovered something new, and it made her feel very happy.

once upon a time, there were two friends. one was a little girl and the other was a swan. the girl was very flexible and loved to dance, and the swan was just as flexible and loved to fly.

one day, the girl and the swan were playing in their favorite field when the girl shouted, "let's play a game!"

the swan smiled and asked, "what kind of game?"

the little girl suggested, "how about hide and seek?"

the swan thought this sounded like fun, so they both shut their eyes. the girl counted to five and then opened her eyes to look for the swan.

but the swan was nowhere to be found! the girl searched high and low but there was still no sign of the swan.

finally, after a while, the girl spotted the swan in a tree. it had been so flexible that it had even managed to fit itself in a little nook in the tree.

the girl shouted out, "i found you!"

and the swan flew down to join her, and together they had a lot of fun!

once upon a time, there was a little bird who lived in a nest in a tree. the bird was very cheerful and flew around the garden, looking for food. one day, the little bird was very hungry and spotted something white and fluffy coming out of the tree.

the bird fluttered down and pecked at the white fluffy stuff. when he tasted it, he found it was delicious! he was eating steam!

"yum!" the little bird said, as he enjoyed his treat.

suddenly, a voice from above called out, "little bird, what have you found?" it was a big owl who lived in the same tree.

"i'm eating steam!" the bird said, happily.

"ah, how nice," the owl said with a smile. "have a good meal and enjoy your day."

the little bird ate all the steam and flew off as happy as can be. since then, he knew to look for steam if he was feeling a bit hungry.

anna and ben are friends. they like to play outside. but today the weather is bad. it is cold and wet. they cannot go to the park or ride their bikes.

"let's play inside," anna says. "we can make signs for our rooms."

"ok," ben says. "that sounds fun. what kind of signs do you want to make?"

anna thinks for a moment. she likes modern things. she likes bright colors and shapes. she says, "i want to make a sign with a star and a heart. and i want to write my name in big letters. what about you?"

ben likes modern things too. but he likes different colors and shapes. he says, "i want to make a sign with a circle and a square. and i want to write my name in small letters. let's go get some paper and crayons."

they go to anna's room. they find some paper and crayons. they start to make their signs. they draw and color. they write their names. they are happy. they show each other their signs.

"wow, your sign is very modern," anna says. "i like your circle and square. they look cool."

"thank you," ben says. "your sign is very modern too. i like your star and heart. they look pretty."

they smile at each other. they are proud of their signs. they hang them on their doors. they say, "these are our rooms. these are our signs. we are modern friends."

one day, sammy was walking down the street and saw something green. he ran over to it and discovered it was a classroom! he peeked inside and saw a kind teacher inside.

"hi there!" said the teacher.

"hi!" said sammy.

"would you like to come inside?" asked the teacher.

"yes!" said sammy and jumped inside. he looked around and the classroom was filled with fun toys and books.

the teacher smiled. "would you like me to bring you a snack?"

"yes please!" said sammy, and the teacher went to the kitchen and brought back a yummy snack.

sammy was so happy and ate his snack with a big smile on his face. he had a wonderful time in the green classroom.

one day, a little girl named lucy was playing in the park. she saw a monkey swinging from a tree. lucy was so excited to see a monkey!

"good monkey," lucy said.

the monkey turned and smiled at lucy.

"i like you," said the monkey.

lucy was very happy, so she hugged the monkey. they decided to go for a walk together, and they had lots of fun.

suddenly, something amazing happened. lucy could fly, just like the monkey! they flew around the park together, laughing and having a great time in the air.

at the end of the day, lucy and the monkey hugged goodbye. they promised each other they would both fly together again soon. lucy waved goodbye as the monkey flew away.

what a good day, lucy thought. a day she would always remember.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to sleep with her pillow every night. one day, lily's daddy washed her pillow and it felt unusual to her. she didn't like it because it felt different from her usual pillow.

lily cried and said, "daddy, my pillow doesn't feel right. it's unusual and i don't like it."

daddy said, "oh no, i'm sorry. let me remind you that it's still your pillow, it just got cleaned. it will feel better soon."

lily felt better after daddy reminded her and she hugged her pillow tightly. from that day on, she remembered that sometimes things can feel unusual, but it doesn't mean they are bad.

one day, tommy was upset. he was crying and didn't know why. he was walking around the room looking for his teddy bear. then he saw something waving near the curtains. he walked closer and saw his teddy bear! now he felt much better and he grabbed the bear and hugged it. he was so happy that he walked over to his mom and gave her a big hug. she smiled and wiped his tears away. then they both walked out of the room and went to play in the garden.

timmy was afraid. he didn't like the dark. he felt like he was peeking into something that he wasn't supposed to see. he curled up in the corner and tried not to look.

just then, timmy's mom came in. she had seen his face and she knew he was scared.

"what's wrong, my little one?" she asked.

timmy trembled. "i'm...i'm afraid."

his mom hugged him and said, "you don't have to be afraid. i'm here to keep you safe."

she turned on the light, and timmy felt better.

"let's take a peek around," she said.

timmy smiled and they went to explore the room. his mom held his hand, and he felt less fearful.

"it's alright," she said. "i will always be here to protect you."

timmy nodded. he knew that his mom would keep him safe, no matter what.

once there was a girl called molly. on a bright and sunny day, molly decided to go on an adventure. she got her hat and her backpack, and set out to explore. after some time, molly came to a tidy land. she had never been here before so she was excited. she looked around and there were so many fun things to do, from climbing trees to running down big hills.

suddenly, molly heard a noise. she looked around and saw a friendly dragon who asked her if she wanted to explore with him. molly said yes, and they set off together. on their journey they visited some amazing places and molly discovered lots of new things. 

at the end of their adventure, the dragon invited molly back to the tidy land. he said she could come whenever she wanted, which made her very happy. molly said thank you and promised to come back soon.

this was the start of an exciting new friendship between molly and the friendly dragon. molly couldn't wait to come back to the tidy land and explore more!

once upon a time there was a little girl called sally who loved fashion. one day she decided to search for the perfect dress. she looked everywhere as she wanted to find something special.

sally asked her mum to help her, so they started searching together. eventually they found the most beautiful dress, with a lot of flowers. sally was so happy that she shouted loudly with excitement.

when they arrived home, sally put the dress on. she looked in the mirror and couldn't believe how wonderful she looked. she twirled around and showed her mum, who said she looked like a princess.

sally smiled proudly and thanked her mum for helping her find the perfect dress. and they were both happy. the end.

once upon a time, there was a little bear named teddy. teddy loved to eat honey, it was his favourite tasty thing in the whole wide world. one day, he found a big loop of honey and started eating it all up. but he didn't notice that the loop was a trap set by a mean old fox.

suddenly, the fox appeared and tried to catch teddy. but teddy was too fast for him and ran away. the fox warned teddy that he would catch him next time. teddy was scared and didn't know what to do.
