then, he remembered his friend, a wise owl who lived in the nearby tree. teddy went to the owl and told him everything. the owl told teddy to be careful and avoid the loop next time. teddy was grateful for the warning and promised to be more careful in the future. from that day on, teddy always looked out for traps and never got caught again.

one day, a little girl named lucy wanted to play a game. she thought of a fun quiz for her friends. she made a fake key and a real key. lucy put the keys in a box and locked it.

lucy called her friend tom to play the quiz. she said, "tom, i have a fun game. guess which key is fake and which one is real. if you guess right, i will give you a prize!" tom was excited to play the game.

tom thought hard and picked the fake key. lucy opened the box with the real key and gave tom a prize. they both laughed and had a great time playing the quiz. they played many more games and had a fun day together.

once upon a time there was a brave little girl named lucy. she was always filled with curiosity and explored the world around her. 

one day, she decided to get out of her house and explore the nearby park. she took a few steps until she came to an exit. she trembled as she thought of her parents and how they would react.

"what if they don't find me?" she thought.

however, her courage overtook her fear and she stepped out to explore the new world ahead of her. she looked around and saw a park filled with things she had never seen before. she was about to take her first step when she heard her parents' voices behind her. 

she was embarrassed to have been caught but also excited to show them all the new things she had discovered. they laughed, and lucy smiled. little did she know what would happen the next time she decided to explore.

once upon a time, there was a girl named jenny. she had big, blue eyes, soft blonde hair and a sweet smile. one day, while walking, she noticed a poor little bird, all alone in the corner of a parking lot.

jenny kneeled down, and the bird hopped onto her hand. jenny said to the bird, â€œhello, little one. whatâ€™s wrong?â€ she opened her hand and the bird looked as if it was waiting for something. 

just then, a compassionate woman came running up to them. she asked jenny if the bird was hurt. jenny said, â€œi donâ€™t know. it doesnâ€™t look very happy.â€ 

the woman softly touched the bird and said, â€œit looks like its wing is caught. let me open this window and see if i can help.â€

jenny and the woman gently opened the window, and with a few quick motions, the woman freed the birdâ€™s wing. the bird quickly flew away, saying â€œtweet tweet!â€ the three of them stood and smiled. 

the compassionate woman thanked jenny for her kindness, and jenny thanked her for her help. after that, jenny skipped home happily, thinking about the bird and the nice woman.

once upon a time there was a small boy called sam. one day sam found some white clay at the beach. he was so excited to see what he could make from the clay. 

he got to work making things, like shapes and animals. he worked so hard that he soon forgot anything else around him. 

but then he heard someone say: "thank you sam, that is the most wonderful thing i have ever seen." 

sam was so surprised and he looked around to see who spoke. he couldn't see anyone so he looked down and saw a white rabbit smiling right at him. 

the rabbit thanked sam again and ran off. sam was so happy that he had made something that the bunny liked so much. he gave a big smile and thanked the bunny too!

once there was a brave bird. he lived on a cable. every morning he would sing. he sang for the sun and for the trees. he sang about the world around him. he sang even when he was scared.

one day, the cable began to sway. the brave bird held on tight, but he didn't stop singing. he sang louder and stronger. he sang to keep his courage up.

soon the storm was over. the brave bird was safe on his cable and his courage was strong. he spread his wings and sang with joy. his sweet song filled the sky and everybody smiled.

once upon a time there was a princess. she was very careless and did not think very much. one day she decided to go for a spin. she ran and ran and twirled around in circles until she felt so dizzy she fell down. the princess felt silly and laughed. she got back up and spun and spun until she was so tired she had to rest. she was happy she was having so much fun but she remembered she had to be careful. so she ran back inside and found a spot to sit and rest. the princess was happy to be safe, and happy that she had learned to be more careful.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named tim. tim had a toy trumpet that he loved to play. he played it all day long. it made a loud noise, but tim did not care. he thought it was fun.

one day, tim's mom said, "tim, you must resist playing the trumpet. it is making a terrible noise." tim felt sad, but he wanted to be a good boy. so, he tried very hard not to play the trumpet. but it was not easy for him.

the next day, tim's mom saw that he was trying to be good. she said, "tim, i am proud of you for not playing the terrible trumpet. let's go to the park and play with your friends." tim was very happy. he knew that being a good boy made his mom happy too.

once, there was a big race. many kids ran in the race. one boy, tom, wanted to win. he wanted the victory. he saw another boy, sam, who was very fast. tom was jealous of sam.

on the day of the race, tom thought of a plan. he saw a big bag. he decided to fill it with sand. when sam was not looking, tom put the heavy bag on sam's back. sam did not know.

during the race, sam was slow. he said, "why am i so slow?" tom ran fast and won the race. he was happy with his victory. but then, someone saw the heavy bag on sam's back. they knew tom cheated.

everyone was mad at tom. they gave the victory to sam. tom was sad and had no friends.

once there was a girl named daisy. she was 3 years old and wanted to get married. she asked her mom and dad if she could marry.

but her mom and dad said, "no, you are still too young to marry." daisy was so jealous of all the other grown ups who could marry.

then daisy had an idea. she got a special pot and put it on her head and pretended it was a wedding veil. she ran around the house saying, "i'm married! i'm married!"

her mom and dad watched and laughed. they were happy to see daisy so happy.

when it was time to go to bed, daisy went happily to her bed, dreaming of the day when she really could marry.

once upon a time, there was a colorful bird. the bird liked to pick things. one day, the bird saw a shiny thing on the ground. the bird did not know it was a weapon.

the bird wanted the shiny weapon. so, the bird went down to pick it up. the bird was very happy with the shiny weapon. the bird showed the weapon to all its friends. the friends were scared of the weapon, but the bird did not know why.

then, one day, the bird tried to play with the weapon. the bird got hurt by the weapon. the bird's friends were sad. the bird did not play anymore. the end.

once upon a time there was a little boy. he liked to play in the kitchen. one day he was playing with a silly toy there. his mommy walked in and saw him. she wanted to encourage him to do something else. she said "let's do something new!" she grabbed a book and they sat down in the kitchen. she read to him and he loved it. the boy smiled and laughed as he listened. his mommy was so happy to see him having fun. she continued to encourage him to try different things. the little boy had so much fun with his mommy that day. he was glad she had encouraged him to try something new.

once upon a time, there was a young bunny named bob. bob had big ears that he liked to sort leaves with. he would hop around the forest, using his ears to pick up leaves and sort them by color.

one day, bob met a squirrel named sue. sue saw bob sorting leaves with his ears and said, "hi, bob! i like how you sort leaves with your big ears. can you teach me?"

bob was happy to help. he showed sue how to pick up leaves with her paws and sort them too. they had a fun day sorting leaves together.

at the end of the day, bob and sue had sorted all the leaves in the forest. they were proud of their work and became good friends. from that day on, they would always play and sort leaves together.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy who loved to eat potatoes. one day, timmy's mom brought home a big bag of potatoes from the store. timmy was so happy and started to play with the potatoes.

timmy's friend, billy, came over to play. billy saw the potatoes and said, "wow, those potatoes are big! can i have one?" timmy said, "sure, but be polite and ask my mom first."

billy went to ask timmy's mom for a potato. she said, "of course, you can have one, but be careful not to drop it, they weigh a lot!" billy took a potato and went back to play with timmy.

later that day, timmy and billy were playing catch with the potato when suddenly, billy dropped it. the potato fell on billy's foot and hurt him badly. billy had to go to the hospital and couldn't play with timmy for a long time.

from that day on, timmy never played with potatoes again. he learned that they can be heavy and dangerous if not handled politely.

once upon a time, there lived a big pig. the pig was very proud and always thought he was the best. one day, the pig went to a market and saw a little pig.

the big pig laughed and said: "look at that small pig, how silly he is".

the little pig heard it and said: "i may be small, but i also have something to offer". 

the big pig was so surprised, he asked: "what can you offer?".

the little pig replied: "i may be small but i can offer friendship and kindness".

the big pig realised he had been mean and said sorry. from that day on, the two pigs became friends. they worked together and split the work down each side.

the moral of the story is that no matter how big or small you are, you can always offer friendship and kindness.

once upon a time, there was an ordinary clown. she was so happy and liked to make people giggle. everywhere she went, people stopped to listen.

one day, the clown was walking down the street when she heard a very sad voice coming from behind a bush. she stopped and listened. it was a little mouse! he was crying so she asked what was wrong.

the mouse told her that he had lost his way home. the clown was so kind. she dried the mouse's tears with her big yellow handkerchief and told him that she would help him find his way home. 

so the clown and the mouse went on a journey and they looked in the gardens, in the fields and on the bridges. at last, the clown helped the mouse find his home.

the mouse was so thankful and so was the clown. she gave the mouse a big hug and a kind smile and then she went on her way, bringing happy giggles everywhere she went.

once upon a time there was a little girl named janey. she lived with her mommy and daddy, and had a pet dog she loved very much.

one day, daddy brought home a special white vest for janey. she was so excited to wear it!

but then daddy said, "janey, if you want to wear this special vest, you must behave well."

janey was worried, but she nodded and said, "i will, daddy."

daddy smiled and said, "i know you can do it, janey."

so janey did her best to be a good girl and behave very well. after a few days, daddy said, "well done janey, you can wear the special white vest now."

janey was so happy! she put on the vest and smiled. daddy was so proud of her.

the end.

once upon a time, there was a little fish named bubbles. bubbles lived in a big ocean with lots of other fish. one day, bubbles was swimming when he saw a big reef in the distance. bubbles wanted to explore the reef, so he swam towards it. 

as bubbles got closer to the reef, he saw a big, scary shark swimming towards him. "oh no!" cried bubbles. "what should i do?" 

"swim away!" said a friendly crab who was hiding in the reef. "but i don't know how to strike the shark," said bubbles. 

"you don't need to strike the shark," said the crab. "just swim away as fast as you can!" bubbles listened to the crab and swam away from the shark as fast as he could. from that day on, bubbles knew to be careful when exploring distant reefs.

the sky was gloomy as he stumbled on. he had been walking for a long time and his feet were tired. suddenly, he saw something lying in the grass. it was a steel box! he picked it up and found a key inside. excitedly, he opened the box. inside was a toy car!

he smiled and said, â€œoh wow! i can play with this car!â€

he put the box down, and with a little stumble, he pushed the car along. he played with it for hours and even though the sky was still gloomy, he was happy.

once upon a time, there was a pupil named tim. tim was a restless boy who liked to run and play all day. one day, tim saw a girl named sue. sue was very nice and they became good friends.

one day, tim and sue had a big fight. tim wanted to play with his toy car, but sue wanted to play with her doll. they could not agree on what to play. this made them very sad.

then, tim had an idea. he asked sue, "will you marry me when we grow up?" sue thought about it and said, "yes, i will marry you." they were happy again and played together all day.

once upon a time, there was a little child named timmy. timmy loved to explore the world around him. one day, he went for a walk in the forest. he saw many interesting things like colorful flowers, big trees, and small animals.

as he was walking, he saw a glowing light in the distance. he was curious and wanted to see what it was. when he got closer, he saw that it was a firefly. the firefly was glowing and it looked so pretty. 

timmy said, "hello little firefly, you are so interesting. why do you glow?" the firefly replied, "i glow because it helps me find my way in the dark." timmy smiled and said, "that's so cool. i wish i could glow too!" 

from that day on, timmy loved to watch the fireflies glow at night. he would always remember the interesting conversation he had with the little firefly.

once, there was a small girl named sue. she wanted to learn a new trick. every day, she watched the birds fly outside her window. she wanted to fly, too. 

so sue decided to find a way to fly. she looked around and saw a wall. it was very thick and tall. sue wanted to learn to fly over it.

she asked her parents to help her. they showed her how to use her arms and legs. she put her hands against the wall and tried to jump. she pushed off the wall and jumped higher and higher. soon, she was flying over the wall! 

sue was so excited. she had learned how to fly! every day, she practiced and got better and better. sue was so proud of herself. she was flying!

once upon a time, there was a cat. the cat was very confused. it did not know where to go. then, a kind person came by and gave the cat some food. the cat was happy and ate the food. the person smiled and petted the cat. the cat was no longer confused and followed the person home. they became best friends forever.

mia and leo are friends. they like to play together. one day, they go to the park with their moms. they see a big fountain with water. they run to the fountain and splash each other.

"look, mia, the water is so cool and nice!" leo says.

"yes, leo, it is fun to play with water!" mia says.

they laugh and have fun. but then, they hear a loud noise. it is a duck. the duck is angry. the duck thinks the fountain is his home. he does not like mia and leo. he quacks at them in a mean way.

"quack, quack, quack! go away, go away, go away!" the duck says.

mia and leo are scared. they do not understand the duck. the duck has a different language. they run away from the fountain and go to their moms.

"mama, mama, there is a mean duck in the fountain!" mia says.

"mama, mama, the duck does not like us!" leo says.

their moms hug them and calm them down.

"don't worry, mia and leo. the duck is just protecting his home. he does not know you are nice. he has a different language than you. but you can still be friends with him. you just have to be gentle and respectful." their moms say.

mia and leo nod. they understand. they go back to the fountain. they say sorry to the duck. they give him some bread. they watch him eat and swim. they smile and wave.

"hello, duck. we are mia and leo. we are your friends." they say.

the duck quacks back. he is not angry anymore. he is happy. he has new friends.

"quack, quack, quack! hello, mia and leo. you are my friends." he says.

mia and leo are happy too. they have learned a new language. they have made a new friend. they play with the duck and the water. they are regular kids. they are having fun.

once upon a time, there was a big dog named max. max liked to play and run outside with his friends. one day, max's owner said they were going on a trip and they had to pack their bags. max helped by putting his favorite toy in the bag.

when they got to their destination, max saw a nurse who was very nice. she gave him a treat and petted him. max was happy and alert because he liked the nurse.

at night, max slept in his own bed and dreamt about playing with his friends again. the next day, they went on a walk and max saw a squirrel. he barked and ran after it, but his owner told him to come back. max listened and went back to his owner.

after their walk, they went back to their room and max helped pack their bags again. he put his toy back in the bag and was ready to go home. max had a great trip and couldn't wait to play with his friends again. the end.

ben and lily were twins. they liked to play in the park with their dog, spot. one day, they saw a big, fat cat on a tree. spot barked at the cat. the cat hissed at spot.

"let's go see the cat," ben said. he wanted to touch the cat.

"no, ben, it's too high," lily said. she was scared of the cat. "and it's getting dark. we have to go home."

but ben did not listen. he ran to the tree and tried to climb it. the cat scratched his hand. ben cried out loud.

"ben, are you okay?" lily asked. she ran to him and hugged him. she saw blood on his hand. she was very worried.

"ow, ow, ow," ben said. he was in pain. he was sorry he did not listen to lily.

"come on, ben, we have to go home," lily said. she took his hand and helped him walk. spot followed them. they walked fast. they did not like the dark.

soon, they saw their house. they saw their mom at the door. she was happy to see them, but she saw ben's hand. she was angry and sad.

"what happened to your hand, ben?" she asked. she took him inside and cleaned his wound. she put a band-aid on it.

"i tried to touch a fat cat on a tree," ben said. he looked down. he was ashamed.

"that was not a good idea, ben," mom said. she hugged him and kissed him. "you have to be careful and listen to lily. she is your sister and she loves you."

"i'm sorry, mom. i'm sorry, lily," ben said. he hugged them back. he learned his lesson.

the end.

lily and ben are friends. they like to play in the park. one day, they see a big balloon. it is red and shiny. it has a price tag on it. it says "one dollar".

"wow, look at the balloon!" lily says. "i want it!"

"me too!" ben says. "but we have no money."

they look at the balloon. they feel sad.

a lady walks by. she sees lily and ben. she smiles at them.

"hello, kids. do you like the balloon?" she asks.

"yes, we do!" lily and ben say.

"well, i have an extra dollar. do you want to buy the balloon?" she asks.

lily and ben are surprised. they nod their heads.

"thank you, lady!" they say.

the lady gives them the dollar. they give it to the man who sells the balloon. he gives them the balloon.

lily and ben are happy. they hold the balloon together. they jump and laugh.

"thank you, thank you, thank you!" they say to the lady.

"you're welcome, kids. enjoy the balloon. but be careful, don't let it fly away!" she says.

she waves at them and walks away.

lily and ben look at each other. they smile.

"you are my best friend!" lily says.

"you are my best friend too!" ben says.

they kiss each other on the cheek. they are glad. they have a balloon and a friend.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved lollipops and always wanted to eat them. one day, her mommy gave her a lollipop and said, "lily, you can have this yummy lollipop, but you have to climb the stairs and go to your room to eat it."

lily was so excited to eat her lollipop that she quickly climbed the stairs. but when she got to her room, she saw her little brother crying. he had fallen down and hurt his knee. lily knew that she had to help her brother first, so she gave him the lollipop to make him feel better.

her mommy saw what happened and said, "lily, you did the right thing. it's always important to help others before we think about ourselves." lily smiled and felt happy that she could make her brother feel better. from that day on, lily learned that being kind and helpful to others is more important than having a yummy lollipop.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she lived in a small house with her mom and dad. one day, her mom took her to a fancy store where they sold luxury toys. lily saw a beautiful doll and asked her mom to buy it for her. her mom said, "we can't buy everything we want, lily. that doll is too expensive."

lily felt sad and thought that she would never have that doll. but then, her mom said, "let's go to the park and have some fun." at the park, lily saw a little boy who was dizzy and couldn't walk straight. she asked him if he was okay, and he said he hadn't eaten anything all day. lily's mom bought him some food, and the little boy felt better.

lily realized that having luxury toys wasn't as important as helping others. she felt happy that she could help the little boy and thought that being kind was the best thing in the world. from that day on, lily always thought about how she could help others and make them happy.

once upon a time there was a little girl named clarissa. she loved to explore the world around her.

today, clarissa was very excited because she wanted to go fishing with her dad. they were going to the big lake close to their house.

when they arrived at the lake, clarissa's dad put a bait on the hook, and then he said to clarissa, "look at that beautiful water. do you think that we can print some fishes for dinner?"

clarissa was so excited and she said, "yes, i believe we can print fish today!"

they both casted their line in the lake and waited patiently for a fish to take the bait. soon enough, a fish was available. clarissa and her dad cheered with joy! they spent the whole day printing fish and finally, they had enough for a delicious dinner. 

at the end of the day, clarissa was very happy with all the new experiences she had while fishing. this was a memory that will last forever!

once upon a time there was a special girl called mary. mary liked to organize things - shoes, toys and even books! one day, mary's mommy said to her, "honey, i have a fun task for you. i need you to organize all the videos in the living room." 

mary said, "ok mommy!" and got to work. she put the videos in order and lined them up neatly. 

when she finished her task, mommy said, "great job! you are a very organized girl. as a reward i am going to make you a yummy cake. what flavour would you like?" 
mary said, "i love chocolate cake." 

mommy said, "great! i'll make you your favourite chocolate cake." 

mary smiled and waited patiently for the cake. when it was ready, it was delicious! mary was happy to have a yummy cake as a reward for her organizing.

one day, mommy and daddy bought an orange thing. it was big and round, and it had a handle on one side. mommy and daddy told their little girl that it was a magical thing and that it needed to be decorated. 

so, the little girl asked mommy and daddy for some colors to decorate with. they gave her markers, paint, ribbon, and glitter. she squealed with excitement. 

the little girl started drawing with her markers. she made little circles, some orange and some not. she also added some glitter to the thing to make it shiny. 

mommy and daddy had to help her with the ribbon. she put big, looping bows on the top of the orange thing. 

when she was done decorating, mommy and daddy told her what the thing was: it was a special pumpkin! the little girl laughed with joy.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to eat cereal for breakfast every morning. one day, her mom gave her a bowl of cereal that tasted very harsh. lily didn't like it at all, but she didn't want to hurt her mom's feelings, so she ate it all up.

after breakfast, lily went to play in the park with her friends. they ran around and played tag, but lily started to feel tired. she sat down on a bench and tried to relax. suddenly, she remembered the harsh cereal and felt sick. her friends noticed she wasn't feeling well and asked if she wanted to go home.

lily nodded and her friends helped her walk back home. when she got there, her mom asked her how she was feeling. lily told her about the harsh cereal and her mom apologized. she gave lily a new bowl of cereal that tasted much better and helped her relax on the couch until she felt better. from then on, lily always made sure to tell her mom if she didn't like something, so she wouldn't have to eat anything harsh again.

once upon a time, there was a clever little mouse. the mouse lived in a tower made of cheese. every day, the mouse would eat the cheese from the tower. 

one day, a big cat came along and saw the tower. the cat wanted to eat the cheese too. the mouse was scared and didn't know what to do. 

but the clever mouse had an idea. he ran up the tower and gained more cheese. then he threw the cheese at the cat and ran away. the cat was too busy eating the cheese to chase after the mouse. 

from that day on, the clever mouse knew how to protect his tower of cheese from any danger.

once upon a time, there was a bad man. he had a steak for dinner, and he wanted to eat it outside. he took the steak, and walked out onto the balcony. suddenly, he stumbled and the steak dropped from his hands. it fell down, far below and landed in the street. the bad man was so sad that he couldn't eat the steak. he knew he would never have it again. 

he stopped and looked down. he saw a little girl standing by the steak, in the street. she was smiling and eating it. the bad man felt better, he was happy that the little girl was enjoying his steak. 

the next day, the little girl came back with her mommy. the little girl gave the bad man a hug and said, 'thank you for letting me have the steak!' 

the bad man smiled, and they all lived happily ever after.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play with her toys and run around outside. but sometimes, she didn't behave very well. her mommy would say, "lily, you need to behave and listen to me."

one day, lily's mommy told her they were going to visit her grandma. lily was very excited because she loved her grandma. when they got there, lily saw a big clock on the wall. her grandma said, "lily, can you count the minutes on the clock?" lily counted to sixty and her grandma was very impressed. she said, "lily, you are so smart!" from that minute on, lily felt very proud of herself and made sure to behave well during their visit.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. he loved rockets and dreamed of going to space one day. one day, timmy saw a rocket in a store and asked his mom to buy it for him. but his mom disagreed, saying they didn't have enough money.

timmy was sad and went to his room to play with his toys. suddenly, he heard a knock on his door. it was his kind neighbor, mr. johnson. mr. johnson had overheard timmy and his mom talking and wanted to give timmy a rocket as a gift.

timmy was so happy and thanked mr. johnson. he played with his new rocket all day long and even invited his friend over to play with it too. they had so much fun together. timmy realized that sometimes people disagree, but there are always kind people who are willing to help.

once there was a little boy who was feeling very miserable. he had been playing outside all day and was feeling so very tired. 

he walked into a big room with a big fireplace in it. all of a sudden, he heard a strange popping sound coming from inside the fireplace. he peeked inside and there was a tiny, sparkly fairy!

the fairy wanted to thank the little boy for discovering her and said to him, "i want to pay you for being so brave, young one". the fairy waved her wand and tiny stars appeared all around him. she then said, "it's all yours now, my little buddy".

the little boy smiled and was so excited. he thanked the fairy and told her that he would never forget her. the fairy then flew away and the little boy waved goodbye. he was so happy that he had made a new, magical friend. 

he carried the tiny stars with him everywhere he went and never felt miserable again.

once there was a purple castle. it was a very happy place. everyone who lived there was always happy.
one day, things started to change. the castle began to look different. the walls were no longer purple, but blue.
the people inside the castle started to feel sad. they missed their purple walls. 
but then something magical happened. a big, beautiful purple dragon flew into the castle. he said he wanted to help.
the dragon waved his big wings and the castle walls changed back to purple. everyone inside was so happy.
the dragon said goodbye, flew away and the castle stayed the same happy, purple place.

once there was a little girl. she was three years old and liked to read books. one day, she saw a shiny book on the table. she went over and opened it up. inside, she found lots of helpful words. 

the little girl was excited to read all the words in the book. she turned to the first page and began to read. she was so happy to learn new things. with each turn of the page she discovered more helpful stories, pictures and phrases. 

the little girl smiled as she read the book. she was so glad the book was helpful and she could improve her reading skills. reading was so fun! the girl was so proud of herself and thankful for the book that helped her learn.

once upon a time there was a boy who was very eager. he wanted to play and tease everyone he saw because he thought it was fun. 

one day, the boy decided to tease an old man who was sitting at a park. the old man didn't look happy about it. he just stared back at the boy in silence. 

the boy thought the old man didn't understand his teasing. so he kept coming closer and closer to the old man and continued to tease him. 

finally, the old man stood up. he was bigger and stronger than the boy had thought. he looked very mad and said, "don't tease me anymore." 

the boy was scared and ran away. he was sad and wished he had stopped teasing the old man sooner. he learned a lesson that day: never tease the old man because he is hard to deal with.

once upon a time, a little boy named tim went to the zoo with his mom. they saw many animals like big lions, tall giraffes, and happy monkeys. tim was very excited and wanted to see more animals.

as they walked, tim saw a small bird on the ground. he didn't know that the bird was ignorant, and it didn't know how to fly. tim wanted to help the bird, so he tried to grab it with his little hands. but the bird was scared and ran away.

tim's mom saw what happened and explained to him that the bird was just scared. she told him that sometimes animals at the zoo need time to learn new things, just like little kids. tim understood and promised to be more careful next time. they continued to explore the zoo and had a wonderful day together.

once upon a time, there was a girl named lily. she liked to jog every day. one day, while jogging, she found a book on the ground. the book was a novel. it had a pretty cover with a delicate flower on it.

lily wanted to read the novel, but she had a problem. her little brother, tim, wanted to play with her. he did not like to wait. tim took the novel from lily and tried to read it too. but he was too young to understand the words.

lily was sad because she wanted to read her novel, and tim was sad because he wanted to play. then, lily had an idea. she decided to read the novel out loud to tim while they sat under a big tree. tim listened to the story and imagined all the fun things in it. they both were happy and enjoyed the story together.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved watching tv. one day, lily's mom told her they had to turn off the tv and go outside to play. lily didn't want to stop watching her favorite show, so she started to worry.

lily said to her mom, "mommy, i'm worried. what will happen if i miss my show?" her mom replied, "don't worry, lily. you can always watch it later."

lily went outside and played with her friends. they had so much fun together! when lily came back inside, she turned on the tv and saw something terrible. her favorite show wasn't on anymore! she was so sad.

lily's mom saw her sad face and asked, "what's wrong, lily?" lily replied, "my show isn't on anymore. it's terrible!" her mom hugged her and said, "it's okay, lily. we can find a new show to watch together." lily smiled and felt much better.

once upon a time, there was a little duck named ducky. ducky loved to swim in the stream all day long. one day, ducky saw a big, grumpy cat sitting by the stream. ducky didn't like the cat because it always made a frown on its face.

ducky wanted to swim in the stream but was scared of the cat. so, ducky thought of a plan. ducky went to his friends, the fish, and asked for their help. the fish were happy to help and swam around the cat, making it dizzy.

the cat got so dizzy that it fell asleep, and ducky could swim in the stream again. ducky was happy and thanked his fish friends. from that day on, the cat never bothered ducky again, and they all lived happily ever after.

bob wanted to race. he invited his friends to take part in an impressive race. everyone agreed and ran to the starting line.

bob pressed the button and the race began. all the racers were so fast but bob was the fastest. he passed the others and reached the finish line first.

the crowd was very excited. they shouted and clapped for bob.

the organizers printed out a certificate for bob. he was very proud to receive it.

bob was the winner of the race. he was so happy that he wanted to race again and again.

lily and ben were twins who liked to play near the lake. they saw a fisherman with a big net and a boat. he was catching many fish and putting them in a bucket.

"can we see the fish?" lily asked the fisherman.

"sure, but be careful. they are rough and slippery," the fisherman said. he showed them the fish. they had shiny scales and sharp teeth. lily and ben touched them gently.

"wow, they are so pretty!" ben said.

the fisherman smiled. "they are, but they are also food. i sell them at the market."

lily and ben nodded. they understood. they thanked the fisherman and waved goodbye.

they walked along the lake and saw many flowers. they were yellow, pink, and purple. they smelled sweet and looked soft.

"look, the flowers are blooming!" lily said.

"they are so pretty!" ben said.

they picked some flowers and made a crown for lily and a necklace for ben. they put them on and danced around.

they were happy and had fun. they liked the lake and the fisherman and the flowers. they went home and showed their mom and dad their gifts. they hugged them and said they loved them.

once upon a time, there lived a brave knight who was always ready to do daring deeds. one day, he was given an important request. he had to take a fierce candle to the king.

"where can i find the fierce candle?", asked the knight. his servant replied, "you can find it at the candle market."

the brave knight set off right away and soon he arrived at the candle market. after looking around, the knight discovered a beautiful, fierce candle and he carefully bought it.

the knight then set off on his journey to the king. after two hours, he finally arrived at the castle gates.

the guard asked, "what is your request?". the knight replied, "i have been sent here to give the king a fierce candle."

the guard smiled and said, "that's wonderful! please enter."

the knight was relieved and handed the candle to the king. the delighted king thanked the knight for his request and rewarded him generously. 

the brave knight returned home, feeling proud of himself. from then on, he was known as the knight of the fierce candle!

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to go camping with her family. they had a big tent that they would sleep in. one day, lily noticed that the wind was getting stronger and the rain was falling harder. the weather was becoming harsh. 

lily's dad said, "the wind and rain will increase, so we need to make sure our tent is secure." they added more pegs to the tent and tightened the ropes. lily helped her mom put blankets on the ground to make it cozy inside the tent. 

that night, the wind and rain increased even more, but lily and her family were safe and dry inside their tent. lily felt proud that she helped make their tent strong. she fell asleep listening to the sound of the rain tapping on the tent.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. one day, lily was playing outside when the rain started to fall. she didn't like the rain because it made her wet and cold. so she ran inside her house and sat by the window. 

lily's mom came to her and said, "don't be sad, lily. the rain will stop soon and the sky will be clear." lily felt a little better knowing that. but she still felt sad. 

then, her dad came and gave her a big hug. he said, "i'm here to comfort you, lily. the rain will stop and we can play outside again." lily felt much better now. she snuggled up with her dad and watched the raindrops fall from the window. she felt happy and safe with her family.

lily was a little girl who liked to play with her toys. she had a phone that could make sounds and lights. she loved to pretend that she was talking to her friends and family.

one day, she was playing with her phone in her room, when she heard a loud noise. she ran to the window and saw a big truck hit a car on the street. the car was broken and the driver was hurt. lily was scared and did not know what to do.

she remembered that her mom had taught her how to use the real phone to call for help. she ran to the kitchen and picked up the phone. she pressed the numbers that her mom had shown her and waited for someone to answer.

"hello, this is 911. what is your emergency?" a voice said.

"help, help, there is a big crash outside. a car is broken and a man is hurt. please come fast!" lily said.

"ok, calm down, little girl. what is your name and where are you?" the voice asked.

"my name is lily and i live on maple street. the crash is in front of my house. please hurry!" lily said.

"good job, lily. you are very brave and smart. we are sending help right now. stay on the line with me until they arrive, ok?" the voice said.

"ok, thank you. i hope the man is ok." lily said.

soon, lily heard sirens and saw lights. she saw an ambulance, a fire truck, and a police car. they stopped near the crash and the helpers got out. they helped the man out of the car and put him on a stretcher. they also put out the fire and moved the truck. lily watched from the window and felt relieved.

the voice on the phone told lily that she did a great job and that she should be proud of herself. he also told her to tell her mom what happened when she came home. lily thanked him and hung up the phone.

when her mom came home, lily told her everything. her mom hugged her and praised her for being so brave and helpful. she said that lily saved the man's life by calling for help. she also said that lily learned a very important lesson: that sometimes, even little people can do big things. lily smiled and felt happy. she knew that she had done the right thing.

once upon time there was a little girl named grace. grace was a very happy child and always smiled. one day grace did something wrong and made her mommy very angry. grace's mommy yelled at her and said, "grace you shouldn't have done that, why did you?"

grace felt very sad, she wanted to make her mommy happy again. she looked up to her mommy and said, "i'm sorry mommy, i wasn't thinking. i'm sorry."

her mommy smiled. she reached down and gave grace a big hug. she said, "it's okay grace, i forgive you. now let's put on your sunglasses and go outside and play."

grace smiled and put on her sunglasses. she and her mommy went to the park. grace saw some of her friends running around. they had so much fun playing.

after a while, they all got a bit sleepy. grace's mom said, "let's go home, it's time for bed." so they said goodbye to their friends and went back home.

grace's mom tucked her into bed and gave her a kiss. she said "good night, sweetie. i forgive you and i love you."

grace smiled and closed her eyes. she was so thankful to have a mommy like hers who would always forgive her. and they all lived happily ever after.

once upon a time, there was a small village far away. all the people in the village were very happy and they loved their village very much. one day, a big gray cloud appeared in the sky. the people in the village were scared and they started to worry. they realized that the gray cloud was not like a regular cloud!

suddenly, the village began to burn! everything around them was turning to ash and smoke. the people were sad and frightened and they tried to save their homes but they could not. all their homes were destroyed by the fire. 

the people of the village learned an important lesson that day. they learned that it is important to be prepared for danger and that it is important to look after each other. in the end, the people of the village rebuilt their homes and village and it was even more beautiful than ever!

once upon a time, there was a little girl named allie. allie was three years old and loved to play outside in the sunshine. one day, allie's dad said to her, "let's go get the swing!" the swing looked very impressive. allie ran to it and said, "daddy, can we swing on it?"

daddy laughed and said, "of course, my little one! i just need to release it from the tree first." allie watched as daddy released the swing from the tree. once it was free, allie hopped on and said, "this will be so much fun!"
 
daddy pushed allie on the swing, higher and higher until she reached the sky! allie felt so happy and free as the wind flew through her hair. she felt so impressed by her swing and couldn't believe how lucky she was to have it. 

when allie was done swinging, she jumped off and hugged her daddy. she said, "thank you daddy, i had so much fun!" daddy smiled and said, "you're welcome sweetheart, i'm glad you like it!"

allie and daddy continued to play the rest of the day. allie spent the rest of her days playing on her impressive swing.

tom and lily were playing in the park. they liked to run and jump and slide. they saw a big hole in the ground. it looked like a fun place to hide.

"let's go in there!" tom said. "maybe we can find a treasure!"

lily nodded. she followed tom into the hole. but it was not a fun place. it was a trap. there was a net on the top of the hole. it fell down and caught them. they could not get out.

"help! help!" tom and lily shouted. they were scared and sad. they started to cry.

a man heard them. he was walking his dog. he saw the net and the hole. he ran over and lifted the net. he helped tom and lily out of the trap.

"are you okay?" he asked. "who did this to you?"

tom and lily did not know. they hugged the man and thanked him. he was very kind. he gave them some cookies and water. he said he was a ranger. he worked in the park. he said the trap was for a rare animal. he said some bad people wanted to catch it and sell it. he said he would find them and stop them.

tom and lily felt better. they said goodbye to the man and his dog. they went back to their mom and dad. they told them what happened. they said they were sorry for being naughty. they said they learned a lesson. they said they would never go into a hole again.

sara and ben were playing with bubbles in the park. they had a big bottle of soap and a wand. they blew bubbles and watched them fly in the air. they laughed and clapped when the bubbles popped.

"look, sara, i made a big bubble!" ben said. he held the wand up and showed sara a huge bubble. it was shiny and round.

"wow, ben, that's a great bubble!" sara said. she was proud of her brother. he was good at making bubbles.

but then a mean boy came and saw the bubble. he wanted the bubble for himself. he ran to ben and grabbed the wand.

"give me that! i want the bubble!" he demanded. he tried to pull the wand from ben's hand.

"no, it's mine! go away!" ben said. he held on to the wand. he did not want to share with the mean boy.

"stop it! you are being rude!" sara said. she came to help ben. she pushed the mean boy away.

the mean boy was angry. he stomped his foot and shouted. he blew hard at the bubble. the bubble burst and splashed soap on his face.

"ow! that hurts!" he cried. he rubbed his eyes and ran away.

sara and ben hugged each other. they were happy. they had their wand and their bubbles. they did not like the mean boy. he was not nice.

they continued to play with bubbles. they made more big bubbles and small bubbles. they had fun. they were proud of their bubbles.

tom and sam are brothers. they like to play with their toys in their room. but they do not like to clean up. their room is very messy. there are cars, blocks, books, and dolls everywhere.

one day, mom says, "boys, you have to clean your room. it is too messy. if you do not clean it, you cannot go to the park later." tom and sam nod. they do not want to miss the park. they love the swings, the slide, and the sandbox.

but they do not really clean their room. they just hide their toys under the bed, in the closet, and behind the curtains. they think mom will not see them. they say, "we are done, mom. can we go to the park now?" mom nods. she does not check their room. she thinks they did a good job.

they go to the park and have fun. they swing, slide, and dig. they forget about their messy room. they are happy.

but when they come back home, they hear a loud sound. they run to their room. they see their toys all over the floor. the bed, the closet, and the curtains are broken. they see a big dog in their room. the dog is chewing on their toys. he is wagging his tail. he thinks he found a treasure.

mom comes after them. she sees the mess. she is very angry. she says, "boys, what did you do? you did not clean your room. you lied to me. you made a bigger mess. and you let the dog in. he is not our dog. he is the neighbor's dog. he ran away from his yard. how did he get in your room?"

tom and sam look at each other. they do not know what to say. they are very sorry. they wish they had cleaned their room. they nod. they say, "we are sorry, mom. we will clean our room. we will tell the truth. we will be good boys." mom nods. she says, "you better do that. and you have to say sorry to the neighbor. and you have to give back his dog. and you have to help me fix the bed, the closet, and the curtains. and you have to go to bed early. no more park for you today."

tom and sam nod. they do not like their punishment. but they know they deserve it. they learned their lesson. they will not be messy and lie again. they hope mom will forgive them. they hope the dog will not come back. they hope their toys are not ruined. they hope the neighbor is not mad. they hope they can go to the park tomorrow.

once upon a time, there was a friendly cop named tim. tim was very attractive. he had a big smile, and his uniform was always clean. everyone in the town liked him.

one day, tim wanted to create something special for the kids in the town. he thought and thought, and then he had an idea. tim decided to make a big, colorful ball for the kids to play with.

tim worked hard to create the ball. he used red, blue, yellow, and green colors. when the ball was ready, he took it to the park. the kids saw the ball and were very happy. they played with the ball all day, and they thanked tim for his wonderful gift.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy had a big desk in his room where he liked to draw and play with his toys. one day, timmy's sister came in and they started to quarrel over who could use the desk. timmy's sister wanted to use it to do her homework, but timmy wanted to play with his toys.

timmy's sister got very angry and started to yell. timmy felt restless and didn't know what to do. suddenly, their mom came in and asked them what was going on. they explained the quarrel over the desk and their mom said they could take turns using it.

timmy and his sister were happy and played together at the desk. they learned that sharing is important and it's better to not quarrel with each other. from then on, they took turns using the desk and played together happily.

once upon a time, there was a brave little frog. his name was floppy. one day he noticed a stream running through his pond. he was very curious and decided to investigate.

he hopped to the edge and peered in.

â€œit looks so sparkly and harmlessâ€, he said.

he was about to jump in, when his mother hopped up beside him.

â€œfloppy,â€ she said. â€œbe careful and always listen to your heart.â€

floppy and his mother continued to stare into the stream together. after a while, he received a gentle whisper from within.

â€œjump in and join the fun!â€ it said.

floppy listened to his heart and decided not to jump. he knew the stream looked harmless, but his instincts said it could still be dangerous.

so, he and his mother hopped away, frog smiling to himself as he realized that sometimes, it pays to be brave and listen to your heart.

once there was a very bad ant. he didn't want to help anyone. he always crawled away whenever he saw someone else in trouble. one day, a nail was stuck in the ground and the ant saw a bee who was trying to get it out. but he still crawled away and didn't help. 

the bee noticed the ant and asked: â€œwhy donâ€™t you help me, ant? together we can get this nail out.â€

but the ant ignored the bee and crawled away. he thought he was too good to help someone else. 

later, the ant was walking in his garden when he stepped on a nail. he was in terrible pain and started to cry for help. but nobody listened. because the ant had decided to crawl away from helping others, no one helped him. 

the moral of this story is that itâ€™s always good to help others, because one day you might need help too and might not be able to find it.

molly was rolling her bin around. she was having so much fun moving and pushing it along. suddenly there was a loud crash. her bin tumbled over onto its side. she heard a voice coming from inside the bin. it said "help me!"

molly was scared, but she was brave too. she carefully lifted the bin back up and looked inside. there was a little squirrel with a hurt foot. he had fallen in when the bin tipped over. he was looking scared and sad.

molly was very kind. she took some sweet food from her pocket and slowly put it inside the bin. the squirrel looked delighted and he slowly took it from her hands. then molly said that everything would be okay. she sat and watched over him until he was back to his old self.

the next morning molly took the bin and the squirrel to the park. she helped the squirrel out of the bin, said goodbye and watched as the squirrel scampered away. molly smiled. she felt very brave.

once upon a time there was a boy who was very restless. his name was john. one day, john wanted to play outside, but he didn't know what to do. he saw a long, colourful hose in the garden and thought it would be fun to use it. so he grabbed the hose and began to rock with it.

john had so much fun that he even began to talk to the hose. he said, "oh, what a fun hose you are! let's rock together!"

the hose replied, "yes! i'm so happy that you are enjoying playing with me!"

john smiled and continued to rock with the hose for the rest of the day. he was so filled with joy that he forgot how restless he was!

once, there was a smelly sock. it wanted to make a sound, so it decided to fold itself. it folded and it folded, until it was a tiny, tiny sock. then, it made a sound - a loud, smelly sound! everyone was surprised and laughed at the sock. the sock was so proud of making that funny sound! it stayed folded up, enjoying the sound it made. from then on, it always folded itself when it wanted to make that funny sound.

once upon a time there was a little girl. she was only three and she was worrying a lot.

one day her mom took her to the store. when they arrived at the store, the little girl saw the ceiling. it was disgusting. she was worried that something bad was going to happen.

her mother wrapped her arms around her to try and make her feel better. she asked the little girl what was wrong and why she was so worried.

the little girl said that she was worried about the ceiling. it looked so gross.

her mom told her not to worry and that everything would be alright. she said that it existed only to keep the rain out and that it wasn't anything to be scared of.

the little girl smiled and felt much better. she knew that her mom was right. she knew that everything would be alright.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play with her dolls and dress them up in pretty clothes. one day, lily saw a doll in the store that she really wanted. it had shiny hair and a beautiful dress, but it was very expensive.

lily's mommy said she couldn't buy the doll because it was fake. lily didn't understand what that meant, so her mommy explained that the doll wasn't real, it was just made to look like a real doll. lily was shocked because she thought it was a real doll.

lily learned that sometimes things can look real, but they are not. she decided to save her money and buy a real doll instead of a fake one. she became very happy when she finally got her real doll and played with it every day. the moral of the story is that it's better to have something real than something fake.

it was a bright and sunny day. mommy and johnnie were in the yard.

"johnnie," said mommy, "let's go for a drive in the vehicle." 
johnnie was so excited! he loved the vehicle. 

mommy started the vehicle and began to drive. they drove past lots of houses and trees. then, they approached a tall bridge.

johnnie was curious how the vehicle would make it across the bridge. "that's hard," said johnnie.

"don't worry, johnnie," said mommy. "our vehicle is very smart."

and sure enough, the vehicle drove across the bridge with ease. johnnie was so proud of the vehicle. he couldn't believe it was so smart!

once upon a time, two friends, jack and jill, were walking in the forest. jack wanted to show jill something special, so he held up a small cube and said, "this is my special cube. it is dependable and i always keep it with me." 

jill asked, "what does it do?" 

jack grinned and said, "it doesn't do much, but i always rely on it. it reminds me to be kind and dependable." 

confused, jill asked, "what do you mean?"

jack replied, "if i'm feeling sad or scared, i look at my cube and it reminds me that i can always rely on myself and my friends."

jill smiled and nodded. she said, "that's a nice message. we should always be kind and dependable to each other". 

the two friends held hands and continued walking thoughtfully through the forest. 

the moral of this story is to always put others' needs before your own and to be dependable when others need you.

once there was a brave boy. he was always ready to fill any fight. one day he was walking through the park and he heard a loud noise. he went to see what was happening and he saw an interesting show. it was an athlete doing incredible stunts. everyone was cheering and the boy was filled with joy. he couldn't wait to fight for justice like the athlete. he wanted to help people just like the athlete was doing. he knew he was ready to fill any fight. the end.

once upon a time, in a small town, there was weird weather. the sun was hot, and then it was cold. the rain came, and then the snow. people did not know what to wear. they were sad.

one day, a little girl named lily went for a walk. she saw a big tree with a small door. she opened the door and found a magic room. in the room, there was a big button. the button said "return."

lily pushed the button, and the weather changed. the sun was warm, and the air was cool. the rain and snow went away. the people in the town were happy again. they played outside and had fun.

every time the weather got weird, lily would return to the magic room and push the button. the town was always happy because of lily. they knew they could count on her to fix the weather. and they all lived happily ever after.

once upon a time, there was a young boy named tim. tim loved to play outside and run around with his friends. one day, tim and his friends decided to play a game of tag. they ran around and had lots of fun, but then tim saw a tree with a big branch that looked perfect for hanging. tim climbed up the tree and hung from the branch. his friends saw him and started to copy him, so they all hung from the branch together. they swung back and forth in motion and laughed so hard that their bellies hurt. tim felt happy that he could share his fun idea with his friends. the end.

once upon a time there was a humble table. it had been used for many years, but it was still strong and sturdy.

one day, a kind old woman came by and saw the table. she was looking for a place to store some of her things, so the table was perfect for the task.

the old woman placed some of her belongings on the table and smiled. she was thankful to know that her items were safe and secure.

the table sat there happily and was filled with the woman's things. every day, the woman would go out and come back with more items to store on the humble table.

soon, the table was full of the woman's possessions and the woman was very pleased. she thanked the table for taking care of her things and for always being so humble and helpful.

the old woman and the humble table lived happily ever after.

once upon a time, there was a dependable fairy named fifi. she lived in a big tree in the forest. fifi had a job to protect all the small animals.

one day, a little rabbit named riri was lost. riri was scared and cried, "help me, please!" fifi heard riri and flew to her. "don't worry, riri. i am here to protect you," said fifi.

fifi took riri's hand and led her back to her family. riri was happy and said, "thank you, fifi!" from that day on, riri knew she could always count on fifi to protect her and her friends.

once upon a time, there was a little spider named spidey. spidey lived in a big, old house with lots of cobwebs. spidey loved to make jokes and laugh with his spider friends.

one day, spidey was crawling on a thin thread when he heard a loud noise. it was a little girl named lily who had come to play in the old house. spidey crawled down to say hello.

"hi, spidey!" lily said with a big smile.

"hi, lily!" spidey said. "do you want to hear a joke?"

"yes, please!" lily said, giggling.

spidey told lily a funny joke and they both laughed. but suddenly, lily saw a big cobweb near her face and got scared.

"spidey, there's a scary cobweb!" lily said, pointing.

"don't worry, lily," spidey said. "i'll take care of it."

spidey crawled up to the cobweb and spun a new, stronger web to catch it. lily was amazed and thanked spidey for being so brave. from that day on, spidey and lily were good friends and always shared jokes and laughs.

once upon a time, there was a special queen. she had a unique kingdom, where she showed love and kindness to everyone. everyone in the kingdom loved her.

one day, the queen wanted to show how much she loved her kingdom. she came up with a special plan to do something no other kingdom had ever seen before.

the queen organized a big parade with colorful flags and balloons. everyone in the kingdom was excited to see it. the parade was special and unique, and the queen wanted everyone to enjoy it.

the queen walked in the parade, smiling and waving at everyone. they all cheered for her and the parade was a great success. the queen's plan had worked, and everyone in the kingdom was very happy.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a red dress that she loved to wear. one day, lily went to a big palace with her mommy and daddy. inside the palace, there were many rooms with pretty decorations.

in one room, there was a big table with lots of food. lily wanted to taste everything! she tried the sweet cake and the juicy fruit. she even tried the spicy sauce, but it was too hot for her. 

after eating, lily explored more of the palace. she saw a big red carpet and a throne fit for a king. lily felt like a princess in the palace. she was so happy to have visited such a beautiful place with her family.

once upon a time, there was a happy little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play with his toys all day long. one day, timmy's daddy came home with a razor. timmy asked his daddy what it was for. his daddy told him it was to shave his beard. timmy was glad his daddy was happy.

the next day, timmy's daddy changed. he didn't smile as much and he didn't want to play with timmy anymore. timmy asked his daddy what was wrong, but his daddy just looked sad. timmy didn't know what to do.

one day, timmy's daddy left and never came back. timmy was sad and didn't understand why his daddy had changed. he missed his daddy and wished he could play with him again. the end.

once upon a time there was a young girl, just 3 years old, who wanted something exciting to do. she saw a chalk, sitting on the ground outside her house, and she had an idea. she decided to enter the chalk and explore what it had to offer.

inside the chalk was a whole new world with places to explore. she saw a mountain, some bushes, and a river with fish swimming in it. she was amazed and couldn't stop exploring. she spent her days walking around, jumping and flying over things, finding new and exciting things everywhere she went.

eventually, the day came to an end, and the young girl had to leave the chalk. she felt sad and wished she could stay in the chalk forever. but, she knew she had to go home, even though she was sad.

the little girl gathered the chalk in her hands and slowly walked home. she'll always remember the days she got to enter the chalk and explore.

once upon a time, there was a girl called lucy. she was very happy and loved to play in the garden. one night, lucy looked up at the night sky and saw an enormous star twinkling above her. she wanted to catch it, so she reached up as far as she could, but it was too far away.

â€œi want that star!â€ said lucy.

she tried and tried and eventually, she managed to climb up to the top of the tallest tree in the garden. when she looked up, the star was still very high in the sky. lucy tried to catch it but each time it moved further and further away. 

then, all of a sudden, the enormous star came zooming down from the sky. before lucy knew it, she had caught it!

â€œi did it! i caught the star!â€ shouted lucy.

lucy held on tight to the star and it shone brightly. she was so happy and knew that this was a night she would never forget.

once upon a time there was a brown duck. he was very happy and he liked to swim in the lake with his friends. one day he decided to go for a swim at noon. suddenly, he was surprised to see another duck! this other duck was very different. he was white! 

the two ducks started to swim around together. they soon became friends and liked to play together. every day they would go swimming at noon and it made the brown duck very happy. 

one day, when they were at the lake at noon, the brown duck was surprised to see a nesting area. inside there were two little baby ducklings! they were brown and white, just like their mama and papa. 

the duck was very surprised and he was very happy. from then on, the brown duck and his new family swam together at noon.

mina and her dad were walking in the park one day. suddenly, mina spotted something exciting. it was a big club! she asked her dad if she could create her own club with her friends. dad nodded and said, "yes!".

mina ran to all her friends and asked if they wanted to join her new club. everyone said yes! she explained that her club would be full of fun activities like playing games, making art and telling stories. 

the new club met up every day and the friends had the best time. they laughed and talked, played games and created beautiful things. every week, the friends would invite someone new to join the club.

the club became more and more popular. it was the most exciting place to be!

one day, the friends decided to go on a slow walk around the park to look at all the new things they had created together. they smiled, laughed and talked the whole time. 

mina was so happy to have started her very own club! it was one of the best things she had ever done.

lola was a three-year-old girl. she loved playing with her pink bracelet. she wore it everyday and never wanted to take it off.

one day, she decided to explore the garden. she ran around, feeling free and happy. but then she saw a big hole. she wanted to investigate the hole, so she crawled inside. when she stepped deeper, she realized she couldn't get out. she felt helpless!

lola started to cry. thankfully, her mummy heard her cries and found her. she smiled and hugged her daughter. lola didn't want to let go of her bracelet, so mummy said "lola, why don't you wear the bracelet outside the hole and i'll pull you out."

lola was relieved. she passed the bracelet to her mummy, and the latter pulled her out easily. lola hugged mummy tightly, and she never forgot how mummy saved her that day. mummy promised to never let her get lost again, and lola promised to always wear her bracelet.

once there was an oak tree in a field. it was very strong and powerful. one day, a little girl came to the field. she couldn't help but to be curious about the oak tree. 

so, she went up to the tree and asked it, "can you tell me about your life?" the oak tree was so wise that it knew the girl was special. 

the oak tree told the little girl about how it had seen the world around it change over the years. it hadn't moved, but it had seen the sun rise and set and it had seen the seasons come and go. 

the little girl was fascinated. she thanked the powerful oak tree for sharing its story and ran off to tell everyone she could about it. she will always remember the wise oak tree and its powerful stories.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had long curly hair that always got tangled. one day, her mom gave her a cool pink comb to use.

lily was excited to use the new comb. she combed her hair and it felt smooth. she went to show her mom and said, "look, mommy! i finished combing my hair!"

her mom smiled and said, "great job, lily! you look so pretty."

lily was happy and went to play with her toys. her friend, timmy, came over and said, "wow, your hair looks nice! did you comb it?"

lily replied, "yes, i finished combing it with my cool pink comb!"

once, there was a tall man. he had a trumpet. he was always making lots of noise and annoying the people in the town.

one day, the people decided to punish the tall man. they wanted him to stop making lots of noise.

so, everyone in the town got together and built a wall around the tall man. then, they told him that he wasn't allowed to play his trumpet anymore.

at first, the tall man was very sad and he just sat alone in his little room. then, one day, he decided to surprise everyone by making a different kind of music. he used his trumpet to make a beautiful melody that everyone could enjoy.

the people were very happy and they celebrated his music. from then on, the tall man only used his trumpet to make beautiful music, and the town was happier and much quieter.

sara has a pink scarf. she likes her scarf very much. she wears it every day when she goes out. her scarf is soft and warm and pretty.

one day, sara goes to the park with her mom. she sees a dog. the dog is big and brown and friendly. sara wants to pet the dog. she asks her mom if she can.

"yes, you can, but be careful," her mom says. "the dog might not like your scarf."

sara goes to the dog. she says hello. the dog wags his tail. he likes sara. sara pets the dog. she says, "you are a nice dog. what is your name?"

the dog barks. he says, "my name is max. i like your scarf. it is pink. can i have it?"

sara is surprised. she says, "no, you can't have my scarf. it is mine. i like it very much."

the dog looks sad. he says, "but i am cold. and i like pink. please, can i have your scarf?"

sara thinks. she likes the dog. he is nice and friendly. but she likes her scarf too. she does not want to give it away. she has an idea.

she says, "you can't have my scarf, but you can share it. we can both wear it. then we will both be warm and pretty."

the dog smiles. he says, "ok, that sounds good. thank you, sara. you are a kind girl."

sara and max wrap the scarf around their necks. they look at each other. they are happy. they are friends. they play in the park with the pink scarf.

tom and mia liked to play pirate in the garden. they had a big box that was their ship, and a hose that was their cannon. they wore hats and eye patches and said "arrr!" a lot.

one day, they saw a big orange cat sitting on the fence. it looked like a tiger. tom said, "look, mia, a pirate enemy! let's spray him with our cannon and make him run away!" mia said, "yes, let's do that!" they grabbed the hose and aimed at the cat.

but the cat was not afraid. he jumped off the fence and ran towards them. he hissed and spat and showed his sharp teeth. tom and mia were scared. they dropped the hose and ran back to their box. the cat followed them and jumped on the box. he scratched and bit the box and made a big hole.

tom and mia crawled out of the hole and ran into the house. they slammed the door and locked it. they were safe. they looked out of the window and saw the cat sitting on the box. he looked very angry. he had water on his fur and his eyes were green.

tom and mia learned a lesson. they decided not to spray the cat again. they said, "sorry, cat, we won't bother you anymore. you are a very brave pirate. we are sorry we made you wet." the cat heard them and meowed. he seemed to forgive them. he jumped off the box and walked away. tom and mia smiled and hugged each other. they were happy. they said, "we are still pirates, but we are nice pirates. we don't spray anyone who doesn't want to be sprayed." they went back to their box and played pirate again. but they left the hose alone.

once upon a time, there was a little bunny who loved to run. every day, he would rush around the meadow, chasing after butterflies and playing with his friends. one day, while he was playing, he saw a white shape in the distance. curious, he hopped over to investigate.

as he got closer, he realized that the shape was a little bird who had fallen from her nest. the bunny knew he had to help her, so he carefully picked her up in his soft, furry paws and brought her back to her nest. the bird's mother was so grateful that she gave the bunny a shiny white feather as a thank you.

from that day on, the bunny learned that helping others was more important than just rushing around and playing all day. he felt proud of himself for being kind, and he always kept the white feather as a reminder of the important lesson he had learned.

lily and ben were playing in the park. they liked to swing, slide and run. they saw a big tire hanging from a tree. it looked like fun.

"can we try the tire?" lily asked ben.

"sure, let's go!" ben said. they ran to the tire and took turns to sit in it. they pushed each other and spun around. they laughed and screamed.

the tire was very attractive. it was shiny and black. it had a red ribbon on it. it was a gift from the park man. he wanted to provide something new for the kids.

but after a while, lily and ben felt dizzy. they stopped the tire and got out. they felt sick and tired.

"are you okay?" ben asked lily.

"i don't feel good. the tire made me sick." lily said.

"me too. let's go home." ben said.

they walked slowly to their mommies. they told them what happened. their mommies hugged them and gave them water.

"next time, don't play too long on the tire. it can make you sick." their mommies said.

"okay, mommy. we're sorry." lily and ben said.

they learned their lesson. the tire was fun, but too much fun was not good. they decided to play with other things next time. they still liked the tire, but they liked their mommies more.

once upon a time there was a hot summer. everywhere was very hot and the sun was shining. one day, a family went to the beach. they were so excited to feel the cold water! when they all arrived, they put their toes in the beach and the cold felt so nice! 

the family laughed and played in the water all day. they ran, splashed each other and had so much fun. but as the day went on, the sun was getting hotter and the water was getting cold! 

the family knew how to value the cold and the hot. they knew when it was hot outside, it was best to be in the cold water. and when it was cold outside, the hot sun was just right. they knew when to take advantage of the cold and the hot. 

the day ended and the night came. the family had memories of the cold and hot day they spent together. they knew all along how to value both the cold and the hot!

mild bill was walking through the park when he started to feel hungry. he looked around and saw a bright blue label on a big tree. he went closer to read what it said, and saw that it was a label for a yummy apple. he couldn't reach it so he started to look for something to help him get the apple. he found a big stick and used it to pull the apple down. mild bill happily took the apple, smiled, and bit into it. the apple was so juicy and sweet! mild bill was so pleased he started to dance with joy. he thanked the tree for the yummy apple.

once upon a time, there was a little girl. she had an empty box but she could not decide what to do with it.

one day, she asked her mom, â€œwhat should i do with this empty box?â€. her mom looked thoughtful and then suggested, â€œletâ€™s have a look. maybe you can use it to do something special?â€ 

the little girl thought and then had an idea - she could use it to make a special home for her special toy. she looked inside and out and then smiled.

the little girl got some paint and pencils to decorate the box and brought in some pillows and blankets to make it comfy. then, she put her favourite toy in the box and made it nice and warm.

the little girl was very happy with her new home for her toy. she smiled and said, â€œthank you, mom. i love my new look!â€.

once upon a time, there was a little girl called daisy. daisy wanted to know what time it was, so she asked her mummy. but her mummy said she had to look at the clock.

daisy was very excited, she had never seen a clock before. she ran around the corner and there, right next to the window, was a big clock! there were big hands pointing to the number five and some small hands pointing to the number nine. daisy was so happy and amazed.

suddenly, a sour smell appeared in the room. daisy wondered what it was and she looked around to see if she could find out where it was coming from. then, she saw a small bowl of sour lemons on the table. daisy laughed because the lemon smell was so sour!

daisy looked back at the clock, and saw the big hand had moved and was now pointing to the number six. she was so excited because she had watched the clock move and now she knew how to tell the time!

mum and dad were getting ready for the day. they had been busy, packing and cleaning the house.

billy watched them and sighed. it was difficult for him to understand why they were doing all this work.

mum noticed and said, "we're going to the beach, billy! do you remember, from our holiday last year?"

billy remembered all the plastic buckets, spades and toys. he smiled and said, "yes, i remember. that was fun."

mum and dad laughed and hugged him. they said, "we're going to have just as much fun this year. but first, we need to pack the car."

billy just sighed. he knew it was going to be a difficult day.

once upon a time there was a nice cherry tree. it was full of sweet, ripe cherries. each day, a little girl would come to pick a cherry. she would eat it and it was always so delicious.

one day, the little girl forgot to go pick a cherry. but then she remembered and ran to the cherry tree. she picked a cherry and smiledbig. it was so nice.

every day, the little girl remembered to visit the cherry tree. and even when she was older and forgot, the cherry tree would always remind her. it was like an old friend.

once upon a time, there was a little dove. the dove lived in a dry tree. the dry tree had no leaves. the dove was sad because the tree was not pretty.

one day, the dove wanted to sleep. it was very tired. so the dove tried to sleep on the dry tree. but the dry tree was not comfortable. the dove could not sleep well.

the dove was very sad. it wanted to find a new tree to sleep on. but the dove was too tired to fly. the dove fell down from the dry tree. the dove did not feel good. the end.

once upon a time, there was an ordinary girl called katie. she was walking down the street one day when she heard someone crying for help. she ran to the rescue, and saw a dog stuck at the top of a tall tree. she wanted to help the dog, so she began to climb the tree. 

but, katie was not an expert climber, and soon she was unable to go any further. just then, a man came along with a film. he clambered up the tree and rescued the poor dog. 

katie cheered, but when the man came down, he was very angry. he said that katie belonged to a special school and had run away. he said she must now go back with him, and that she would never again be allowed to be so ordinary.

katie was so sad, and the story sadly ends here.

once upon a time there was a big, strong table in the middle of a room. on it, two friends were sitting and discussing.

the first was mary. mary was a small, friendly girl. she loved to talk and play. 

the second was joe. joe was a big, strong boy. he was always asking questions and finding out about the world.

on the table, mary and joe talked about many things. they talked about animals and minutes, plants and trees, and even the sun and stars. 

they discussed these things together until the sun had gone down, and the stars had shone in the night sky. and when they were done, they hugged each other and said goodbye. 

the end.

once upon a time, there were two friends named jack and jane. they wanted to go out and play but their bikes were broken and wouldn't work. jane suggested they go find a mechanic to help fix their bikes.
