"it means they are nice and kind. they help each other and they don't hurt the other team. they say sorry when they make a mistake. they share their water and their snacks. they taste good," tim said.

"they taste good? how do you know?" anna asked, surprised.

"because i tasted one," tim said, smiling.

"you tasted one? when? how?" anna asked, shocked.

"when we came here, i saw a girl from the yellow team sitting on the bench. she had a cut on her knee and she was crying. i felt sorry for her, so i went to her and gave her a hug. then i licked her knee to make it better. she stopped crying and smiled at me. she said thank you and gave me a cookie. she tasted good," tim said, proud.

anna stared at tim, not sure what to say. she looked at the girl on the bench, who was now playing again. she looked happy and healthy. she looked at spot, who was licking his paws. she looked at tim, who was licking his lips.

"tim, you are a very compassionate boy. but you are also a very silly boy. you don't taste people. you taste food. people are not food. people are friends. do you understand?" anna said, gently.

tim nodded, a little embarrassed. he understood. he was sorry. he didn't mean to be rude. he just wanted to help.

"ok, then. let's watch the game some more. and next time, if you want to taste something, ask me first. i have some candy in my pocket. do you want some?" anna said, forgiving.

tim smiled, grateful. he wanted some. he liked candy. he liked anna. he liked the game. he liked the park. he liked the day.

he blew a kiss to the girl on the bench. he gave a hug to spot. he took a candy from anna. he tasted it. it was sweet. it was good. he was happy.

lily and ben were playing in the bathroom. they saw a shiny thing on the sink. it was a razor. lily wanted to touch it.

"look, ben, a shiny thing!" lily said. "can i have it?"

"no, lily, that is not for us. that is for daddy. it is sharp and can hurt you." ben said. he was a reliable brother. he knew some things were dangerous.

but lily did not listen. she reached for the razor. she wanted to see how it felt. she did not see the water on the floor. she slipped and fell. the razor cut her hand. she cried out loud.

mommy heard the cry. she ran to the bathroom. she saw lily and ben and the razor and the blood. she was very angry and scared.

"what happened here? who touched the razor?" mommy asked.

"i did, mommy. i'm sorry. it was shiny and i wanted it." lily said. she was in pain and sorry.

mommy took lily to the doctor. the doctor fixed her hand. he gave her a bandage and a sticker. he told her not to touch razors again.

lily learned a lesson. she should listen to her brother and mommy. they knew what was good for her. she should not touch things that were not for her. they could hurt her and make her sad. she should be careful and safe.

once upon a time, in a big green forest, there lived a mysterious deer. this deer had a big horn on his head. he was very proud of his horn. all the other animals liked him because he was nice and helpful.

one day, a little bird was stuck in a tree. the deer saw the bird and wanted to help. he went to the tree and started to shake it with his strong legs. the tree shook and the little bird fell down, but the deer caught her with his horn. the bird was very happy and thanked the deer.

from that day on, the deer and the bird became best friends. they played together and helped each other. the other animals in the forest saw their friendship and learned that being kind and helping others is very important. they all became friends and the forest was a happy place.

john was walking with his mum. they were outside and the sky was blue. john looked up and noticed an aeroplane. his mum said he could go over and look closer. he thought that sounded easy so he ran over. when he was close he saw the aeroplane flying high in the sky. he wanted to touch it! he started to jump as high as he could, but he couldn't reach it. suddenly, he lost his balance and he fell over and hurt his arm. he had tears in his eyes and his mum hugged him tightly. they had to go to the hospital to make it better. john did not get to touch the aeroplane and it was not an easy ending.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a soft, red velvet dress that she loved to wear. one day, her mommy took her to the store to buy some toys. lily saw a big, nosy dog outside the store, but she was not afraid. 

when they got inside, lily saw lots of toys she wanted to buy. she had some money in her pocket that she wanted to spend. she picked out a doll and a teddy bear. her mommy said she could only choose one, so she decided to spend her money on the teddy bear. 

lily hugged her new teddy bear tightly and they walked outside. the nosy dog was still there, but lily did not mind because she had her new friend with her. she went home happy and spent the rest of the day playing with her new teddy bear on her soft, red velvet dress. the end.

once, a group of children were playing in the park. one of them, jill, was looking for something to do.

suddenly, she saw a strange structure in the middle of the park. she walked over to it and saw that it had some funny shapes and colours.

"what is this?" she asked her friends.

"i don't know," they all replied, looking confused.

just then, a strange creature popped out of the structure. it had a huge smile on its face and it was holding a wand.

"let me show you what this is," it said.

it waved its wand and a castle appeared. everyone was amazed.

"amazing. can you show us more?" asked jill.

the creature smiled and waved its wand again. mountains, rivers, and more structures appeared.

the children were so amazed that they didn't know what else to say.

"you are very clever," said jill.

the creature smiled and said, "that's why i'm here to show you something fun and cool."

the children all thanked the creature and waved goodbye as it disappeared into the structure.

once upon a time, there was a large family of bears. they were usually very happy and shared lots of hugs and food together. 

one day, the youngest bear was feeling worried. he didn't want to share his toast with anyone else. 

the mother bear smiled at him and said, "little one, why don't you want to share your toast?" 

the little bear shrugged sadly and said, "i'm worried that i won't have enough for everyone."

but the mother bear told him that there were enough pieces of toast to share with everyone in the family. everyone was able to eat a delicious snack. 

the little bear was so happy! they all shared the toast and it was the most delicious snack ever. 

the end.

anna and ben are friends. they like to play on the farm. they see a big barn. the barn has many animals inside.

"let's go and see the animals," anna says.

"ok, but we have to be quiet," ben says. "the farmer is busy. he is testing the milk from the cows."

they walk to the barn. they see cows, pigs, chickens, and horses. they are all making noises. anna and ben smile. they like the noises.

they see a baby goat. the baby goat is white and fluffy. it is jumping and running. anna and ben want to pet the baby goat.

"hello, baby goat," anna says. "you are so cute. can we pet you?"

the baby goat stops. it looks at anna and ben. it bleats. it runs to them. it licks their hands. anna and ben giggle. they pet the baby goat.

the farmer comes out of the barn. he sees anna and ben. he sees the baby goat.

"hello, kids," the farmer says. "are you having fun?"

"yes, we are," anna and ben say. "we like the baby goat. he is friendly."

the farmer smiles. he says, "that's good. the baby goat is new. he was born yesterday. i was testing his mother's milk. do you want to see?"

anna and ben nod. they follow the farmer. they see the mother goat. she is brown and big. she has horns. she is eating hay.

the farmer shows them a machine. the machine has tubes and bottles. the farmer says, "this is how i test the milk. i put the tubes on the goat's udders. the milk goes into the bottles. then i check the milk. i see if it is good or bad."

anna and ben watch. they are curious. they ask the farmer questions. the farmer answers them. he is nice. he lets them taste the milk. the milk is warm and sweet.

anna and ben like the milk. they say, "thank you, farmer. the milk is good. the goat is good. you are good."

the farmer laughs. he says, "you're welcome, kids. you are good, too. you are polite and quiet. you can come and visit the barn anytime. but now, it is time to go. the animals need to rest. and you need to go home."

anna and ben say, "ok, farmer. goodbye, animals. goodbye, baby goat. we will come back soon."

they wave to the farmer and the animals. they hold hands. they walk back to their parents. they are happy. they had fun on the farm. they learned about the barn and the milk. they made a new friend. the baby goat.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside in the sun. one day, lily's mommy recommended that she wear a hat to keep the heat off her face. lily was patient as her mommy helped her put on the hat.

lily played for a while, but then she got thirsty. her mommy recommended that she drink some water to stay hydrated in the heat. lily was happy to drink the water and felt much better.

later, lily's mommy made some cookies. they smelled so good and lily was very patient as she waited for them to cool down. finally, they were cool enough to eat and lily enjoyed them very much.

sara and ben are twins. they like to play with their toys. one day, they find a big box of cards. the cards have pictures of animals, fruits, and shapes.

"let's play a game," sara says. "we can match the cards that are the same."

"ok," ben says. "i will go first."

ben picks a card. it has a picture of a banana. he looks for another card with a banana. he finds one and puts them together.

"good job, ben," sara says. "now it's my turn."

sara picks a card. it has a picture of a palm. she knows what a palm is. it is a part of her hand. she shows ben her palm.

"look, ben, this is a palm," sara says.

"i know, sara, i have a palm too," ben says. he shows sara his palm.

they compare their palms. they are the same size and shape. they have five fingers each. they have lines and curves on their skin.

"our palms match," sara says. "they are the same."

"yes, they do," ben says. "but they are not ordinary. they are special."

"why are they special?" sara asks.

"because they are ours," ben says. "and we are twins. we are the best match of all."

sara smiles. she hugs ben. they are happy. they love each other. they love their palms. they love their game.

once upon a time, there was a little fishy named bubbles. bubbles lived in a big pool with lots of other fishies. they swam and played together all day long. but one day, bubbles felt very lonely. he wanted to move to a different part of the pool to make some new friends.

so, bubbles swam and swam until he found a new spot in the pool. there, he saw a big, shiny rock. bubbles thought the rock looked lonely too, so he swam up to it and said hello. suddenly, the rock started to move! it wasn't a rock at all, but a friendly turtle named tommy.

tommy and bubbles became the best of friends and swam all around the pool together. bubbles was no longer lonely and was very happy he had moved to a new spot in the pool. from then on, bubbles learned that sometimes it's good to move and try new things, because you might just find a new friend.

tommy was playing in the sun. he was wearing a purple shirt and smiling. suddenly he heard someone calling his name. it was his dad.

â€œtommy, letâ€™s go play a sport!â€ said his dad.

tommy was excited. he ran to the field with his dad.

tommy thought for a moment. â€œletâ€™s play catch!â€ he said. 

â€œgood choice!â€ said his dad.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily who loved to play outside. one day, she found a pretty flower in the garden. she picked it up and smelled it, but her mommy told her not to eat it because it was poison.

lily asked, "why can't i eat it, mommy?"

her mommy replied, "because it's not nice for your tummy. it can make you sick."

lily understood and said, "okay, mommy. i won't eat it. but can i keep it?"

her mommy permitted her to keep the flower, but reminded her not to eat it. lily was happy and thanked her mommy for being so nice. they continued to play outside and enjoyed the rest of their day together.

once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a little girl named sally. sally had a big, soft wrap. she loved to wrap it around her when she felt cold or troubled. one day, sally lost her wrap. she looked everywhere, but she could not find it.

sally asked her mom, "mom, have you seen my wrap?" her mom said, "no, but let's look for it together." they looked in the bedroom, the kitchen, and the living room. but they still could not find the wrap.

sally was sad and troubled. she could not resist crying. but then, she saw her dog, spot, in the yard. spot had her wrap! he was playing with it. sally ran to spot and hugged him. "thank you, spot!" she said. now sally was happy and warm again.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named jess. jess liked to play with her toys, but one day, jess had a special task to do. she had to take all the clothes out of her wardrobe and hang them up on hangers.

jess was a very polite little girl and she was very excited to do her special task. she started to take the clothes out of her wardrobe and carefully hang them up on the hangers.

when jess was almost finished, she heard a noise behind her. it was her mom.

jess' mom said "jess, you have done such a good job! you have been very polite and you have hung up all of the clothes very carefully. you did a great job!"

jess was very proud of herself and gave her mom a big hug. she was happy she had been able to help out.

once there was a little girl named jane. she was very bossy and always wanted things her way. 

one day, jane's mom was in a hurry. she was running around the house gathering items to take with her. jane wanted to help her mom, but her mom didn't have time. she told jane to stay put. 

jane got frustrated and wanted to hurry to the park with her mom. she asked her mom if she could go but her mom said no. she said she would take jane when she was done with her errands. jane thought about this for a bit, but she knew she had to be patient. 

jane's mom was finished in no time. she said it was time to pack up and leave. jane jumped up in excitement and grabbed her bag. she and her mom quickly got in the car and drove to the park. 

when they arrived, jane was surprised to see a lake there. she and her mom took a boat ride out onto the lake, and it was so beautiful! as the sun was setting, they had to hurry to get back. they quickly said goodbye to the lake and drove home to get a good night's wake.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a cheerful smile and loved to play with her toys. one day, lily's mommy gave her a bottle of milk to drink. lily drank all the milk and then she shrugged her shoulders. 

later that day, lily went to the park to play. she saw her friends and they were all playing together. lily felt a little shy, but then she saw her friend emma waving at her. lily felt cheerful and ran towards her friend. 

at the end of the day, lily went back home and her mommy asked her how her day was. lily smiled and said, "i had fun with my friends at the park and then i shrugged when i finished my milk." her mommy smiled and gave her a big hug.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy loved to play with his toys. one day, he decided to throw a ball. he threw it so high, it hit the sheet on his bed! timmy thought it was so cool. 

then, he tried to throw a bigger ball. but it was too heavy and not easy to throw. so, timmy went outside and found some leaves. he threw them up in the air and watched them fall down. it was easy to throw the leaves and it was fun to watch them flutter in the wind. 

after playing for a while, timmy got tired and went inside to take a nap on his cozy sheet. he dreamed about throwing balls, leaves, and even a sheet up in the air! when he woke up, he was excited to go outside and play again.

once upon a time, there were two little boys. one was named john and the other was named tim. they were best friends and went everywhere together.

one day, they were playing outside and they saw a big car. "i want to drive it," exclaimed john. tim agreed and the two boys climbed into the car. 

john started the car and drove down the road, but suddenly a cage flew over the car! in the cage was a fake bird. both boys started laughing and quickly reached out and caught the cage. 

john then drove them back home and the two boys proudly showed their parents the fake bird in the cage. they had an amazing adventure without leaving home. 

the end.

sam and lily are twins. they like to play outside in the yard. they have a big red ball and a small yellow car. they throw the ball and push the car on the grass. they have fun.

but then the sky becomes gray. the wind blows hard. the rain falls fast. sam and lily are wet and cold. they run inside the house. they see mom in the kitchen.

"mom, we are wet and cold!" they say.

mom smiles and hugs them. "you need to wash and change, my loves. it is time for a warm bath and some hot soup. come with me."

mom takes them to the bathroom. she fills the tub with water and bubbles. she helps them take off their wet clothes and put them in the hamper. she washes their hair and body with soap and a soft sponge. she rinses them with clean water. she wraps them in big fluffy towels. she dries their hair and body. she puts on their pajamas and slippers.

they feel warm and cozy. they go to the kitchen. they see dad at the table. he has a big pot of soup and some bread. he smiles and kisses them.

"hello, my loves. you look clean and happy. are you ready for some soup?"

they nod and sit down. they eat the soup and bread. they drink some milk. they talk about their day. they thank mom and dad for the bath and the soup. they hug and kiss them.

they go to their bedroom. they brush their teeth and go to bed. they snuggle under the blanket. they close their eyes. they dream of sunny days and fun games. they are happy.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she was very glad because she got a big bag of candy from her grandma. she opened the bag and saw lots of different candies. she picked one and put it in her mouth. it tasted very sweet.

lily's little brother, max, came into the room and asked for some candy. lily was happy to share with him. max picked one and examined it closely. he said it was a red candy with white stripes. lily agreed and they both ate their candy together.

after they finished their candy, lily and max went outside to play. they ran around and had lots of fun. they both felt very happy and glad that they got to eat some yummy candy.

one day, a normal cat named tom went outside to play. he liked to see all the things in his yard. there were trees, flowers, and even some lumber. tom saw the lumber and had an idea.

tom went to his friend, a dog named max. "max, let's build something with the lumber," said tom. max thought it was a great idea. they started to build a small house for them to play in. but soon, they began to argue. tom wanted the house to be big, while max wanted it to be small.

in the end, they decided to work together and build a house that was just the right size. they were happy and played in their new house all day long. the lumber that tom had seen in the yard had turned into a fun place for them to play.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. one day, she went to the park with her mommy. at the park, she saw a big balloon. "wow, that's impressive!" she said.

suddenly, a man came and blew up the balloon with gas. "look, mommy! the man is blowing up the balloon with gas," lily said. 

the man saw lily and waved at her. "hi there, little one!" he said. 

lily smiled and waved back. "hi!" she said. 

after the man finished blowing up the balloon, he gave it to lily. "here you go, little one. enjoy the balloon!" he said. 

lily was so happy and she held the balloon tightly as she walked around the park with her mommy. it was a wonderful day.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to draw and make things. one day, she decided to design a special picture for her mommy's birthday.

lily's daddy asked, "how much do you think it will cost to make this picture?"

lily replied, "it will not cost anything, daddy. i am making it with my own crayons and paper."

daddy was proud of lily's creativity and did not want to make her feel ashamed for not knowing the price of things.

he said, "that's wonderful, lily. i can't wait to see your special picture for mommy!"

once there was a famous trumpet. it was a special instrument that made wonderful sounds. 
one day a little bug decided to crawl onto the trumpet. the bug wasn't paying attention and quickly got stuck on the trumpet! it was in a tight spot and it couldn't move away.

the trumpet wasn't happy about the bug and it tried to blow the bug away with a loud noise. but the bug wouldn't budge! the bug was determined to stay on the trumpet. 

the trumpet was frustrated and tried over and over again to blow the bug away. finally, the bug was so scared that it ran away from the trumpet and back outside.

the bug was safe, but the trumpet was still famous for its beautiful sound.

once upon a time, there was a sleepy spider. he wanted to own his own home, so he set off to find one. first, he looked in the trees but all he found was leaves. he scurried around the ground and found a small hole. it was just the right size for a sleepy spider! 

he rushed inside and looked around. it was perfect - a cozy place to rest. the spider wiggled in, like a cuddly toy. he wriggled until he was comfortable and settled down. it felt so good to be in his very own home! 

he stayed there all day, taking nice naps in his safe and dark place. but once it got dark outside, the spider came out and began spinning webs. he spun webs until the morning and then he crawled back into his cozy home and fell back asleep.

since then, the sleepy spider has been living happily in his own home. he takes cozy naps and spins webs at night. he loves his own little home, and is never too sleepy to tell it so!

lily liked to make things with thread. she had many colors of thread in her box. she made bracelets, necklaces, and flowers with thread. she gave them to her friends and family.

one day, she found a shiny thread in her box. it was silver and sparkled in the sun. lily thought it was very pretty. she wanted to make something special with it. she decided to make a star with the shiny thread.

she cut a piece of the shiny thread and bent it into a star shape. she used tape to keep the ends together. she was very happy with her star. she hung it on her window with a string. she wanted to see it shine every day.

but the next day, when she woke up, she saw that her star was gone. she looked around her room, but she could not find it. she was very sad. she asked her mom, "mom, where is my star?"

her mom said, "i'm sorry, lily, but your star was bad. it was not a real thread. it was a wire. it was sharp and dangerous. it could have hurt you or someone else. i had to throw it away."

lily felt angry and confused. she did not understand why her star was bad. she liked it very much. she said, "but mom, it was so shiny and pretty. i made it with love. why did you throw it away?"

her mom hugged her and said, "i know, lily, i know. but sometimes, things that look shiny and pretty are not good for us. they can trick us and hurt us. you have to be careful with what you find and what you make. you have many other threads that are safe and beautiful. you can make another star with them. i will help you if you want."

lily nodded and wiped her tears. she still missed her shiny star, but she understood that her mom was right. she went to her box and picked a yellow thread. she said, "mom, can we make a sun with this thread? it is also shiny and pretty, but it is not bad."

her mom smiled and said, "yes, lily, we can. a sun is a wonderful idea. it will shine every day and make you happy. let's make a sun with this thread."

tim and sam are brothers. they like to play with paper and make things. one day, they find a toy laser in their dad's room. it is shiny and red and makes a funny sound.

"let's play with the laser!" tim says. he takes the laser and points it at the wall. he sees a bright dot on the wall. he moves the laser and the dot moves too.

"wow, that's cool!" sam says. he wants to try the laser too. he asks tim to share the laser with him. but tim does not want to share. he says, "no, it's mine! i found it first!"

sam feels sad and angry. he thinks tim is mean. he goes to his room and finds some paper. he decides to make something with the paper. he folds the paper and makes a plane. he folds the paper again and makes a star. he folds the paper some more and makes a flower. he likes to fold paper. he thinks it is fun and creative.

he goes to show his paper things to tim. he hopes tim will like them and play with him. he knocks on tim's door and says, "look, tim, i made some paper things. do you want to see them?"

tim opens the door and sees sam's paper things. he thinks they are pretty and nice. he feels sorry for being mean to sam. he says, "wow, sam, you made some paper things. they are sweet. i'm sorry i did not share the laser with you. do you want to play with the laser now?"

sam smiles and says, "yes, i want to play with the laser. but can we also play with the paper things? i can show you how to fold them. it is easy and fun."

tim nods and says, "yes, let's play with the paper things too. i want to learn how to fold them. it is good to share and learn new things."

they hug and go to play with the laser and the paper things. they have a lot of fun and laugh together. they are happy and good brothers.

once upon a time, there was a girl called june. every day, she would go to the city with her dad to have fun.

one day, when they were at the city, june saw something very special. she saw a big door made of metal with a big red lock on it. her dad said to her, "that lock is special. you have to unlock it with something special."

june was puzzled. she asked her dad, "what do i need to unlock it?"

"you need to be gentle and try to find the small key that opens it," her dad said.

june tried hard to be gentle and eventually found the key. she excitedly opened the lock and what she saw amazed her.

inside the locked door, there were an amazing city full of lights and fun activities. she gasped in wonder and felt happy that she could unlock the door.

june and her dad went through the door and enjoyed the city together. they both had a great time and knew unlocking the door was worth it.

mia and leo were twins who liked to help their mom in the kitchen. they were very enthusiastic and wanted to learn how to cook. one day, their mom let them make some cookies with her. she gave them each a bowl of dough and some cookie cutters.

"look, mia, i made a star!" leo said, showing his cookie to his sister.

"that's nice, leo, but i made a heart!" mia said, snapping her cookie cutter on the dough.

they both smiled and put their cookies on a tray. their mom put the tray in the oven and turned on the stove.

"now we have to wait for the cookies to bake," she said. "but be careful, the stove is very hot. don't touch it, okay?"

"okay, mom," mia and leo said.

they sat on the floor and played with their toys while they waited. they could smell the cookies getting ready. they were very excited.

"mom, are the cookies done?" mia asked.

"let me check," their mom said. she opened the oven and took out the tray. she put it on the counter and used a spatula to lift a cookie.

"ouch!" she said. she dropped the cookie and shook her hand. "the cookie is too hot. i burned my finger."

mia and leo ran to their mom and hugged her.

"are you okay, mom?" leo asked.

"i'm okay, sweetie, it's just a little burn," their mom said. she put some ice on her finger and kissed them both. "thank you for caring. you are such good helpers."

she gave them each a glass of milk and a cookie. they were still warm, but not too hot. they tasted delicious.

mia and leo enjoyed their cookies and thanked their mom. they were very happy. they decided that they loved to cook with their mom.

miley had a friend named lily. they both liked to play yoga. miley was really good at it and lily asked her to lend her a yoga mat. miley said it was fair and lent the mat to lily. 

they had lots of fun practicing yoga together. they moved their bodies into different shapes and laughed when they fell over. 

after playing, lily wanted to lend the mat back to miley. miley said it was no problem and thanked her. they waved goodbye and miley went home with her mat. 

miley and lily had so much fun playing together and they promised to play again soon.

once upon a time there lived a bee. the bee loved to fly around outside in the fresh air. one day as the bee was flying, it saw a nice sunny spot. the bee liked the warm sun, so it flew down and relaxed. suddenly, the bee heard a loud noise and felt a sharp pain. the bee was dead!

the bee had been stung by a big bee. the bee was very sad it had died but it was happy it had been able to relax in the sun for a bit before it passed away.

the other bees were sorry to hear that their friend was dead. they made sure to keep an eye out for any more bees flying around, so that they could stay safe.

the lesson from this story is to relax and enjoy life, but also be careful.

once upon a time, there was a stubborn little rabbit who lived close to the shore. the rabbit loved to explore, but his parents were always warning him to be careful. "if you go close to the water, you will get in trouble!â€ they said.

one beautiful morning, the rabbit was looking at the shore and saw something very exciting - a pile of big rocks! he decided it would be fun to build something with them, so he started gathering rocks and piling them up.

just then, his parents came running up to him. â€œwhat do you think you're doing?â€ they shouted. "you could get hurt if you play so close to the water!â€

the rabbit didn't give in. he was being stubborn and kept on building. suddenly, the ground beneath him started to shake and he started to fall into the icy water! the rabbitâ€™s parents were very scared and grabbed him before he got hurt.

the moral of the story is to always listen to your parents and be careful when you are playing near the water!

sara and tom were playing with their toys in the living room. they liked to make up stories with their dolls and cars. sara had a big doll with long hair and a pink dress. tom had a small car with four wheels and a horn.

"let's pretend that my doll is a princess and your car is a dragon," sara said. "the dragon wants to take the princess to his cave, but she is frightened and wants to escape."

"ok," tom said. "but the dragon is very strong and fast. he can catch the princess easily."

sara and tom moved their toys around the floor, making noises and voices. sara made her doll run away from tom's car, but tom chased her with his car, honking and growling.

"help, help!" sara made her doll cry. "the dragon is coming! he wants to lock me in his cave!"

"no one can help you, princess!" tom made his car say. "you are mine now! i will part you from your friends and family!"

sara did not like tom's game. she felt scared and sad for her doll. she wanted to stop playing, but tom did not listen. he grabbed her doll with his car and tried to pull her hair.

"stop it, tom!" sara shouted. "you are hurting my doll! give her back to me!"

"no, i won't!" tom shouted back. "she is my prisoner! you can't have her!"

sara and tom started to tug and pull on the doll's hair. they both wanted to have the doll, but they did not want to share. they got angry and loud. they did not notice that their mom was watching them from the kitchen.

"hey, hey, hey!" their mom said. "what is going on here? why are you fighting over the doll?"

sara and tom stopped and looked at their mom. they felt ashamed and sorry. they realized that they had been mean and rude to each other.

"we were playing a game, mom," sara said. "but tom was too rough and scary. he wanted to lock my doll in his cave and part her from me."

"i was just pretending, mom," tom said. "but sara did not like my game. she wanted to keep her doll and not let me play with her."

their mom sighed and shook her head. she walked over to them and took the doll from their hands. she looked at the doll's hair and saw that it was tangled and pulled.

"look what you did to the doll," she said. "you ruined her hair. how do you think she feels?"

sara and tom looked at the doll and felt bad. they saw that they had hurt the doll and each other.

"we are sorry, mom," they said. "we are sorry, doll."

their mom smiled and hugged them. she gave them the doll back and helped them fix her hair.

"it's ok, my loves," she said. "i know you were just playing, but you have to be careful and kind. you have to respect each other's toys and feelings. you have to share and take turns. and you have to use your words, not your hands, when you have a problem. ok?"

"ok, mom," sara and tom said. "we understand. we will do better."

they hugged their mom and thanked her. then they hugged each other and apologized. they decided to play a different game, one that they both liked and agreed on. they were happy and friendly again. they learned their lesson.

tom and sue were playing in the garden. they liked to dig and make mud pies. they found an old ashtray in the dirt. it was blue and round and had a picture of a fish on it.

"look, i found a fish bowl!" tom said. he filled the ashtray with water and put some grass and stones in it.

"no, it's not a fish bowl, it's an ashtray. my dad has one like that. he puts his smokes in it." sue said. she took the ashtray from tom and dumped the water out.

"hey, give it back! i want to play with it!" tom said. he grabbed the ashtray from sue and ran away.

sue chased him and tried to get it back. they ran around the garden and splashed in the puddles. they got very wet and dirty. the ashtray got soaked too.

"stop, stop, you're making a mess!" mom said. she came out of the house and saw them. she was not happy. she took the ashtray from them and threw it in the trash.

"that's not a toy, that's a nasty thing. you shouldn't play with it. and look at you, you're soaked and muddy. come inside and get cleaned up." mom said.

tom and sue followed mom inside. they were sad and sorry. they liked the blue ashtray. they wanted to play with it more. but they knew they did something bad. they said sorry to mom and hugged her. mom forgave them and gave them a bath. she told them a story about a real fish bowl and a real fish. tom and sue liked the story. they forgot about the ashtray. they were happy again.

anna liked to shine her flashlight in her bedroom at night. she had many attractive stickers on her flashlight. she liked to make shapes and colors on the wall with the light. she felt happy and safe in her bedroom.

but one night, her brother tom came into her bedroom. he was angry and mean. he said, "stop shining your flashlight! you are making too much noise and light. i can't sleep in my bedroom. give me your flashlight now!" he tried to grab her flashlight from her hand.

anna did not want to give her flashlight to tom. she said, "no, this is my flashlight! you can't have it. go away and leave me alone!" she held her flashlight tight and shone it in tom's face. he squinted and shouted, "ow, that hurts! stop it, stop it!"

they started to fight over the flashlight. they pulled and pushed and yelled. they made a lot of noise and mess in the bedroom. they woke up their mom and dad, who came to see what was wrong.

mom and dad were not happy. they said, "what are you doing? why are you fighting over a flashlight? this is not how you behave at night. you should be quiet and respectful and go to sleep. now, give us the flashlight and say sorry to each other."

anna and tom felt ashamed and sorry. they gave the flashlight to mom and dad and said sorry to each other. they hugged and said good night. mom and dad tucked them in their beds and kissed them. they turned off the light and left the bedroom.

anna and tom closed their eyes and tried to sleep. they did not shine the flashlight anymore. they dreamed of attractive stickers and shapes and colors. they felt happy and safe in their bedroom.

once upon a time, there was a cat. he was gentle and loved to play. one day, he decided to go for a walk. he walked and he walked until he came across an old tree. inside the tree he found a jar of jam. he was so happy! he put the jam in his pocket and continued walking until it was time to go home.

on the way back, he heard a noise. he turned around and saw a little bird. the bird was scared so the cat was very gentle. he moved slowly and spoke softly to the bird. the bird decided to come with him and they began to walk back together.

they arrived home and the cat set the jar of jam down on the table. he remembered the bird and said goodbye. the bird thanked him and flew away.

the cat thought about the bird all night and the next day he decided to return to the old tree. he looked everywhere but the bird was nowhere to be seen. he left some of the jam for the bird and then he gently walked back home.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play in the park with her friends. one day, lily's mom gave her a new toy to play with. it was a shiny red ball that bounced really high.

lily was so happy with her new toy that she wanted to show it to her friends. when she got to the park, she saw that her friends were sad because they couldn't find their treasure box. lily wanted to help her friends, so she provided them with her new ball to play with.

suddenly, one of lily's friends noticed something shiny under a tree. it was the treasure box! they all ran over to see what was inside. they found a bunch of shiny coins and jewels. they were so happy and grateful to lily for providing them with her new toy. from that day on, they all played together with lily's shiny red ball and the treasure box. the end.

once upon a time there was a chubby little bear called ben. he had lots of friends who he liked to play with every day. 

one day, ben and his friends were playing in the park when they saw a big green bean in the grass. "look what i found!" ben said. 

ben's friends were excited and asked him what the bean was. "i don't know," said ben. 

ben's friends all had ideas of what to do with the bean. one suggested they cook it. another suggested they play games with it. 

but ben just smiled and said he had a different idea. then he hugged the bean tight and held it in his arms.

his friends laughed and ben laughed too. "this bean is my new friend," ben said. 

and that's how ben got his new chubby green friend and they have been together ever since.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy loved to play with clay. he would make all sorts of things like animals and cars. one day, timmy decided to make something very unusual. he wanted to make a clay castle with a moat and a drawbridge.

timmy worked very hard on his castle. he rolled and molded the clay until it was just right. but then, he got frustrated because the drawbridge wouldn't stay up. he wanted to quit and throw the clay away. but his mom encouraged him to keep trying.

finally, timmy figured out how to make the drawbridge stay up. he was so happy and proud of his unusual clay castle. he played with it for hours and showed it to all of his friends. timmy learned that even when things get tough, he shouldn't quit because he can do anything he puts his mind to.

lily and tom are friends. they like to play in the park. yesterday, they went to the park with their moms. they saw a big slide. lily wanted to go on the slide, but tom was scared.

"come on, tom, let's go on the slide. it is fun!" lily said.

"no, lily, i don't want to. the slide is too high. i might fall," tom said.

lily was persistent. she tried to make tom go on the slide. she said, "don't be scared, tom. i will go with you. we can hold hands. it will be easy."

tom still said no. he shook his head. he said, "no, lily, i don't like the slide. i like the swings. let's go on the swings."

lily was sad. she wanted to go on the slide with tom. she said, "please, tom, just try it once. maybe you will like it. it is not scary. it is fun."

tom looked at the slide. he looked at lily. he saw that she was sad. he did not want to make her sad. he said, "okay, lily, i will try it once. but only once. and you have to hold my hand."

lily smiled. she said, "thank you, tom. you are a good friend. i will hold your hand. don't worry."

they went on the slide together. they held hands. they slid down fast. they felt the wind in their hair. they laughed.

they reached the bottom. they looked at each other. they were happy.

"wow, that was fun!" tom said.

"see, i told you!" lily said.

they hugged. they went on the slide again. and again. and again. they had a lot of fun. their moms were proud of them. they were brave and persistent. they were good friends.

anna and ben are playing with blocks. they want to make a big building. they put many blocks on top of each other. they are happy.

but then, max comes. max is not nice. he likes to break things. he sees anna and ben's building. he runs to it and twists it. the blocks fall down. anna and ben are sad and angry.

"max, you are stupid!" anna shouts. "why did you twist our building? we worked hard!"

max laughs. he does not care. he thinks it is fun to twist things. he looks for something else to twist.

ben has an idea. he whispers to anna. they make a new plan. they pretend to make another building. but this time, they use sticky tape. they tape the blocks together. they make the building look weak.

max sees the new building. he thinks it is easy to twist. he runs to it and twists it. but nothing happens. the building does not fall. the tape holds the blocks. max is confused. he twists harder. he hurts his hand.

anna and ben laugh. they tricked max. they say, "max, you are stupid! you cannot twist our building. it is strong!"

max is mad. he runs away. he does not want to play with them anymore.

anna and ben are happy. they hug each other. they keep their building. they are proud.

once upon a time, there was a lonely tree. the tree had no friends. it stood in a row with other trees, but they were far away.

one day, a little bird came to the tree. the bird was tired and needed a place to rest. the tree let the bird sit on its branch. the bird was happy and gave the tree a big squeeze with its wings.

from that day on, the tree and the bird were best friends. they were not lonely anymore. they played together every day, and the tree was very happy to have a friend.

once upon a time there was a princess who lived in a castle far away. she was a very gentle princess, who smiled gently and had a kind heart.

one day, the princess was walking through the forest when she heard a loud noise coming from the distance. the noise was getting louder and louder. she quickly realised that it was a monster and it was coming closer!

the princess started to run and quickly, very quickly, she ran back to her castle. she opened the door and hurried inside. the princess was scared, but she remembered to close the big door behind her, so the monster couldn't follow.

the princess was safe now, she was so relieved. she went to the kitchen and made herself a nice cup of warm milk to drink. it was a mild, sweet drink and it made her feel much better.

the princess slowly started to relax, but then she remembered that she still had to save the people from the danger. she put on her princely clothes and ran outside to save the people from the monster. hurry princess!

lily and ben were friends who liked to play in the park. they liked to swing, slide and run, but their favorite thing was to splash in the puddles after the rain. they wore boots and coats and laughed as they made the water fly.

one day, they saw a big puddle near the fence. it was the biggest puddle they had ever seen. they ran towards it, eager to splash. but when they got closer, they saw something moving in the water. it was a frog.

"hello, frog," lily said. "can we splash with you?"

the frog did not answer. it just croaked and jumped away.

"come back, frog," ben said. "we want to be your friend."

the frog did not come back. it hid under a leaf.

lily and ben were persistent. they did not give up. they looked for the frog in the puddle, under the leaves, behind the rocks. they called its name and made frog noises. they hoped the frog would change its mind and play with them.

but the frog did not want to play. it was scared of the big boots and the loud voices. it wanted to be alone and quiet. it wished the children would go away.

then, lily had an idea. she took off her boots and coat and put them on the ground. she walked slowly and softly to the puddle. she smiled and whispered to the frog.

"please, frog, don't be afraid. we are nice and gentle. we just want to splash and have fun. will you join us?"

the frog looked at lily. she did not look so scary without her boots and coat. she looked kind and friendly. she sounded sweet and calm. the frog felt curious and brave. it decided to give lily a chance.

it jumped out of the leaf and landed on lily's hand. lily gasped and giggled. she showed ben the frog.

"look, ben, the frog came to me. he wants to be our friend."

ben was happy and surprised. he took off his boots and coat and joined lily. he touched the frog gently and said hello.

the frog croaked and smiled. it liked lily and ben. they were nice and gentle. they wanted to splash and have fun. it decided to join them.

they splashed in the puddle together, the frog, lily and ben. they made the water fly. they laughed and croaked. they became friends.

once upon a time, there was a little bird. he had the softest, fluffiest feathers and the cutest little beak. the bird loved to sing. every morning, he would wake up, flutter his wings, and sing the sweetest songs.

one day, the little bird met a bigger bird. the bigger bird taught him some new songs. they sang together and flew around the sky, creating a beautiful melody. the little bird loved learning the new songs and he practiced them every day.

the little bird kept singing the new songs and he soon became the best singer in the forest. all the other birds came to listen to him and he even began teaching them the new songs. he taught them how to chirp in perfect harmony and soon, the whole forest was singing together!

once upon a time there was a piano in a room. it was shiny and organized. every day, a little girl would come to the room and roll around the piano. she loved to roll and have fun.

one day, the little girl decided to see what sounds the piano made when she rolled across it. she rolled a little slower this time, and the piano made a gentle tinkling sound. she loved it.

she kept rolling over the piano with different speeds, seeing what different sounds it made. she found that if she rolled fast, the piano made a loud noise. but when she rolled slower, it was more gentle.

the little girl was so happy and amazed. she kept rolling across the piano until it was time for dinner. she said good-bye to her piano and promised to come back and play again tomorrow.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a big, brown teddy bear that she loved very much. one day, lily's mom gave her a new novel to read. it was about a princess who lived in a castle.

lily sat down with her teddy bear and started reading the novel. but she soon realized that her teddy bear was too big and was covering the words in the book. she said to her teddy bear, "please remove yourself so i can read."

teddy bear moved aside and lily continued reading. she was so engrossed in the story that she didn't notice when her mom came in and said, "lily, it's time for bed." lily closed her novel and gave her teddy bear a big hug before going to sleep.

once upon a time, in a small house, there was a little girl named sue. sue loved to eat sweet things. one day, sue saw a big pastry on the kitchen table. it was cool and looked yummy. sue wanted to eat the pastry, but it was not hers.

sue thought, "i will just peek at the pastry, and maybe take a little bite." sue took a bite, but she did not stop. she ate the whole pastry. sue felt happy but also a little bad.

later, sue's mom came home with her little brother, tim. tim was sad and crying. mom said, "tim did a good job at school today, so i bought him a big, cool pastry as a treat. but now it's gone!" sue felt very bad. she knew she should not have eaten the pastry. the moral of the story is to not take things that are not yours.

one day, a little girl named sue went to the park with her mom. sue saw a big orange cat sitting on the grass. the cat was very pretty, and sue wanted to play with it. she ran to the cat and said, "hi, cat! let's play!"

the cat looked at sue and said, "i lost my tooth. can you help me find it?" sue wanted to help her new friend. they both looked around the park, under the trees and near the swings.

after a while, sue found a small, white tooth on the ground. "look, cat! i found your tooth!" the cat was very happy and thanked sue. they played together all day, and sue had a new orange friend.

once upon a time, there was a girl named sue. sue was very happy in her small house. one day, she saw a field across the street. sue thought the field was so pretty, so she decided to kneel down and admire it from afar. 

but when sue knelt down, she found that someone had plopped a cheap chair in the middle of the field. sue felt sad, because she wanted to take a closer look at the grass, trees, and flowers stored in that field. 

sue knew she had to do something, so she went to her neighbour's house to ask him for help. when her neighbour heard her story, he helped sue take the chair away so she could explore the field. 

sue was so relieved and thanked her neighbour for the help. now, sue was finally able to kneel down in the field and admire the beauty it had to offer. she was so happy!

once upon a time, there was a kind rabbit named benny. benny lived in a cozy burrow with his friends, the squirrels and the birds. benny loved to count the flowers in the meadow and the acorns in the trees.

one day, benny found a pretty frame in the woods. he wanted to show it to his friends, but he didn't want to be rude. so, he asked politely if he could borrow the frame to show them. his friends were happy to see the frame and thanked benny for being so polite.

but then, something bad happened. benny accidentally broke the frame while he was showing it to his friends. his friends were upset and benny felt very sorry. he tried to fix the frame, but it was too broken. benny learned that even when you're polite, accidents can still happen.

once there was a rabbit who was hungry. he knew he would have to find food, so he started to look. he saw a carrot and thought it looked tasty. 

he hopped over to the carrot and asked, "can i have a bite?"

the carrot answered, "yes, of course you can!" 

the rabbit was so happy and thanked the carrot for being so kind. he took a big bite and was very satisfied. 

but then he realised he had been too eager. he hadn't asked the carrot's owner for permission. the rabbit felt ashamed for not asking and ran away quickly. 

the end!

anna and ben are friends. they like to play in the park. one day, they see a big bus. the bus is pink. it has many pictures on it. the bus says: "come and join the fun trip!"

anna and ben are curious. they want to see the bus. they run to the bus. they see a man. the man has a hat and a smile. he says: "hello, kids! do you want to go on a fun trip with me? i have toys and candy and games for you!"

anna and ben are excited. they say: "yes, please! we want to go on the fun trip!" they try to get on the bus. but then they hear a voice. the voice is loud and angry. it is their mom.

"anna! ben! stop! do not go on the bus! come back here!" their mom says. she runs to them. she grabs their hands. she pulls them away from the bus. she says: "that is a bad man! he is not your friend! he wants to take you away from me! you have to mind me! you have to stay with me!"

anna and ben are scared. they do not understand. they say: "but mom, he has a fun trip! he has toys and candy and games! why can't we go with him?"

their mom says: "no, no, no! he is lying to you! he does not have a fun trip! he has a bad trip! he has no toys and candy and games! he has danger and pain and sadness! you have to trust me! you have to listen to me! i love you! i want to keep you safe!"

anna and ben are sad. they do not want to go on a bad trip. they do not want to have danger and pain and sadness. they want to have fun and joy and love. they hug their mom. they say: "we are sorry, mom. we did not know. we love you, too. we will mind you. we will stay with you."

their mom says: "it's okay, my darlings. i am not mad at you. i am glad you are with me. you are very brave and smart. you did the right thing. come on, let's go home. we can have our own fun trip. we can play with your toys and eat some candy and read some books. how does that sound?"

anna and ben say: "that sounds great, mom! thank you, mom! you are the best mom!" they smile and hold their mom's hand. they walk away from the bus. they do not look back. they are happy. they are safe. they are loved.

once upon a time, there was a little bunny who loved to eat carrots. he lived in a cozy burrow made of wood. one day, the bunny found a tiny orange seed and decided to plant it in his garden. he watered it every day and watched it grow bigger and bigger.

after a few weeks, the seed turned into a big orange tree. the bunny was so happy and proud of his tree. he loved to sit under it and eat his carrots. but one day, a big storm came and destroyed the bunny's burrow and his beloved orange tree. the bunny was very sad and had to find a new home.

one day, a little boy named tim found a clean knob in his yard. he liked the clean knob and wanted to keep it. so, he decided to bury it in the ground to hide it from his friends.

tim dug a small hole and put the clean knob inside. then, he covered it up with dirt. he was very happy with his secret. later, his friend sally came over to play. they played with toys and had fun.

tim wanted to show sally the clean knob, but he was scared she would take it. so, he said, "sally, i have a secret. i buried a clean knob in the yard, but you can't take it, okay?" sally agreed and they went to the spot where tim buried the knob. they dug and dug, but they could not find the clean knob.

tim was sad and said, "i can't find my clean knob. i lost it." sally felt bad for tim, but she didn't know how to help. they looked for the knob all day, but they never found it. tim was very sad and cried because he lost his clean knob. the day ended with tim feeling upset and without his clean knob.

once upon a time, there was a little boy called jack. he was only three years old but he loved exploring. one day, he went on an adventure and found a deep, dark well. he wanted to see what was inside so he dropped a pebble down the well.

suddenly he heard a splash! he was so surprised. he shouted down the well, "hello, who's down there?"

a deep, grumbly voice replied, "it's me! i'm a friendly ogre. what have you dropped down here?"

jack was a bit ashamed so he admitted, "just a tiny pebble".

the ogre laughed, "that was kind of you! now i have a game that i like to play. could you drop down something else so i can play?"

jack thought for a moment before deciding. he dropped down some small stones and he heard the ogre laughing. jack was so happy he had made the ogre happy. in the end, jack felt so proud that he had made a new friend.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. he had a shiny gold toy car that he loved to play with. one day, he took his car to the park to play with his friends.

as he was playing, timmy noticed a big dog walking towards him. the dog looked nervous and timmy felt scared. he sighed and wanted to run away, but he didn't want to leave his toy car behind.

suddenly, the dog started barking and timmy's friends ran away. timmy was left alone with the dog, feeling even more nervous. but then, the dog picked up timmy's gold toy car in its mouth and brought it back to him. timmy was so happy and grateful that he gave the dog a big hug. from that day on, timmy and the dog became best friends and played together every day at the park.

once upon a time there was a prince. he was very brave and powerful and loved to explore the land. one day he decided to go on a great journey. he rode on his horse, but the horse slipped and the prince fell off. he was now broken and had to be taken home. 

when the prince arrived home the people wanted to catch him and take care of him. so they surrounded him and softly caught him. they were so gentle with him that he did not feel sore at all. 

after the prince was taken care of, he got better and better each day. until one day he could fly and explore the land like he used to. he was back to his old self again and all the people were happy. 

the end.

once upon a time there was a little lady called lily. she lived in a meadow full of flowers. every day she would make sure that the flowers were clean and happy. one day a flower in the meadow needed some extra care. lily was eager to help, so she started taking care of it.

she watered it with love and care, and before long the flower began to bloom. lily knew that if she took care of the flower it would eventually bloom. this taught her a valuable lesson, that with enough love and care anything can blossom and grow.

she continued to take care of the other flowers, and soon the entire meadow was filled with bright and beautiful blooms. all the other ladies in the meadow were very impressed and wanted to learn from lily. they asked her to teach them how to make their flowers bloom. lily smiled and said, â€œnothing will bloom without love and care.â€ 

the other ladies were very impressed with lily. she showed them that love and care are essential to make something beautiful bloom. from that day on, they all looked after the meadow and the flowers, and everyone was happy.

alice was playing hide and seek with her friends. she hid behind the brick wall in the garden. she was so excited and impatient to be found! 
but soon, alice could feel the ground shaking and trembling. she was scared and couldn't understand what was happening. she slowly looked around the corner of the brick wall. 
suddenly, she saw a big, green and yellow monster! it was so tall, it almost touched the sky. alice trembled with fear.

seeing the scared little girl, the monster smiled and said in a gentle voice, "it's alright! i'm here to join your game. come out and let's play together."

alice was relieved. she and her friends started playing and the monster joined in too. they both had lots of fun!

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she lived on a farm with her family and their animals. one day, lily and her brother jack went to the barn to play. jack said, "let's play hide and seek!" and lily agreed.

while they were playing, they heard a loud noise outside. they went to the door and saw a big storm coming. lily said, "we need to pray for the storm to go away." jack asked, "what does 'pray' mean?" and lily explained, "it means we talk to god and ask him to help us."

they held hands and prayed for the storm to stop. after a few minutes, the storm went away and the sun came out. lily said, "god heard our prayer!" and jack said, "that's amazing!"

from that day on, lily and jack prayed regularly and thanked god for all the good things in their lives. they also continued to play in the barn and have fun together.

once there was a little boy named bob. bob could not open the drawer in his bedroom. the drawer was so difficult to unlock! he tried again and again and still could not open it.

bob was very frustrated and started to cry. then his mom came into the room. she saw the drawer that was giving bob so much difficulty. she smiled, and said, â€œdonâ€™t worry bob, i can help you unlock the drawer.â€

bob's mom put her hand on the drawer and softly whispered, â€œunlock!â€ suddenly, the drawer opened! bob was so happy and surprised. he opened the drawer and found lots of games and toys! he was so excited and thanked his mom for helping him unlock the drawer.

from then on, bob was excited to play with the toys he found in the drawer. he could not believe that unlocking the drawer was so easy!

john was a generous boy who liked to perform. everyday, he would do tricks for his family and friends and make them laugh. one day john had a very special trick to show. he put out his thumb and said,"watch this".

john's mom watched and said,"what are you going to do, honey?"

john looked up at her with a huge smile and said,"i'm going to make my thumb disappear!"

john closed his fist and waved it around, then opened it slowly. sure enough, his thumb had vanished! john's family and friends were amazed and cheered with laughter.

john had performed the best trick yet. he was so proud of himself. from then on, he kept performing amazing tricks, and everyone continued to be amazed.

once upon a time, there was a hidden minute. no one had ever seen it. but it was always there, waiting for someone to discover it.

one day, a three year old girl called lucy was walking through the woods. suddenly, in the middle of a big sunny meadow, something caught her eye. it was the hidden minute, lying in the grass.

lucy picked it up and took it home. she put it on the kitchen window sill. as the sun shone on it, the hidden minute began to melt.

when lucy woke up the next day, she couldn't believe her eyes. instead of a hidden minute, there was a beautiful shimmering puddle of sunshine in the kitchen window sill. she smiled and laughed with delight.

from then on, every morning lucy would wake up and watch the minute melting. she enjoyed watching it change shape and glimmer in the sun.

once upon a time, there was a big, heavy rock. a little boy named timmy wanted to see if he could lift it. he tried and tried, but it was too heavy for him. 

one day, timmy's dad dug a hole in the ground. timmy wondered what it was for. his dad said they were going to test the soil to see if it was good for planting seeds. 

timmy thought it was fun to watch his dad put dirt in a little bag and send it away to be tested. he wanted to help, but he knew the bag was too heavy for him to carry. so, he just watched and learned.

once upon a time, there was a big, wild lion. he was very strong and had a big, fluffy mane. one day, he saw a white rabbit and chased after it. the rabbit ran as fast as it could, but the lion was too fast. the rabbit screamed for help, but no one came. just when the lion was about to catch the rabbit, a kind girl appeared and scared the lion away. the rabbit was safe and happy.

once, a poor family lived in a small house. the father was often away at work and the mother had to look after their three children all on her own. every year the mother insisted that the children saved a little bit of money. 

the eldest child was 7, the middle child was 5 and the youngest child was only 3. the youngest child was too young to understand why his mother insisted that they save money but he listened to her anyways.

one day, the mother insisted that the children put their money in the bank. the eldest and middle children each had five dollars and the youngest just had one. he thought it was too little to save but his mother said it was a good start.

even though he was only three, the youngest child was determined to save money like his mother insisted. every week he added a cents or two to his money box until he eventually had enough to put in the bank. 

when he did, the mother said that he was a clever boy for following her instructions and would be rewarded for it one day. the youngest child smiled, knowing that he did the right thing.

once upon a time, in a big forest, there lived a funny monkey named max. max loved to joke and make his friends laugh. he would swing from tree to tree, playing with all the animals.

one day, max found a big, yellow banana. he thought it would be easy to share it with his friends. max called out to all his friends to come and see the banana. they all came running and were very excited.

max thought of a funny joke to play with the banana. he put the banana on the ground and waited for his friend, the elephant, to come by. when the elephant walked close, max yelled, "watch out for the banana!" the elephant stopped and laughed. all the animals laughed too. they knew max was always joking. they shared the banana and had a fun day in the forest.

once there was a boy who was very nervous. one day, he saw a monster. he was so scared that he wanted to go and hide. he ran to his bedroom and closed the door. 

he looked around and noticed a red crayon. he knew that he could use it to draw something on the door, and he thought it could protect him from the monster. so, he got the crayon and started to draw. 

he took a deep breath and said: "mom, can you help me? there is a monster outside and i am scared." 

his mom smiled and said, "no worries, my dear. let's cut a big circle in the door, then you will be safe. " 

the boy nodded, and together with his mom, they cut a big circle in the door. the boy looked through the circle and saw that the monster was gone. 

he was so relieved and happy. from then on, whenever he was scared, he knew that he could cut a circle in the door.

once there was a nice bottle. his name was fancy. he lived on top of the mountain. every day he waved to the birds who flew by.

one day a little boy found fancy. his name was jack. he took him home. jack showed him to his mommy and daddy. they said he was a fancy bottle.

jack liked to take fancy everywhere. he put him in his pocket and took him to the park. he showed him to the ducks swimming in the pond. 

they had so much fun together. they explored the park, played games, and even ate ice-cream. 

jack kept fancy safe and they stayed friends forever.

tom and lily went to the zoo with their mom. they wanted to see the monkeys. they ran to the monkey house and looked at the big glass. they saw many monkeys. some monkeys were swinging on ropes. some monkeys were eating bananas. some monkeys were playing with each other.

tom and lily observed the monkeys. they liked the monkeys. they pointed at the monkeys and said their names. they said, "look, mom, a brown monkey! look, mom, a black monkey! look, mom, a baby monkey!"

one monkey was very funny. he was spinning on a tire. he spun faster and faster. he made funny noises. he made tom and lily laugh. he stopped spinning and jumped off the tire. he looked very dizzy. he wobbled and fell on the ground. he made tom and lily laugh more.

the dizzy monkey got up and shook his head. he looked at tom and lily. he smiled and waved at them. he picked up a banana and threw it at the glass. he made a loud bang. he made tom and lily jump. he made tom and lily scream.

mom said, "don't be scared. the monkey is just playing. he can't hurt you. he is behind the glass." she hugged tom and lily. she said, "did you like the monkeys?" tom and lily nodded. they said, "yes, mom, we liked the monkeys. but the dizzy monkey was the best!"

once there was a little boy. he was three years old. his mom and dad wanted to measure him to see how tall he was. 

the little boy was excited. he watched his parents take out a measure. it was a long, thin, tight piece of string.

they started to measure from the top of his head to the floor. they had to be very careful to make sure it was tight. 

when his mom and dad put the measure up against the wall, something funny happened. they both let out a gasp as the measure struck the wall!

the little boy was so surprised. he was sure he had grown so much! but his parents told him he was still the same height as before. 

the little boy smiled because he knew his mom and dad still love him. he knew he didn't have to be tall to be special to them.

lily and max are friends who like to play in the park. they admire the big kids who can run fast and jump high. they want to be like them when they grow up.

one day, they see a sign that says "exercise class". they think it is a fun game where they can learn to run fast and jump high. they follow the sign and join the class.

but the class is not what they expect. it is hard and boring. the teacher makes them do push-ups, sit-ups, and squats. they do not like it at all. they want to play and have fun.

"max, this is not a game. this is work. i do not want to do this anymore. let's go back to the park." lily says.

"but lily, we have to finish the class. maybe then we can run fast and jump high like the big kids. we have to try." max says.

"no, max. this is not fun. this is silly. come on, let's go." lily says. she grabs max's hand and pulls him away from the class.

the teacher sees them and shouts. "hey, where are you going? you have to stay and finish the exercise. it is good for you. come back here!"

but lily and max do not listen. they run away as fast as they can. they go back to the park and play with their toys. they are happy and free. they do not need to do the exercise class. they can run fast and jump high in their own way. they admire each other and their own skills. they are the best friends ever.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to wear her favorite dress with flowers on it. every day, she would wear it and twirl around in it, feeling happy.

one day, lily went to the park with her mom. she played on the swings and the slide, but then she noticed something. her dress had a big stain on it! she started to worry that her dress was ruined and she wouldn't be able to wear it anymore.

but her mom was very careful and she knew how to get the stain out. she showed lily a pattern of how to wash the dress and make it clean again. lily was so happy that her dress was saved and she could wear it again. she hugged her mom and felt very grateful.

once upon a time there was a wealthy boy. he was very mean and loved to tease the other children. one day, he was playing with a shiny pin. he went to the park to find someone to tease.

he soon found a little girl, who was only three. the boy thought it would be fun to tease her with the pin. he showed the girl the pin, and she was so excited. she started to laugh and smile.

but then, the wealthy boy teasing her with the pin got too close. he accidentally poked the little girl with the pin! ouch! the girl started to cry. she had never felt such pain.

the wealthy boy was scared. he ran away from the park, leaving the little girl all alone. he did not apologize or even look back. 

the little girl was so sad and scared. she had never been teased like that before. she never wanted to see the wealthy boy again. 

the end.

sally saw a perfect tree in her backyard. she was excited and wanted to climb it. she grabbed a hold of the trunk and started to climb.

halfway up the tree, she saw a worm. it was round and wiggling. she wanted to touch it, so she reached out and touched it gently. the worm wriggled around and then crawled away.

she kept on climbing, until she reached the top. from up there, she could see everything. the view was perfect!

she smiled and hugged the tree. then, she carefully climbed down. before she went inside, sally looked up at the tree and thanked it.

once upon a time there were two little cats named ted and sarah. they were best friends and could not stand to be apart. sarah wanted to visit ted in his office, so she asked her mommy if she could go. but mommy said no, because she thought it was too far away and not safe. sad and frustrated, sarah turned to ted. 

"it isn't fair," she said. 

"i want to come to your office with you and have some fun. why can't mommy just let me go?"

just then, ted's boss stepped in. "no," he said, "it is not safe for young cats to come to an office. we have a lot of important things here that need to be taken care of-it's too selfish to let children just run around."

but ted could see that sarah was very sad. he wanted to make her feel better so he said, "it's okay, sarah. i will ask my boss if he will let you come and visit me in the office one day. i promise!" 

sarah smiled and decided she could wait. she knew that, in the end, ted would be able to make it happen.

the lazy east rocket was parked in the sky. it had been so quiet and still for so long that some of the stars could barely remember its name. one day, a small alien called bob decided to take a look inside. he wanted to be the first to lift off in this rocket and journey to never before explored parts of the universe.

bob approached the rocket and said excitedly, â€œiâ€™m going to be the first one to lift off in this rocket!â€ but when he tried to open the door, he discovered it wouldnâ€™t budge. no matter how hard he pushed, it just wouldnâ€™t move.

bob leaned against the rocket and groaned. â€œwhat am i going to do now?â€ he wondered. then he had an idea. maybe if he got some help from the other aliens, they could lift the door together. so bob ran back to the alien base and asked his friends if they could help him.

the other aliens were lazy, so they told bob they would come and help him tomorrow. but when they arrived the next morning, it was too late. the rocket had rusted and broken apart, and bob was nowhere to be found.

a sad ending indeed. all of the aliens were devastated that they were too lazy to lift the door open the day before and help bob with his ambitious space mission.

jamie was in a room. it was very calm. jamie looked around. he could hear a sound. he listened and then he heard it. it was music and it was very soft. jamie liked it. he smiled. then he heard someone talking. he listened to the voice. it was his mom talking. he couldn't understand what she was saying but it sounded nice. he was peaceful and happy. he stayed in the room, listening to the music and his mom's voice. it was a nice moment.

lila and ben are friends. they like to play in the park. one day, they see a big truck. the truck has ice-cream. lila and ben love ice-cream. they run to the truck.

the man in the truck is nice. he smiles at lila and ben. he says, "what do you want?" lila and ben look at the ice-cream. there are many kinds. lila wants chocolate. ben wants strawberry. they tell the man.

the man gives them ice-cream. he says, "that will be two coins." lila and ben look at their pockets. they have no coins. they are sad. they say, "sorry, we have no coins."

the man sees their sad faces. he feels sorry for them. he is humble. he says, "it's okay. you can have the ice-cream for free. but you have to do something for me." lila and ben say, "what do we have to do?"

the man says, "you have to use your manners. you have to say thank you and please. and you have to share your ice-cream with someone who has none." lila and ben say, "okay, we can do that." they say, "thank you, sir. you are very kind." they take their ice-cream and go to the park.

they see a girl sitting on a bench. she has no ice-cream. she looks lonely. lila and ben go to her. they say, "hi, we are lila and ben. do you want some ice-cream?" the girl says, "yes, please. that would be nice." lila and ben share their ice-cream with her. they make a new friend. they are happy. they use their manners. they use their ice-cream. they are humble.

once upon a time there was a girl named molly. she was only three years old and she wanted something very special. one day her mommy and daddy offered her a beautiful cushion. it was fluffy and pink and very adorable. molly was so happy and hugged it tight. she carried it around everywhere, even to her friend's houses. 

her friends wanted one too and so molly happily offered hers to them. they all had so much fun playing with their cushions and trying to make the softest and cuddliest one. after a while, the friends put them away, thanked molly and said goodbye. 

molly took her cushion home and proudly showed it to her mommy and daddy. they told her that she had been a very kind and generous girl. molly smiled and went to bed with her cushion. she had the nicest dreams about her cute, adorable cushion. the end.

once there was an ugly barn. one day, a kangaroo arrived at the barn. he wanted to jump inside, but the door was closed. luckily, the kangaroo had a clever idea. he jumped up, and put his paws on the door. with a big push, he managed to open it! soon the kangaroo was jumping up and down, exploring the barn. he discovered lots of things, and had lots of fun. 

the kangaroo was so busy jumping around that he didn't notice the farmer coming. when he saw the kangaroo, the farmer was astonished! he chased the kangaroo out of the barn. the kangaroo was scared, so he jumped, and jumped, and jumped until he was far away from the ugly barn.

once there was a cute purple bear. he liked to play in the park each day. he liked to play tag, hide and seek and even run around in the grass. one day a girl came to the park to play. she saw the cute purple bear and asked "can i play too?"

the bear said, "of course!" so, they both played all day. the girl and the bear chased each other and laughed. the sun was setting and they knew they had to go home, so they said goodbye. 

the girl said, "let's play again tomorrow." the bear smiled and said, "yes, let's play tomorrow!" 

the girl skipped home with a smile in her heart and the bear went back to his den. they had had a fun day playing together.

once upon a time, there was a shy little girl named lily who loved flowers. she had a pretty vase that she liked to use to put them in. one day, lily's mom asked her to help stir the cake batter. lily was nervous, but she wanted to help her mom.

as they stirred the batter, lily's mom said, "i bet these cupcakes will be as pretty as the flowers in your vase." lily smiled, feeling proud that she was helping. they put the batter in the oven and waited.

when the cupcakes were done, lily's mom took them out and they looked delicious. lily's mom said, "let's put them in your vase to make them look even prettier." lily was surprised but excited. they put the cupcakes in the vase and it looked beautiful.

lily's dad came home and saw the vase full of cupcakes. he said, "wow, those look yummy! did you make them, lily?" lily smiled and nodded. she was no longer shy, but proud of what she had accomplished.

once upon a time, there was a happy owl. the owl lived in a big tree. the tree was in a pretty forest. the owl liked to play with his friends.
