one day, the owl saw a little girl. the girl was lost in the forest. the owl wanted to help her. the owl said, "let me take you home." the girl was happy to see the owl. she said, "yes, please help me."

the owl flew high in the sky. he saw the girl's house. the owl showed the girl the way. they walked together. soon, they reached the girl's house. the girl was so happy. she thanked the owl. the owl was happy too. they became good friends.

once there was an elderly lady who was walking down the street. she was holding a big rubber ball. she suddenly heard a voice from behind her.

"hi! can i hold the ball too?" the voice belonged to a small three-year-old.

the elderly lady smiled and said, "of course you can! take the ball and make sure you don't drop it."

the little boy held the ball with both hands and excitedly said, "wow! this rubber is so bouncy!" he began bouncing it up and down the street. 

when he stopped, the elderly lady said, "make sure you give the rubber ball back when you're done." 

the little boy smiled, thanked the elderly lady and ran off with the rubber ball.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. he loved to swing on the swings at the park. he wore a blue shirt and pants. one day, he saw a man in a suit walking towards him. the man asked timmy if he wanted to swing higher. timmy said yes and the man pushed him. but the man pushed too hard and timmy flew off the swing and got hurt. the man in the suit ran away and timmy was sad.

one day, mommy and daddy took john to the beach. john was excited! he saw the tide coming in and out and watched the birds flying around.

mommy and daddy went for a walk to explore the beach and offered john a snack. but he wanted something special. so they offered him an ice cream. john was so happy!

john was embarrassed when he dropped some of his ice cream. it spilled all over the sand. he didn't know what to do and he felt embarrassed.

mommy and daddy told him it was ok. they offered him a towel to clean up and hugged him tight. daddy said that everyone makes mistakes, even grownups like them! that made john feel better. 

with a full tummy and a happy heart, john watched the tide come in and out until it was time to go home.

once there was a big black bear who liked to run. everywhere he went he would turn and look around to see if he was being followed. one day, he got very tired and stopped to take a rest.

suddenly, he heard something behind him. he turned and saw a little girl wearing a pink dress. she was looking right at him with a friendly smile.

"hello!" said the little girl.

the black bear smiled back. "hello!" he replied.

the little girl asked, "what were you doing?"

"i was running," the black bear replied.

the little girl smiled and said, "i like to run too! can i run with you?"

the black bear was so happy, he nodded his head and said, "yes, let's go!"

so the little girl and the big black bear went running together, turning and looking around and making sure no one was following them. they had a lot of fun running around and before long, they had forgotten all about being tired.

once there was a little girl named lucy. she was wearing her favourite clothes; a pink dress and yellow shoes. she was walking in the park when she spotted a butterfly on a flower. she admired the butterfly, its wings seemed to blink in the sunlight.

suddenly a different butterfly flew by. it was bigger and brighter than the first one. lucy couldn't help but smile.

just then, a voice called out to her. it was her mother. "lucy! time to go". her mother looked friendly and polite. 

lucy said goodbye to the butterflies and thanked them for the nice surprise. she promised to come back soon to say hello. 

her mother smiled, it was time for them to go home. lucy happily took her mother's hand, and off they went.

lily and ben are playing with tubes in the park. they like to roll them down the hill and watch them go fast. they also like to make sounds with them, like horns and whistles.

"look, lily, i can make a loud horn with this tube!" ben says, blowing into a big tube.

"that is nice, ben, but i can make a whistle with this tube!" lily says, holding a small tube to her mouth.

they take turns making sounds with their tubes, and laugh and clap. they are having fun.

but then, they see their mom waving at them from the car. she is holding their bags and coats. she says it is time to go home.

"come on, lily and ben, we have to leave now. it is getting late and cold. say goodbye to the park and the tubes," mom says.

lily and ben feel sad. they do not want to leave the park and the tubes. they want to play more.

"can we take the tubes with us, mom?" lily asks.

"no, sweetie, we cannot. the tubes belong to the park. we have to leave them here for other kids to play with. maybe we can come back another day and play with them again," mom says.

lily and ben nod. they understand. they say goodbye to the park and the tubes. they hug and thank them for the fun. they put the tubes back where they found them.

then, they run to the car and get in. mom buckles them up and drives away. they wave at the park and the tubes one last time.

they are still sad, but they are also happy. they had a nice day with the tubes. they hope to see them again soon.

tom and lily were playing with their toys in the living room. they liked to pretend they were doctors and nurses, and they had a phone to call for help. the phone was heavy and had many buttons, but they knew how to use it.

suddenly, they heard a loud knock on the door. they ran to see who it was. it was their grandma, who came to visit them. they were happy to see her and hugged her.

"hello, my darlings," grandma said. "i have a surprise for you. do you want to see it?"

"yes, yes, yes!" tom and lily said.

grandma opened her big bag and took out a small box. she gave it to tom and lily. they opened it and saw a shiny new phone. it was light and had a screen and many colors.

"wow, thank you, grandma!" tom and lily said. "this is the best phone ever!"

they wanted to play with the new phone right away. but they had a problem. they both wanted to hold it and press the buttons. they started to fight over it.

"give it to me, it's mine!" tom said.

"no, it's mine, i saw it first!" lily said.

they pulled and pushed and shouted. the phone slipped from their hands and fell on the floor. it broke into pieces. they were shocked and sad.

"oh no, what have we done?" tom said.

"we broke the phone, grandma will be mad!" lily said.

they looked at grandma, who was watching them. she was not mad. she was sad.

"i'm sorry, grandma," tom and lily said. "we were bad. we didn't share the phone. we broke your surprise."

grandma hugged them and said, "it's okay, my darlings. i'm not mad. i'm sad because you fought over a thing. things are not important. love is important. you are important. you are my surprise. can you share your love with each other?"

tom and lily nodded and said, "yes, grandma. we love you. we love each other. we're sorry."

they hugged grandma and each other. they felt better. they didn't need the phone to play. they had each other. they were happy.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. lily was very hungry and she wanted to eat some cookies. she went to her mom and said, "mommy, i want to eat cookies!" her mom said, "okay, let's go to the kitchen and get some cookies."

lily held her mom's hand and they walked to the kitchen. lily's mom gave her some cookies and lily was very happy. she ate all the cookies and said, "mommy, i want more cookies!" her mom said, "no, lily. you can't have more cookies. you will get a tummy ache."

lily was sad and said, "but i'm still hungry." her mom said, "okay, let's make some popcorn instead." lily held her mom's hand and they went to the living room to make popcorn. they had a fun time making popcorn and watching a movie together. lily was no longer hungry and she was happy to spend time with her mom.

lily loved lollipops. she liked to lick them and make them smaller and smaller. she liked the sweet taste and the bright colors. but she did not like to bathe. she hated the water and the soap and the shampoo. she cried and kicked when her mom tried to wash her.

one day, her mom had a clever idea. she bought a big lollipop for lily and told her it was a special one. she said it was a magic lollipop that could make her happy and clean. she said lily had to bathe first and then she could have the lollipop. lily was curious and wanted the lollipop, but she was also troubled. she did not trust the water and the soap and the shampoo.

her mom filled the tub with warm water and bubbles. she put some toys and a rubber duck in the water. she said it was a fun bath and lily could play with the toys and the duck. she said she would be gentle and quick with the soap and the shampoo. she said she would not let the water go in lily's eyes or nose. she said lily could hold the lollipop in her hand while she bathed.

lily was still troubled, but she also wanted the lollipop. she decided to try the bath. she took the lollipop and got in the tub. she played with the toys and the duck. she licked the lollipop and made it smaller and smaller. she let her mom wash her hair and body. she did not cry or kick. she found out the bath was not so bad. she felt happy and clean.

when she got out of the tub, she dried herself with a fluffy towel. she put on her pajamas and brushed her teeth. she finished the lollipop and threw away the stick. she hugged her mom and said thank you. she said she liked the magic lollipop and the fun bath. she said she would bathe again tomorrow. her mom smiled and kissed her. she said she was proud of lily and she loved her. she said good night and tucked her in bed. lily fell asleep with a sweet dream.

once upon a time, there was a man who loved to build things. he loved to use wood and stones and he was very happy when the sunshine shone down on his creations.

one day, he wanted to build something even bigger and more important. he worked hard all day, but the sun was so hot that he felt very tired. he knew he had to keep going so he didn't give up.

but when he finished building it, something awful happened. the sun had made the wood too weak and it fell down! the man was so sad and he knew it would be too hard to build it again. he just had to accept that his important creation was ruined. 

the man was so upset. he couldn't believe the sunshine had ruined something he had worked so hard to build. he always thought sunshine was something special, but it was never so important as he had thought.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside in the sunshine. one day, she was picking daisies in the field when she saw her friend ben coming towards her.

"hi lily!" said ben. "what are you doing?"

"i'm picking daisies," replied lily. "do you want to help me?"

ben nodded and they picked daisies together. suddenly, lily had an idea. "let's throw the daisies up in the air and see where they land!" she said.

so, they threw the daisies up in the air and watched as they floated down to the ground. lily felt calm and happy as she watched the daisies dance in the wind.

after they finished playing, ben said, "that was so much fun! let's do it again tomorrow!"

lily smiled and nodded. she couldn't wait to play with her friend again and throw more daisies in the air.

once upon a time, there was a young boy named timmy. timmy loved to play outside and gather sticks and rocks. one day, timmy saw a big van parked on the street. the van had a picture of candy on it. timmy was so excited to get some candy, so he ran up to the van. 

but then, a mean man inside the van grabbed timmy and took him away. timmy's parents searched for him everywhere, but they couldn't find him. they were so sad that they cried every day. 

eventually, the police found timmy's body in the van. he had been hurt very badly. timmy's parents were heartbroken and couldn't believe what had happened to their young son. from that day on, they warned all the other young children in the neighborhood to stay away from strangers and their vans.

once there was a smelly butter. it was so smelly that everyone around it said "yuck"! poor butter. it felt so sad. it wanted to be like all the other butter.

one day the butter was so sad it started to cry. it cried and cried until it made a big pool of water around it.

then suddenly the sun came out from behind the clouds. it felt really warm and made the butter happy. the water around it started to boil and the smell of the butter changed from smelly to sweet. everyone breathed a sigh of relief.

the butter was happy and excited. it had a new smell! it was a happy end for the smelly butter.

once upon a time there was a mom and dad who had a baby girl. she was very eager to make something fun. one day when her mom and dad were outside, she found a lime. she ran up to her mom and dad and showed them what she had found. they said she could make something fun with it.

the little girl was very excited. she put the lime in a cup and added some water and sugar. she stirred it and watched the lime turn into a special drink. she was so proud of her work.

the little girl was eager to share her drink with her mom and dad. she entered the kitchen and found them there. with a smile she presented them her lime drink. her mom, dad and everyone else in the house all enjoyed it. 

the little girl was very proud of herself. she was happy that she was able to make something fun with the lime and make her family happy.

once there was a girl who loved the color pastel. she was very happy when she was surrounded by pastel hues and she even painted her room in various pastel shades. but she had one problem: no one understood her love for pastels. her parents thought she was crazy for decorating with so many pinks, purples, and blues.

one day, she decided that she wanted to go on an adventure to a place filled with pastel colors. she wanted to see all the crazy pastel hues of the world. so, she asked her parents to take her on a trip to the land of pastels.

to her surprise, her parents agreed, and they set off on a long journey. as they flew over the world, the girl marvelled at all the amazing pastel shades below her. everywhere she looked she saw a new color of pastel. 

when they arrived, the girl went exploring and she was amazed by all the wonderful things she saw. she was finally able to understand why she loved pastels so much! everywhere she looked, she was surrounded by the crazy hues of pastel. 

from that day forward, the girl never felt alone on her journey to understand the meaning of pastel shades. she knew that wherever she went, there would always be a creature painted in the beautiful, crazy hues of pastel.

sara and ben were best friends. they liked to play in the yard every day. they had a big ball, a red wagon, and a yellow swing. they shared everything and had fun.

one day, they found something unusual in the yard. it was a shiny rock with many colors. sara and ben both wanted the rock. they grabbed it at the same time and pulled hard.

"let go! it's mine!" sara shouted.

"no, it's mine! i saw it first!" ben yelled.

they began to quarrel and tug on the rock. they did not hear their mom calling them for lunch. they did not see the big dog running towards them. the dog liked shiny things too.

the dog barked and jumped on sara and ben. he snatched the rock from their hands and ran away. sara and ben fell to the ground and looked at each other. they felt scared and sorry.

they hugged and said, "i'm sorry. you can have the rock."

"no, i'm sorry. you can have it."

they got up and ran to their mom. they told her what happened and asked for a sandwich. they decided to play with their ball, their wagon, and their swing instead. they learned that a rock was not worth losing a friend.

once upon a time, there was a restless little mouse. everywhere he went, his tiny feet tapped and twirled. he was so excited to explore and have fun!

one day, the mouse noticed that his friend the bunny had been very sad. the bunny had quit playing and running around like he used to. so the mouse asked him what was wrong.

the bunny told the mouse that heâ€™d stopped loving the things he used to love, like playing and going on adventures. the bunny wanted to feel excited and happy again.

the mouse felt sad to see his friend so restless. he was determined to help! he promised to take the bunny on a surprise adventure.

the two friends skipped and hopped through the woods together. when they reached a large meadow, the pair laughed and rolled around in the grass. the bunny was so happy again!

the little mouse was glad he quit his own games for a day, and showed his friend the power of love. it was much better than being restless!

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy liked to wear his favorite red shirt every day. he would wear it to school, to the park, and even to bed. his mom told him he had to wash it, but he didn't want to take it off!

one day, timmy went to a big party. there were lots of people there, and they were all waiting for the fireworks to start. timmy had never seen fireworks before, but he knew they were special. when the fireworks started, timmy felt happy and excited. he watched the fireworks light up the sky, and he felt like he was in a magical world.

after the fireworks, it was time to go home. timmy's mom asked him if he had fun, and he said yes. she told him that he was a dependable boy, and she was proud of him. timmy didn't know what dependable meant, but he knew it was a good thing. he smiled and hugged his mom, feeling happy and loved.

once upon a time, there was a kind man named john. john was very generous and loved to help people. one day, he saw a little girl crying on the street. he asked her why she was crying. the little girl said that she had hurt her knee and it hurt a lot. john said, "don't worry, i can heal your knee". 

john took the little girl to his house and cleaned her knee. he put a bandage on it and gave her a lollipop to make her feel better. the little girl was very happy and said, "thank you, john. you are so kind and true". john smiled and said, "i just like to help people. that's what makes me happy". 

the little girl felt much better and went home. she told her mom about john and how he healed her knee. her mom was very grateful and said, "we need more people like john in this world". the little girl agreed and said, "yes, john is a true hero".

one day, the little girl was feeling curious. she saw a big wheel in the playground and wondered what it would be like to spin it. she went up to it and tried to spin it, but it wouldn't move. 

and then her mom walked up, saw what she was doing, and said, "let me help you." she knelt down and turned the wheel. 

the little girl was so happy! she ran around and around the wheel and laughed as it spun faster and faster. mom watched with a smile on her face.

when the little girl got tired, mom said, "let me help you back down." she held the top of the wheel and slowly worked it back to a stop. 

the little girl smiled and gave her mom a big hug. they both laughed and the little girl said, "thank you for helping me."

once upon a time, there was a small girl called lucy. every day, she would dream of flying high up in the sky like a bird. one day when she was out in the park she spotted a police car.

lucy was so excited and ran over to it. she asked the police inside, "can i fly high?" the police said, "sure, why not? hop in and we'll take you for a ride!"

so, lucy hopped into the police car, and off they went. as lucy felt the wind and the speed of the car, she felt like she was flying. when they got back to the park, lucy was so happy. she thanked the police and ran back to tell her family all about her high flying dream.

once upon a time, there was a dog named max. max was a loyal dog to his owner, tim. tim loved max very much. max loved to run and play on the ground. 

one day, tim took max to the park to play. max was having fun running around and chasing his ball. but then, some kids came and started to disturb max. they threw sticks at him and tried to scare him. max didn't like that. 

tim saw what was happening and quickly went over to max. he picked him up and hugged him. "don't worry, max," he said. "i won't let anyone disturb you." max felt safe in tim's arms and was happy to have such a loyal owner.

anna and ben were playing in the garden. they liked to pretend they were chefs and prepare food for their dolls and teddies. they used leaves, flowers, rocks and sticks as ingredients. they had a small fire pit where they cooked their dishes.

"look, ben, i made a cake with petals and mud," anna said, holding a round lump of dirt. "do you want to try some?"

"no, thank you, anna. i made a soup with water and grass. it smells good," ben said, stirring a pot over the fire. "do you want to try some?"

anna nodded and put her cake down. she went to ben and took a sip of his soup. she made a face and spat it out. "yuck, ben, this is not soup. this is yucky water," she said.

ben laughed and said, "it's not yucky, anna. it's yummy. you just don't like it because you're a picky eater."

anna was angry and said, "i'm not a picky eater, ben. you're a bad cook. your soup is gross and your fire is too big. you're going to burn everything."

ben was angry too and said, "i'm not a bad cook, anna. you're a mean sister. my soup is delicious and my fire is just right. you're going to ruin everything."

they started to argue and shout at each other. they did not notice that the fire was growing bigger and bigger. they did not notice that the wind was blowing the smoke towards the house. they did not notice that their mom was inside, taking a nap.

the smoke reached the house and set off the alarm. the alarm was loud and scary. it woke up mom and made her jump out of bed. she smelled the smoke and ran to the window. she saw the fire in the garden and her children arguing near it. she felt helpless and scared. she grabbed her phone and called for help. she yelled at anna and ben to get away from the fire and come inside.

anna and ben heard their mom and saw the smoke. they realized they had made a big mistake. they felt sorry and scared. they dropped their pots and ran to their mom. they hugged her and said they were sorry. they waited for the firemen to come and put out the fire. they learned a lesson that day. they learned to be careful with fire and to be nice to each other.

once upon a time, there was a warm and happy family. they made their home in a beautiful meadow full of flowers and grass.

one day, the family decided to go for a walk. they all put on their shoes and stepped out of the house. they were so excited to explore the meadow together.

when they arrived at the meadow, the family stopped to admire the beautiful view. suddenly, a rabbit hopped by and the family shouted, "hello!"

the rabbit heard the family's greeting and stopped to look at them. she smiled and said, "would you like to play with me?"

the family was delighted. they asked, "can we play?"
the rabbit nodded and said, "yes, but you must wait until i permit it."
the family agreed and waited patiently. suddenly, the rabbit hopped around in a circle and shouted, "now you may play!"

the family laughed and jumped into the meadow where they had a wonderful time running, hopping and playing together under the warm autumn sun.

once upon a time there was a wild cat. she liked to run out of her house and play in the garden. but she didn't always do the right things.

one day, she saw a big pattern in the garden. she wanted to make it better, so she covered it up with leaves. her owners saw this and were angry. they had to punish her.

so they gave her a time-out. she had to sit still in her bed for five minutes. she wanted to play, but she knew that this was the right thing to do.

after five minutes, she was allowed to go back out into the garden. but she promised not to touch the pattern again. and she kept her promise! from that day on, she was very careful and did the right thing.

once upon a time, there was a baby named timmy. timmy loved his crib and would sleep in it every night. one day, timmy's big sister molly wanted to play with him. she asked him to follow her to the park. timmy was excited and he followed her.

molly was not honest with timmy. she led him to a scary forest instead of the park. timmy got scared and started crying. he wanted to go back to his crib. but molly didn't care and left him alone in the forest.

poor timmy was lost and didn't know what to do. he cried and cried until a kind stranger found him and took him back home. the moral of the story is to always be honest and never lead someone into danger.

once upon a time there was a small girl named suzy. she was sad all the time because nobody ever wanted to be her friend. she tried to talk to the other kids but they would never listen. one day, suzy decided to make a present for everyone in her town. she used colorful things and big smiles to make it. when she showed them the present, they weren't very nice. they said harsh things and made fun of her. 

suzy was so upset, she wanted to hide. but then she remembered something her mom had once told her - to forgive people, even when it's hard. so she opened her heart and forgave the mean kids for being so harsh. 

in the end, the other kids realized how kind suzy was and soon, she had lots of friends. everyone in town was so happy and suzy was too. she knew then that remembering to forgive is the best present of all.

once there was a girl named zoe. zoe was 3 years old and she loved to study.

one day, zoe decided to go to the library to study. she took her special equipment with her, like her books and pencils.

when she arrived at the library, zoe was excited to see all the tall shelves full of books. she carefully studied each book and took notes to remember the important things.

zoe was a great student and soon she was able to answer all the questions in the books. she was so proud of herself!

after studying all day, zoe knew she would need more equipment next time to become even better at studying.

the end.

lila was upset. she missed her mom. her mom went to work in the sky. she flew in a big metal bird. she said she would be back soon. but lila did not know when soon was.

she looked out the window. she saw the moon and the stars. they were bright and shiny. she wondered if her mom could see them too. she wondered if her mom was in the universe. she wanted to talk to her mom.

she picked up her phone. she pressed the green button. she heard a beep. she said, "mom, are you there? i miss you. i love you. come back soon."

she waited for an answer. she heard another beep. she heard a voice. it was her mom. she said, "lila, i'm here. i miss you too. i love you more. i'm in the sky, but i can see the moon and the stars. they are beautiful. just like you. i'll be back soon. i promise."

lila smiled. she felt happy. she said, "mom, you are beautiful too. i'm glad you can see the moon and the stars. they are in the universe. just like us. i'll wait for you. i promise."

she pressed the red button. she put down her phone. she hugged her teddy bear. she looked out the window again. she waved to the moon and the stars. she said, "good night, mom. good night, universe."

once upon a time there was an ancient sailor named carl. he was sailing in his boat when he spotted a dolphin swimming in the sea. he wanted to make friends with the dolphin, so he held out his hand. but to his surprise, the dolphin didn't want to be friends. she kept swimming away from him.

carl said, "please don't be scared. i just want to be your friend."

the dolphin said, "i'm not scared, i'm just not interested in being your friend. i'd rather be alone."

carl said, "it's ok. i understand. but can i at least replace your loneliness with something else? something that will bring you joy?"

the dolphin thought for a moment, and then said yes. so carl gave the dolphin a hug and said, "you deserve to be happy. and no one should ever have to be alone."

this story teaches us that true friendship is based on kindness and understanding, and not on replacing someone's loneliness with something else.

one day, a bald man was walking down the street. he counted to ten as he went. he decided to stay at the park. he was very happy. 

at the park, he saw a little bird. he was yellow and had a long beak. the man asked the bird, "what's your number?" the bird said, "one." 

the man was excited. he said, "let's play a game. we will stay here and count to ten. then we will fly away!" 

the bird liked this idea. they both stood on the ground and counted to ten. then they flew away, high up in the sky. they looked like two specks in the sky. 

as they flew higher and higher, they counted the clouds. they saw one, two, three and more; exactly the same number as the man had counted on the street.

once upon a time there were two people. one was called tom and the other was jackie. tom was a nice person and often did nice things. jackie was jealous of tom, because he wanted to do the same things.

one day, tom did something special. he drew a picture for jackie. jackie was very happy and it made her smile. tom was happy too.

afterwards, jackie asked tom if she could do something special too. tom said yes and helped her draw a picture. this made jackie feel very special.

the next day, tom did something really kind. he gave jackie a present. jackie was so excited and thanked tom. this made tom feel really happy.

afterwards, jackie was no longer jealous of tom. she was happy that he was doing nice things and she was happy to be doing nice things too.

at the forest, there was a little bunny named binky. binky was so cheerful, she loved to run and play with her friends.

one day, binky stumbled upon a trap that had been left by a hunter. binky was so scared and she started to cry. 

but then, a friendly fox named fluffy came over and asked her why she was crying. binky told fluffy about the trap. 

fluffy said, â€œno more crying. we can solve this together!â€

so, binky and fluffy worked together to set the trap aside. when it was done, binky was so happy and fluffy was so cheerful. 

they high fived each other and went back to playing in the forest. binky was so glad that fluffy helped her solve the trap.

one day, a boy named tim went for a walk in the park. the sun was shining, and the day was mild. tim saw a big square on the ground. it was made of colorful chalk. he thought it looked fun, so he stepped into the square.

a girl named sue walked up to tim. she smiled and said, "want to play with me?" tim nodded his head and said, "yes, please!" sue took a ball from her bag and they started to play.

they took turns to pass the ball to each other. they laughed and kicked the ball inside the square. they played until the sun went down. tim and sue were happy to make a new friend. they waved goodbye and went home, excited to play together again soon.

once upon a time, there was a little girl. she had a chair in her bedroom which was very comfortable for her. every day after lunch, she liked to take a nap in her chair.

the little girl was always hungry, and so she was excited when her mommy said it was time for dinner. she put on her yummy clothes and imagined what dinner would taste like.

when the little girl's dinner was ready, she sat in her chair and ate it. the dinner was so yummy, she barely had enough room for dessert.

when dinner was done, the little girl was very tired. she climbed into the chair and went to sleep.

the little girl had a wonderful nap and when she woke, she felt like she had enough energy to play all day.

the end.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a box full of cubes. the cubes were red, blue, green, and yellow. lily loved to play with them and build towers.

one day, lily's friend came over to play. they decided to sort the cubes by color. lily was patient as they worked together to put each cube in the right group. they had so much fun!

after they finished sorting the cubes, they built a big tower with all the red cubes. it was so tall! lily's friend was amazed. they played with the cubes all day and had a great time.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. he loved playing with his cards. one day, he was playing with his cards when his sister came in.

"can i play too?" she asked.

timmy said, "sure, it's easy. here's a card for you."

they played for a while, but then timmy's sister won all the cards. timmy was sad.

"i surrender," he said.

"don't worry," said his sister. "we can play again." 

they played again and this time, timmy won. they both laughed and had fun together. the end.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to play with his toys, especially his toy car. one day, timmy's mom told him it was time to clean up his toys. timmy didn't want to clean up, so he hid his toy car under his bed.

as time passed, timmy's toy car started to shrink. timmy was sad when he saw that his toy car was now too small to play with. his mom asked him why he didn't clean up his toys, and timmy told her he was sorry.

timmy's mom told him that it's important to be responsible and take care of our things. she said that if we don't take care of our things, they might shrink or even end up in jail (like when we lose them). timmy learned his lesson and promised to be more flexible and responsible.

once upon a time there was a loyal cat named felix. he lived with a family of five. every night at dinner, felix would sit at the table and wait for his dish.

one night felix sat down, waiting for his dish and he heard the family talking.

mama said: "i can't believe we never have leftovers anymore."

papa replied: "i know, it must be because of felix."

mama smiled: "yes, he is so loyal he eats everything we give him."

the family laughed and then papa brought felix his dish. felix ate it up and licked his plate clean.

the family was so thankful to have such a loyal cat. from then on they made sure to leave him special treats after dinner. felix was always loyal and happy to have his dish.

once upon a time there were two soldiers. they were very big and strong. every day they would study how to be brave and fight bad people. one day they saw a huge army on the horizon. the two soldiers held their breath. but instead of fighting, the huge army ran away! the two soldiers had won and were very proud. they studied hard and they were now heroes!

once upon a time there was a mummy and a daddy and a little boy called tom. tom liked to sing. one day his mummy said, "let's go to the cafe!"

tom was so happy and he sang a song. when they got to the cafe, mummy said, "what do you want for dessert?"

tom looked at the menu and saw ice cream. he said, "ice cream please!"

mummy said, "yes, ice cream for you!"

tom was very grateful and he sang another song. he enjoyed every bite of his yummy ice cream.

when tom finished his ice cream, mummy said, "that was delicious, wasn't it?"

tom smiled and said, "yes, it was yummy! can i have more?"

mummy laughed and said, "why not? let's get two more scoops!"

tom was very happy. he sang a happy song and thanked mummy for the ice cream. they all enjoyed it together. the end.

once upon a time, there was a whale swimming in the middle of the sea. he was startled by a loud splash. he peered into the water expecting to see something, but nothing was there. he was frightened, so he decided to sit still, hoping the strange noise wouldn't come back. suddenly, he felt a tap on his back and heard a voice. he quickly turned around and saw a small fish. the fish said "hello whale. why are you so frightened?"

the whale replied, "i thought something was coming to get me."

the fish smiled and said, "don't worry, you're safe here. sit and be calm."

the whale thanked the fish and sat down. he felt better knowing that the fish was there and he was no longer frightened. from then on, the whale and the fish were friends, and they stayed together even when the sea was full of strange sounds.

tim and mia like to play pretend. they have a stage in their room, where they act out stories. one day, they decide to play detectives. they wear hats and coats and have magnifying glasses.

"let's solve a mystery," tim says. "we need a clue."

mia looks around and sees a sock on the floor. "look, a sock!" she says. "maybe someone lost it."

"good clue, mia," tim says. "let's follow it."

they pick up the sock and walk around the room, pretending to look for more clues. they see a shoe, a ball, and a book. they put them on the stage.

"who do these things belong to?" tim asks.

mia thinks hard. she remembers that their brother ben was playing in their room earlier. she has an idea.

"maybe ben is the mystery person," she says. "let's ask him."

they go to ben's room and knock on the door. ben opens it and sees them holding his sock, shoe, ball, and book.

"hey, those are mine!" he says. "what are you doing with them?"

"we are detectives," tim says. "we solved the mystery. you left your things in our room."

ben looks surprised. he takes his things back and says, "sorry, i forgot to put them away. you are good detectives."

tim and mia smile. they are happy they solved the mystery. they go back to their room and play some more. they are not weak. they are smart and brave. they like to solve mysteries.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy loved to play by the river and watch the boats go by. one day, timmy saw a big, dependable boat that he really liked. he thought to himself, "i want to ride on that boat!" 

timmy went to his mommy and asked if they could ride on the boat. mommy said yes and they went to the boat. timmy was so happy to be on the boat and he thought it was the best boat ever. 

as they rode on the boat, timmy saw lots of fish in the water and he thought they were funny. he also saw some birds flying in the sky and he thought they were pretty. timmy was having so much fun on the boat that he didn't want to get off when they got back to the shore. 

from that day on, timmy always thought about the dependable boat and how much fun he had riding on it. he couldn't wait to go back and ride on it again. the end.

one day, tom and sam went to play in the woods. they liked to run, jump and climb on the trees. they saw a big hole in the ground. it was a cave.

"let's go inside and see what is there," tom said.

"ok, but be careful. it is dark and scary," sam said.

they took a stick and a flashlight and walked into the cave. they saw many rocks and bats. they heard a loud roar. it was a bear!

"run, run, run!" tom shouted.

they ran back to the entrance, but the bear was faster. it blocked their way. they were trapped.

"what do we do now?" sam asked.

"we have to solve this problem. we have to make the bear go away," tom said.

he looked around and saw a big rock. he had an idea.

"hey, bear, look at this!" he yelled.

he threw the rock at the bear's head. the bear was angry. it turned around and chased the rock.

"now, let's go!" tom said.

they ran out of the cave and did not look back. they were safe.

they hugged each other and smiled.

"we did it! we solved the problem!" sam said.

"yes, we did. we are brave and smart!" tom said.

they went back to their home and told their mom and dad what happened. they were proud of themselves.

they never went back to the cave again. they knew it was a dead place. they liked to play in the woods, but not in the cave.

tom and sam were brothers who liked to play in the garden. one day, they found a big hole in the fence. they wanted to see what was on the other side, so they crawled through the hole.

they saw a lot of flowers and trees and a pond with fish. they also saw a big red car parked near a house. tom wanted to touch the car, but sam said no.

"that is not our car. it belongs to someone else. we should not touch it," sam said.

but tom did not listen. he ran to the car and opened the door. he saw a shiny key in the ignition. he turned the key and the car started. it made a loud noise and smoke came out of the exhaust.

tom was scared and jumped out of the car. he ran back to the hole in the fence. sam followed him. they heard someone shouting from the house.

"hey, who started my car? what are you doing in my garden?" it was the owner of the car. he was angry and came out of the house.

tom and sam crawled through the hole and ran to their own garden. they hoped the man did not see them.

they felt bad for what they did. they knew they should not have gone through the hole and touched the car. they decided to tell their mom and dad what happened.

they also decided to replace the hole in the fence with some wood and nails. they wanted to fix their mistake and respect their neighbor's property.

they learned that it is wrong to go where they are not invited and to take what is not theirs. they also learned that some things are hot and dangerous and should not be played with. they said sorry to their mom and dad and to their neighbor. they promised to be more careful and respectful in the future.

once upon a time there was a smart little girl called daisy. daisy was very alert and was always looking around and trying to learn new things. 

one day, daisy was looking in the kitchen and she spotted a big jar full of lollipops. she wanted to try one, so she asked her mom, "can i have a lollipop?". 

her mom smiled and said,"yes daisy, you can have a lollipop, but you will need to ask nicely."

so daisy crossed her hands and said politely, "can i please have a lollipop?". 

this time her mom nodded and said, "yes of course, you can have one. just be careful not to eat too many!" 

daisy was very happy and raced over to the jar to get a lollipop. she grabbed one and ran off to enjoy it. 

the end.

one night, a bear and a rabbit were walking in the woods. the night was dark and the stars twinkled in the sky. suddenly, a distant noise made the rabbit tremble.

the bear said, "what is that noise and why are you trembling?"

the rabbit replied, "i am scared because the noise is trouble."

the bear was brave and he said, "let's go and see!"

they walked together until they saw a big lion in the distance. the rabbit trembled again and said, "help! that lion is trouble! we need to run!"

the bear knew the lion was fierce, so he quickly said, "quickly, let's go back and run away!"

the rabbit and the bear ran as fast as they could and they were soon far away from the distant lion. the rabbit was relieved and no longer trembling.

ben and mia are friends. they like to play together. one day, they find a big box in the park. it is empty and clean.

"let's make a house with the box!" mia says.

"good idea!" ben says. "i will lead you to a good spot."

ben takes mia's hand and leads her to a shady tree. they put the box under the tree and cut a door and a window with scissors. they draw flowers and stars on the box with crayons. they make a roof with a blanket.

"wow, our house is so pretty!" mia says.

"yes, and cozy too!" ben says. "we are lucky to have a house like this."

they go inside the box and pretend to cook and read and sleep. they have a lot of fun in their house. they are happy.

once upon a time, there was an enormous popcorn machine. it sparkled and shone as if made of diamonds. every day, the children around the neighbourhood would come together and applaud. they loved the delicious popcorn the enormous machine would make. the children always had the same routine: they would cheer and clap and then wait for their turn to get a bag of the crunchy snack.

soon, the popcorn machine was making the most delicious popcorn in town. everyone would line up in long queues and applaud when it was their turn to get a bag of yummy popcorn. even the adults and grandparents smiled and cheered along.

one day, something amazing happened. everyone gathered around the enormous machine, and cheered even louder than before. out of the machine popped the biggest bag of popcorn anyone had ever seen. everyone gasped, and then cheered even louder. they took a huge bite out of the popcorn and it was the tastiest they had ever had. everyone applauded in joy, and the children laughed and smiled the whole night.

the enormous popcorn machine made everyone happy, and it was the best popcorn in town.

one day, a little mouse was walking along the forest path, looking for something to eat. all of a sudden, the mouse heard a noise behind him. he quickly turned around and saw a big furry human standing right in front of him. the little mouse was very scared and he wanted to run away, but the human reached out and grabbed him with one hand.

the mouse asked him, â€œwhat do you want? please donâ€™t hurt me!â€ 
the human chuckled and replied, â€œdonâ€™t worry, iâ€™m not going to hurt you. i just want to play. whatâ€™s your name, little mouse?â€

the mouse answered, â€œmy name is max.â€
the human smiled and said, â€œitâ€™s great to meet you, max. what do you usually do in the forest?â€

max said, â€œi like to look for food and explore.â€
the human said, â€œthat sounds like fun. would you like to explore with me?â€

max thought for a moment and then said, â€œyes, letâ€™s do it!â€ 
so, the little mouse and the furry human set off on an adventure together. they had lots of fun exploring the forest and finding things to play with. when the sun went down, the human said goodbye and gave max a

once upon a time, there was a silly train. the train was made of steel. it was very big and strong. the train loved to travel on the tracks.

one day, the silly train decided to travel far away from home. it went through the woods and over the hills. the silly train saw many animals and plants.

after a long time, the silly train missed its home. it wanted to go back. the train traveled back on the tracks. it was happy to be home again.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside in the evening when the sun went down. one day, she discovered a beautiful butterfly in her garden. it had bright colors and fluttered its wings. lily was so happy to see it!

her friend, timmy, saw the butterfly too and became jealous. he wanted to catch it and keep it for himself. but lily told him that the butterfly was happy in the garden and should stay there. timmy realized that lily was right and felt better. they both watched the butterfly fly away into the evening sky.

lily and tom were friends who liked to draw. they had many crayons and papers to make pictures. one day, they decided to draw symbols. symbols are shapes that mean something. for example, a heart means love, and a star means wish.

lily drew a heart and said, "this is a symbol for love. i love my family and my friends." tom drew a star and said, "this is a symbol for wish. i wish i could fly like a bird." they showed each other their symbols and smiled.

then, tom had an idea. he drew a circle with a line and said, "this is a symbol for laugh. i like to laugh and have fun." lily liked tom's symbol and drew one too. they laughed and made more symbols for laugh.

but then, lily saw a symbol that tom drew that she did not like. it was a square with a cross and a dot. she asked, "what is this symbol, tom?" tom said, "this is a symbol for lily. you are a square because you are boring, a cross because you are mean, and a dot because you are small."

lily felt hurt and angry. she said, "that is not a nice symbol, tom. that is a mean symbol. you are not my friend." she grabbed her papers and crayons and ran away. tom felt sorry and sad. he realized he had made a mistake.

he ran after lily and said, "lily, wait. i'm sorry. i was just joking. i did not mean to hurt you. you are not a mean symbol. you are a nice symbol. you are a flower because you are beautiful, a sun because you are bright, and a heart because you are kind."

lily stopped and looked at tom. she saw that he had drawn a new symbol for her. it was a flower, a sun, and a heart. she felt happy and forgave him. she said, "thank you, tom. you are a nice symbol too. you are a star because you are special, a cloud because you are soft, and a laugh because you are funny."

they hugged and made up. they went back to their drawing and made more symbols for each other. they learned that symbols can be nice or mean, and that they should always be kind to their friends.

the moral of the story is: be careful with your words. they can hurt or heal.

lucy was a three year old girl who loved to jump. everywhere she went, she was jumping. she was in her yard one day, and saw her house's roof. she saw how high it was, and decided to try and jump onto the roof. 

"i can jump up there!" she said happily.

she started to jump, but just kept falling short. no matter how hard she tried, she just couldn't reach the roof. 

suddenly, a delicious ice cream truck drove by, and lucy got an idea. she ran to the truck and bought some ice cream.

with the ice cream in her hand, she started to jump again, and sure enough, she made it onto the roof! she sat atop the roof, eating her delicious ice cream and feeling so proud of herself.

lily likes to pick flowers. she likes to pick yellow flowers best. they are bright and pretty. she has a basket to put them in. she wants to give them to her mom.

one day, she goes to the park with her dad. she sees many yellow flowers there. she runs to pick them. she does not see the sign that says "do not pick the flowers". she does not see the animal that lives in the flowers.

the animal is a bee. it is yellow and black. it does not like lily picking its flowers. it gets angry. it flies out of the flower and stings lily on her hand. lily cries out loud. it hurts a lot.

her dad hears her cry and runs to her. he sees the bee and the flowers. he sees the sign. he is not happy. he picks up lily and takes her to the car. he says they have to go home. he says lily was bad. he says she has to say sorry to the bee and the flowers.

lily feels sad and sorry. she does not want to pick flowers anymore. she wants to hug her mom and make her hand feel better. she learns a lesson. she will not pick flowers that are not hers. she will be careful of animals that can hurt her. she will listen to signs and her dad. the end.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy loved to watch the pigeons in the park. they were so pretty and flew so high in the sky. one day, timmy saw a man with a noisy machine scaring the pigeons away. timmy didn't like that.

"hey mister, why are you scaring the pigeons away?" timmy asked.

"i need to clean the park. the pigeons make a mess," the man replied.

"but they are so pretty. can't we just clean up after them?" timmy asked.

the man thought about it and decided timmy was right. they cleaned up after the pigeons and the park was still clean. timmy had won the argument and the pigeons could stay. the moral of the story is that sometimes it's better to find a solution that makes everyone happy instead of just getting your own way.

once upon a time, there were two friends named tilly and jack. they were both very restless and loved to play together in the fields.

one day, tilly had an idea. she wanted to find a great truth. but how could they do that? then jack had an idea. he said, "let's go on an adventure and explore the world for the great truth!" tilly was so excited about this that she jumped up and down.

so they set out on their adventure. they visited every corner of the world together and asked many people, but no one could give them the great truth. but they kept searching and searching.

finally they reached the top of a tall mountain. there, they asked a wise old man. he said, "the truth can only be found when you search inside your heart."

so tilly and jack sat still and quiet, and searched inside their hearts until they found the great truth they had been looking for. then they smiled and hugged each other, happy that they had found the truth.

once upon a time there was a little girl named lucy. she was so sad and her eyes looked very gloomy.

one day, she went to the castle to ask for help but no one was there. lucy's heart felt heavy and full of trouble.

so, she knelt down and started saying "please help me! i'm so sad and i don't know what to do".

suddenly, a magical fairy appeared in a ray of sunshine. the fairy looked at lucy and said, "it's ok, don't worry. i will help you."

the fairy cast a spell that made lucy's heart lighter. she smiled and thanked the fairy with a big hug.

the next day, lucy awoke feeling happy and excited. she ran around the castle singing a happy song. no more gloominess or trouble!

thanks to the magical fairy, little lucy was happy once again.

ben is a dog. he likes to run and play with his ball. he has a red collar with his name on it. his mom and dad gave him the collar. they love ben very much.

one day, ben sees a cat in the yard. he wants to chase the cat. he runs after the cat, but the cat is fast. the cat jumps over the fence and runs away. ben is sad. he lost his ball and his collar. he looks for them, but he can't find them.

he hears his mom and dad calling him. they are looking for him too. they are worried. ben runs to them. he wags his tail and licks their faces. they hug him and pet him. they are glad to see him. they have his ball and his collar. they found them in the yard. they put the collar back on him and give him the ball. ben is happy. he tastes his ball. it tastes like dirt and grass. he likes it. he plays with his mom and dad. he loves them very much.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to watch cartoons on tv. one day, she was watching her favorite cartoon when her mom told her it was time to eat lunch. 

lily didn't want to stop watching the cartoon, so she asked her mom if she could eat in front of the tv. her mom said no, but lily kept asking and asking. finally, her mom said yes, but only if she promised to eat all her food. 

lily was so happy to eat in front of the tv, but she got so into the cartoon that she forgot to eat. when she was done watching, she looked down and saw that her food was all spoiled. she felt sad and told her mom that she lost her appetite. 

her mom explained that if she doesn't eat her food, it will spoil and she won't feel good. lily promised to always eat her food first before watching cartoons.

once upon a time there was a girl called sarah. she wanted to go for an adventure, so she asked her mom if she could ride a mule. her mom said no, sarah was too young, so she wasn't allowed. 

but sarah didn't give up easily. she asked her mom again and again. finally, her mom said yes. she allowed sarah to go for her adventure on the mule.

sarah was so excited, she ran outside and jumped on the mule's back. it was a sweet mule, because it didn't want to leave sarah behind. together they went on an adventure around the woods. 

hours passed and sarah's mom started getting worried. she went out looking for her daughter. after a while, she heard a voice coming from the woods. it was sarah, calling for her mom.

sarah's mom ran towards her and hugged her tightly. she said, â€œiâ€™m so glad you are safe, sarah.â€ 

sarah smiled and said, â€œi had the best adventure mom. thank you for allowing me to go on the mule!â€

once upon a time, there was a little bird named tweetie. tweetie loved to fly around and zoom through the sky. one day, tweetie noticed the ground shaking. it was an earthquake! tweetie felt scared and tired from all the flying.

but tweetie knew what to do. she flew down to the ground and found a safe place to rest. after a little while, the earthquake stopped and tweetie felt better. she flew back up into the sky and zoomed around again, happy to be flying freely once more.

from that day on, whenever tweetie felt tired or scared, she remembered the earthquake and knew that she could always find a safe place to rest. and so, tweetie continued to zoom through the sky, enjoying every moment of her flying adventures.

tom and jen are friends. they like to play dress-up with old cloths. they find cloths in a big box in the attic. some cloths are big, some are small, some are soft, some are scratchy.

tom picks a blue cloth. he wraps it around his body. he says, "i am a king. this is my robe." jen picks a red cloth. she puts it on her head. she says, "i am a queen. this is my crown."

they pretend to rule the land. they make rules for their toys. they have a tea party with their cups and plates. they have fun.

but then, the cloth on jen's head falls off. it is too big for her. it does not fit. jen is sad. she says, "i am not a queen anymore. i want a new crown."

tom sees jen is sad. he wants to help. he looks in the box. he finds a yellow cloth. it is small and soft. he says, "jen, look. i have a new crown for you. it is yellow and pretty. it will fit you."

he gives the yellow cloth to jen. jen smiles. she puts it on her head. it fits her. she says, "thank you, tom. you are a good king. and i am a good queen."

they hug. they play some more. they are happy. the end.

once upon a time, there was an old cat. the cat liked to move around a lot. one day, the cat went to a big field with a pitch. the pitch was full of green grass. the cat saw a bird on the pitch and tried to catch it. the bird was too fast and flew away. the old cat went back home and took a nap. the end.

sara and ben like to play with trains. they have many tracks and cars. they make a big loop with the tracks on the floor. they put the cars on the loop and watch them go round and round.

"look, sara, the train is fast!" ben says.

"yes, it is. but i have an idea. let's make the loop more fun!" sara says.

she takes some books and puts them under one part of the loop. she raises the track with the books. now the loop has a hill.

"wow, sara, that is cool! but is it not difficult for the train to go up the hill?" ben asks.

"let's see!" sara says. she pushes the train with her hand. the train goes up the hill, but then it stops. it cannot go down the other side. it falls off the track.

"oh no, sara, the train is broken!" ben says.

"it is okay, ben. we can fix it. and we can make the hill smaller. then the train can go over the loop and not fall off." sara says.

they take some books away and make the hill smaller. they put the train back on the track. they watch it go over the loop and smile.

"yay, sara, you did it! the loop is fun and not difficult!" ben says.

"thank you, ben. you are a good friend. i like to play with you and the trains." sara says.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to make cakes with her mommy. one day, they decided to make a cake for lily's grandma. they got all the ingredients and started to mix them together. lily's mommy told her to use a small fork to mix the batter.

while they were making the cake, lily's little brother came into the kitchen. he wanted to help too. he grabbed the small fork and started to play with it. suddenly, he accidentally swallowed the fork! lily's mommy quickly called the doctor, but it was too late. the fork had gotten stuck in his throat and he couldn't breathe.

lily and her mommy were very sad that they couldn't save her little brother. they learned that it's important to be careful with small things, especially when making food. from that day on, they always made sure to keep small objects away from their little brother.

once upon a time there was a young peach tree. one day, the peach tree heard a loud ringing sound. he looked around, but he couldn't see where the noise was coming from. suddenly, a small, yellow bird hopped out from behind some nearby bushes - it was chirping and the ringing sound was coming from it.

the bird flew up to the peach tree and said, "hi there! i'm a young bird and i'm looking for some peaches to eat. do you have any?" 

the peach tree thought for a moment, then said, "that's a good idea! i have lots of peaches here and you are welcome to as many as you want." 

the bird was delighted and started eating all the tasty peaches. he thanked the peach tree for the snack and flew away. and that is the story of how a young bird found a tasty peach treat thanks to a ringing chirp!

tom and mia were playing in the park. they liked to run, jump and slide on the grass and the swings. they saw a big tree with many leaves and branches. they wanted to see what was behind the tree.

they ran to the tree and looked behind it. they saw a big pile of sticks and stones. some of the sticks were long and sharp. they looked like spears. tom and mia were curious. they wanted to touch the spears.

"look, mia, spears!" tom said. he picked up one of the spears and held it in his hand. he felt the pointy end. it was hard and cold.

"be careful, tom, you might hurt yourself!" mia said. she picked up another spear and looked at it. she saw some marks and drawings on the wood. they looked like animals and people.

"wow, mia, look at these!" tom said. he saw the same marks and drawings on his spear. he wondered who made them and why.

"maybe they are very old, tom. maybe someone left them here a long time ago." mia said. she wanted to know more about the spears and the marks.

they decided to take the spears with them and show them to their mom and dad. they thought they had made a big discovery. they were very happy and excited.

they ran back to the grass and the swings. they saw their mom and dad sitting on a bench. they waved at them and shouted.

"mom, dad, look what we found!" tom and mia said. they held up the spears and showed them to their mom and dad.

their mom and dad looked surprised and worried. they got up from the bench and walked to tom and mia. they took the spears from their hands and looked at them closely.

"where did you get these, tom and mia?" their mom asked. she sounded serious and scared.

"behind the big tree, mom. there was a pile of sticks and stones. some of the sticks were spears. they have marks and drawings on them. we wanted to show you. we made a discovery!" tom and mia said. they smiled and hoped their mom and dad would be proud of them.

their mom and dad looked at each other and frowned. they did not smile. they did not look proud. they looked angry and sad.

"tom and mia, these are not spears. these are arrows. they are very dangerous. they can hurt people and animals. they are not for playing. they are for fighting. someone left them here because they were in a war. a war is when people are very mad and mean to each other. a war is very bad and sad. you should not touch these arrows. you should not take them with you. you should leave them where they are. do you understand?" their dad said. he sounded stern and loud.

tom and mia felt confused and scared. they did not understand what a war was. they did not understand why the arrows were bad and sad. they did not understand why their mom and dad were angry and sad. they did not like the arrows anymore. they felt a bitter taste in their mouths.

"yes, dad, we understand. we are sorry, dad. we did not know, dad." tom and mia said. they nodded and looked down.

their mom and dad hugged them and kissed them. they told them they loved them and they were not mad at them. they told them they were brave and smart and they did make a discovery. they told them they would explain more about the arrows and the war when they got home. they told them they would find something else to play with in the park.

tom and mia felt a little better. they still felt bitter, but they also felt loved. they hugged and kissed their mom and dad back. they said they loved them too. they said they were sorry again. they said they wanted to play something else.

their mom and dad smiled and nodded. they took the arrows and put them back behind the tree. they told tom and mia to stay away from them. they took their hands and walked with them to the grass and the swings. they helped them find a ball and a kite. they played with them and laughed with them. they had fun in the park. they forgot about the arrows and the war. they were happy again.

one day, timmy and his friend sally were playing outside. suddenly, it started to rain. they ran to timmy's house and went inside. timmy's mom was there and she gave them some cookies.

timmy said, "i'm bored. what can we do?"

sally said, "let's draw pictures!"

timmy said, "no, let's write a story!"

sally said, "okay, but it can't be gloomy."

timmy said, "i know! let's write about a big victory!"

so, they wrote a story about a superhero who saved the world from a bad guy. they were so happy with their story that they forgot about the rain outside. when the rain stopped, they went outside and played in the sunshine. it was a great day!

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. one day, lily went to the park with her mom. she was wearing her favorite pants that had flowers on them. 

at the park, lily saw a puppy. she wanted to play with the puppy, but the puppy ran away. lily said, "mommy, can we follow the puppy?" 

her mom said, "yes, we can follow the puppy, but we have to be patient. the puppy might be scared." 

lily and her mom followed the puppy all around the park. finally, the puppy stopped and let lily pet him. lily was so happy that she gave the puppy a big hug. from that day on, lily and the puppy were best friends.

bob loved to play in the garden. he liked to explore and look for wild animals. one day, he saw a thread. it was bright and colorful. he wanted to pick it up and take it home with him. he reached out to take it, but it slipped away! bob was very disappointed and searched for the thread everywhere. he couldn't find it! he was sad and looked for comfort in his mommy's arms. 

suddenly, a wild animal appeared! bob was so excited and forgot about his lost thread. he smiled and tried to get a closer look at the animal. it was as if the wild creature was saying "follow me". bob got up and followed it.

the wild animal led bob to a special place. when he looked down at the ground, he saw the same thread! he was so happy and couldn't believe it. he picked up the thread and put it in his pocket. he was so lucky to find it! from that day on, bob would always look for the thread when he went out to play, just in case.

once upon a time there were two friends, bob and jan. they were best friends and loved to play together. one day jan wanted to organize a game to play but bob didn't want to join in. he just wanted to sit in the icy park and watch the sparkly stars in the sky all evening.

"come on, bob! let's organize a game!" jan said, trying to encourage her friend.

but bob just shook his head, not wanting to play. jan felt sad and turned away from bob, making him feel low and lonely. after a while, bob noticed that he had made jan sad. he thought about the importance of spending time together and chose to organize a game with jan.

they had lots of fun playing, catching sparks and ignoring the icy night air. at the end of the evening they hugged each other tight and jan thanked bob for organizing the game.

the moral of this story is that we should all take time to share, play and have fun together with our friends and family. there is nothing like a shared experience to bring us closer together.

once upon a time, there was a little girl called mary. mary was very enthusiastic and was always happy. one day, mary's mom and dad set off with her to visit a big barn. when they arrived, mary was so excited! the barn was tall and big and had lots of animals living in it. mary saw cows, horses, sheep and chickens all living in the barn. mary's eyes lit up as she saw all the animals. she was so enthusiastic and couldn't wait to explore. 

mary raced around the barn, watching the animals and learning about their different characteristics. she was so curious, asking her parents questions and wanted to pet them all. mom and dad were happy to see her so intrigued and enthralled with the barn. 

at the end of the day, mary said goodbye to the animals and thanked the barn, before setting off back home. mary was so happy, with the memories of the barn in her heart.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved to explore his backyard at night with his flashlight. one night, he found a mysterious box buried in the ground. 

excitedly, timmy ran inside to show his mom. "mommy, look what i found!" he exclaimed, holding up the box. 

his mom smiled and said, "let's see what's inside." together, they opened the box to reveal a humble treasure - a shiny rock. 

timmy was disappointed at first, but his mom explained that sometimes the most precious things are simple and humble. timmy agreed and added the rock to his collection, feeling proud of his discovery.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play in the bathtub with her rubber duckies. one day, she decided to fill the tub with lots of bubbles and toys. she turned on the water and watched as it started to fill up.

but as she was playing, she noticed that her hands were wrinkly. "oh no!" she said to herself. "i've been in the water for too long. i need to get out." but when she tried to stand up, she slipped and fell. "ouch!" she cried.

her mom heard her and rushed into the bathroom. "are you okay?" she asked. "i slipped," lily said, "and now my foot hurts." her mom looked at her foot and saw a stubborn scale stuck to her heel. "let's soak your foot in some warm water," her mom said, "and then we can try to get that scale off." and that's just what they did.

once upon a time, there was a smart lion who liked to eat spoons. he thought they tasted delicious, so he would eat spoons all day long. one day, the lion noticed he was all alone. he didn't want to be alone anymore, so he went out looking for a friend.

he searched high and low, until he found a little bird sitting on a tree branch. he asked the bird, "do you want to be my friend?" the bird was excited and said, "yes, of course!" the lion and the bird became best friends.

every day, the lion and the bird would go on fun adventures together. then one day, the lion noticed something was wrong with his best friend. the bird was weeping and he couldn't figure out why. the lion asked, "what is wrong, little bird?"

the bird sniffled and said, "i'm sad because i don't have a spoon to eat anymore. i don't know what to do!" the lion was so touched by the bird's sad story. he said, "don't worry, little bird. i'll find you a spoon."

the lion went off in search of a spoon and found one right away! he brought it back to the bird and said, "here you go! now you can have something to eat!" the bird smiled and said, "thank you, my smart lion friend!" the two friends were so happy they laughed

mommy put her lunch in her bag. it was a light brown bag with a smiley face. 

mommy said "come on, let's go to the park." she grabbed her lunch and reached out her hand so timmy could take it. 

the two of them went outside. the sun was shining and it felt nice and warm. they walked to the park and sat down in the grass. 

mommy opened her lunch. she said "let's share. here, have a sandwich." 

timmy ate the sandwich and said "it's yummy. can i have more?" 

mommy smiled. she put some chips and an apple in front of timmy and said "eat up, we have to go home soon." 

timmy happily ate his lunch and was full. he put his apple core in mommy's bag. 

they stood up and mommy said "that was a nice light lunch. now let's go home and take a nap." 

timmy smiled and held mommy's hand. he was happy knowing he had a full tummy.

one day, sara decided to spend a peaceful day in the park. she grabbed her favorite toy, spike, and went outside.

when sara arrived, she was amazed to see that the park was so quiet. she couldn't hear any cars, only a few birds peacefully chirping. sara went for a walk and saw some friends playing on the swing set.

sara asked her friends, "can i play with you?"

they were happy to have her join them. they all took turns pushing each other on the swing set. whenever it was sara's turn, spike got to come along too!

after the fun was over, sara thanked her friends and said goodbye. she waved to them as they left while she stayed behind and enjoyed the peaceful park. sara spent the rest of her day exploring and playing with spike. 

by the end of the day, sara was feeling very happy and content. she smiled and began heading home, spike still in her hand.

once upon a time, there was a tiny fish. its name was flash. flash was very small but it was happy. it had a good home in a stream. every day, it swam and had fun.

one day, flash saw something high in the sky. it was a bird! flash watched the bird fly high in the sky and it wanted to fly too.

flash started trying to fly. it jumped up high and it jumped higher and higher. but it just couldnâ€™t fit in the sky.

so flash decided to make a change. it swam faster and faster in the stream and it built up some power. then it jumped higher and higher until it was flying above the stream.

flash had fit in the sky and it was so happy! it flew around and around and saw so much. it was the most amazing thing flash had ever seen. and ever since then, flash has been flying high and having lots of fun.

once upon a time, there was a tall duck. he wanted to swim, but there was a wall in his way. he tried and tried to find a way to get over the wall.

finally, he spotted a tall tree. he waddled over and climbed to the top. from there, he could see over the wall. he jumped down and landed on the other side.

then, the tall duck spread his wings and started to swim. he swam and swam until he got tired. then he hopped onto a big rock to take a rest.

he watched the sun setting in the sky and then flew back home. from then on, he went swimming every day.

once upon a time there was a kind man who liked coal. he filled his house with it, so he had lots of coal for all his needs. one day, a naughty man came to the kind man's house and he tried to steal the coal. he reached up and grabbed a big pile, but he couldn't take it away!

the kind man saw the naughty man and shouted, "what are you doing? that's my coal!" the naughty man ran away and the man was very upset. 

the kind man decided to get help. he called the police and they caught the naughty man. the police took the naughty man away and gave the kind man his coal back.

the kind man was very happy to get his coal back. he felt peaceful and safe again. from that day on, he kept his coal safe so that nobody could ever steal it.

once upon a time there was a little girl. she was so excited because it was the day of her exam. she had been learning and practicing so hard; she was sure that she was going to fit her exam.

but when she looked at the exam paper she felt terrible. there were so many questions, she couldn't even understand them! she looked around her - all the other kids seemed to know what to do.

she started to feel so sad. she couldn't fit her exam. she wanted to quit and go home. but she remembered what her mum had said to her - that if she tried her best she would do really well. so she decided to try her best.

she slowly and carefully read each question, and did her best to answer. after a long time, the exam was finally over.

when the results were announced, the little girl was so happy - she had fit her exam! she was so proud of herself for not giving up and for trying her best.

sam and mia were at the beach with their mom and dad. they liked to play in the sand and look for shells and crabs. they also liked to watch the boats and the waves.

one day, they saw a big boat with a lot of boxes on it. they wondered what was inside the boxes. they asked their dad, "what is the boat doing?"

dad said, "the boat is loading the boxes. that means it is putting them on the boat. the boxes have things that people need or want in other places."

sam and mia nodded. they wanted to see more. they walked closer to the boat with their dad. mom stayed on the sand with their towels and snacks.

as they got closer, they saw something incredible. one of the boxes was moving and making noises. they heard a splash and saw a big octopus come out of the box. the octopus had eight long arms and a round head. it was purple and slimy. it looked angry and scared.

the octopus saw sam and mia and their dad. it waved its arms at them and made a loud sound. sam and mia were surprised and a little scared. they hid behind their dad.

dad said, "don't worry, kids. the octopus is not going to hurt us. it just wants to go back to the water. it must have been in the wrong box. let's help it."

dad picked up a big stick and gently pushed the octopus towards the water. the octopus slid along the sand and reached the edge of the water. it thanked dad with a soft sound and swam away.

sam and mia clapped and cheered. they had never seen an octopus before. they thought it was incredible. they hugged their dad and said, "you are the best, dad. you helped the octopus."

dad smiled and said, "you are the best, too, kids. you were brave and kind. now let's go back to mom and tell her what we saw."

lily likes to sing. she sings when she wakes up, when she plays, and when she goes to bed. she sings loud and happy. she sings about flowers, stars, and rainbows.

one day, lily finds a bubble wand in her toy box. she runs outside and blows big bubbles. she sings to the bubbles as they float in the air. she sings, "bubble, bubble, you are so pretty. bubble, bubble, please stay with me."

but tom, the boy next door, does not like lily's singing. he thinks she is too noisy and silly. he wants to pop her bubbles. he grabs a stick and runs after lily. he swings the stick at the bubbles and makes them burst. he laughs and says, "bubble, bubble, you are so weak. bubble, bubble, you are gone."

lily is sad and scared. she drops her bubble wand and runs away. she cries and says, "bubble, bubble, you are my friends. bubble, bubble, why did he hurt you?"

tom feels strong and proud. he picks up the bubble wand and blows a big bubble. he sings, "bubble, bubble, i am the best. bubble, bubble, you are my toy."

but then, a big wind comes and blows the bubble away. the bubble flies high and far. tom tries to catch it, but he trips and falls. he hits his head on a rock and bleeds. he cries and says, "bubble, bubble, come back to me. bubble, bubble, i am sorry."

but the bubble does not hear him. the bubble flies over the trees and the houses. the bubble sees lily hiding behind a fence. the bubble smiles and says, "lily, lily, you are so kind. lily, lily, i will always love you."

the end.

once there was a bird named xander. xander was very proud of his wings and he could soar higher than any other birds in the sky. he liked to show off the amazing things he could do when he was soaring in the air.

one day, he was telling the other birds about how great his wings were and how much he could do when he flew. he said, "i can even do math with my wings!"

the other birds were amazed, but when xander tried to do the math in the sky, he was too clumsy and slipped. he suddenly found himself crashing down and couldn't fly back up again.

the other birds laughed, but the wise old owl swooped down to help xander. he told xander, "sometimes, it pays to be modest and take your time. if you try to do too much at once, it can be dangerous!"
