xander learned his lesson. he realized that it was not a good idea to be too proud and spicy. feeling embarrassed, he slowly flew back home.

once there was a brave little girl named lucy. everyday, lucy would watch her dad as he prepared for the day. he would get out his axe and chop a bit of firewood. lucy thought his axe was the most amazing thing.

one day, lucy was feeling very brave. she decided she wanted to try out the axe. she went over to the wood pile and started trying to chop wood, but it was much harder than she thought it would be. she was very clumsy with the axe.

at first her dad was angry, but then he realised that lucy was just trying to help him. so he taught her the right way to use the axe. he showed her how to chop the wood slowly and carefully.

from that day onwards, lucy helped her dad chop the firewood. they worked together, slowly and carefully. lucy was no longer clumsy with the axe, but steady and strong like her dad.

tim and sam are friends. they like to play sport. they have a ball and a bat. they go to the park with their mums.

"can i hit the ball first?" tim asks.

"ok, but i will catch it," sam says.

tim holds the bat and sam throws the ball. tim swings the bat and hits the ball hard. the ball flies in the air.

"wow, good hit!" sam says. he runs after the ball.

but the ball is too fast. it goes over the fence and into the road.

"oh no, the ball is gone!" tim says.

they look at the road. there are many cars and bikes. they are loud and fast. they cannot get the ball.

they are sad. they like their ball.

a man sees them. he is clever. he has a big stick. he walks to the road. he waits for the cars and bikes to stop. he uses the stick to get the ball. he brings the ball back to tim and sam.

"here you go, boys. be careful next time," he says.

"thank you, sir. you are very kind," tim and sam say.

they are happy. they have their ball again.

they hug the man. they hug their mums. they spend the rest of the day playing sport in the park. they have fun.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside in the park with her friends. one day, lily found a treasure map on the ground. she followed the map and finally found the treasure. but when she opened it, she realized it was fake. 

lily was very sad and angry. she screamed loudly and her friends came running to see what was wrong. lily showed them the fake treasure and they all agreed to help her find the real treasure. they searched everywhere and finally found a real treasure chest. 

lily was very happy and thanked her friends for helping her. she learned that sometimes things may not be what they seem, but if you keep trying, you can find something even better.

anna was very happy. she was going to visit her grandma for the first time. she packed her favorite toy, a pink bunny, and her pajamas in a small bag. she hugged her mom and dad and got in the car with them.

they drove for a long time, until they saw a big house with a green garden. anna saw her grandma waiting for them at the door. she smiled and waved. anna ran out of the car and hugged her grandma.

"welcome, welcome, my dear anna!" her grandma said. "i'm so glad you're here. come, let me show you your bedroom."

she took anna by the hand and led her inside the house. they went up the stairs and entered a cozy room with a big window. there was a bed with a blue quilt, a dresser with some books and toys, and a painting of a flower on the wall.

"this is your bedroom, anna. you can sleep here and play here. do you like it?" her grandma asked.

anna looked around and nodded. she thought the room was impressive. it was so pretty and comfortable. she put her bag on the bed and took out her pink bunny.

"thank you, grandma. i love it. and i love you," she said.

"i love you too, anna. you're such a sweet girl. now, why don't we go downstairs and have some cookies and milk? i baked them just for you," her grandma said.

anna smiled and followed her grandma. she was very happy. she was going to have a wonderful time with her grandma.

once there was a strong igloo. it was built by some polar bears and they were very proud of it.

one day a fox was walking around and he saw the igloo. he wanted to see how strong it was, so he decided to cut it with a sharp knife.

he started cutting the igloo but it was too strong for him. a polar bear who had seen the fox cutting came over to him and said:
"why are you cutting my igloo?"
the fox said he wanted to see how strong it was.

the bear then said,"no cutting! this igloo is a very good home for me and my friends. leave it alone!"
the fox agreed and he ran away.

the polar bears were very happy because the igloo was still strong. they thanked the bear who had saved their igloo. from then on they kept it even stronger.

once upon a time there was a little boy named jack. jack was only three-years-old, but he already loved to talk. everywhere he went, he would chat and chat and chat. 

when jack asked his mom what an opera was, she smiled and said, "an opera is a special kind of show. everyone sings and there's lots of beautiful music."jack was so excited, he began telling all of his friends at daycare all about opera. 

one day, jack's mom told him she had a surprise. when they arrived, jack couldn't believe his eyes: they were at a fake opera! the singer's voices were loud, and the performers acted out each scene. jack had so much fun, he couldn't stop talking about it! 

the next day, jack went around telling everyone all about the fake opera show. jack was also excited to see another real one someday soon!

once upon a time there lived a little boy. his name was jack. he loved to explore the world around him.

one day, he asked his mom, â€œcan i go outside?â€ she nodded and said, â€œyes, it's a beautiful day.â€

jack ran quickly out the door and into the yard. he was so happy to be outside.

he saw a new flower growing in the garden. he asked the flower, â€œwhat's your name?â€ the flower smiled and said, â€œmy name is daisy. welcome!â€

jack was so cheerful and excited to meet daisy. they talked for a while about the other animals in the garden.

after a while, daisy said, â€œi have to go now, but it was nice to meet you!â€ jack waved goodbye and said, â€œbye daisy! come back soon!â€

jack smiled as he watched daisy fly away. he was filled with a feeling of happiness. his heart was full of warmth and welcome.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy who loved to ride his bike. one day, timmy was riding his bike down the street when he saw a cop car. the cop waved at timmy and said, "hey there, little guy! that's a perfect bike you have there." timmy smiled and said, "thank you, mr. cop!" 

the cop asked timmy where he was going, and timmy said he was just riding around the neighborhood. the cop said, "well, be careful and make sure you wear your helmet." timmy nodded and rode off, feeling happy that the cop liked his bike. 

as timmy rode down the street, he saw his friend billy playing in his yard. billy said, "hey timmy, can i ride your bike?" timmy said, "sure, but be careful!" billy hopped on the bike and rode around, feeling the wind in his hair. when he was done, he said, "thanks timmy, that was so much fun!" timmy smiled and said, "i know, riding bikes is the best!"

lily and tom are twins. they like to play with their new toys. mom and dad gave them new toys for their birthday. lily has a new doll and tom has a new car.

one day, they go to the park with mom and dad. they see a big band playing music. the band has drums, trumpets, and flags. the band is doing a march. lily and tom want to see the march.

they run to the band. they want to touch the drums and the flags. but the band does not like that. the band says, "stop! go away! you are making noise!"

lily and tom are scared. they scream. they run back to mom and dad. mom and dad hug them. they say, "it's okay. the band is not angry. they just need to play their music. you can watch from here. but you cannot touch their things."

lily and tom nod. they watch the march from a distance. they clap their hands. they like the music. they forget their scream. they are happy.

grandma and grandpa were so proud one day. they had made something special for their little grandchild. it was a sparkly heart, shaped like a balloon, with all the colours of the rainbow. they filled it with love, and then poured it into a jar with a bow on top. 

"now, our grandbaby will feel the love each time she looks at it," said grandma. 

that day the grandparents gave the jar to their grandchild who hugged it tightly and smiled. "thank you!"

grandpa was especially proud, his heart almost exploding with love. the grandparents hugged each other and all three of them beamed with joy. 

grandma said, "remember, all you have to do, my dear, is pour a little bit of this love into your heart each time you feel sad." 

the grandchild nodded and smiled, happy that she had something so special, made with so much love.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy loved animals and always wanted to see an ostrich. one day, timmy's mom took him to the zoo to see the ostrich. timmy was so excited and he kept asking his mom when they would see the ostrich.

after seeing the ostrich, timmy and his mom went to a restaurant to eat. timmy's mom asked him what he wanted to eat and timmy said he wanted to cook his own food. his mom was surprised but happy to let him try. they ordered a deep dish pizza and timmy helped put the toppings on.

while they were waiting for the pizza to cook, timmy's mom asked him what his favorite animal was. timmy said, "i like the ostrich because it has big feathers and runs really fast." his mom smiled and said, "i like the ostrich too. it's a very interesting animal." finally, the pizza was ready and timmy and his mom enjoyed their delicious meal together.

once upon a time there were two friends, tom and jack. tom was always very careful with his things, but jack was very careless. one day, tom went to a fancy party and brought his new watch.

the party was fun, but eventually it was time for tom to go home. he said goodbye and then realised he had lost his watch! 

jack felt sorry when he heard about it. he said to tom, â€œi know it was a fancy watch, but donâ€™t worry! iâ€™m sure youâ€™ll find it.â€

tom searched everywhere, but he could not find his watch. he was very sad. then jack said to tom, â€œremember - be careful with your things, otherwise you can lose them.â€ 

finally the two friends found tom's watch. tom was very happy and thanked jack for his help.

the moral of the story is that we should be careful with our things, otherwise we can lose them!

once upon a time there was a little girl named lucy. she was very playful and loved to go to the movies. every weekend, when her mom would take her to see a new movie, she was so excited! she would raise her hands in the air with joy.

on one particular weekend, lucy and her mom went to their favorite movie theater. that day, a new movie was playing and lucy was even more excited than usual. she smiled and raised her voice in anticipation. 

"mommy, is that the new movie?" she asked.

"yes it is," her mom replied.

"can we go see it?" lucy asked.

mom smiled and said, "of course! we can watch the movie and have a lot of fun!"

so mom and lucy went into the movie theater and watched the playful movie. they laughed and smiled throughout the movie, and lucy felt happy and excited the whole time. 

at the end of the movie, lucy was feeling so happy that she threw her hands in the air and shouted, "yippee!" it made her mom laugh and raised their special bond even higher. 

the end.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she was walking in the forest when she saw a weird trap. "what is that?" she asked herself. suddenly, a little bird flew down and got stuck in the trap.

"oh no! little bird, i will help you," said lily. she tried to open the trap, but it was too strong. "i need to find someone to help us," she said to the bird.

lily ran to find her friend, timmy. "timmy, please come with me. a little bird is trapped in a weird trap," she said. timmy followed lily to the trap and together they were able to free the bird. "yay! we did it! the trap is over and the bird is free!" they shouted.

one day, bob the bear saw winter coming. he wanted to prepare so he went on a journey. as he walked, the cold air made him feel dizzy and he started to nod off. he was so exhausted, he decided to take a nap. when he awoke, the snow had blanketed the ground. winter had arrived and bob was happy. he had the perfect plan for how to make the most of the winter months. he would build a snowman! 

bob went off in search of the perfect place to build. after hours of walking, he finally found the perfect spot. but when he arrived, he spotted something strange. in the middle of the snow was another snowman! bob was surprised. he thought he was the only one who had the idea. as he got closer, he noticed something even more peculiar. the other snowman looked just like him! 

bob was amazed and slightly dizzy by the sight. suddenly, he realized why. it was a reflection! the snow on the ground was so bright and shiny that it had created a mirror image of bob's snowman. he smiled and walked away, nodding in appreciation. he knew winter could be a magical season.

one day, a little girl named mia went to the park with her mom. mia wore her favorite jacket. it was red and very different from her other clothes. mia loved her jacket very much. in the park, she saw a boy named tom. tom was playing with a ball.

"hi, tom! i like your ball," said mia. "can i play with you?"

"sure, mia!" said tom. "let's play catch!"

mia and tom played catch with the ball. they laughed and had lots of fun. mia took off her jacket because she was hot from playing. she put it on the bench.

suddenly, a little dog came to the park. the dog saw mia's jacket and thought it was a toy. the dog took the jacket and ran away.

mia and tom saw the dog and ran after it. they clapped their hands to make the dog stop. the dog stopped and dropped the jacket. mia was happy to get her jacket back. she thanked tom and the dog.

from that day, mia, tom, and the little dog became best friends. they played together in the park every day.

once upon a time there was a skeleton who had done something bad. nobody wanted to be his friend anymore, and he felt so sad. he wanted to make things right, so he asked everyone to forgive him. 

the skeleton apologized with a sweet smile. he promised he would never do it again, and he wished that everyone would give him another chance.

at first everyone was scared and didn't know what to do. but then one little boy said that he would forgive the skeleton. that made the skeleton so happy, and soon all the other children followed. 

the skeleton was thrilled and everyone was friends again. they all laughed, danced and had a wonderful time together. 

the skeleton was so thankful for the little boy's kindness and generosity. he realized that forgiveness can be sweet, just like honey!

peter was floating out in the ocean, further and further away from shore. he couldn't see anybody, only the endless blue of the sea. he was starting to feel scared. suddenly, he noticed a white anchor bobbing in the current. he felt reassured that he was not alone as he held onto the anchor. he felt the weight of the anchor and enjoyed the steady feeling it gave him. little by little, he was carried closer and closer to shore. soon enough, he could see the white sand of the beach. with strength, the anchor pulled peter to the beach and he was safe. feeling happy again, peter waved goodbye to the white anchor and ran to the shore.

once, there was a sister. she was so happy. she liked to eat delicious food. one day, her brother had an idea. he said, "let's bury our food in the sand and play a game!" so they did. the sister buried her food in the sand. her brother buried his food, too. then they both dug it out! the sister's food was still delicious. she laughed and laughed. after that, the brother and sister played together all day long.

once upon a time, there was a festival. everyone was excited and speeded about, having lots of fun. 

annabelle was at the festival with her mom and dad. she wanted to try something new and delicious, so she went to the food stall. she saw lots of interesting food, but the one that caught her eye was a sour treat. she excitedly asked her mom if she could try it. 

her mom said yes, and annabelle eagerly took a bite. the sour treat was so tangy and delicious! she couldn't help but speed away and eat some more. 

annabelle had a great time at the festival, and she couldn't wait to go back next year. she was so happy that she got to try something new and tasty.

ben and mia liked to play hide and seek in the park. they took turns to count and hide. one day, they saw a big boat on the lake. it was unique. it had many colors and shapes on it. it looked like a toy.

"wow, look at that boat!" mia said. "it is so pretty and fun!"

"let's go see it!" ben said. "maybe we can hide on it!"

they ran to the boat and climbed on board. they saw many rooms and things on the boat. they decided to hide in different places. mia hid under a table with a cloth. ben hid in a closet with some coats.

"ready or not, here i come!" mia shouted. she got out of her hiding spot and looked for ben. she searched the boat, but she could not find him. she called his name, but he did not answer.

"ben, where are you?" mia said. "this is not fun anymore!"

she started to feel scared and lonely. she wished she had not left the park. she wanted to go back to her mom and dad.

meanwhile, ben heard mia's voice. he wanted to surprise her, so he stayed quiet in his hiding spot. he thought she would find him soon. he did not know she was scared and lonely. he did not know the boat was about to move.

suddenly, the boat started to make a loud noise. it began to move on the lake. ben and mia felt the boat shake and sway. they both got out of their hiding spots and ran to the deck. they saw the water and the shore. they saw their mom and dad waving and shouting.

"help! help!" ben and mia cried. "we are on the boat! we want to go back!"

the boat's driver heard their cries. he saw the two children on his boat. he was surprised and angry. he did not know they had sneaked on his boat. he turned the boat around and brought them back to the shore. he scolded them for being naughty and dangerous.

ben and mia were sorry and scared. they hugged their mom and dad. they said they were sorry and they would never do it again. they learned their lesson. they decided to play hide and seek in the park, not on the boat.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. he loved playing with his cart, which was his favorite toy. one day, he wanted to be popular and have lots of friends to play with.

timmy decided to make a lemonade stand with his cart. he worked hard and succeeded in making delicious lemonade. people loved it and soon he became very popular. timmy was happy because he had lots of friends to play with now. 

from that day on, timmy and his cart became famous in the neighborhood. they would sell lemonade every weekend and everyone loved it. timmy was proud of his success and loved playing with his cart even more.

once upon a time, there was a group of friends who loved to play together. one day, they went to the park to play hide-and-seek. but one of the friends, named timmy, didn't want to play fair. he kept peeking and cheating. the other friends felt sad and angry.

so, they decided to punish timmy by not letting him play with them anymore. timmy felt sorry and said sorry to his friends. he promised to play fair from now on. his friends were grateful and forgave him. they played together happily ever after.

sara loved to dance. she danced every day with her mom and dad. she danced in the living room, in the kitchen, and in the garden. she danced when she was happy, when she was bored, and when she was angry. dancing made her feel good.

one day, sara went to a dance class with other kids. she was very excited. she wanted to learn new moves and make new friends. but when she got there, she saw that the other kids were better than her. they could jump higher, spin faster, and balance longer. sara felt sad. she felt like she could not dance.

she ran to her mom and said, "mom, i want to quit. i can't dance. the other kids are better than me. i don't want to be here."

her mom hugged her and said, "sara, don't quit. you can dance. you just need to practice and have fun. the other kids are not better than you. they are different from you. everyone has their own style and their own pace. you have your own style and your own pace. you are a beautiful dancer. i love to watch you dance."

sara looked at her mom and smiled. she felt a little better. she said, "mom, thank you. i love you. i will try again. i will practice and have fun. i will dance with my own style and my own pace."

she went back to the dance class and joined the other kids. she did not compare herself to them. she did not feel sad. she felt happy. she danced with her mom and dad. she danced in the living room, in the kitchen, and in the garden. she danced when she was happy, when she was bored, and when she was angry. dancing made her feel good.

the moral of the story is: don't quit something you love because you think you are not good enough. practice and have fun. be yourself and enjoy your own style and pace. you are a beautiful dancer.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play with her puzzle. one day, lily's mommy made some hot soup for her. lily tasted the soup and said, "yummy, it's hot!" 

lily's mommy said, "be careful, it's hot. blow on it to make it cooler." 

lily blew on the soup and then said, "mommy, can i kiss you?" 

lily's mommy smiled and said, "of course, you can kiss me. but first, let's finish your soup." 

lily finished her soup and then gave her mommy a big kiss on the cheek. they both smiled and continued to play with lily's puzzle.

once upon a time, there was a very sad little girl. she had purple arms and was always so sad. one day, she had a very big cry and it kept going and going. then she felt something touch her arm. she looked around and saw her mom smiling at her. her mom said, "it's okay, honey. i forgive you."

the little girl was so happy and hugged her mom so tight. she felt tears of joy on her cheeks and knew that the sadness was gone. she smiled and said, "i forgive you too!"

from that day on, the girl followed her mom's example and tried to forgive all the people around her. she never forgot the big purple arms of her mom. they reminded her that forgiveness was the best feeling in the world.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play with her toys and sing songs. one day, her mommy told her that they were going to have a party for her birthday. lily was so excited! she couldn't wait to see all her friends and get lots of presents.

the day of the party arrived and lily's mommy was very busy. she was cooking food and decorating the house. lily helped by blowing up balloons and putting up streamers. the house looked so pretty and colorful!

when all of lily's friends arrived, they played games and ate cake. lily got lots of presents and felt very happy. but then, something unexpected happened. one of the balloons popped and scared all the kids. they started to cry and wanted to go home.

lily's mommy knew just what to do. she got out some bubbles and started blowing them in the air. the kids laughed and chased the bubbles, forgetting all about the scary noise. lily's party ended up being the best one ever, all thanks to her mommy's quick thinking.

once there was a poor family that lived on a farm. the family had a small garden full of different fruits and vegetables. in the garden was a vine with delicious grapes. the mother in the family asked her three year old daughter, sarah, if she would like a grape from the vine. sarah eagerly nodded her head yes and made a request, â€˜can i have a grape, mummy?â€™ 

the mother picked a grape off the vine and handed it to sarah. sarah was happy to get the grape and said thank you. she smiled at her mummy before taking a bite of the grape that was sweet and juicy.

after eating the grape, sarah asked for another one. the mummy said, â€œthat was it for today. i'm sorry, but we don't have many grapes because we are so poor.â€ the little girl understood and said â€˜ok, mummy.â€™ she gave her mummy a big hug and went off to play.

once upon a time, there were two friends. one day, one of them got a paper. it was very delicate, like tissue paper.

he wanted to show his friend, so he carefully picked it up. but his friend warned him. he said that he must be gentle so it wouldn't get torn.

the friend was careful and he held the paper very carefully. but then, it still ripped. he was so sad.

but his friend had a good idea. he said they could tape it back together. they got some tape, and put the paper back together. when they were done, the paper was as good as new.

the friends were happy. they had fixed the delicate paper together.

sara liked to play with her grandma's yarn. she liked the colors and the softness. she liked to make shapes and pretend they were animals or hats or scarves. one day, she found a big ball of yarn that was very old. it was gray and brown and had holes and knots. sara wondered why her grandma kept it.

she asked her grandma, "what is this yarn for? it is not pretty or nice."

her grandma smiled and said, "this yarn is very special to me. it is old, but it has a story. let me explain."

she took the yarn and showed sara a picture. it was a picture of her grandma when she was a little girl, like sara. she was wearing a sweater that looked like the yarn. she was with her mom and dad and they were happy.

"my mom made this sweater for me with this yarn. she was very good at knitting. she used to tell me stories while she knitted. she taught me how to knit too. this yarn reminds me of her and the stories and the love."

sara looked at the yarn and the picture. she felt something warm in her heart. she hugged her grandma and said, "i like this yarn too. can you teach me how to knit? can you tell me stories too?"

her grandma nodded and said, "of course, my dear. i would love to. come, let's sit and knit and talk. this yarn has more stories to tell."

once upon a time, there was a little boy who couldn't understand things very easily. he was deaf and he couldn't hear anything that people said. one day at noon, the boy was walking in the park with his mom. he was trying to understand the noises he heard, but it was too hard. then all of a sudden, he saw a bunch of birds in a tree nearby. he saw that the birds were dancing and singing and making noise. he was so amazed, he stopped to watch them.

the boy noticed that some of the birds were louder than the others. he watched as the birds flapped their wings and jumped around. he felt so happy that he could understand what the birds were saying! he laughed and smiled, and his mom smiled too. she was so happy to see her son so happy and understanding things. 

from then on, the boy loved visiting the park at noon to watch the birds. he liked to listen to the birds and understand what they were saying. he was so happy to understand something even though he was deaf. the boy and his mom would both go visit the birds every day at noon.

once upon a time, there was a curious little girl named sue. sue liked to play with her toys and ask questions. one day, sue found a small box in her room. it looked like a cell. she thought it was a new toy.

sue asked her mom, "mom, what is this cell?" her mom said, "it's a special box to send a gift to your friend, tim." sue was happy. she wanted to send a gift to tim. sue put her toy car in the cell and closed it.

sue's mom helped her send the cell to tim. after some days, tim got the cell. tim was very happy to see the toy car. he called sue and said, "thank you for the gift!" sue and tim were very happy to share toys and be friends.

mommy was very excited as she was about to put a new dress for lucy, her three-year old daughter. lucy saw the dress and said, "it's so pretty!" she did not want to change, but mommy said, "come on, lucy. we have to go to grandma's house and the dress looks pretty." 

mommy helped lucy put on the dress, but it just did not look right. lucy said, "help! the dress is too tight. i can't walk." mommy said, "oh dear! i forgot to check if the dress fits! don't worry, i think we can save it."

mommy put some lace at one side of the dress and made a few stitches around it. lucy said, "yay! now, it fits much better." mommy said, "yes, that should do the trick." she was very happy that she was able to prevent the dress from tearing.

they took the dress off and put it back in the wardrobe. after that, they got ready to go to grandma's house. they looked around and mommy said, "you look so pretty, lucy!" lucy smiled as mommy gave her a big hug.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy loved to play with his toy equipment, which was very special to him. his favorite toy was a rare red truck that he loved to push around the house.

one day, timmy's mom asked him to clean up his toys, but he didn't want to stop playing. he decided to hide his red truck under the couch so he could keep playing with it later. but when he went back to get it, he couldn't find it anywhere.

timmy searched and searched, but his red truck was nowhere to be found. he was very sad and felt like his day had come to a bad end. he realized that hiding his toys wasn't a good idea and promised to always put them away properly from then on.

once upon a time there was a bird. the bird was very happy and loved to fly high in the sky. every day the bird would fly around looking for dinner.

one day the bird found something very bad. it was a dark cloud and it was chasing him. the bird flew and flew as fast as he could but the dark cloud kept getting closer.

the bird kept flying until he saw a very bright light. it was so bright that it made the dark cloud go away.

the bright light was coming from a little house in the forest. the bird flew down to say hello, and the people inside welcomed him in. they gave the bird some tasty dinner, and the bird was so happy that he sang a song of thanks.

the bird stayed at the little house for the rest of the day. he was so happy that he had found a safe place and a delicious dinner. he knew he wouldn't have to worry about the bad cloud ever again.

once upon a time, there was a pirate who wanted to go sailing on the sea. but before he could, he had to stop for something very important: an apple. but, when he got to the store, he only saw bitter apples, so he decided to turn away. then, a voice called out to him.

"hey pirate! stop! i have something special for you!"

the pirate looked around, but he couldn't see anyone. then he heard the voice again.

"up here!"

he looked up and saw a small bird perched on a tree branch.

"i have something sweet and juicy for you," the bird said.

the pirate was so happy! he thanked the bird and began to eat the sweet apple. all of his bitterness was gone, and he was ready to start his voyage on the sea.

once upon a time there was a little girl called anna. one day, anna went to the park to play. she looked around and saw a big tree with a measure of hidden leaves. anna wondered what they were. she went closer and started to question the leaves.

suddenly, the tree started to whisper a response. the leaves said "come closer and touch them, they will give you a surprise!" anna was curious but she was afraid. she took a deep breath and bravely touched the hidden leaves.

to her surprise, anna suddenly felt scared and cold. she tried to back away but it was too late. anna realised that the leaves were hiding a monster! the monster grabbed anna and she screamed for help. even though she screamed and yelled, no one came. 

the monster flew away with anna, never to be seen again.

once there was a man named jed. jed was very hungry and went to a nearby store to get something to eat. he found some meat, but it looked very filthy. when he touched it he found that it had begun to rot. 

jed was so sad, he knew he couldn't eat the meat. he went back to the storekeeper and asked, "why did you give me this filthy, rotted meat?"

the storekeeper was surprised, and apologized. he said, "i'm sorry, i didn't realize the meat was not good. i'll give you some fresh meat." jed was so happy and thanked the storekeeper. 

jed thanked the storekeeper and went back home with the fresh meat. he had a tasty meal and was happy he hadn't eaten the rotted, filthy meat!

once upon a time, in a small house, there was a little girl named lily. she had a big toy box filled with many toys. one day, her friend tim came over to play.

"can i borrow your toy car?" tim asked lily. lily said, "yes, you can borrow my toy car, but you must be nice to it." tim played with the toy car, but he was not nice. he threw the car on the floor, and it broke. lily was sad, and tim felt bad.

later, they went to the kitchen for a snack. lily's mom gave them apples to eat. but tim's apple was spoiled. "yuck! my stomach hurts," said tim. lily's mom told them, "it's important to check your food before you eat it."

after that day, tim learned to be more careful with toys and food. he promised to be nice to lily's toys and to always check his food. lily and tim played together every day, and they became the best of friends.

emily was walking past the lab. it was very exciting. the lab was huge and it was painted bright pink. emily stopped and admired it. she could not believe how beautiful the lab was. 
emily decided to go inside. there were lots of things to explore. she saw lots of amazing things and studied them with care. everything was so interesting. 
the room was full of pink. emily was so happy! she wanted to stay forever and admire the lab. emily went home with a big smile on her face and the memory of the beautiful lab in her heart.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily who loved ice-cream. one day, she went to the park with her mommy and daddy to get some ice-cream. she was so happy when she got her ice-cream cone.

but then, a big dog came and knocked her ice-cream cone out of her hand! lily was sad and started to cry. her mommy and daddy tried to make her happy again, but she just wanted her ice-cream back.

suddenly, a kind lady came over and gave lily a new ice-cream cone. lily was so happy and thanked the lady. she spread a big smile on her face and continued to enjoy her yummy ice-cream. the end.

once upon a time, there was a little boy who had a very loyal friendâ€”a toy dragon! the dragon was very small, no bigger than a jug. one day, the little boy was playing in his room when he was hit with a magical sparkle. suddenly, the dragon started to shrink! 

the little boy was devastated. he looked to the dragon and asked, "why are you getting so tiny?"

the dragon tapped into the little boy's energy and spoke with a tiny voice, "i'm shrinking to protect us both. i'm making myself small so i can be with you wherever you go!"

the little boy gave the dragon a big hug and said, "thank you for being so loyal to me, friend."

the dragon smiled and said, "it's what friends are for." 

and the little boy and his loyal dragon lived happily ever after.

mama was very busy with her work today and she had a deadline to meet, so she told her daughter to be very patient. her daughter had never been asked to do such a difficult thing before--be patient and not interrupt right away. but eventually, the little girl did as she was told and waited and waited. 

finally, the time came and mama got her paycheck. the little girl saw it when mama was counting and she noticed a penny! she was so excited that she shouted "can i have it, mama? can i use it?". but mama replied: "no, sweetheart. i'm sorry. this penny is too delicate for us to play with. you'll just have to delay having a penny for a little while."

the little girl was a bit sad about the delay, but she nodded in understanding. mama told her that one day she would get a penny of her own--a nice shiny new one! this made the little girl very happy and she couldn't wait for mama to give her the coin. 

days passed, and one day the little girl's birthday arrived. mama gave her a special gift: a shiny new penny just for her! now the little girl could play with it and treasure it forever. 

it was a delayed pleasure, but now the little girl knows that she finally has her penny!

once upon a time, there was a little dog named max. max was very impatient. he always wanted to play, jump, and run. one day, max was playing and running too fast. he fell and hurt his leg. max was sad and he suffered because his leg hurt a lot.

max's mom took him to the doctor. the doctor took an x-ray of max's leg. the x-ray showed that max had a little break in his leg. the doctor put a cast on max's leg to help it get better. max had to be patient and wait for his leg to heal.

as max waited for his leg to get better, he learned to be more patient. he played with his toys and did not run too fast. when his leg was all better, max remembered to be careful and not run too fast. the moral of the story is that being patient and careful can help keep us safe and happy.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lucy. she was only three years old, but she was very brave. she was determined to climb up a tall hill near the park.

"i'm going to climb the hill," she said to her mommy.

"no, lucy," said mommy. "it's too steep and dangerous."

lucy was not deterred and she started making her way up the hill. as she walked, it started to get thin and she had to help her feet find the right places to step. soon, she was at the top and she saw a big, tall spike in the ground.

"what's that?" asked lucy.

"that's a spike," said mommy. "it's a thin pole that rises from the ground."

lucy looked around and saw the beautiful view from the top of the hill. she felt very proud of herself for making it all the way up.

"we made it!" said lucy.

mommy smiled and said, "yes, we did."

once upon a time, there was a clever little boy named tim. he loved to play with his rubber ball. one day, tim saw a big crab on the beach. the crab had big claws and was walking funny.

tim went to the crab and said, "hello, mr. crab! do you want to play with my rubber ball?" the crab looked at tim and said, "yes, i would like to play, but i might pinch the ball with my claws."

tim thought for a moment and then said, "don't worry, mr. crab. we can play without you pinching the ball. you can use your legs to kick the ball instead."

so, tim and the crab played together. they kicked the rubber ball back and forth on the beach. they both had a lot of fun. tim was happy that he made a new friend, and the crab was happy that he didn't pinch the ball.

anna and ben are friends. they like to play at the park. they see a big slide. it is very long and shiny. anna wants to go on the slide, but ben is scared.

"come on, ben, it is fun!" anna says. she runs to the slide and climbs up the steps. she sits on the top and smiles. "look, ben, i can see the whole park from here!"

ben stays on the ground. he shakes his head. "no, anna, it is too high. i don't like it. it is scary."

anna slides down. she goes very fast and laughs. she lands on the sand and jumps up. she runs to ben and hugs him. "don't be scared, ben. it is not scary. it is fun. i will explain to you how to do it. you just sit on the slide and hold on to the sides. then you let go and slide down. it is easy and fun. you can do it, ben. i will help you."

ben looks at anna. he sees that she is happy and not scared. he trusts her. he nods. "okay, anna, i will try. but you have to go with me."

anna smiles. she takes ben's hand and leads him to the slide. they climb up the steps together. they sit on the top and hold on to the sides. anna says, "ready, ben? one, two, three, go!"

they slide down together. they go very fast and laugh. they land on the sand and jump up. they hug each other. "we did it, anna! we did it!" ben says. "it was fun! it was not scary. thank you for explaining to me how to do it. you are a good friend."

anna says, "you are welcome, ben. you are a good friend too. i am proud of you. you are brave. do you want to go again?"

ben says, "yes, anna, i do. let's go again!"

they run to the slide and climb up the steps. they slide down again and again. they have a lot of fun. they are happy. they are friends.

anna and ben are friends. they like to play in the park. today, they see a big hat on a bench. the hat is red and blue and has a yellow star.

"wow, look at that hat!" anna says. "it is so pretty. can i try it on?"

"ok, but be careful. maybe it belongs to someone," ben says.

anna puts the hat on her head. it is too big for her. it covers her eyes and ears. she laughs.

"ha ha, i look funny. how do i look, ben?"

ben laughs too. he thinks anna looks silly. he takes a picture of her with his toy camera.

"you look like a clown, anna. cheese!"

anna and ben hear a voice. it is a man. he is wearing a white coat and glasses. he is holding a clipboard and a pen.

"excuse me, children. that is my hat. i need it for my test," the man says.

"your test? what test?" anna asks.

the man smiles. he points to a big balloon. the balloon is green and has a number on it. it is tied to a string.

"i am testing how high the balloon can fly. the hat has a device that can measure the height. see this button?" the man says.

he shows anna and ben a small button on the hat. he presses it. the balloon starts to rise in the air.

"wow, that is cool!" ben says.

"can we watch?" anna asks.

"sure, you can watch. but please give me back my hat. i need to record the data," the man says.

anna takes off the hat. she gives it to the man. she is sorry to lose the pretty hat, but she is curious about the balloon.

"thank you, children. you are very nice. do you want a reward?" the man asks.

he opens his coat. he has a pocket full of candies. the candies are colorful and shiny. they look yummy.

"yes, please!" anna and ben say.

the man gives them each a candy. they unwrap it and put it in their mouths. it is sweet and chewy.

"mmm, this is yummy!" anna says.

"thank you, mister. you are very nice too," ben says.

the man smiles. he puts the hat on his head. he watches the balloon fly higher and higher. he writes something on his clipboard.

anna and ben watch too. they hold their candies and their hands. they are happy. they have made a new friend. and they have learned something new.

sara and ben like to play with numbers. they have a book with numbers and pictures. they can count to ten and say the names of the numbers. one day, they go to the park with their mom. they see a big river with water and ducks. they want to play near the river.

"look, ben, i see a number on the duck!" sara says. she points to a yellow tag on the duck's leg. it has a number four on it.

"wow, sara, you are right! that is a number four!" ben says. he runs to the duck and tries to touch the tag. the duck does not like that. it quacks and bites ben's finger.

"ow, ow, ow!" ben cries. he drops the book and runs back to sara. his finger is red and hurts. the duck swims away with the book.

"ben, are you okay?" sara asks. she hugs ben and looks at his finger.

"no, sara, i am not okay. the duck was mean. it took our book. and it bit me. i don't like ducks anymore." ben says. he is sad and angry.

mom hears ben's cry and comes to them. she sees ben's finger and the duck with the book. she is worried and angry too.

"ben, sara, what happened? why did you go near the duck? you know you should not do that. ducks are wild animals. they can be dangerous. and you lost your book. that was a gift from grandma. how could you be so careless?" mom says. she is not happy.

sara and ben feel embarrassed. they know they did something wrong. they are sorry for losing the book and hurting ben. they wish they did not play with the duck. they wish they listened to mom. they say sorry to mom and to each other. but mom is still mad. she takes them home and does not let them play anymore. they have a bad day.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play with dough and make shapes like animals and flowers. one day, her mommy asked her to be obedient and clean up her toys. 

lily replied, "okay mommy, i will clean up my toys after i study my shapes with the dough." 

mommy smiled and said, "that's a great idea, lily. you can study and learn while having fun with the dough." 

so, lily played with the dough for a little while longer and made a beautiful butterfly. then, she obediently cleaned up her toys and put them away. 

mommy was proud of lily for being such a good listener and for studying with the dough. they hugged and went to have some yummy snacks together. the end.

once there was a young bird, who wanted to soar in the sky. but no matter how hard she tried, she couldn't seem to fly.

one day, the bird heard about a magical chamber. inside the chamber was a secret that would help the bird soar. 

the bird flew up to the chamber and knocked on the door. "who's there?" said a voice from inside.

the bird replied, "its me, the young bird who wants to soar in the sky. may i come in and learn the secret to flying?"

"yes, come on in," the voice said.

the bird entered the chamber, and was amazed by what she saw. she saw a beautiful feather and a golden hourglass. 

the voice said, "this feather is your ticket to flying. use the independent spirit within you to soar. put the feather in your hair, close your eyes and imagine yourself flying as high as you can."

the bird followed the instructions and felt her heart soar. miraculously, she was able to fly! from that day forward, the young bird became an independent flyer who was able to soar through the sky.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named millie. millie liked to jog every morning to see the beautiful views. one morning, she put on her favourite running shoes and went for a jog. as she jogged, she loved seeing the trees and birds.

suddenly, millie spotted a little rabbit hopping along on her path. millie stopped to greet the friendly bunny. she held out her hand and the bunny hopped into it. millie was so happy to make a new friend.

millie was gentle and helpful with the bunny. she wanted to make sure the bunny felt safe. she brought the bunny with her on her jog and they looked at the views together.

the bunny was very thankful to millie for being so helpful. millie was happy knowing that she could help make someone's day a bit better. 

the next morning, millie and the bunny jogged together again. millie was thankful to have a new friend and they shared many more beautiful views together.

once upon a time there was a boy. his name was jake. jake liked to play outside. every day he would hear the birds singing.

one day, jake was looking around and he saw an arrow. it was blue. jake wanted to touch it, but he was scared. he heard a noise and he was very scared.

it was just a squirrel! the squirrel said, "hello!" it wanted to play.

so, jake and the squirrel played together. they had so much fun! they chased each other around, they raced and they played hide and seek. as they were playing, they heard a noise.

it was an arrow flying through the sky! it was blue, just like the arrow jake had seen. the squirrel and jake watched the arrow fly away.

they had so much fun playing together. they became best friends!

toby was a young boy, he was very curious. one day as he was playing in the park he noticed a cricket chirping loudly. toby wondered what the cricket was saying. he also noticed that the cricket looked quite nervous. toby had many questions so he decided to ask.

â€œhello little cricket," toby said.

the cricket stopped chirping, looked around and said â€œyes, what is it?â€ 

â€œwhy do you look so nervous?â€ toby asked.

the cricket took a deep breath and said, â€œi need to go somewhere but i'm scared to leave."

toby nodded in understanding and said, â€œbe brave little cricket! i'm sure you'll make it there safe.â€

the cricket smiled weakly and said, â€œthank you! now i just need to find the way.â€ 

toby smiled and said, â€œmaybe i can help you. would you like that?â€ 

the cricket nodded, â€œyes, i would appreciate it very much!â€

so toby and the cricket began walking together. toby was filled with wonder and admiration for the brave little cricket. with toby as his guide, the cricket was no longer nervous - he was feeling brave and confident. toby was happy he could help the cricket on his journey.

one day, john and his mom had very little money. mommy said the money was tight. she was sad and asked john what they could do.
john thought carefully and then his face lit up. he suggested they could look for money in their house. 
mommy was surprised. she said, "where do you think we'd find money?"
john said, "maybe in the dresser! or behind the couch!"
mommy smiled and said, "let's hurry and look!"
john and mommy searched together through the house and found some money in one of the drawers. they hugged each other and cheered with delight. they had enough money again to buy food and have fun.

jill was feeling anxious. she had been dreading this day for weeks on end. it was her first day at school and she was so scared. 

her teacher smiled at her and handed her a piece of chalk. she was excited to hold it in her hands. she grabbed it and tried to draw a picture of a flower on the blackboard. 

but no matter how hard she tried, her hand would not stay still. she was so nervous that the picture was a big mess.

her teacher was kind and she helped jill to find the courage she needed to finish the picture. beautiful flowers soon appeared on the board.

jill smiled at her handiwork, but before she could even finish going over the lines with red chalk, she lost her balance and fell. she was embarrassed, but the teacher comforted her and helped her back on her feet. 

jill had come to this special day ready to learn and have some fun. all the anxiousness she felt that morning was gone, and she was ready to make her own flowers with the chalk.

once upon a time, there was a fat cat named max. max loved to play with his toy blocks and build towers. one day, max's friend lily came over to play. "what are you building, max?" asked lily. "i'm building a big stadium for us to play in!" replied max.

lily was excited to play in the stadium, but she didn't know how to build. "can you teach me how to build, max?" she asked. "sure!" said max. "first, we need to stack the blocks on top of each other like this." max showed lily how to stack the blocks and they both worked together to build the stadium.

when they finished building, max and lily played in the stadium all day long. they ran races, played tag, and had so much fun. "thanks for teaching me how to build, max!" said lily. "no problem, lily. building is fun!" replied max. from that day on, max and lily built all sorts of things together and had many more fun adventures.

once upon a time, there was a little orange bird named sunny. sunny loved to fly around and sing songs. one day, while sunny was flying, she saw a big, scary cat. the cat wanted to catch sunny and eat her for dinner!

sunny was very scared, so she flew to her friend's house. her friend's name was lucky, and he was a wise old owl. sunny told lucky about the cat and asked him what to do. lucky told sunny to lay low and stay safe until the cat went away.

sunny listened to lucky's advice and stayed in her nest until the cat left. she learned that when she was in danger, it was important to stay safe and not take unnecessary risks. from then on, sunny always remembered to be careful and to listen to wise friends like lucky.

once upon a time, there was a kind and nice boy named timmy. he loved to play with his toys and run around in the park. one day, he saw a little bird who was hurt and couldn't fly. timmy felt very sad for the bird and promised to take care of it. he brought the bird home and gave it some food and water.

timmy was very compassionate and took care of the bird every day. he even made a little nest for it to sleep in. he loved the bird very much and the bird loved him too. one day, timmy's mom said they had to take the bird to the vet for a test. timmy was worried, but he promised the bird that everything would be okay.

sadly, the test showed that the bird was very sick and there was nothing the vet could do to help. timmy was heartbroken and cried a lot. he held the bird in his arms and promised to always remember it. timmy buried the bird in the park and said a little prayer for it every day. even though the ending was bad, timmy knew he had done the right thing by being kind and compassionate to the little bird.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. one day, she went to the park to play. she saw an empty swing and sat on it. suddenly, she heard a noise and turned around. she saw a big owl sitting on a tree. she said, "hello, mr. owl! do you want to play with me?"

the owl replied, "no, i don't want to play. i am very hungry and need to find some food to eat."

lily said, "oh no! you can't fight with other animals to get food. that's not nice. let's find some berries for you to eat together."

so, they looked for berries and found a lot of them. they sat together and ate the berries. the owl was very happy and said, "thank you, lily. you are a good friend." from that day on, they played together every day.

once upon a time there was a girl called nina. she really loved getting mail. every day, nina would look out of her window and wait for the postman. when he arrived she would quickly run outside to get her mail.

one day, nina received a very special envelope. it was bright and colourful and filled with lots of pictures. when she opened it, there were lots of new toys inside! nina was so thrilled that she couldn't wait to share the news with her friends.

nina spread the word to everyone she saw, and soon everyone knew about her special mail. everyone was very grateful to nina for sharing her special mail with them.

nina was so happy that she got to spread the joy of receiving mail with her friends. she would always look forward to getting the mail every day.

once there was a small boy who was very wealthy. he lived in a big house and had lots of toys. one day, he started to sneeze. it was not a normal sneeze like most people have. the sneezing was so bad that he couldn't stop! 

he went to the doctor and the doctor did a special test to find out what was wrong. the doctor told the boy and his family that he had allergies and he need to take special medicine. 

the wealthy boy was happy. he did not have to sneeze any more! he was so glad that he had a doctor who was able to help him. the wealthy boy was able to play with all of his toys without having to worry about sneezing.

once upon a time, there was a chubby little bear. he was all alone in a cold winter. he shivered and shivered in the snow. he went to sleep, hoping it would make him warmer.

but when he woke up, he was still very cold. he huffed and he puffed and he trudged through the snow. he wanted to find some place to stay warm. 

but every door he tried was closed. he felt so sad and so tired. he just wanted to sleep again. but the cold was too strong! 

so that's how the little chubby bear died in the cold winter. he was so sad and so tired, but he couldn't find a way to stay warm. he never got to sleep again.

paul looked up in the sky and wondered. he saw a big, white owl flying hello. the owl swooped and soared through the air like it was fit for the sky. 

paul was so amazed that he said outloud, â€œhey mr. owl, do you want to be friends?â€ the owl hooted in response. then paul asked, â€œdo you want to play with me?â€

the owl hooted again. paul began to run and laugh in delight. he and the owl flew in circles around the tree. as the sun began to set, paul said goodbye to his new friend with one last hoot.

the owl looked down at paul and flew away with a fit of wings. paul waved goodbye as the owl flew away.he began to walk home and wondered if the owl would ever come back.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to draw with her pen and make pictures of flowers and animals. one day, lily's big sister, sarah, came into the room and said, "lily, i need to use your pen. can i borrow it?"

lily didn't want to share her pen because sarah was always bossy and never let her play with her toys. but lily didn't want to suffer and be sad, so she decided to be nice and let sarah use her pen.

sarah was surprised that lily was being so kind. "thank you, lily," she said. "you're not usually so nice to me."

lily smiled and said, "i don't want to suffer. i want to be happy and have fun with my pen."

from that day on, sarah was nicer to lily and they played together with their pens and made beautiful pictures. and lily learned that sometimes it's better to be kind and not suffer than to be mean and unhappy.

rob and luke were best friends. one day, rob wanted to show luke something special. he took luke's hand and led him outside. 

when they got outside, luke's eyes opened wide with wonder. there was a hockey rink! luke had never seen a hockey rink before and he was so excited. 

rob promised he would teach luke how to play hockey. he gave luke his first hockey stick and explained some of the rules. luke thought it looked very difficult, and he was a bit scared. 

rob kept encouraging him and he offered to help. little by little, luke started to learn the basics. he enjoyed the game and was soon playing with confidence. 

rob was so proud of luke's progress. they would go outside every day and practice until they became the best hockey players around!

anna was sad. she wanted to play with her blocks, but they were on the table. the table was too high for her. she could not reach the blocks. she tried to climb on a chair, but she fell down. she hurt her knee. she began to weep.

"anna, what is wrong?" mama asked. she heard anna's weep. she came to the room. she saw anna on the floor. she saw the blocks on the table. she saw the chair on its side.

"i want my blocks!" anna said. she wept louder. she pointed at the table.

mama hugged anna. she kissed her knee. she said, "i'm sorry, anna. you should not climb on the chair. it is not safe. you could get hurt. you are a good girl. you can play with your blocks, but you need to ask for help."

mama lifted anna up. she put her on the table. she gave her the blocks. she said, "here you go, anna. you can play with your blocks on the table. the table is useful. it can hold your blocks. it can also hold your snacks and your books. but you need to be careful. you need to sit still. you need to listen to mama. can you do that?"

anna nodded. she smiled. she said, "thank you, mama. i love you. i love my blocks. i love the table. i will be careful. i will listen to mama." she stopped weeping. she started to build with her blocks. she was happy.

once upon a time, there was a little girl called rose. rose was playing happily in her garden until she heard a loud shout from upstairs. it made her feel very scared and helpless. she wanted to know what was happening, but she was too scared to check what was going on.

suddenly, rose heard a loud crash upstairs and then one of the windows broke open. out of the window jumped a big, mean man. he had a mean face and he was looking right at her.

rose felt very scared and helpless, so she began to cry. she tried to run away, but the man shouted at her to stay still. he grabbed her and put her in his bag.

the bad man carried rose upstairs and she never saw her garden ever again. she was never to be seen or heard from again.

tim and sam were brothers who liked to play in the woods behind their house. they liked to climb trees, make forts and look for animals. one day, they found a big pile of lumber near a path. it was wood that someone had cut from the trees.

"wow, look at all this lumber!" tim said. "we can use it to make a bigger fort!"

"or a boat!" sam said. "or a bridge!"

they ran to the pile and started to pick up some pieces. but then they heard a loud voice.

"hey, you kids! get away from my lumber!" it was a man who came out of a small hut. he looked angry and had a big saw in his hand.

"who are you?" tim asked. "why do you have so much lumber?"

"none of your business!" the man said. "this is my lumber and you can't touch it! go away or i'll call the police!"

tim and sam were scared. they dropped the lumber and ran back to the path. they wondered who the man was and why he was so mean. he was a mysterious man who did not like to share.

they decided to go home and tell their mom what they saw. maybe she would know more about the man and his lumber. they hoped he would not come after them. they also hoped he would yield some of his lumber to other people who needed it.

once upon a time there was a little girl who was very shy. she loved to explore the world but sometimes she just needed to stay at home. one day as she was exploring her house she found a special ornament. it was a beautiful color and it sparkled in the sunlight. she decided to take the ornament outside with her to see what adventures she could have with it. 

she enjoyed walking around the park and looking at the trees, birds and flowers. she took the ornament with her everywhere she went. she laughed and smiled as she explored and had fun. 

when it was time to go home she was happy but a little bit shy. she was afraid to go back to her house so she stayed a little bit longer. finally, she decided to take the ornament home with her as a reminder of the fun she had. she kept the ornament in her bedroom and enjoyed it every day.

once there was a girl. she was walking outside and it was very wet. she saw a celery on the ground. she stopped and picked it up. she took a bite out of the celery and it was so crispy. she liked it so much that she decided to take it home with her.

on the way, she heard a noise. she stopped and looked around. it was raining so she was very wet. she saw a dog barking at her. she was scared, but she rememered the celery in her hand. she slowly ate the rest of it and the dog stopped barking. 

the girl was happy and thanked the celery for saving her. she put the stalk in her pocket and carried on her way, feeling very grateful and safe.

once upon a time there was a log. it was very cozy and harmless. one day a small chipmunk named frank hopped on top of the log. he felt so comfy that he curled up and fell asleep. suddenly, he started to shiver. it was cold outside and he needed a way to stay warm!

frank noticed the sun was rising and felt the warmth on his back. he jumped off the log, ran towards the sunshine and was all cozy again.

then, he remembered the log. he went back to check and saw that the log was still there, waiting for him. he knew that he could count on the log to keep him warm and cozy whenever he needed it. so, he hopped back on, wrapped himself up and fell asleep again.

once there was a hippo who was very tired. he wanted to go to sleep, but he had a hurt foot. he looked around for a soft place, and he spotted a big comfy bed. he hopped on, and quickly snuggled in.

he let out a big yawn and closed his little eyes. then, ever so slowly, he began to drift off to sleep. as he dozed off he had dreams about running and eating and playing. 

but then, just as he was about to drift off completely, he heard a noise! he quickly opened his eyes and saw a big fat mouse nibbling on his bed. he was so startled he jumped up and the mouse scurried away.

but then he remembered how tired he was and decided the mouse could keep the bed. he hopped off and found a grassy spot under a shady tree. he snuggled in and finally fell fast asleep. 

the hippo slept soundly all through the night until the morning sun woke him up. he felt much better after his long nap and he knew that he would be able to play and explore all day long.

once upon a time, there was a girl named lily. she had an old blouse that she loved to wear. one day, lily decided to play hide and seek with her friends. she found a good hiding spot behind a big tree. her friends looked for her, but they couldn't find her. lily giggled quietly while she hid. 

after a while, lily got bored of hiding and wanted to join her friends. she came out from behind the tree, but her blouse got caught on a branch and ripped. lily felt sad because she loved her old blouse. but her friends told her not to worry and they all went to play together. 

from that day on, lily learned that it's okay if her clothes are old or get ripped. what's important is having fun with friends.

once upon a time, there was a big purple dragon named puff. puff loved to fly high in the sky and blow smoke out of his nose. one day, puff met a little girl named lily who wanted to learn how to fly like him. puff decided to teach her how to fly.

puff showed lily how to flap her wings and soar through the clouds. lily was so happy that she could fly just like puff. they flew together for hours until it was time for lily to go home. as she was leaving, puff blew a big cloud of smoke to say goodbye.

lily went home and told her mom all about her adventure with puff the dragon. she was so excited that she drew a picture of puff with his purple scales and big wings. her mom hung the picture on the fridge so they could remember their fun day with puff forever.

once upon a time, there was a boy named timmy. timmy loved to play in his garden with his spade. one day, timmy's mom came to him and said, "timmy, be ready to come inside soon. it's going to rain."

timmy ignored his mom and kept playing with his spade. suddenly, the sky turned dark and it started to rain heavily. timmy's mom came outside and warned him, "timmy, i told you to be ready. you need to come inside now."

timmy quickly put down his spade and ran inside with his mom. he was happy to be safe from the rain and thanked his mom for warning him. from that day on, timmy always listened to his mom and was ready for anything she said.

once upon a time, there was a princess who wanted to marry a prince. she looked all around her kingdom, but she couldn't find the right prince. one day, she saw a handsome prince in the traffic. she knew he was the one she wanted to marry.

the princess went to the prince and asked him to marry her. he said yes, and they had a big wedding. the wedding was so tight that everyone had to squeeze together to fit in the castle. but it was a happy day for everyone, and the princess and prince lived happily ever after.

once there was a man who was walking down a hot street. he felt thirsty and decided to find a stream. after walking a bit further he finally saw a stream. it sparkled in the hot sunshine and looked like it was full of crystal clear water. 

the man was very happy and got ready to drink some of the cool water. but then he heard a growling noise behind him. when he looked back he saw a big, scary dog. 

the man was scared and he didn't know what to do. he had never seen this dog before. then he thought to himself, "i need to trust that the dog is friendly". so he took a step closer and the dog wagged its tail. 

the man was very relieved. he bent down and started to drink the cool, refreshing water from the stream. the man and the dog became friends and drank the water together. 

the man was very grateful to the dog for trusting him and giving him a chance. and the dog was happy to show the man that it was friendly.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside and explore the woods near her house. one day, she found a big barrel in the woods. it was very dirty and disgusting. 

lily wanted to write her name on the barrel, so she took out a marker from her pocket and started writing. but suddenly, she heard a loud noise. it was a bear! the bear was angry and started chasing lily. 

lily ran as fast as she could, but she tripped and fell. the bear caught up to her and took the marker from her hand. the bear wrote something on the barrel and then ran away. when lily looked at the barrel, she saw that the bear wrote "mine". 

lily was very sad and scared. she ran back home and told her parents what happened. they called the forest rangers and they found the bear. unfortunately, the bear had to be put down because it was becoming too dangerous for people to be around. lily learned that it's important to respect nature and not write on things that don't belong to her.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved playing with her dolls and teddy bears. one day, she went to her grandma's house. grandma was famous for her delicious cookies.

lily asked, "grandma, can i help you make cookies?"

grandma said, "sure, you can hold the bowl and mix the powder."

lily was so happy to help. she held the bowl tightly and mixed the powder. the cookies turned out to be very yummy. grandma and lily enjoyed eating the cookies together.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to go on adventures with her family. one day, they went on a trip in their car. lily sat in the back seat with her brother, max. 

as they drove down the road, lily noticed a noisy sound coming from the trunk. "what's that noise?" she asked her mom. "it's probably just some things bouncing around in the trunk," her mom replied. 

lily and max were curious, so they asked if they could see what was in the trunk. their dad pulled over and opened the trunk. they saw lots of bags and boxes, but one box was making the noisy sound. 

when they opened the box, they found a toy car that max had forgotten to put away properly. "i'm sorry," max said. "i didn't know it would be so noisy." lily forgave him and they all continued on their adventure, happy to have solved the mystery of the noisy trunk.

once upon a time there was a little mouse called lucy. she was very cheerful and loved to explore. one day she scuttled into the kitchen, looking for something to do. suddenly her eyes lit up when she saw something shiny in the fridge. she nosed open the door and tumbled inside!

the mouse couldn't believe her luck. all around her were delicious treats! she quickly took a bite of the creamy cheese and then raced up the shelves to eat some of the juicy apples.

but then she heard a loud noise coming from the corner. her heart raced as she saw a cat with its eyes on her. lucy quickly dashed away and scrambled to escape. she dodged the cat's claws and zoomed out of the fridge.

lucy ran back to her burrow and felt relieved. she was safe and she had been on a very exciting adventure! from that day on she decided to never enter the fridge again - but her cheerful nature still made her smile when she passed it.

once upon a time there was a big strong bear. he was brave and liked to dare other animals to do silly things.

one day he dared a rabbit to jump into a big pond in the middle of spring. the rabbit was so scared and kept saying, "no! no!"

but the bear kept saying, "go ahead and jump, don't be scared!"

finally the rabbit decided to be brave and took a big jump. he jumped high and far, into the pond.

when he got out of the pond he was really wet and cold. the bear said, "now do you see why i dared you? it isn't so bad, is it?" 

the rabbit agreed, and then the bear said, "now if you do something even more daring i'll give you something special."

the rabbit thought for a moment, and then said, "dare me to go into the expensive store and get something from it?"

the bear said, "ok, that is daring! go get something special for yourself if you can."

the rabbit hopped off and went to the expensive store. he got something special, and the bear was so proud of him. he gave the rabbit a special reward, and from then on the rabbit was not scared to dare himself to do new things.

once upon a time there was a rabbit called bob. bob was a modest rabbit. his biggest dream was to go to the university. 

one day, bob was hopping along in the forest. suddenly, he came across an old building. it looked like the university! bob hopped closer to have a better look.

then, he saw a group of rabbits in gowns. they were wearing hats on their heads and were carrying books in their paws. bob realised that this must be the university. he was so excited.

bob hopped up to the group of rabbits and asked "do you go to university?" 

one of the rabbits smiled. "yes, we all go to university" he said. 

bob was so happy, he wanted to join them. the rabbits said that he had to pass an eating test first. as the test went on, bob ate and ate until he passed.

at the end of the test, they all cheered. and bob was accepted into the university. he was so happy and so proud.

bob couldn't wait to start learning at the university. and he lived happily ever after.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named savannah. she loved to play games outside. one day, savannah wanted to fill her bucket with water from the river. she wore her bright green dress and ran to the river.

when she got there, she saw another little girl who seemed so sad. she asked the little girl what was wrong. the little girl said that she had no buckets and could not get the water. savannah was very compassionate and shared her bucket with the other little girl. they filled the bucket together and shared some big smiles.

the two girls became great friends and would often play together. when savannah went to play, she always wore her green dress because it reminded her of how compassionate she could be. 

savannah and the other little girl were best friends and were always helping each other. savannah was always wearing her green dress and carrying her bucket as a reminder of their friendship.

once upon a time, there was a long floor in a big house. a little boy named timmy loved to play on this long floor. one day, timmy's friend came to visit him. "welcome to my house!" said timmy. "let's play on the long floor together!" 

timmy and his friend ran up and down the long floor, laughing and having fun. suddenly, timmy's friend tripped and fell on the floor. "ouch!" he cried. timmy felt bad and asked, "are you okay?" his friend nodded and said, "yes, i'm fine. but the floor is hard and hurts when you fall on it."

timmy thought for a moment and said, "i know what we can do! let's put some soft pillows on the floor so it won't hurt if we fall." his friend smiled and said, "that's a great idea!" they found some pillows and put them on the long floor. now they could play and have fun without worrying about getting hurt. they both agreed that the long floor was even better now with the soft pillows.

john was sad because he missed his group. they used to do fun things together every day, but one day they stopped. something stupid happened and they all stopped talking. john was very sad he couldn't see them anymore, he missed them all so much.

one day, he saw some of his friends walking in the park and he decided to join them. they were so surprised to see him, they welcomed him with big smiles. john was so happy. after that, the group got together again and they did all of their activities like before.

john was so pleased to be back in his group. he was so glad that something stupid hadn't ruined their friendship. now all of them are together again and at the end of each day, john still misses them a lot.

once upon a time, there was a little girl who had a jeep. she loved to drive her jeep around her neighborhood. every night, she pretended her jeep was a race car and went super fast.

one day, the little girl was feeling a bit nervous. she had been asked to lie to her mom. she didn't want to lie, but she was scared her mom would be mad at her.

she decided to take her jeep out for a drive to make her feel better. she hopped in the jeep and drove around the block. as she drove, the nervous feeling started to go away. the fresh air and the safe jeep made her feel much better! 

when the little girl got home, she decided to tell the truth to her mom. she was no longer scared and the truth had to be told. she was very proud of herself and never drove her jeep when she was feeling scared again.

sara loves to play with her ball. she kicks it and throws it and rolls it on the ground. she likes to make it go fast and far. sometimes she runs after it and tries to catch it before it stops.

one day, sara is playing with her ball in the park. she sees a big hill and thinks it would be fun to roll her ball down it. she runs to the top of the hill and pushes her ball hard. it goes very fast and very far. sara is happy and wants to get her ball back.

she starts to run down the hill, but she does not see the big rock in her way. she trips over the rock and falls to the ground. she feels a terrible pain in her knee. she cries and cries. she wants her mommy.

her mommy hears her cry and rushes to her. she picks her up and hugs her. she sees the blood on her knee and says, "oh, sara, you have a boo-boo. let me clean it and put a band-aid on it. it will be okay."

she takes sara to the bench and wipes her knee with a wet cloth. she puts a band-aid on it and kisses it. she says, "there, all better. do you want to play with your ball some more?"

sara shakes her head. she says, "no, thank you. i don't like the hill. it is too fast and too far. i want to play on the slide. it is slow and safe."

her mommy smiles and says, "okay, let's go to the slide. but be careful, okay?"

sara nods and says, "okay, mommy. i will be careful. i love you."

her mommy says, "i love you too, sara." they hold hands and walk to the slide. sara forgets about her boo-boo and has fun again.

once upon a time, there was a bunny who loved to play. he was always hopping around and exploring. his mom tried to take care of him, but it was hard to keep him still. 

one day, his mom yelled at him for hopping around too much. she gave him a big lecture about how he needed to be more careful. the bunny sighed, feeling sad and scared.

his mom then had an idea. she took him out to a big store and let him pick out something new! the bunny was so excited. he chose a new toy and smiled from ear to ear. his mom patted him on the head and the bunny knew that she still loved him. 

the bunny had learned his lesson and he made sure to be more careful when playing. from then on, he was happy and playful, but mindfull of his mom's words.

once upon a time, there was a pretty little girl named lily. she loved to play with her toys and draw pretty pictures. one day, her parent told her not to pour water from the big jug in the kitchen. but lily didn't listen and poured the water all over the floor.

her parent was very angry and scolded her. lily felt sad and promised to never pour water again. but one day, when her parent was not looking, lily poured water again. this time, she slipped on the wet floor and hurt herself badly.

the moral of the story is that we should always listen to our parents and not do things we are told not to do, or else we might get hurt.
