once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she had a big task to do. her mom asked her to clean up her toys. lily was scared to do it because she thought it was too hard. but her mom said she could do it and gave her a hug. 

lily started to pick up her toys. she felt happy when she finished. she ran to her mom and waved her hands in the air. her mom was proud of her. 

from that day on, lily wasn't fearful of doing tasks anymore. she knew she could do it if she tried. she loved to wave to her mom every time she finished a task.

once upon a time there was a small rabbit called daisy. daisy loved to keep things and was very successful in doing so; recently she had found a beautiful pastel blue shell on the beach and kept it. one day, daisy took a lovely walk through the meadows and met a squirrel called jack. daisy was very excited to share her shell with jack and proudly showed her shell to jack.

jack said, "that's an amazing shell; i'm so jealous! you are so successful at collecting things".

daisy smiled and said, â€œthank you, jack. i love to keep things, but i also like to share them with my friends.â€

jack was very impressed with daisy and this moral of daisy's; sharing was caring. they both hopped away, promising to one another to keep sharing with the friends around them. 

the moral of the story is that it's better to share than to keep things for yourself. sharing with friends not only makes us successful, but it also brings us closer together.

once upon a time, there was a little fish named nemo. nemo was very small and he lived in a big ocean. one day, nemo saw a big fish that was very ugly. the big fish was trying to eat nemo, but nemo was too quick and he swam away.

nemo was very scared and he thought about what he could do to stay safe. he remembered that his mommy had told him about oxygen. oxygen is what fish breathe to stay alive. nemo realized that he needed to find a place with lots of oxygen so he could breathe and stay safe.

nemo swam and swam until he found a place with lots of oxygen. it was a perfect fit for him! nemo was so happy that he found a safe place to live. he learned that it's important to find a place that fits you and keeps you safe.

once upon a time there was a farmer. he had a problem; the fence around his farm needed to be repaired. he had to raise a ladder so he could get to the top of the fence and fix it.

he asked his son for help, but his son was very ignorant.

the farmer said, â€œplease help me son, i need to raise the ladder so i can fix the fence.â€

the son replied, â€œi donâ€™t understand. what does raise mean?â€ 

the farmer smiled. â€œraising the ladder means to lift it up. so, i need you to help me lift the ladder.â€

the son nodded and they both raised the ladder. together, they were able to get the fence fixed.

the son was very proud of himself. he learned that day that raising a ladder means to lift it up!

joey was very ready for his day. he hopped out of bed and put on his shoes. he grabbed a board and went outside. he could see his friends playing in the park.

joey went to the playground. he put his board down and was ready to play. he saw a tall slide and ran to it. he climbed up the ladder and got to the top of the slide. then he held on tight and bounced down!

when he reached the bottom, joey felt so happy. he got back up again and did it again. joey bounced down the slide again and again. he couldn't get enough of it!

at the end of the day, joey was tired but he had had so much fun. he put his board away and went inside to get ready for bed. joey knew that the next day he would come back and bounce on the slide again!

once there was a boy named tim. he liked to watch his favorite show on the television. one day, tim felt dizzy. he did not like feeling dizzy, so he sat down on the floor.

tim's mom saw him sitting on the floor. she came to comfort him. she gave him a big hug and a soft pillow to rest his head on. tim felt a little better with his mom's help.

after a while, tim's dizziness went away. he was happy again. tim and his mom watched the television together. they laughed and had fun with their favorite show. tim was glad his mom was there to help him.

once upon a time there was a little girl who liked to watch television. she had a big, hairy chair to seat in while she watched her favorite shows. 

one day, the little girl went to her chair and was surprised to feel something fuzzy. when she looked closer, she saw a big, hairy spider had made it's home there! 

the little girl was a bit scared but she was brave. she slowly reached out and carefully picked up the spider. then she found a gentle place outside to set the spider down and watched it scuttle away. 

the little girl was so happy to have been gentle and brave! she went back to her chair and watched television without any hairy spider surprises.

once upon a time, there was a yellow bird who lived in a big tree. one day, the bird fell down from the tree and hurt its wing. the bird cried and cried until a kind veterinarian came to help. the veterinarian looked at the bird's wing and said, "don't worry little bird, i will fix your wing." 

the veterinarian took the bird to her clinic and put a bandage on its wing. the bird felt much better and was happy to be able to fly again. the bird thanked the veterinarian and flew back to its tree. from that day on, the bird was very careful and made sure not to let anything bad happen to its wings again.

one day, a little girl named lucy went to the park. she saw a pretty flower. the flower was red and yellow. lucy wanted to pick the flower, but she did not know how.

a friendly bird saw lucy. the bird said, "hi, lucy! do you need help?" lucy said, "yes, i want to pick the flower, but i can't." the bird said, "i can help you. let's do it together."

lucy and the bird worked together. they managed to pick the flower. lucy was happy. she said, "thank you, bird!" the bird said, "you're welcome, lucy! it's a clear day, let's play!" so, lucy and the bird played in the park all day.

today was a happy day for tom. tom was a little boy and he liked to play outside. he saw a butterfly fluttering around his garden and he was so excited. he reached out to touch it but he was too slow.

tom kept looking for the butterfly and he eventually spotted it again. this time, he was faster and he managed to catch it with his hands. he smiled and gently rubbed its wings with his fingers. the butterfly was so soft and beautiful.

then, tom heard a noise behind him and he was scared. he saw a big dog coming towards him. the dog barked and tom was scared. tom ran away, but the dog followed him.

the dog stepped closer and closer. tom was very scared and he started crying. he didnâ€™t know what to do. he closed his eyes and wished it would go away. suddenly, he felt something soft and warm on his hand. the butterfly had come back and was rubbing against tomâ€™s fingers.

tom stopped crying and opened his eyes. the dog had gone away and the butterfly was still there. tom smiled and kept rubbing its wings gently. he thanked the butterfly for coming back and saving him. from then on, whenever tom was scared, he remembered the butterfly and knew that everything would be ok.

once upon a time, there was a quiet little town. in this town, there was an old house. in the old house, there lived a kind man named tom. tom had a magic touch that could heal people.

one day, a sad girl named lily came to tom's house. she had a big boo-boo on her arm. "can you help me?" asked lily. tom smiled and said, "yes, i can heal your boo-boo." tom touched lily's arm, and her boo-boo was all better.

lily was so happy that she told all her friends about tom's magic touch. soon, many people came to tom's house to be healed. the quiet town was not so quiet anymore, but everyone was happy and healthy. the end.

once upon a time, there was a mommy and her little girl. they went to the store to buy a new purse for the mommy. the little girl saw a silly clown and started to laugh. the mommy bought the purse and they went home. the little girl played with her toys and the mommy put her new purse on the table. the day came to an end and they went to bed, dreaming of silly clowns and new purses.

once upon a time there were two friends called sally and jake. they lived near the beach and liked to go there to play.

one day, sally wanted to have a picnic but she had no food. she asked jake to go and buy some.

"please get some tuna," sally said.

so jake went to the store and asked the shopkeeper for some tuna. the shopkeeper said he only had a competitive tuna which cost more.

jake came back with the competitive tuna and they had a wonderful picnic on the beach. they shared the tuna and they had a great day.

at the end of the day, they said goodbye and thanked each other for the picnic.

"thank you for the competitive tuna," sally said. 

"you're welcome," jake said.

once upon a time, there was a light tape. it was special because it could number things.

one day, a 3 year old girl wanted to use the tape. she used it to count her toys. she counted numbers up to 10. she was so proud of herself.

then she wanted to do something new. she used the light tape to put a number on the wall. it was so much fun.

the girl was so happy. she was excited to be able to number things with the light tape. she counted and counted and counted. 

finally, she was done. she hung the light tape back where it belonged with a big smile on her face.

once upon a time, there was a big, yellow squash. this squash lived in a garden with many other small plants. the squash was very happy and liked to play with its friends.

one day, a rabbit saw the expensive squash and wanted to eat it. the rabbit started to rush towards the squash. the squash was scared and called for help.

just in time, a kind bird heard the squash's cry. the bird swooped down and picked up the rabbit. the rabbit was taken far away from the garden. the squash was safe and thanked the bird. they all lived happily ever after.

once upon a time, there was a rich man who lived in a big house. he had many things, but he was not happy. one day, he saw a raven outside his window. the raven looked sad and hungry. the man felt sorry for the raven and decided to give him some food.

the raven was very happy and flew away. but the man was still not happy. he wanted more things. he went to the store and bought many things, but he still felt empty inside. then he remembered the raven and how happy he was with just a little bit of food.

the man decided to settle down and be happy with what he had. he gave away many of his things to people who needed them more. from that day on, he was happy and content. and sometimes, he would see the raven outside his window and they would both be happy together.

sam was feeling bored one day. he wanted to watch a movie, but his mom said it was too late. he decided to find something else to do. he went outside and saw his friend paul. paul pulled out a kite and asked sam if he wanted to play. sam thought it looked fun and said yes.

sam and paul ran together to find a good spot to fly the kite. as they were running, they heard a noise coming from behind them. it was their neighbor mrs. smith. she was deaf and was shouting for help. sam and paul stopped and turned around. mrs. smith showed them a piece of paper with the word "pull" written on it.

sam and paul both figured out what mrs. smith wanted them to do. they ran over to her lawn chair and pulled it for her. mrs. smith was so happy and thanked them both. she told them that it was very kind of them to help someone in need.

the moral of the story is to always be kind and helpful to others, even if you don't know them. it might be a small gesture like helping someone pull a lawn chair, but it could mean the world to someone in need.

once there was a little girl. every evening she loved to play in the garden. on this particular evening, she was playing princess. she twirled and twirled until she was all finished. 

when evening came, she put on her pale dress and went to bed. it was her special bedtime routine. 

after her parents tucked her in, they walked outside to look up at the night sky. hundreds of tiny stars were shining in the pale sky. it was a beautiful sight. 

eventually, the little girl fell asleep with a smile on her face. she had finished another perfect evening.

lily liked to study her pet cat, milo. she watched him sleep, play, and eat. she learned how he liked to be petted, and how he hated water. she also learned that he had a bitter tongue.

one day, lily wanted to taste milo's tongue. she thought it might be like candy, or milk, or cheese. she waited until he was sleeping on the couch, and then she crawled over to him. she opened his mouth gently, and stuck out her tongue.

but milo's tongue was not like candy, or milk, or cheese. it was bitter, and rough, and prickly. lily made a face, and spat out the fur. she felt a sharp pain in her tongue, and started to cry.

milo woke up, and saw lily crying. he was confused, and scared. he licked her face, and tried to comfort her. he did not understand why she had tasted his tongue. he thought she was his friend, and he loved her.

lily stopped crying, and hugged milo. she said she was sorry, and that she loved him too. she learned that milo's tongue was bitter, but his heart was sweet. she decided to never taste his tongue again, and to study him in other ways.

one warm summer day, a small girl named charlotte ran out to the backyard with glee. she was so excited for a new adventure that day! she noticed a beautiful palm tree in the center of the backyard and ran towards it.

when she made it to the base of the palms, she saw an ant on the ground inching its way up the trunk at a slow, steady pace. charlotte watched it for a few moments, and then said, â€œhello ant! why are you running so slow?â€

the ant looked up at her and said, â€œi'm running slow because i'm trying to reach the top of this palm tree, and that's a long way to go!â€

charlotte smiled, and she said, â€œthen let's both run together, so you can get there faster!â€ 

the ant smiled back and said, â€œthat sounds like a great idea!â€ so, the two of them started running together up the palm tree, faster and faster. eventually, they made it to the top!

charlotte and the ant stopped at the top of the palm and looked down. they both smiled and charlotte said, â€œthank you for running with me, my little ant friend. that was lots of fun!â€

the ant nodded and said, â€œme too, charlotte. until next time!â€ and with that, they went

once upon a time, there was a little boy named tim. tim was very obedient. he always did what his mom and dad told him to do. one day, tim went to the park with his mom. the park was big and had lots of fun things to do.

at the park, tim saw a big red ball. he wanted to touch it. but, his mom told him not to touch the ball because it belonged to someone else. tim felt embarrassed because he didn't know he shouldn't touch it.

tim was sad but he wanted to be obedient, so he didn't touch the ball. then, a big dog came and took the ball away. tim was sad because he didn't get to play with the ball. the dog ran away with the ball and tim went home with his mom.

lila loved stars. she liked to look at them in the sky at night. she liked to draw them on paper. she liked to make them with clay. she had many stars in her room.

one day, a man came to her house. he said he wanted to buy her stars. he said he would give her a lot of money. lila was happy. she thought she could buy more clay and paper. she said yes.

the man took all her stars. he put them in a big bag. he gave her some money. he said thank you and left.

lila counted the money. it was not a lot. it was not enough to buy more clay and paper. she felt sad. she wanted her stars back.

she ran outside. she saw the man get in a car. she saw him drive away. she yelled, "stop! give me back my stars!" but he did not hear her. he did not care.

lila cried. she looked at the sky. it was dark. there were no stars. the man had taken them all. he had sold them to someone else. he had been harsh. he had tricked her.

lila learned a lesson. she learned that stars are not for sale. she learned that some people are not nice. she learned that she should not trust strangers. she learned that she should love what she has.

once upon a time there was a little girl called sarah. she was three years old. 
one day, sarah went for a walk in the forest. she was very excited. she saw all sorts of interesting things, like animals and plants. then she saw a mushroom. 
sarah was very happy. she bent down and admired it. she thought it was very pretty. 
suddenly, a fairy flew down from above and landed next to the mushroom. she thanked sarah for admiring her mushroom. the fairy was so grateful and made a wish for sarah. 
sarah thanked the fairy and then she went home. she was very happy and always remembered the magical moment.

once upon a time there was a puppy named fuzzy. fuzzy was a small, white puppy and very excited to explore the world. one day, fuzzy found a sharp, shiny thing in the grass. he sniffed it and then he bit it.

"ouch!" fuzzy felt a sting on his tongue and he realized it was a razor. fuzzy backed away and was very scared of the razor.

suddenly, the sky grew dark and thunder roared all around fuzzy. he was very helpless and didn't know what to do.

just then, fuzzy saw a big, strong wolf. fuzzy was so scared he closed his eyes tight and shook.

the wolf stepped closer and said, "it's okay, fuzzy. i won't let the razor hurt you. i'll take care of it."

fuzzy opened one eye and sure enough, the wolf had the razor in his mouth. fuzzy was so thankful for the wolf and he quickly cuddled up to the wolf and went to sleep.

once upon a time, there was a boy. his name was timmy. timmy had a lot of hair on his head. his mom told him he needed to go to the barber to cut his hair. 

timmy went to the barber. the barber was a man who cuts hair. he had a lot of scissors and combs. timmy sat on the chair and the barber cut his hair. 

after the barber finished, timmy went home. his mom asked him how it went. timmy said the barber did a good job. he liked his new haircut. 

but then, the barber realized he cut timmy's hair too short. he felt guilty. he called timmy's mom and told her what happened. timmy's mom was very nice and said it was okay. the barber felt better and promised to be more careful next time.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play in her backyard with her toys. one day, her mommy asked her to help prune the bushes. lily didn't want to, but her mommy said it was important to keep the backyard nice and neat.

lily started to prune the bushes, but she got bored quickly. she saw a butterfly and wanted to chase it instead. her mommy told her to focus on pruning and ignore the butterfly for now.

lily finished pruning and sat down on the grass. she looked at the peaceful sky and said, "mommy, can we play now?" her mommy smiled and said, "yes, we can play now." they played together until it was time for dinner. lily was happy she helped her mommy and had a fun day.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy. timmy had a favorite spoon that he always used to eat his cereal. one day, timmy's spoon broke and he was very sad. 

timmy's mommy saw how sad he was and gave him a big hug. she promised to buy him a new spoon the next day. when they went to the store, timmy picked out a shiny new spoon that made him very happy. 

but, timmy's mommy also noticed that he had a little cut on his finger. she put a band-aid on it to help it heal. timmy felt much better with his new spoon and his healed finger. he smiled and ate his cereal with joy. the end.

once upon a time, there was a little girl called susie who wanted to go on an adventure. so she packed her special bag full of exciting things and set off. on her way, she found a beautiful red flower, a screw and a shiny penny. she put them inside her bag and happily skipped along.

soon, susie reached her destination: a beautiful park. it was filled with lots of trees, flowers and birds. she explored the park, collecting more treasures like pebbles and leaves. she also found a hedgehog and helped it back home. 

when it was time to leave, susie packed her bag with all of her treasures. she took one last look at the beautiful park and smiled, before setting off on her way back home.

sam and ben are brothers. they like to play with their dog, rex. rex is a big, black lab. he is very friendly and smart.

one day, sam and ben find a big box in the garage. it has many wires and buttons and lights. they do not know what it is. they think it is a toy.

"let's play with it!" sam says.

"ok!" ben says.

they open the box and see a big machine. it has a screen and a keyboard and a microphone. they see words on the screen. they do not know what they mean.

"maybe it can talk to us!" ben says.

"let's try!" sam says.

they press some buttons and speak into the microphone. they say hello and their names and ask questions. they wait for the machine to answer.

but the machine does not answer. it makes a loud noise and sparks. the screen goes black. the machine is broken.

sam and ben are scared. they run away from the box. they find rex in the living room. he is sleeping on the couch. he hears them and opens his eyes. he sees them and wags his tail.

"rex, rex, we are sorry!" sam says.

"we did something bad!" ben says.

they hug rex and tell him what they did. rex listens and yawns. he does not care about the box. he cares about his boys. he licks their faces and makes them laugh.

"rex, you are the best!" sam says.

"rex, you are smarter than us!" ben says.

they play with rex and forget about the box. they do not know that the box is their dad's computer. he uses it for his work. he is a scientist. he will be very angry when he sees what they did. he will think they are foolish. but rex will not. he will love them anyway.

once upon a time, there were two friends: poppy and tom. they joined each other for play every day. one day poppy had a coin, but tom did not have a coin. tom was sad, so poppy shared her coin with him so that they could join in playing together. tom was so happy and he hugged poppy. they played together happily ever after.

once upon a time, there was a bird. the bird lived in an ancient tree. the tree was very big and had many branches. the bird had a nest on one of the branches. the nest was made of sticks and leaves.

one day, a big wind came and blew the nest out of the tree. the bird was very sad. it didn't know what to do. it couldn't carry the nest because it was too heavy. 

then, a kind rabbit saw the bird and asked what was wrong. the bird told the rabbit about the nest. the rabbit said it could help. it carried the nest back up to the tree and put it back on the branch. the bird was very happy and thanked the rabbit. from that day on, the bird and the rabbit were good friends.

once upon a time there was a little girl. she was so happy! she loved to explore, so she set off on a grand adventure.

she walked, and she ran and explored every place she went - she was never still. she came to a big room. it had a big red door with an exit sign. she was scared, but she was brave and she set off to explore.

as she opened the door, the most magical thing came out - it was a big park! she ran around and played for hours and hours. she was so happy to find this amazing place.

when it was time to go home, she set off back through the door and it closed behind her.

but she will never forget her amazing adventure! she will always keep it in her heart, and she will come back again soon.

once there was a little boy who loved playing his violin. he was only three and he knew how to make the instrument make beautiful music. every day he strummed his violin and he loved it dearly.

one day his parents gave him a modern violin. he was so excited and he wanted to try it without delay. but when he played the instrument, he found that the music had no sound. he tried harder but it was all in vain.

the little boy was very sad and so he ignored the modern violin. he went back to his old violin and played it, making beautiful music just as he used to.

the little boy forgot all about the modern violin and continued playing his old one. he was content with the music that he made and he did not need the modern one. he was happy playing his old violin, and he continued to ignore the modern one.

once upon a time, there was a gray table. it was in a room with a little boy who loved to play with toys. one day, the boy was playing with his toy car and he accidentally bumped into the table. the table started to wobble and the boy got scared that it might fall over. 

but then, his mommy came into the room and saw what was happening. she quickly grabbed some tape and used it to prevent the table from falling over. the little boy was so happy that his mommy saved the table and his toys from falling down. from that day on, the little boy made sure to be extra careful when playing near the table.

once upon a time, there was a farmer who had a big farm. he had lots of animals like cows, pigs, and sheep. one day, he wanted to go to the store to buy some food for his animals. he got in his car and drove really fast. he liked to speed because it made him feel happy.

as he was driving, he saw a little bird on the side of the road. the bird looked sad and the farmer felt thoughtful. he stopped his car and got out to see if the bird was okay. the bird had hurt its wing and couldn't fly. the farmer took the bird back to his farm and took care of it until it was better.

from that day on, the farmer didn't speed anymore. he realized that it was more important to be kind and thoughtful to others, even if it meant taking things slower. the little bird became the farmer's friend and would visit him every day on the farm.

once upon a time there was a happy little boy called tom. tom loved to joke and make people laugh. one day, tom and his family were visiting a big old castle. inside the castle was a huge chamber with a high ceiling and windows all around it. 

tom and his family stopped to admire the room, which was very calm and peaceful. but then something strange happened. tom started to joke around and started to make funny noises and silly faces. suddenly, the chamber filled with laughter. 

tom's mum smiled and said, "oh tom, what a joker you are!" tom felt very proud and kept on making people laugh. everyone was filled with joy. tom knew he had made the chamber smile.

once upon a time, there was a white cat named fluffy. fluffy loved to work at the store. every day, fluffy would help put things on the shelves.

one day, a little boy came into the store. he saw fluffy and said, "hi, fluffy! can you help me find a toy?" fluffy nodded and led the boy to the toy shelf. the boy picked a red ball and said, "thank you, fluffy!"

later, fluffy saw a girl crying. fluffy asked, "why are you sad?" the girl said, "i lost my mom." fluffy held her hand and helped her find her mom. the girl hugged fluffy and smiled.

the people in the store loved fluffy because he was always kind and helpful. the moral of the story is to always be kind and help others, just like fluffy the white cat.

once upon a time there was a young girl. she loved to play and explore. one day she wanted to try something new. she asked her mother if she could have a special dish. her mother said yes and gave the girl a dish. 

the young girl was excited! she took the dish outside and looked closely at it. the dish was full of all sorts of goodies. she couldn't believe her eyes. she took a bit of each thing, and was so happy with what she received. 

the young girl had so much fun tasting all the different things in the dish. she thought it was the best thank she had ever gotten! she ate until she was full and thanked her mother for the dish. the young girl smiled and played the rest of the day.

once upon a time, there was a little mouse. the mouse liked to create things. he made a big, smelly cake. the cake was so smelly that it made the mouse's nose wiggle.

one day, the mouse went outside to play. he saw a big cat. the cat saw the smelly cake and wanted to eat it. the mouse was scared, but he had an idea. he gave the cat the smelly cake.

the cat ate the smelly cake and was very happy. the mouse was happy too. the cat and the mouse became friends. they played together every day. and they both loved the smelly cake.

once upon a time there was a little girl called emma. she was three years old. emma went to the park with her mom and dad. they brought some food for her to eat. 

when emma sat down, she saw a small bird. she was excited to see it and wanted to get closer to it. she slowly walked to the bird and then it flew away. 

emma was a bit worried. she guessed the bird didnâ€™t want her to be close. but then the bird returned with some food. it put the food near emmaâ€™s feet. 

emma was very happy! she started to eat the food and the bird stayed with her. they ate the food together and then the bird flew away. emma waved goodbye to the bird as it left. 

emma smiled. she was no longer worried and was very happy to have met the bird.

once upon a time there was a huge, old man. he lived in an old house by the river.

every day the old man would go to the river and repair the broken boats that he found. he was so good at repair that he started to teach others how to do it.

the old manâ€™s lessons were a huge success. soon he had lots of students and he built a huge workshop for them.

every day everyone would help repair the boats together. soon they were all big, strong boats and they could go on adventures together. 

the old man was very proud of all of his students and they were all very happy with their work. 

the end!

once upon a time, there was a chubby cricket named jim. jim loved to sing and hop around in the grass. one day, jim hopped into a hole and couldn't get out. he cried out, "help! help! i'm stuck!"

just then, a little girl named lily walked by and heard jim's cries. she peeked into the hole and saw jim's chubby body. "don't worry, jim. i'll get you out!" she said. she reached in and pulled him out of the hole.

"thank you, lily!" said jim. "you saved me."

suddenly, a big storm came and lightning struck a tree nearby. lily and jim were scared, but they stuck together and waited for the storm to pass. after the storm, they said goodbye and jim hopped away, singing a happy song.

once upon a time, there was a little girl with a mysterious sister. the little girl loved her sister very much, but she always felt sad because her sister never wanted to play with her. 

one day, the little girl decided to ask her sister why she never played with her. her sister explained that she was always busy with her own things and didn't have time to play. 

the little girl was sad, but she didn't give up. she thought of a plan to make her sister happy. she filled a bucket with water and asked her sister to soak her feet in it. her sister felt relaxed and happy. 

from that day on, the little girl and her sister spent more time together. the moral of the story is that sometimes we need to take the time to make others happy, even if it means doing something simple like soaking their feet in water.

once upon a time there was a family who had to move house. they had to pack all their things into boxes and sacks. it was a difficult job to do but they all worked together to get it done quickly. 

when they had finished packing, the family went on a holiday. they went in a big car and drove for a long time until they arrived in their new house. 

the family had lots of fun on their holiday. they stayed in a big hotel, ate in nice restaurants and went to the zoo. 

when the holiday was over, the family had to unpack all the sacks and boxes. it was a lot more difficult than it was to pack them! but eventually the job was done and the family settled into their new house. 
the end.

once there was a girl who loved to dress up. every day, she chose her favourite outfit, and set off on an adventure.

one day, the girl was trying to dress when she realized that her favourite dress was too small. she was very upset, but she was persistent and determined to find a way to make it fit.

so, day after day, the girl worked hard. she stretched, pulled, and pinned her dress. she kept going until finally, the result was the perfect fit.

the girl couldn't believe it â€“ her hard work had paid off! she couldn't wait to show her friends her beautiful dress and how she had made it fit.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named bob. he was just three years old and had a cheeky grin. bob's mom was always very kind and gentle with him, but one day she wanted to ask him something tricky. she wanted him to accept a task that was quite difficult.

bob thought it over and over again. he was scared to say 'yes' and he was scared to say 'no'. but his mom kept smiling and talking to him nicely, so he decided to accept the task.

the task was to keep his mouth shut - that is, not talk - whenever his mom asked him too. it was a difficult thing to do, as bob was always chatting away. but he promised his mom that he could do it, so he accepted the challenge. 

from then on, whenever his mom wanted some quiet, she would ask bob to keep his mouth shut, and he would nod and obey. his mom was so happy that he would try his best to do something quite difficult, and she rewarded him with a big hug and a kiss. 

bob had shown his mom that even though he was only a little boy, he could understand and accept things that weren't always easy.

once upon a time, there was a big, old car. the car was red and had four wheels. it could speed very fast and go to many places. one day, the car went to a new place it had never been before. it was a park with lots of trees and flowers. the car drove around the park, going fast and slow. it was so much fun! when it was time to go home, the car felt happy and tired. it had a great adventure in a new place.

once upon a time there was a little bunny called bob. bob was very alert and liked to go exploring. one day bob was looking around in a grassy meadow and he spotted a bright white sheet flapping in the wind. bob hopped over to investigate. "oh wow!" he said, with a big smile on his face. he brushed the sheet with his paw and looked underneath. to his surprise, he found a big juicy carrot. "yummy!" he exclaimed, hopping around with joy.

bob wanted to thank whoever had left the carrot for him. so he called out, "thank you, who ever you are! thanks for the carrot!" but no one replied. bob shrugged his furry little shoulders and then hopped away, still thanking whoever had left the treat for him. 

he hopped off with a hop, skip and a jump, feeling very grateful that he had found such a yummy snack. he waved a paw in the air and shouted,
"thanks again!"

the end.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she loved to play outside and catch butterflies. she had a special net that she used to catch them.

one day, lily went outside to play and saw a big, rude dog. the dog barked at her and scared her. lily didn't know what to do, so she ran away.

later that day, lily saw a beautiful butterfly flying around. she wanted to catch it, but she didn't have her net with her. suddenly, the rude dog appeared again and started chasing the butterfly. but then something amazing happened - the butterfly flew into the net that the dog was carrying in its mouth! lily was so happy that she had caught the butterfly without even using her net. she realized that sometimes things work out in unexpected ways.

lily and ben went to the park with mom. they saw a big fountain with water that went up and down. lily and ben liked the fountain. they wanted to play in the water.

mom said, "no, you cannot play in the fountain. the water is not clean. it has dirt and germs. you will get sick."

lily and ben were sad. they complained to mom. they said, "but we want to play in the fountain. it looks fun. it is hot today. we are thirsty."

mom said, "i have a better idea. let's go to the ice cream truck. you can have a cold treat. then we can find a clean fountain to drink from. how does that sound?"

lily and ben smiled. they liked ice cream. they said, "ok, mom. that sounds good. thank you."

they went to the ice cream truck and got their favorite flavors. then they found a clean fountain to drink from. they were happy and refreshed. they thanked mom for the ice cream and the water. they had a good day at the park.

melanie was smart. she was three years old and she loved to balance her grocery bags. she would spend lots of time figuring out which bag should go where. she always wanted to make sure the bags were balanced just right.

one day, she decided to go to the grocery store. she was so excited to go there and balance her bags. she grabbed the biggest bag and put it on her left hip and a small one on her right. she also had a big one in each hand. 

at the store, melanie went up and down the aisles, excitedly picking out her favorite things. she put them all in her bags, making sure she balanced them just right. she was so proud of herself.

when she got home, she had to carefully carry her bags into the kitchen. she was so careful with them, making sure she kept them balanced. her mom was so proud of her!

melanie smiled to herself as she put all of her groceries away. she had been so smart to remember to balance her bags. she was so happy that she had done it all by herself!

lily and ben were playing in the park. they liked to run and jump and slide. they saw a big pond with ducks and fish. lily wanted to feed them some bread. ben wanted to catch them with his net.

"come on, lily, let's catch some ducks!" ben said.

"no, ben, that's not nice. the ducks are living things. they have life. we should be kind to them," lily said.

"but it's fun, lily. look, i caught a fish!" ben said, holding up his net.

"put it back, ben. the fish needs water to breathe. it will die if you keep it," lily said.

ben did not listen. he wanted to keep the fish. he ran away from lily. lily followed him. she was angry and sad.

"ben, stop! you are hurting the fish!" lily shouted.

ben ran to the bridge. he saw a big swan swimming in the pond. it was white and graceful. it looked at ben with its black eyes.

"wow, a swan! i want to catch it too!" ben said.

he threw his net at the swan. but the swan was too fast and smart. it dodged the net and flapped its wings. it made a loud noise. it scared ben.

"help, help! the swan is angry!" ben cried.

lily ran to ben. she took his net and threw it away. she hugged ben.

"ben, you are silly. you should not try to catch the swan. the swan is strong and proud. it does not like to be bothered. you should leave it alone. you should remain calm and quiet," lily said.

ben nodded. he was sorry. he said sorry to the swan. he said sorry to lily. he said sorry to the fish. he learned his lesson.

lily and ben went back to the playground. they played nicely. they watched the swan swim in the pond. it was graceful and beautiful. they smiled.

once upon a time there was a boy called steve. he was a brave and daring boy who loved to explore new places.

one day steve set off on a new adventure. he packed his bag and went for a walk in the woods. the woods were mysterious and exciting so steve was sure he was going to have lots of fun. he walked for a long time until he found something interesting; a pick.

steve thought the pick looked dangerous but he wanted to take it home with him. when he picked it up he noticed something strange was happening. tiny sparks started to come from the pick and it lit up in a big way. 

steve knew he had to get it back to his home quickly. he ran as fast as he could but he was too slow. suddenly, a giant monster appeared and chased him. 

the monster shouted, "you must complete the mission or you will be harmed!" steve was horrified and tried his best to run away, but the monster was too quick. in the end, the monster caught up to steve and the pick was never seen again.

once upon a time, there was a little boy named timmy who loved to draw. he would draw all day long, and his mommy would always say, "timmy, you're going to be an artist someday!"

one day, timmy was drawing a big rhinoceros when his mommy came into the room. "wow, timmy, that's amazing!" she said.

timmy smiled and said, "i want to write a story about a rhinoceros who was too hot."

his mommy smiled and said, "that's a great idea! but remember, timmy, it's important to always stay cool and not let our emotions get the best of us."

later that day, timmy finished his story and showed it to his mommy. she read it and said, "timmy, this is wonderful! and you know what? you're going to be a great writer someday too!"

tim was a little boy who was very weak. he had been sick for a few days and was feeling very tired. he laid down on the sofa and decided to rest.

tim closed his eyes and tried to get comfy. but he did not feel better. his mom came over and gave him a lemon to eat.

tim bit into the lemon and it was so sour that he made a funny face. his mom smiled and he ate the whole lemon. tim felt a bit better and he rested some more.

after a while he felt stronger and he got up. he felt much better and he was full of energy. he could play now and he was happy.

once upon a time there was a little girl called amanda. she loved to play with her toys and she was very happy. one day she went to the park to play and when she arrived there, she saw something very special. it was a big red box with a secret inside.

but when she opened the box, it was empty. she was sad and she tried to remember what was inside the box. she thought hard but the memory was gone. she felt so tight in her little heart.

suddenly, a fairy appeared in front of her and said she had the power to restore the box's memory. amanda was so happy that she agreed to the fairy's offer. the fairy waved her wand and then the box had a memory again.

but then suddenly the box made a loud sound and a huge monster appeared. the monster was so angry that it wanted to destroy amanda! amanda was very scared but the fairy told her to run away quickly.

but it was too late and the monster got her and ruined her happy day. amanda's toys were broken and she couldn't restore her happy day. she was so sad and all she wanted was to have her happy day back but it was all gone.

once upon a time there was a family. they were very happy and they loved to collect things. they would collect rocks, shells and pretty flowers.

one day the family went on a special adventure. they took a long walk and found this special place. it was so charming! it was the perfect place to collect even more special things.

the family was so happy they found this place. they decided to make it their home. they collected rocks, shells, flowers and other special things to make the home look nice. they even made a beautiful garden.

every day the family would go exploring and collecting things to add to their special home. they were so happy and content. they loved their charming family home.

once upon a time there was a little girl named sunshine. she was a brave and adventurous three year old. one day, she decided to go on her own in the forest.

as she was walking along a path, she heard a crackling sound. looking up, she saw a broken shield in a nearby tree. she walked closer to take a better look. with a curious giggle, she reached out her hand to grab it.

suddenly, a voice rang out - "you must never touch that shield." sunshine jumped with surprise. she stepped back and looked around. but the forest was quiet. 

sunshine decided to listen to the mysterious voice. she repeated to herself, "i will never touch the broken shield". 

little did she know her words would be put to the test. a few days later sunshine returned to the same forest and found herself in an epic battle. when she felt she could take no more, she looked up to the tree and spotted the broken shield. taking her own advice, she reached out and grabbed the broken shield. it turned out to be the only weapon she had to protect herself and win the battle!

the moral of this story? listen to your instincts and repeat the wise words to yourself. you never know when they might come in handy.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily who loved to play with her toys. one day, her friend jack came over to play with her.

"let's play with your dolls!" jack said excitedly.

lily was shy and didn't like to share her toys, but her mom encouraged her to let jack play too. "it's okay, lily. sharing is nice," her mom said.

lily felt sorry for being selfish and decided to share her dolls with jack. they had so much fun playing together and lily was happy that she listened to her mom's encouragement.

anna liked winter very much. she liked to play in the snow with her dog, max. she liked to make snowmen and snow angels. she liked to wear her red coat and her pink hat and her warm boots.

one day, anna and max went to the park. they saw a big tree with many lights and shiny things. anna thought it was very pretty. she wanted to look closer. she ran to the tree and max followed her.

on the tree, anna saw a big bow. it was blue and sparkly. anna liked blue and sparkly things. she reached for the bow, but it was too high. she jumped, but she could not touch it. she felt sad.

then, she heard a voice. it was a boy. he was standing next to the tree. he had a charming smile and brown eyes. he said, "hello, do you like the bow? i can help you get it. i made it for the tree."

anna smiled back. she said, "yes, i like the bow. it is very pretty. thank you for helping me." the boy lifted anna up and gave her the bow. anna hugged the bow and said, "thank you, you are very nice. what is your name?"

the boy said, "my name is ben. what is yours?" anna said, "my name is anna. this is my dog, max. he likes you too." max wagged his tail and licked ben's face. ben laughed and said, "he is very cute. do you want to play with me in the snow?"

anna nodded. she said, "yes, i want to play with you. you are my new friend." ben said, "you are my new friend too. come on, let's have fun." they ran to the snow and played with max. they had a wonderful time. they did not want to leave.

the end.

once upon a time, there was a monkey named max. max was very brave and loved to sing. one day, max was walking through the jungle when he saw a banana tree. he climbed up the tree and picked a big yellow banana.

suddenly, max heard a loud noise. it was a lion! the lion wanted to eat max and his banana. max was scared but he didn't run away. instead, he started to sing a brave song. the lion stopped and listened to max's beautiful voice.

"wow, you sing so well! can i have a bite of your banana?" asked the lion.

max smiled and shared his banana with the lion. from that day on, max and the lion became friends and they would often sing together in the jungle.

tim and jen are friends who like to play on the farm. they like to feed the cows, pet the sheep and run in the grass. one day, they see a huge pile of hay in the barn. they think it looks like fun to jump on it.

"let's play on the hay!" tim says.

"ok!" jen says.

they climb up the hay and start to jump and roll. they laugh and have fun. but then, tim has an idea.

"let's make a fort with the hay!" he says. "we can use these sticks and these ropes to hold it together."

jen looks at the sticks and the ropes. she does not like them. she thinks they are sharp and hard. she does not want to use them.

"no, let's not make a fort," she says. "let's just jump and roll. the hay is soft and nice."

tim and jen disagree. they both want to play on the hay, but they want to play differently. they start to argue.

"i want to make a fort!" tim says.

"i don't want to make a fort!" jen says.

they get angry and sad. they stop playing and sit on the hay. they do not look at each other.

after a while, they hear a moo. they turn and see a cow looking at them. the cow is hungry and wants to eat the hay. the cow walks towards them and starts to nibble on the hay.

"hey, that's our hay!" tim says.

"go away, cow!" jen says.

they try to shoo the cow away, but the cow does not listen. the cow keeps eating the hay. tim and jen look at each other. they realize that they have a bigger problem than their disagreement. they need to work together to save their hay.

"let's make some noise and scare the cow away!" tim says.

"ok, let's do that!" jen says.

they stand up and start to yell and clap and wave their arms. the cow is surprised and scared. the cow runs away from the hay and back to the field. tim and jen cheer and hug. they are happy that they saved their hay.

"sorry, i disagreed with you," tim says.

"sorry, i disagreed with you, too," jen says.

they smile and say they are still friends. they decide to share the hay and play together. they jump and roll and have fun. they forget about the sticks and the ropes. they only need the hay and each other.

once upon a time there was a quiet sheep called daisy, who liked to wander about in the grassy fields by her farm house. one day, daisy boldly followed the sun as it started to set and she ended up at a tall, leather gate. 

the gate had an old, heavy padlock on it that daisy could not open. suddenly, she heard a friendly voice coming up from behind her, â€œwould you like me to show you what is behind this gate?â€

daisy was startled and turned around to see a white rabbit with long ears and a long, leather tail. daisy was happy to meet the rabbit, who introduced himself as mr. rabbit.

mr. rabbit explained, â€œif you follow me, i will lead you to a special place through the gate and you can discover what is around the bendâ€. 

daisy followed the rabbit beyond the leather gate, not knowing what was to come. the path was quiet as the two friends walked along, until they came upon a wondrous field. 

delighted, daisy shouted for joy, for she had discovered the most beautiful garden she had ever seen. daisy and mr. rabbit had plenty of fun exploring the garden together, until the sun set and it was time for daisy to go home. 

daisy thanked mr. rabbit for leading her to this special place and waved goodbye to him as she hopped away, content

once, there was a foolish sun who liked to shine all day long, even when the moon came out. one day, the moon was really mad. the moon shouted, "enough! stop shining!" the sun said, "no, i won't stop. it is my job to shine all day long." the moon said, "if you don't stop, i will cover you up with a napkin." the sun said, "you can't catch me!" and kept shining.

so, the moon grabbed a big napkin and covered the sun. the sun was so angry. he shouted, "let me out!" the moon said, "no, you need to think before you shine too much." the sun didn't understand and kept shouting. after a while, the moon said, "okay, i will let you out if you promise to shine only when it is daytime." the sun agreed and the moon took away the napkin.

the sun shone every day, but only when it was daytime. whenever the moon came out, the sun smiled and let the moon take over. the sun had learned his lesson and was no longer a foolish one.

"mommy, i'm so cold," said toby, a three year old boy. 
it was an evening in the middle of winter and toby was feeling the cold.
"maybe you should wear a jumper," mommy said, so toby put on his favourite green jumper.
"but i'm still cold," toby mentioned.
mommy looked out of the window and said, "let's go for a walk, toby. that might warm you up a bit."
so toby put on his coat and hat and went outside with mommy. 
mommy and toby had a wonderful evening walk and toby didn't feel the cold anymore.
"we should go for a walk every evening," toby mentioned with a big smile.
mommy laughed and said, "okay toby, we will!"

peter and his family went to the opera. it was a jolly evening. peter was very excited and pulled his dad's hand as they entered the theater.

the opera was full of bright lights, loud music and people clapping. peter was amazed.

the show was about to begin and the conductor started waving her arms. suddenly the musicians began playing and the actors started singing. peter was so excited he could hardly stop jumping and clapping.

after a while, the show ended and their family started to go home. peter was happy and kept talking about the opera all the way home. his dad had to pull him along so they could reach home in time for dinner. 

they arrived home and the family had a delicious meal together. peter was so happy that he'd gone to the opera and he already couldn't wait to go to the next one.

once upon a time, there was a little girl named lily. she lived in a small village near a big tower. the tower was very tall and had a lot of windows. lily loved to watch the lively birds fly around the tower.

one day, lily went to the tower to explore. she climbed up the stairs and looked out the window. she saw the beautiful view of the village. suddenly, she heard a loud noise and felt the tower shake. she regretted going up the tower because she was scared.

just then, a kind man came to help her down the stairs. he told her that the tower was being repaired and it was not safe to be inside. lily was relieved and thanked the man for helping her. she learned her lesson and promised to always listen to the grown-ups.

once upon a time, there was a little kitten named mittens. mittens was very creative and loved to play with toys. one day, mittens was playing with her favorite toy mouse when she saw a big dog coming towards her. the dog was growling and looked very scary.

mittens was scared and didn't know what to do. she tried to run away, but the dog was too fast. suddenly, mittens had an idea. she blinked her eyes and pretended to be asleep. the dog sniffed around her and thought she was just a sleeping kitten.

mittens was so happy that her creative idea worked. she knew she had to be careful around big dogs, but she was proud of herself for being so clever. from that day on, mittens always remembered to blink when she was in trouble.
